description:
We were bummed when we were unable to do the UberEats for Memphis Minnie's the night before, but we were happy to be able to get another chance to eat here! 

When we came in, the savory aroma of barbecue filled the restaurant, welcoming us in more and more the deeper we walked inside. As we walked closer, we noticed the steam warming up the restaurant from all of the BBQ cooking. We also liked how each table had its own paper towel roll, as it can get pretty messy when we eat BBQ! We thought long and hard and ended up ordering some mac 'n' cheese, potato salad, a cornbread muffin, 1/2 pound of brisket, and some pork. 

The mac 'n' cheese was very cheesy, much more so than I am used too! Nonetheless, I appreciated all the cheddar cheese that was drowning the pasta. The pasta was a good balance between firm and soft, making this some great mac 'n' cheese! 

The potato salad was also tasty! I appreciated how there were large chunks of red potato lodged into the potato salad. Furthermore it looked like Memphis Minnie's put in the effort to really make this potato salad worth our money - the scoop is almost overflowing out of the bowl! 

The cornbread muffin tasted pretty average compared to the rest of the sides. I think it would have tasted good if I had this first or by itself, but compared to the first two sides, it didn't impress me as much. Still, I did like how the sides were crispy, but the inside was very soft. 

The brisket was savory, but it didn't have as much fat as most brisket does - which can be either a good or bad thing for you, depending on what you're looking for. Because of that, it also wasn't dripping in its own juices as well. Nonetheless, I liked how the slices were easy to cut and the pieces were quite large. 

The pork was somewhat dry for some of its pieces, which was something I didn't like about it. However, it still tasted pretty savory as well. Even though it was dry, it wasn't tough; it was still easy to cut and wasn't too chewy. Still, I am glad we ordered the pork. 

I'm so glad I was able to try out Memphis Minnie's before leaving San Francisco! It definitely made me feel a bit nostalgic, as someone who has lived in the South before recently moving. Definitely a great place to try some home style BBQ!
author: Liselle L.

description:
Skeptical about BBQ in California, so this review wasn't much of a surprise. The meat I had was all luke-warm and rather dry. The sauces were good, but they were really runny as well.

Shared a sampler platter with my friend--a little pricey, but did the job to feed two petite girls!

Brisket- best of the bunch
Pork rib-tips- Not bad, but there were a few pieces that were dried out and tough
Tri-tip- dry and looked like a sad, grey piece of meat
Mac n' cheese-pretty good, bechamel/real cheese based
Fries- standard
Cornbread-would have appreciated if they gave two since it's a sampler platter that I'd assume is a shared dish. Crumbly and sweet, decent

+1 for customer service! A homeless came in and pretty much walked over and grabbed food off our plates, so they offered us some ribs to make up for it.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
We got the three meats, chicken pork and 

brisket 

seasoned fries were the best 

Cornbread was ok

Sauces were ok

sweet T was very good

Good customer service
author: B I.

description:
It's been awhile since I've been to Memphis Minnie's in person. This time I ordered delivery. Food was good. I got the rib tips which came in a large potion with your choice of sides, and corn bread. The meat had a great smoke flavor and was tender. The rib tips have bones, so if that's not your thing order something else. 

These sides were good and the cornbread was hot. It came with a few sides of bbq sauce. The sauce was a bit on the vinegar side. 

I also tried the banana pudding. Omg it was amazing. Very traditional, not fancy, and a large potion. If you like vanilla pudding and fresh banana then I would recommend it. 

Only con was the box the food came in looked like it and felt like it was rubbed in sauce, multiple cooks wiped their hands on it, and was dipped in a vat of oil. The entire outside of box was filthy! Maybe they could pack it with clean hands and wipe the counter off.
author: Alan H.

description:
WOW, this barbecue place is so mouth-watering delicious! SF lives just two blocks away from this joint thankfully, so we just walk down when were getting those bbq cravings. It's an order and sit down type of establishment. They have signs that remind customers to only sit down after you've ordered which is nice. There's a limited number of tables but I've never had an issue with seating here. At the tables, there are 4 different type of Memphis Minnie sauces to go with the food. I really like  their hot sauce and their tangy sauce. They also have a vinegar type of sauce which I haven't tried yet. Plenty of paper towels in a roll on the table ftw.

I've been here twice - first time I had their pulled pork sandwich and it was so filling! Loved adding the sauces onto the sandwich to get a different taste. The second time SF ordered their Tuesday special, which was a pork belly special sandwich and I got their chili cheese fries. It was so ungodly amazing. The fries were so hot that the fresh cheddar cheese melted into a gooey mess and there was tender pulled pork and freshly cut red onions as well. The pork belly sandwich is definitely a must-order if you're ever there on a Tuesday! It's a very thick slab complemented with cole slaw and choice of side. We ordered with the sweet potatoes and it was boiled with honey water, very delicious!
author: Ada C.

description:
I've been on a brisket roll the last couple days! The meat on these are quite firm, though not way too hard. A good amount of chew distributed between the meaty and fatty (chewy fat) portions of the meat. No chunks of fat on these! The flip side is that these aren't as smoky as the ones I had at Magnolia Smokehouse, but they are also more salted. 3.5/5.

The spareribs were a tad dry for my tastes, and the salt flavor dominated the smokiness, though you could taste it in the background, after you'd chewed and swallowed the meat. 3/5.

You get more bang for your buck on the meat here versus the other SF BBQ spots! 3.5/5.
author: Nicole H.

description:
Ordered the brisket and whole smoked chicken meal. Unfortunately the meat was very very dry and tasted "dusty" - no seasoning. 

The sides I chose were baked beans and fries. I was expecting more flavour from the beans but it was kinda watery. The fries were decent.

For dessert I had the fried peach pie.
This was the best part of the meal! Very nice tasting and felt like it was baked today.
author: Yama H.

description:
30weeks pregnant and during impromptu drive along the coast with hubs  I was craving some BBQ and not pseudo-bbq but real deal, down home grubbin BBQ. Flipped the truck around and headed to SF to Memphis Minnie's. The reviews looked great so let's try it out. 

Parking was a pain but boy the food was off the hook!

Hubs: slab of ribs, cornbread, mac&cheese, and sweet potatoes.

Me: pulled pork sandwich with Mac&cheese and a piece of sweet potato pie!

Meats and the mac was AHmazing! We tried all of the sauces. My fav was a combo of the Texas red and it's hot. 

This place is nothing fancy but it IS freaking good. Those living in SF you can get delivery thru grubhub. 

We will definitely be back!
author: Sonya C.

description: Great Ruben special. Great service. I'm in the neighborhood so I wake up to the great smell of them cooking up the daily meat.
author: Nick C.

description: Pretty mediocre food. Brisket is bone dry. Mac and cheese seemed like it had been left out and the cheese congealed. They also don't have any regular bbq sauce other than an extremely hot red sauce.
author: Katherine F.

description:
Ordered food through Uber Eats and go on with my day. I got a notice via American Express that they were paid for the food. 20 minutes later I get a notice from Uber Eats saying that my order was cancelled for an unknown reason and I was still charged. What kind of back alley two dollar hooker deal is this??? 

Never again.
author: Andrew M.

description: Is it too much to ask for decent food when you choose carry out? I ordered the Friday special, a cheeseburger with fried onions and bacon but got just a sad cheeseburger, that wasn't even rung up correctly.
author: Michele H.

description: The food was amazing! I ordered delivery but after 20 minutes was informed that they were unable to deliver. The option to pick up is not available and it's clear that it should be.  My son picked up my order and was told it wasn't paid for but I ordered through eat24 and paid from my card...by the way was charged for order. The woman running the register at Memphis Minnie's was awesome after she was informed by us that I was already charged gave my son our order with no hesitation...THANK YOU
author: Jessica H.

description:
I have walked by here countless times, but it was somehow never the right occasion... but then the stars finally aligned this weekend.  (The boo said let's go to Memphis Minnie's. That was the occasion.)

We walked into this unassuming spot, ordered from the nicest staff who accommodated my always indecisive ordering, and somehow were able to get two massive "half" sandwiches each, with a huge pile of fries and Mac n cheese as our sides for something like $13ea. How are they doing bbq like this with prices like this in the heart of SF? 

Boyf said he'd been a regular before his more recent health kick, so he knows his way around his brisket sandwich and sauces. I went with the southern star -- half brisket, half smoked pork. They come dry, which is how I like it. You dress it how you like it with their selection of 4-5 sauces on the tables. Both meats were really good, especially the pork (mmmm fatty) and really generous portions. I was plenty full without eating most of the bread.

I didn't actually like the sauces much (too watery?) or their Mac n cheese (bland and over cooked as most are), but that's really not a problem. I'm good with meat and potatoes. I'm a simple girl. 

We got a stamp card. We'll be back.
author: Vivian H.

description:
As someone who grew up in Florida and Georgia, I have opinions on BBQ. Memphis Minnie's is cooked meat smothered in sauce not BBQ. There's no smoke flavors coming through, no BBQ texture to the meat. Not entirely their fault since getting the permits for a proper smoker in SF is basically impossible.

The sides absolutely rescue the place and the portions are good. Perfectly fine 3 star place, if you're around and hungry you won't be sad but not worth traveling to when there are at least 2 vastly better BBQ joints in town.
author: Kurt N.

description:
let me preface this by saying : I don't know shit about bbq. I've always found most of the bbq places I've been to as lacking in flavor and dry. I thought that was just how bbq was. I decided to give this place a shot anyway, bc I had a discount on ubereats and I was craving cornbread. 

i just received my order from here ten minutes ago, and oh my god. I'd die for whoever made this. The meat is so tender and juicy and I think it's seasoned very well; I ate like half of it without even putting any sauce on the thing. I got the smoked pork plate, and I'm shoveling more into my mouth as I write this. If you haven't tried this place, definitely worth the shot! I was a lil skeptical about it, because 1) not a huge fan of bbq, 2) some reviews were kind of bad, but honestly this is probably the best choice I've ever made in my life
author: Erin K.

description:
Never again. Ordered from MM on GrubHub...delivery was fast, but there were no sauces included. I called the restaurant and was told by the helpless guy that answered the phone..."uh...sorry bout that. I don't know what happened. There should be some in the box." I said there wasn't and BBq isn't really BBQ without sauce. Again, "well, really sorry bout that. Not sure what happened"

Wasted $60 horrible!

Will never order from here and will never speak fondly of it
author: Scott D.

description: I ordered delivery through Cavair.  I ordered the smoked chicken plate.  When I received my order I took a couple of bites of my chicken and noticed that the chicken was still raw and pink.  The order came with 3 pieces so I checked the other pieces and they were as pink and raw as the one I bit into.  I had to make myself throw up and then took pictures of the chicken, then I had to throw away the chicken.  I tried calling the restaurant to make a complaint but no one answers after several tries I decided to make a complaint to Caviar and the Food Safety and Inspection department.  This is not acceptable to serve your customers raw chicken and I will be taking all necessary actions.  This is very disappointing.
author: Lennie G.

description:
Smokey.  Homey.  Funky.  That's the experience you get.  Walkable distance from 4505, but without the line.  Kind of one of those places that you hope people don't hear about, so that it doesn't get overrun.

Smoked fried chicken?  Wow.  yes, please!  How did they do that, anyhow?

Smoked brisket? check!  Pulled Pork? check!  You can get it all on a sampler platter.

And don't forget about the sides!  collard greens never tasted so good.  lots of bacon fat, smooth as a baby's bottom, slides right down to your tummy.  all of the sides are good, but the greens really stand out.

Service is fine; nothing fancy.
author: Benjamin H.

description:
Let me break this one down for you all San Francisco folk... Memphis Minnie's is delicious!

I grew up in Tennessee and spent many years living on the Mississippi River down in historic Memphis. I've been to Beale Street for bike nights and have had the best BBQ in Memphis and in TN. Memphis Minnie's captures it all! If you are looking for REAL BBQ - look no farther! It's smokey and juicy. Memphis Minnie's has amazing brisket and Mac and cheese as well! Their cornbread is almost like what my grandma makes, as well! So dang yummy! 

If you're looking for a delicious BBQ experience here in SF - Memphis Minnie's has it... 
trust me, I know what Memphis BBQ tastes like.

Also, great for delivery!
author: Marie C.

description: Have you had their burger? Their brisket chili? As a kid and now as an old dude in Lower Haight, this is a place you should check out.  Fuck yeah.
author: scott P.

description: Being from the South, one thing I've gathered that the southern bar b q out here sucks. This place never disappoints. The vinegar slaw is bomb and you can go wrong with the ribs, pork, or the Thursday special fried chicken sando with cornbread. This isn't a dressed up place, just a pure and simple bar b q joint. Which it should be
author: Jonathan K.

description: They only had spare ribs whereas I prefer baby back ribs. So, I ordered their brisket. The brisket was definitely better than average. They have 4 or 5 different types of barbecue sauces to meet different tasting needs. The sides were not all that great, but the service was fast and prompt. The barbecue smell inside the restaurant was nostalgic of Memphis barbecue restaurants. They also have a nice selection of blues music that they play over the restaurant speakers.
author: Omar S.

description:
Tonight was my first time eating at this burger joint after my neighbor had suggested it this week. Back in the early 2000s I'd notice the sign each time I was going to Downtown. Now I know better than to just gaze at hidden gems in the Haight District!
I rarely have a burger for dinner! I had the Maxi Burger. The plate came with onion rings, which I didn't finish, since my neighbor ordered me a slice of Scratch Pecan Pie. Pecan pie is a rarity in my life. Sometimes I'll notice it during Thanksgiving Dinner. Diet Coke was part of my meal!
Coming to Memphis Minnie's was a real treat! I'm definitely coming back.
author: Julio B.

description: This IS NOT REAL BBQ. Don't ever go here. The food was blanded, hell nasty, and was not worth the price. I won't give this food to my dog because I'm afraid he is going to to have the shit's for days. The food then made me throw it all up.
author: Leticia S.

description:
Food is usually outstanding.  Since I had forgotton that several months ago it had taken over an hour to get a small lunch on a weekday afternoon between 1230-130, and I was working nearby, I stopped in to get some to-go.
12:15pm wednesday.  6 diners.  5 served, 1 waiting.  4 people in kitchen or behind counter.  Stood there for ten minutes like an idiot.  No one made eye contact or bothered to acknowledge my presence.  Waving credit card.  Nothing.
Walk out, no time left on break to get lunch.  Fuck this place it jumped the shark.  1 star for the years of good food though.  Never be back.  Wont bother to when there is a great BBQ around the corner that is actually HAPPY that I walked in the door.
author: Alex C.

description:
I had the fortune to live within walking distance of this spot, and I made sure to make use of that.

California of course isn't known for BBQ, and as such I'm probably not the best judge of how this would compare to real BBQ in the South. That said, in my California opinion, Memphis Minnie's is awesome. Almost every time I've gone, everything I've ordered has been good to great. And since I've gone probably 20 or 30 times I feel like I have a pretty informed opinion.

In my opinion, these are the best meats and sides:
- St. Louis Style Smoked Pork Ribs
- Slow-Smoked Texas Beef Brisket
- Potlikker Greens
- Minnie's Macaroni & Cheese

Everything else is good, but these 4 things are the best on the menu.

I also love the 4 sauces they have on every table, the spicy one isn't all that spicy and the Texas one is kind of blah, but the customization is nice. My personal favorite is the North Carolina sauce that has mustard in it, although the vinegar one is also great for cutting through the fatty, rich meat.

I also have a funny story about one visit. So I was with my friend, and we both ordered food and were seated and we got to talking about how he's from LA, and he happens to be someone who enjoys smoking the marijuana. Whatever, I don't judge, and it's legal-ish now anyway.

So we're talking, and this lady at the table next to us overhears us and asks how he likes SF. She's an older lady, a little frazzled looking, and he mentions that it's nice but he misses some parts of LA and also it's cold. The lady finishes before us, and before leaving says "hold out your hands, I got something to welcome you to San Francisco".

No joke, he cups his hands and this lady proceeds to literally fill up his hands with marijuana. I have no idea how much, but like, way more than any normal person just carries loose on them. My friend looks like a little kid on Christmas, eyes lit up, huge smile. Me being unused to seeing drugs I was just shocked.

Does the story end there? No! Apparently my friend, who I'll now start referring to as "my idiot friend", went home and made the marijuana into cigarettes. Which he left on a table, that apparently isn't level. So his French Bulldog somehow knocked them off and ate them all.

Luckily my idiot friend's dog was fine, but he said the dog was staring at the ceiling, drooling and unresponsive, for hours.

Back to the restaurant, in my mind there are only two main issues with Memphis Minnie's. First, it pains me to say so, but sometimes the meat is a bit dry. I've watched plenty of food shows that go to real Southern BBQ spots, and the meat always looks juicy. Maybe those were bad days.

Second, obviously the prices are too high. I can eat their "Minnie's Taster" three meat combo no problem, which in my mind means it's too small. I feel like if you go to a BBQ place and order their largest platter, it should be way too much food to finish. Memphis Minnie's isn't there, and for $20 it's too much. Either it should be like $14, or they should seriously add 1/3 more food to it.

Anyway, prices and ocasional quality issues aside, I really like this place. It's unique, the interior is kitschy and fun, and it gives me a chance to eat something that is outside the normal California fair. I sadly no longer live nearby, but I have very fond memories of when I did. Especially about that insane lady who carries around buckets of marijuana.
author: Sm L.

description:
Probably worst meal ever,had it delivered,brisket was dry,pork tasteless,fries were cold,rolls were stale,pies tasted like they were a week old,Mac and cheese/slaw containers were both open and spilt,so to sum it really really poor quality,cold and definitely overpriced for the quality and quantity... AVOID,go elsewhere.
What's worse is that the owner doesn't even have the balls to reply to either myself or Eat24
You suck you yellow bum.
Grow a pair...
author: John R.

description: Awesome place, great food ! Pit-smoked plates are all you'll ever need . Friendly stuff and great ambiance
author: paul c.

description: You order, wait for your food and take a seat. We ordered the half pound brisket and 6 baby back ribs. It was cooked really well and placed all on one plate which was very filling. The service  was okay. The atmosphere is kinda old school.
author: Steven W.

description: Had a fried chicken sando. It was fine but just examining it, are two discs of chicken battered and fried. Tasty enough, crunchy, a little dry. The side of greens pot likker, was virtually inedible, super sour super sweet. But eaten with the heavier sandwich between bites helped balance the affair.
author: E. W.

description: Yum! Had the ribs + mac n cheese - would recommend both. Cozy place with good service.
author: Michelle B.

description:
This is a great BBQ place. Long live Memphis Minnie's.

Had the ribs, chicken and brisket, all good af.

Unique sauces.

Highly recommend for your bbq fix.
author: Matt G.

description:
Listen up, kids. Every first Friday of the month, Memphis Minnies smokes the ginormous beef rib. Yes, it's not cheap, $28 for the rib, but its oh so dericious. Like nommy nom effin nom! Bark. Smoke ring. Well seasoned. Giant bone to beat your enemies with. No sauce needed. Taste the meat. 

Warning is that it's available until it sells out. I got there at 11am when they opened. Hallelujah and praise Jesus!
author: Pickle R.

description:
Great BBQ atmosphere pick nick style table common at good BBQ spots. But let's go to what counts the brisket . Holy smokes knocked my freakin sox off.
 Super moisten tender perfectly slow cooked breaks apart like fish meat. The pic does no do it justice to flavor. 
Had good beer on tap too. 
Great customer service too food was prompt .
Will definitely return
author: Eric P.

description: Best BBQ in SF! I don't eat pork so having beef options is the best. Everything is delicious but don't leave without trying their coleslaw, it's the best so far! Worth the finger licking experience with every sauce!
author: Gardenia H.

description: Had the Tuesday Special Pork Belly Sandwich which was excellent. For those who have guilt like me over the excessive fat, I asked for no mayo and used a knife and forks to cut away the pork fat. A guilty pleasure done with less guilt!  Includes a side, had the beans, wonderful.
author: Dan W.

description:
Once upon a time, I left my heart at a Texas bbq pit. I never got it back, bbq has never been the same. So I was pleasantly surprised by how much I like Memphis Minnie's, I'm now kicking myself for not trying this place out sooner!

Went for lunch and the boyfriend and I shared the Minnie's Taster (which was plentyyyy of food for the both of us). Sausage, brisket, ribs + slaw, beans, and added mac n cheese, here's the breakdown:
-Sausage: really good flavor! I didn't think that the casing had much crunch though (I know, I'm nitpicking)
-Brisket: smokey and delicious...I forgot to ask for the fatty cut (my favorite) but we got a good mix. Not the most moist brisket I've ever had, but it definitely wasn't dry
-Ribs: I haven't had ribs that I've enjoyed this much in a longgg time. I like these so much better than 4505s (which I think is too sweet/sticky/gummy on top). These are super meaty and tender with a nice rub ;)
-Slaw: tangy and sweet, reminds me of bread and butter pickles...couldn't get enough of the slaw!
-Beans: Eh, not bad but I'd probably pass next time...I like 4505s baked beans much better
-Mac N Cheese: mmm so creamy....so delicious

Overall, the meats really held their own with lots of flavor, smokiness, and great texture. You can tell they do it right, low and slow, by the layer of pink on the edge of the meat once it's cut. On top of that, I did enjoy the sauces; despite being a little thinner, they had a lot of flavor...I like the mustard one the best, then the Texas red sauce.

The atmosphere is fun and laid back. The place has a lot of history and it's all over the walls. It was so refreshing to walk into a restaurant and feel like I've left the pretentiousness of San Francisco behind. Lauren helped us order and she was very sweet and friendly.

We'll probably be coming here from now on instead of 4505!
author: Chanel H.

description:
Good bbq! 

Food was good - I had the chicken sandwich which really didn't feel like a sandwich from a bbq spot (probably my fault for assuming i'd end up with a bbq pulled chicken). It was tasty though and the creamy sauce, tho very messy was tasty and ample. The bbq platter was a little more what we wanted -- traditional bbq. It was the best we've had in sf, but as a frequent visitor to the south, it didn't quite live up to our hopes or dreams.  

Atmosphere is great, very casual and low key. Exactly what you want it to be.
author: Stephanie M.

description: If it were for the food alone, I would have given this place 4 to 5 stars but I had something occur that left a bad taste in my mouth about their service.  I was enjoying my food and took started to eat the beans when I heard something crack and shatter in my mouth.  It was either a piece of concrete or a soft pebble.  At first, I thought it was a tooth but after digging around in my mouth and recovering the five pieces of whatever it was, I figured out it was not a tooth.  Anyway, I brought it to the attention of a staff member, a heavy set guy with beard and glasses, and he just basically said "we will check the beans".  Now honestly, if a customer experiences something like this and discreetly pulls you aside, you really need to extend yourself in some way to accommodate them.  Nothing, Nada, Ziltch.  Honestly, I am not sure if I will be going back again.
author: Colin Y.

description: The ribs are delicious and fall off the bones,  but I didn't really like their sauces. There is a vinegar sauce,  hot sauce,  Texas red sauce,  and mustard sauce.  What happened to the regular BBQ sauce and honey barbeque sauce? Their sauces are liquidy, but I like the thicker sauce. Even though the food was good and the price is great ($10 for 3 ribs), I was a little bit disappointed because of the sauces.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
If you're looking for bbq in SF, come here. You should eat in-house if possible. 

Fried chicken, Mac n cheese, brisket, chopped ribs. Daily specials - just had their fried chicken sandwich h.  Lots of love from the people and the food.
author: Josephine L.

description:
I had such high expectations for this place since I was told this place has the best barbecue. 

The food was pretty average. We got the chicken, brisket and andouille sausage to share. For our sides, we got the mac n cheese, beans and greens. 

Brisket: mixed review. Some parts were dry and some were tender and moist. Flavor was ok. I needed to put lots of their house sauces on the barbecue to make it taste better. 

Andouille sausage: can't go too wrong with this. Had a nice flavor and I believe had a little spice to it. I dipped the sausage in one of their house sauces as well. 

Chicken: best out of everything. The chicken was fried. The chicken was moist and flavorful. I still dipped it in the house hot sauce since it was delicious. 

Mac n cheese: eh, it was ok. The consistency of the cheese was not too thin and not too thick. Too bad it was a little lacking in flavor.

Cornbread: dry 

Beans: tasty! I liked how there was meat mixed in it! 

Greens: very tasty. I have never had greens with a vinegar base. I think the vinegar base helped to cut out the bitterness that greens sometimes tend to have. 

Service: excellent. The lady that helped us was very informative and friendly. She kept checking up on us to make sure everything was ok. I know, perhaps the owner will respond and ask why I didn't tell her how I really felt about the food. Maybe I should have spoken up, but I didn't.
author: Nancy A.

description:
Am I here for BBQ or am I about to be a character in a children's storybook? That's what I was thinking when I came upon what looked like a red barn of a restaurant with farm animals painted in front. The interior could use some sprucing up. Like a lot of these bbq/soul food/diner type of spots, it was also decorated with a lot of knick knacks, t-shirts on the walls, and various accolades hung up. One thing I was wondering, how can I enjoy pork when there are so many pictures of cute piglets on the walls?
I am quite green when it comes to the art of barbecue, but I appreciate the labor of love that goes into it. We shared the Two Way Combo (22.95) and Minnie's Taster w/ 3 Meats ($26.95). Both come with 2 small sides & a cornbread muffin.

St. Louis Style Smoked Pork Ribs - great smokey flavor, a little dry, but of course the house sauces saved them.
Slow-Smoked Texas Beef Brisket - definitely very tasty, but a little dried out.
Smoked Chicken - surprisingly, I enjoyed chicken the most. The skin developed a nice crunch and the meat was tender. 
Cornbread muffin - yummy, hard to go wrong with a corn muffin, & slightly oily on the outside.
Minnie's Macaroni & Cheese - thick & gooey, and slightly sweet.
Potato Salad - not bad, but I didn't have too much of it, as I'm not a fan of celery & onions.
Tart n Tangy Slaw - I don't care for slaw, but the sour, cold, crunchy leaves were rather refreshing for that warm hot day.
Deep South Sweet Potatoes - sweet & mushy.

I found Memphis Minnie's food reasonably satiating, not amazing, but I remember the neighborhood-friendly service. The guy working the counter was very outgoing and offered up a free cookie to the first person who could name the artist of the soul song was playing over the speakers at the time.
author: Joy W.

description:
I was in the area and was starving with a friend. We walked around the neighborhood and it was Memphis Minnie's that caught our eye!

We asked for recommendations and ordered the Southern Star (beef and pork brisket sandwich) w/ a side of Mac & Cheese and I got the Pulled Spicy Chicken Sandwich w/ a side of Sweet Potatoes.

The Southern Star - JUICY. Interesting that it was thin sliced, but it was clear that the meat was very tender. Pretty simple in flavor, but tasty. 

Mac & Cheese - Cheesy and good. Pretty creamy, best served hot. 

Pulled Spicy Chicken Sandwich - ALSO JUICY- Wasn't sure if I would be into this one but it was very good. I gobbled it up right away!

Sweet Potatoes - Always loved sweet potatoes. These were cooked in apple juice, so it tastes just like that. Sweet potatoes & apple juice. Not sure if I'm the biggest fan but the touch of sweetness is nice and goes pretty well with the chicken (and probably pork).

Overall quite good, one of the better BBQ places I've tasted in SF. I've got plans to come back and try their Fried Chicken.
author: Sofia R.

description: I want to start this off by saying that this place's customer service is AMAZING! Their staff is friendly, welcoming, and extremely attentive. We met the coolest group of people here, all while enjoying some amazing food! Coming from a rich background of loving home cooked, heart warming food, this place is is definitely up to par! You can't find BBQ like this just anywhere and we are glad we did.
author: Deena R.

description:
Eureka! I have finally found somewhere to get my BBQ fix in San Francisco. Plus it's close to where I live. The restaurant and menu selection were not impressive, but I enjoyed the flavors of the sauces available at the tables. 

My friend and I ordered a variety of meats and sides to split. For meat, we went with the beef brisket and pork ribs. LOVE the pork ribs, especially with the spicy sauce. PRO TIP: MIX THE SAUCES TOGETHER!! The meats are dry, but that's what good sauce is for. 

For sides, we got the potato salad, mac n cheese, and cornbread. The cornbread went well with the meat, and I'm always a sucker for mac n cheese. The main piece of criticism that I have is that the room temperature of all the food was off-putting, like it was obviously it was sitting out for awhile.

Regardless, I did enjoy the food here and would come back to eat it again!
author: Stefanie C.

description: I like it! True southern vibe in this joint, not to mention juicy tender ribs, crispy fried chicken, and delicious collared greens and Mac n cheese! It's been difficult to find good southern BBQ in the bay, and I feel successful having stumbled upon this place today. Sweet tea is authentically too sweet, so you have to cut it with unsweet tea. The table is stocked with sauces for your ribs.
author: Kris F.

description: Best damn BBQ in the city, hands down!!!  I've heard Memphis Minnie's BBQ for awhile, I just never made the time to go there until now.  My family and I were there last Sunday and we ordered: beef brisket plate and sandwich pulled pork plate and sandwich, and BBQ chicken.  All the meats were full of flavor and melted in your mouth.  The buns for the sandwiches were I believe brioche I maybe wrong on the brioche but it had that buttery rich flavor brioche buns have and it complimented the beef brisket sandwich.  He last time I had BBQ this good was years ago at Everett and Jones in Oakland.  As far as the sides we had the BBQ beans and seasoned fries.  The beans were delicious they were full of that sweet BBQ flavor along with a decent amount of meat. My son got the seasoned fries and they were plentiful and were not greasy.  The service was excellent everyone behind the counter were friendly and we also got our food relatively fast.  Everything was great except the price was a little steep but to tell you the truth the food was worth it.  Overall, awesome BBQ and definitely worth going out of the way to eat there.  #MemphisMinnie #SanFranciscoBBQ #BestBBQ
author: Mike S.

description: Hmmm didn't like much stuff here. Tried the Nashville hot chicken, it was very dry and not spicy at all. The brisket was B minus. The mac and cheese was B minus. The cornbread was very good and so was the tri tip. I didn't enjoy any of the sauces they had at all. They lacked flavor and were watery.
author: Phoenix F.

description: I feel bad that I haven't written this sooner, because we've been going to Memphis Minnie's BBQ Joint for several years now.  We just love the place!!   We live in the Easy Bay and regularly drive into the city specifically to go to Memphis Minnie's.  My favorites are the Two Way Combo with Beef Brisket & Cajun sausage.  The meats are superb.  My favorite side is their Mac & Cheese.  Hands-down, the best Mac & cheese I've ever tasted.  A Two-Way Combo is a ton of food.  It really makes 3 meals for me, and that is my intention.  It's so much fun to have all those wonderful leftovers to bring home for the next few days.  On their Specials, Wednesday's is our favorite:  the Pastrami Sandwich.  I tell you, it melts in your mouth...it's so unbelievably tender.  But the single most fantastic item at Memphis Minnie's, in my eyes, is their Mustard Sauce.  At first, I wasn't even open to it...I like the traditional red BBQ sauces.  But my husband convinced me to just try it, and I was hooked!  It's just phenomenal.  Hell, I'd chug it like a beer if I could, but that would probably be a little undignified!  I will tell ya, parking is miserable.  So my husband and I do the tag-team bit and he runs in and picks up the order which we had phoned in, while I drive around the block a few times.  Then we bring our bag of deliciousness to the beach and make an afternoon or evening of it.  I've turned family and friends onto this gem and they, too, have become disciples.  You've just got to try it!!!!
author: Nancy E.

description: Great food, clean place. Has hole in the wall feel. A little pricy, but worth every penny. BBQ I've personally had on this side of the bay!!!
author: Chapel T.

description: I had the the special of the day. On Tuesday it was a pork belly sandwich with spicy mayo and tangy slaw. It was the best lunch I've had on haight street lately. And to top it all off, the woman at the front was extremely pleasant and helpful. Nothing like delicious food and friendly service!
author: Efren Y.

description: Awesome West Coast BBQ!! Ribs amazing, brisket is off the chain and tender!! Greens good, sweet potato's yum and slaw different but delish!! Thanks for the best BBQ on the West Coast that I have had yet!!
author: Amanda N.

description:
Rib were excellent with siblings and friend. [Leftover] Cold ribs without the sauces were even better.
 And for less than $100 for 5 adults!
author: Sam L.

description: Very good food.Great BBQ joint with unique daily specials.  Not of space inside
author: Debra E.

description: I was craving for short ribs and since Memphis is right next to my apartment, I decided to give a try. Because I didn't wanna wait, I called in to place an order for pickup. I ordered 4 ribs in total and it cost about $10. They were decent sizes and Memphis included both BBQ and mustard sauces on the side. The ribs were pretty tender and juicy and they tasted really good if you dipped them in mustard and BBQ sauces. Decent quality with decent price. Probably will go again whenever I'm craving for ribs.
author: Clare L.

description: I love BBQ. And I'm sure there are plenty of friends who could attest to this. I travel 100's of miles to try recommended spots.  This BBQ was pretty good. The chicken (smoked) was tender. The ribs we nice and tender and well smoked. The sausage was good too. I even liked the sides (potato salsa and mac and cheese). My real complaint is the BBQ sauce. I'm not a dry rub only kind of lady. I like my meats saucy and accompanied with an authentic BBQ sauce. The stuff I tried was not good at all and they have 4 (maybe 5 I found a bottle of sauce that wasn't on any other table) BBQ sauces to choose from. My friend who dined with me agreed. So, if you can chow down with just the meat, this place is decent. But if you need something for dippin' I'd suggest finding another joint.
author: Kimberly R.

description: Really really rude service. The staff were having an loud argument amongst themselves, and the whole atomosphere was just so awkward that i had to leave. I asked to get boxes to go so I can get out of there , the waitress came over and threw a couple boxes at me, one went on top of my food. I'm pretty speechless and shocked how this place remains open. The BBQ was meh at best and the experience just totally ruined it. I ended up giving my ribs away to the homeless.
author: Alvin D.

description: Good barbecue and good sides. My favorite is the brisket, mac & cheese, and pecan pie! The store is heavily penetrated with smoke that it seems a little unhealthy. We take it to go!
author: R A.

description: Awesome delicious Texas-style BBQ. Feels like one of the few neighborhoody, down to earth joints left in SF. I went in yesterday and was treated like family. Along with the food being excellent, the atmosphere is great with rock and blues music playing and lots of great bbq mementos and signs on the walls. Can't recommend this place enough.
author: Storm F.

description: Best burger in the world. Seriously. The nicest people, the most delicious cornbread, brisket, and fries. Every. Single. Time.
author: Mikaela H.

description: I haven't even tasted the food...........the service was lousy....the employee cutting the meat is putting bits of meat in his mouth, even with gloves on... I say all red sauce... hot.... I get all yellow... I wasn't told no corn bread... I come back... I get a roll and come back to change sauce... I only got one side... potato salad... just one... with my brisket rib combo... never paid $24.90 before.... over charging at closing and don't have corn bread... not informing or listening to customer.... I'm done trying to deal with this Joynt!  Ribs Luke warm.. and cold grease on portion of brisket...please get some help with the sides.....and watery sauces.... people just giving you $$$....
author: Kathy W.

description: The brisket melted in my mouth and the ribs had a great smokey flavor like my grandpa used to make. I'll be back for sure
author: Joey S.

description: It makes me so sad to leave this review because I used to love this place.  Since May 2018, it's been under new ownership and everything has changed for the worse.  I just took my family there and had a horrible experience.  Food was awful - ribs and brisket were so greasy and gross, and the sides overly sweet and greasy too.  The only thing that was still edible was the cornbread.  Worst of all was the service - the new owner Gui Bok Lee is rude rude rude.  I don't think he realizes that dining is a hospitality business.  People will quickly forget how food tastes, but they will never forget how you make them feel.  Definitely never going back.
author: Dun W.

description:
This used to be my favorite BBQ place in the Bay Area, it certainly smells great unfortunately I feel it's a total rip-off and quality has suffered along with the authenticity SF once had. 
I simply asked for the leanest brisket possible and offered to pay. The last 3 times it was mostly fat, I'd even go as far as saying 85-90% fat. A slimy, gelatinous ball of fat. Despite drowning it in the tasty BBQ sauce, it was like trying to eat jell-o, but a greased up version. No thanks. 
The greens are pretty good and I love the slaw. That's it though. It's a bummer, I knew Bob, and I don't think he would serve that to patrons.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
Best soul food in the city hands down! Smoked fried chicken is so next level. Great staff always super friendly. 

Coming from Memphis I would expect some memphis branded bbq sauces, but our bbq is traditionally dry rub and smoked.
author: Calvin S.

description: These ribs are so delicious!  Their sauces are all unique and have great flavor.  I love the tangy mustardy yellow sauce.  They have great collard greens, beans, macaroni and cheese.. all good.  I do think their cornbread could be a little better.  Also, prices are great.  You get enough food for two people for 23-24 bucks.  Awesome!!
author: Maureen O.

description:
Food is very good. Traditional American BBQ. And very quick service. 

The people are lovely too.
author: Johnny B.

description: Dropped in here for lunch today, and immediately began salivating at the delicious smell of roasting meat. We both ordered the special of the day, a pastrami reuben sandwich, which after a short wait, was revealed to be a glorious pile of pastrami with cheese, sauerkraut and dressing, grilled to perfection on rye bread. Oh boy, was it tasty. We had our choice of sides, and I chose the mac and cheese, which was not the best ever, but it was quite good. We loved this place and will return soon.
author: Alison J.

description: Great southern bbq and has different sauces to please your pallet. Reminds me of home cause lord know you can't get good pork in Texas
author: Willie R.

description:
Delicious!!!! 
Came here at the spare of the moment. And we're totally satisfied with the food and friendly service!!!!
author: Sandra L.

description: Met my expectations for a bbq joint. Brisket was pretty good. Nothing spectacular. If you have a bbq craving, this will hit the spot. If you are looking for something special, look elsewhere.
author: Mike F.

description: Memphis Minnie's catered my wedding reception, and we were all so pleased that they did! My reception was held at a private home in San Francisco, and they delivered and set it all up - disposable chafers and everything. We had some very picky and hard-to-please guests and even they loved the food -- when your guests are complimenting the Caesar salad when there are also delicious ribs and mac and cheese to eat, you know they've done something very very right! (And those ribs and mac and cheese were bomb dot com, too!) A very special thank you to Tom and his staff who had to get up early to make our food fresh for the desired drop-off time. I already can't wait to have Memphis Minnie's barbecue again.
author: veronique f.

description: Great BBQ! Love coming to this place to get good bbq. I have tried the ribs, brisket, and sausage. All delicious. The meats are smoked and have a different sauces you can add. Good side dish options too. Mac and cheese and seasoned fries are my favorite. Prices are reasonable especially for what you get. Definitely recommend.
author: Jessika R.

description: It's beyond hard finding good bbq in San Francisco but we found this place and it's beyond amazing. As a Texas guy living in California, this food took me back! We'll be back for sure! Sooooo good!
author: Joel H.

description: One of my favorite spots in SF. Smoked fried chicken and brisket are amazing. Thursday's fried chicken sandwich special is also worth a trip to Lower Haight.
author: Chris V.

description: I ordered a food to go and when I came up to pick up on time, they told me they had some priority costumers before and I waited for 25 minutes for an order of 3 burgers. Besides of that, the cashier, an Afro-american woman didn't had any training about costumer service, she just didn't care at all about my waiting time. Avoid this place if you like things on time!
author: Marcelo N.

description:
After hours of searching we finally just decided to eat something close buy.... I was not disappointed. 

I ordered the pulled spicy chicken sandwich with mac n cheese. Also had some of their fries. The sandwich is actually a little spicy, contrary to most spicy chickens I've had. I definitely liked it, and for some odd reason wasn't able to finish, but that might be due to other reasons! The mac and cheese is pretty good! Somewhat hard to mess that up, but i've definitely seen bad macs so I am glad this one was nice and rich. Their fries are great! I really like seasoned fries, so I am a fan. I feel like if I lived there, I would definitely swing by for my fries cravings.

We went on a sunday evening, it wasn't too crowded. Place is semi small, GREAT for groups of 4. We had a group of 8/9 so we were lucky and found tables next to each other and we just put em together. 

Staff friendly! Definitely check this place out :D
author: Akash P.

description: You can order a single rib for $3.95 if you're not a heavy meat eater. The rib was super tender and flavorful. I also ordered the greens and slaw sides. Unfortunately, both were too tangy and I had trouble finishing even half. The service is super fast, my food came out in less than 5 minutes, on a Saturday 6pm dinner time.
author: Winnie Y.

description:
Great mix of Texas BBQ and Memphis pork style. If you were to order the brisket in Austin, it would come out the same way.  

They even have Shiner beer which is like a Philly place having tastycakes. 

Basically a slice of Austin,TX.
author: Michael R.

description:
On my continued hunt for the best pastrami sandwich in SF, I decided to give Memphis Minnies a chance to redeem itself (check previous review for context). I finally remembered one Wednesday to make my way out to lower haight since that is the only day they serve pastrami.

Pastrami Reuben - 4/5 - The pastrami here is thick cut and has a nice crust to it. In contrast to my previous disappointment here with dry meats, the pastrami was incredibly moist. It states on the description that it's cured, then smoked, then steamed so perhaps this is why this meat was so wet and flavorful. The biggest problem here is that they only put two layers of meat throughout the sandwich. When I first bit into the sandwich the flavor was totally drowned out by the rye and dressing. I did some quick surgery on it and put all of the meat one one half. This resulted in a perfectly balanced taste and quantity. The ownership should add twice the amount of pastrami layers and increase the price a few dollars to put this sandwich in contention for one of the top pastrami sandwiches in the city. 

Rib Tips - 2/5 - Why did I order an item that I knew was going to disappoint me? No idea. But I did. And it did. It was the same as the ribs I got last time. Dry. 

Grit sticks - 3/5 - Interesting concept, decent side dish. Good but I wouldn't order this again.

Beef ribs - 4/5 - I'm going to start by saying that in other cities, I've had much, much better beef ribs than these. Unfortunately, this is SF, which means that BBQ options are extremely limited. I can only think of a handful of places that even consistently offer smoked beef ribs as more than just the occasional special. This is unfortunate as this is my favourite BBQ meat of all. Of those options, Memphis Minnie's so far has been the best. The flavor is good, the smokiness is definitely there and the amount of meat on the bone is acceptable. It doesn't quite melt in your mouth and there are parts which are just too chewy and stiff but it definitely outshines it's competition.

Peach pie - 2/5 - Dessert is unsurprisingly not the focus of this shop. This was ok but I've definitely had better hand pies.

Adding to the improved experience while there, I have to make note that the manager (owner?) noticed that I had to wait an extra 30 minutes for the beef ribs and generously threw in an extra one in my takeout box. Bonus points.

Overall, I was quite pleased with this visit to Memphis Minnie's and would return here for more (on wednesdays). The pastrami sandwich and the beef ribs were enjoyable and I would order both again. This time around, "I'm a fan."
author: Mark O.

description:
A breath of fresh air with a local vibe. If you want real BBQ that isn't gentrified this is your place. Good bars near by, so make it a night out. 

fat equals flavor
author: Henry L.

description:
Every since the new smokers were installed two months ago the BBQ is more juicy and tender than before.  While not open on Monday's you can double up on the Pork Belly Sandwiches on Tuesday. The thick sliced home made bacon is candied until there is a slight crack through the honey. If everyone were to vote for more bacon sides, I think it would be perfect. A half pound side of candied bacon even if it costs $20 is well worth it. I would buy more bacon to go if I knew it would not hurt their sales. A half pound of bacon is good for two to three of their Tuesday special sandwiches. 

 I have brought in their bacon, full rack of ribs, smoke chicken wings, onion strings, corn bread, pecan pie, to my hungry coworkers for lunch and it is like feeding time on the shark shows. My coworkers line up chomping on the bit to get some great food. If the coworkers turned around in line they would see they were taking too long to fix their plate. 

Save the first Friday of every month for a special treat .BBQ Beef Ribs are served on the First Friday of every month. The meat on the ribs is about a pound to a pound and a half of 14 hour smoked goodness. It is $28 for just the ribs and then you can order it with two medium sides. 

If you like hamburgers it is made with a mix of beef brisket and chuck, topped with home made bacon slices, pimento cheese, and more onion strings, Would love to see what a double looks like on a stacked bun but it is not on the menu. BBQ seasoned fries are one option, or you could have mac & cheese, greens, BBQ beans, coleslaw. If you like chili they make great BBQ beef brisket chili.

I changed my schedule so I can swing by to pickup some great food.
author: Edward J.

description: I have been eating here since it opened. Each time I return, no matter how long the in between time is, the food is really good and remarkably consistent. Brisket! Ribs! Coleslaw! MacNCheese!  Don't forget to try the fried chicken. Savory corn bread. It's a neighborhood gem of a bbq joint that will welcome you with an engaged staff that digs the culture that created this style of cooking. It's a can't miss place for a comforting meal.
author: Harris T.

description:
Although I'd fire mohawk girl with her selective customer service, the food is always awesome! It's kinda pricy, but well worth every bite. It's great for bringing a group of people, and splitting a couple combos. Meat is tender and tasty-both dry and with sauce. Their sauces are awesome, and I always seem to find myself drenching my meat with the "stupid hot sauce" until it's too late. Lol Brunette dude was kind enough to give me a glass of milk :). Lol he saved the day with another visit here. 

But yes,  try every meat, the greens, sauce just everything. Lol but you be the judge. Oh and let me know how the macaroni is, bc I'm picky with my mac and cheese. Enjoy and get your protein up! #cheatday #sauce #fresh
author: Clinay C.

description:
OH YEEAAHH!!!  Now this is how southern cooking is done!  I haven't had great tasting southern fried chicken like this in years.  The food is absolutely to die for.  On my next visit here, I will get the beef brisket smothered in hot sauce.

It's the only way to eat it!  :)
author: Alex W.

description:
Santa Maria Tri Tip Sandwich + side of potato salad = $13

Foundation drink (unlimited refills) = $2.50

Thought my sandwich was going to be a little bigger for the price (at least Kinders sized) but hey, still delicious! They LOADED the Tri Tip into my sandwich so I scooped out half and used a fork a knife to eat it, yum! Be sure to check out the 4 sauces on the table! Potato salad was a bit dry so I'd probably pick something else next time but my boyfriend loved the Mac and Cheese! Also, sandwich literally has 2 buns + choice of meat. Slightly disappointed there wasn't any lettuce, tomatoes, or anything of the sort. Apart from that, customer service was awesome and woman at the cash wrap was extremely friendly. 

NOTE: pay before sitting down!
author: Kaye S.

description:
The three that run this place CARE!!! WOW!!! I had an issue with my order placed through GrubHub. Called the restaurant back and spoke with Jader who personally promised to make it right or deliver it himself! Sent a private courier to deliver my correct order and when there was an issue there, called the courier and made them circle back to get to us. When we received the ordered portion of our food, it was accompanied by goodies (desserts!) sent to us straight from the owners. 

THAT'S what I call excellent service and making a crappy experience wonderful!
author: Charlene B.

description: I was really craving barbecue ribs brisket and since the normal place that I go to was sold out which is Gorilla Barbeque. So I was going through Yelp to see what else I can choose from. I came across this please and read the reviews just so happens that the first review that I read was from one of my friend that have been here before so I said the heck with it I trust his judgment and went for it. The place is a bit dark but that's not what matter what matters is the food and let me tell you the beef brisket is amazing. So my order was a full slab of ribs quarter pound of the beef brisket a small mac and cheese a small potato salad and two cornbread's all came out to be under $50. Yay if I knew the beef brisket was going to be this amazing like my friend wrote on Yelp I would have gotten half a pound but I didn't want to chance it I wanted to try it before which was a big mistake I should have got half a pound lol. Slab of ribs was good but nothing over the top. However their cornbread is pretty good the mac and potato salad was mediocre. Their sauce is really good. All thank to reading John's review my friend that I found a new place just in case my other place all sold out! I will definitely be back for the beef brisket.
author: Michele T.

description: Yummy bbq... Sides are awesome. Love the sauce is all on the side and there's different choices.
author: Crystal N.

description: Stopped by this place after sending the day in Golden Gate Park and the Haight . Every thing we tried was Great. Can't wait to go to the city again
author: Gary F.

description: This place is great! They have smoked fried chicken, it is literally smoked then fried! And yes that is as good as it sounds. I have been here a few times and have always left extremely  satisfied. Its somewhat run-down and borders a really dirty bar that you can hear through the wall, but to me that just adds to the environment and it really feels like and old-school BBQ joint.
author: Sam W.

description:
been going there for years and I've never had a bad meal or experience there.  

I've tried over half the things on the menu and I have enjoyed every single one of them.

5 stars all the way
author: Robert S.

description: Average BBQ place, their bar-bq fries were good but I was very disappointed in their pulled pork sandwich. It's was just plan dry meat between bread. No sauce, no lettuce, nothing. They have their own sauces at the table but they're far from standard barbecue sauce which would've made their sandwich 10x better.
author: Kimberly W.

description:
Have been to this homey BBQ place many times as well as taken out. One of the best BBQ in town!  Authentic slow cooked, dry rubbed Southern BBQ.  Everything from meat to sides and desserts is made from scratch. They have it all--pulled pork, BBQ ribs, smoked chicken, pork rib tips, smoked sausage  and brisket. Especially love the ribs, the rib tips, and brisket, so flavorful!  Sandwiches  are also available. There's 3 varieties of  regional house made sauces to accompany meat if you choose-- Texas red, a tangy South Carolina mustard based sauce and a North Carolina vinegar based sauce. 
Great value. For 2 of us, it usually averages about $20 each for top quality BBQ, 2 home made sides and a cornbread muffin as well as a drink.
author: E W.

description:
Their Wednesday pastrami sandwich truly is a basic sandwich, just meat and pastrami! It is thick cut, and they put a decent amount of meat in it, but it seemed a little dry and needed one of the sauces to complement it. (I prefer the red more than the yellow.) Overall, it wasn't anything special to me, oh well. I don't think I'd be willing to cough up the ~$13 total for it and a small side again.

Tried their brisket and ribs on another day. $28.59 total for a half pound of each! Pricey, but it'll last a few meals it turns out. The ribs taste better than the brisket, which I wish were a little juicier. Makes me miss the brisket I had back in Austin. Maybe I'd come back for a ribs platter?
author: Linus W.

description: Some of the most amazing BBQ we've ever had. We shopped at Upper Playground and they suggested we check this place out for lunch. We were so excited to see the prices weren't outrageously inflated and the customer service was 5 star worthy as well. The brisket almost brought tears as well as the smoked chicken and Mac n cheese. Please stay open forever. We'll be back soon!
author: James P.

description:
3.5 stars

Parking is difficult in this area, better to take public transportation than to drive if you don't live nearby.

Had the rib tip plate with mac and cheese and collard greens.

Mac and cheese was okay.. it didn't taste very cheesy and tasted a lot like it looked.. yellow mush. 

Collard greens were better, super tangy to contrast with the meat. 

Oh and  I got a lot of pork rib tips. Had to take half home because I couldn't finish it. Had the corn bread and the rest of the rib tips about two days later and they were still really good. 

Wish I had put more sauce into my to go box though..
author: Yvonne K.

description:
The brisket was tender but a bit on the dry side. It wasn't very smoky and was kinda bland overall. The only traces of smoke were in the dark bark along the edge of each slice, but that wasn't enough. 

I wasn't a big fan of the sauce either. The regular red Texas sauce had a really strong cumin flavor, and I didn't think that paired well with the meat. Since the meat wasn't very smoky or flavorful, the cumin became even more pronounced.
author: Nei N.

description:
This place is really tasty and average priced. The workers are really nice and the tables were clean upon our arrival. 

The meat was really juicy and tender while not feeling sooo greasy it makes you sick. Definitely worth checking out if you're in the area. The only draw back is the lack of BBQ sauce selection.
author: Cornelius V.

description: I just moved to town from Alabama, and I was craving pulled pork and white bbq sauce. Scoured the web for a good spot, and this place seemed the most promising. Called to check that they had white bbq sauce, and was thrilled to find out they did. I was a little nervous going in that I would be dissapountex, but this place did not let me down. Pork was amazing, and the white bbq sauce was everything I hoped it would be. Great food, friendly staff, authentic atmosphere. If you're craving southern bbq, check this place out!
author: Abby R.

description:
The food is NOT BBQ, southern or palatable. The Greens had LOADS of sugar and mustard in them. The Mac n Cheese (more Mac than the cheese) had a strange subtle spice in it as if it were pumpkin spice, really strange texture, taste and color. The ribs/meat is an EMBARRASSMENT to all Q'er's in the world. Let's be honest, these people aren't what you'll deem southern cooks or bbq'er's. It's like a strange experiment, and if you aren't familiar with eating real BBQ and southern cuisine then you wouldn't know at all the difference, and that saddens my heart because they're being cheated out of authentic cuisine. This place get two thumbs down. 

I refuse to spend money on garbage food, especially by an establishment who allow KKK to be painted on their recycling cans inside where patrons can see. Memphis Minnie's is a place for novices or people who love to throw money away.
author: Candor G.

description: Ordered the sampler to share and it was AMAZING!!! Got the brisket, trip tip and the ribs. All 3 meats had sooo much flavor and it was cooked perfectly!!! The Texas red sauce and bbq complemented the meat! Took 3 bottles of it home with me!!!
author: Victoria D.

description:
Came here twice now.. 
First experience I had high expectations of this place given the wonderful reviews.. 
We ordered the ribs and a few order items but can't remember.. The ribs were tough.. 
Second time coming back to try it again.. 
I ordered chicken wings, ribs, fries
The ribs were better this time around.. 
The fries weren't so great.. I didn't think you can go wrong with French fries.. A little disappointing...
author: Lor L.

description: Tried this place out twice now. Great service great environment & great food. Kid friendly also which is always a plus .The mac & cheese is great by the way!. Our family just found our new favorite bbq spot .
author: Cristina C.

description:
I've been here once before, and wasn't impressed, but it was decent enough to fulfill a BBQ craving when you can't get to your favorite spot! The food is nothing to write home about... Definitely doesn't make me feel like I'm back in Memphis!!! Whenever I talk about the trips Ive had to Memphis, TN, I always talk about the good BBQ I've had! I don't know what this is... but it ain't that! 

This review is based on my attempt at giving them a second chance... 

The pricing is steep! Way too expensive for the mediocre, skimpy portions. Then, if you try to save money by getting a "2 way combo", they won't let you get two of the same meat choices.  This is how the person taking my order informed me of that rule, "You can't get the same meat twice!! PICK SOMETHING ELSE!" in a very rude tone! I felt like I was being scolded.  

I had called ahead to inquire about how long an order would take.  The woman told me, "about 10 minutes", so in an attempt to order it to coincide with the time my husband would make it there.  When I called back to order, the same lady said, "It's going to be 20-30 minutes" (this was about 10 minutes after I called the first time), I asked if there had been a lot of orders since I called 10 minutes ago. She answered me by saying, "YOU WANT THE FOOD OR NOT?!" So, I politely said, "No, actually I don't." and hung up.  I was about to spend over $50, but I sure am glad that I didn't.  We won't be going back!
author: Dionna S.

description: First time here with my girlfriend, she ordered brisket plate with mac & cheese, greens. I ordered pastrami sandwich and BBQ fries. The folks here are very friendly and helpful, the food is AWESOME we both wipe the plates clean. Hurry up down here before this place blows up.
author: Jimmy P.

description: This is one of the BEST BBQ places I've ever had. You know how you cant find anything as good as dad's? This. This is amazing. The staff was very friendly and helpful.
author: Samantha R.

description:
We ordered from GrubHub as it was raining the entire weekend. In all we had the smoked fried chicken, beef brisket, pork tips, and sausage. Everything was delicious, however, I felt the chicken had to too much batter. The pork tips were nice as well, however, I prefer bigger pieces of meat (will pass on this next time, but still delicious).

As sides we ordered, coleslaw, seasoned fries, and mac & cheese. Coleslaw was okay, the mac & cheese and fries were fantastic! The fries came with cajun seasoning and were fried to perfection. They mac & cheese was rich but not too rich, very creamy, and good size portion.

We will definitely eat here again with a slight change to our meat order next time around. Can't wait to go back.
author: Rudy S.

description:
Great neighborhood bbq!

The brisket and the pulled pork are fantastic. Ribs are good too but I've had better (they still have a nice bark).

Also- tons of sauces. The hot sauce is AMAZING. This place does a great job of covering all bases. 

Their beans are also by far the best in the city. 

Would give five stars, as they are certainly better than 4505 but they need to up their rib game. If it's not falling off the bone, it's not done smoking.
author: Hannah B.

description: Last time coming here 5 stars. I got 1/4 POUND of the brisket. 1/2 of it was pure fat... For $800... Don't you trim your meat at all? Should have been 2 stars. What a waste of $$$. Don't know if I'll go back after many years of being a patron. Guess I'll try the old brothers inlaw  bbq next time?
author: Linda L.

description:
Rewind to 2005. Picture me, a man who's *just* moved to California and is 100% naive of what San Francisco's all about...

Dude walks up, offers to show me around town. #incomingfacepalm
So I give him my number. #facepalm
He takes me here since I'm a Southerner. #nicetrybeatrixkiddo
I don't get why he doesn't eat the rib cartilage & bones.
I ultimately dis this place.

Unrewind to 2014. A friend at the office #beetsbyschrute randomly hands me a rib. Turns out it's from here. Is a revisit in order...?

(^_^) RIBS (photog http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/memphis-minnies-san-francisco?select=rfX795bQvGfNy61v-e3tEQ)
On the dry / overcooked side. But the cuts are great - not overly fatty, plenty of cartilage, less bone x more meat. Moister ribs are at places like Q Resto Wino (photog http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/q-restaurant-and-wine-bar-san-francisco?select=kccU-RALcObwU-CQChQYfA) or Gwhi Lo (revvie http://www.yelp.com/biz/hi-lo-bbq-san-francisco-2#hrid:yA6iw2AWRcC5q4O8X-PCCg).

(v_v) SLAW (photog http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/memphis-minnies-san-francisco?select=fCgNu3cBisJWMfw802dgBg)
Sweet. Not the characteristic coleslaw sweet but a weird bell pepperish sweet. Still overly sweet right after chugging sweet tea. The fact that I threw it away says a lot if you know how much I heart coleslaw. My fave slaw is at SnarfHead's (revvie http://www.yelp.com/biz/catheads-bbq-san-francisco#hrid:IfS1EB1ogR5ExHgkBifjAQ).

(v_v) GREENS (photog http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/memphis-minnies-san-francisco?select=WV_cd_7GUZOjvlQnUsLkSg)
Also strangely sweet. Also sweet even with a pre-sugared, pre-iced-tea'd palate. I trashed it with the coleslaw. My pref greens are at StimpyHead's (revvie http://www.yelp.com/biz/catheads-bbq-san-francisco#hrid:IfS1EB1ogR5ExHgkBifjAQ).

(^_^) BBQ PORK EGG ROLLS (photog http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/memphis-minnies-san-francisco?select=BYwqnLcpak9e2eq4zA8mDQ)
Non-greasy. Oddly enough, prob the coolest part of my meal.

(^_^) TEA (photog http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/memphis-minnies-san-francisco?select=m5gl-GH9gyaHvE7Ynzjb8g)
Standard. No unsweetened option, btw.

(-_-) CORNBREAD (photog http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/memphis-minnies-san-francisco?select=4KS3F458QjrPIlOipkzzhQ)
Dry. Dunk it in your iced tea before eating. Yes way.

(v_v) TEXAS RED SAUCE (photog http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/memphis-minnies-san-francisco?select=-fKVndjWFErNDPaP8m3fDA)
Tastes like melted cinnamon candy, muted.

(v_v) IT'S STUPID HOT! SAUCE (photog http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/memphis-minnies-san-francisco?select=-fKVndjWFErNDPaP8m3fDA)
No it's not.

(v_v) NORTH CAROLINA VINEGAR SAUCE (photog http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/memphis-minnies-san-francisco?select=-fKVndjWFErNDPaP8m3fDA)
Not very vinegary. Could use more tang.

(-_-) SOUTH CAROLINA MUSTARD SAUCE (photog http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/memphis-minnies-san-francisco?select=-fKVndjWFErNDPaP8m3fDA)
Okay, but flavor quickly fades. Drown everything in this.

I used to never be able to say no. Now I'm way better at ice princing men & women who hit on me. Jeebusz, wth does city life do to us as people? It gives us BBQ egg rolls, that's what.
author: Dan B.

description: Love this place! Not just the food... The vibe too. Brisket is the bomb with mac n cheese.
author: Jami J.

description:
If I could give this a (-) amount of stars I would. The food was pretty good, but my burger and fries took about 20 min to arrive. My friend who ordered ribs and brisket was halfway through his plate by the time my meal arrived.

This is where it gets horrendous. A family of 7 came in and sat down at a table. The older grey haired lady told the. They couldn't sit there for some reason and told them to sit at my table where me and my friend were already sitting. It was a tight squeeze and there were 2 members of the party of 7 to still arrive.  The grey haired lady with the tie dyed shirt said "Don't worry by the time you all decide and order, these guys (me and my friend) will be done right." 

Ummm excuse me wtf?? Are you serious??? Your kicking  us out to make room for another customers?? What if we wanted some dessert? Heaven for bid we wanted to sit and chat for a second! I had been eating my burger for 13 minutes at this time. I honestly couldn't believe what this lady was doing. Honestly, it was one of the most rude customer service experiences I've ever witnessed or been apart of. 

In all the food was pretty good but the old lady with grey hair and a tye dyed shirt literally ruined the experience.
author: James J.

description:
I would never make the claim that Memphis Minnie's has the best BBQ in town. BBQ can be hit or miss in this city. I always feel that people take good BBQ for granted around here. Good BBQ is no joke, it takes hours of preparation before that meat you just ordered lands on your plate. 

What I can say about this place is that its unique and its consistent. 

What I like about this place:
They have 4 different sauces on the table that range from sweet to spicy hot. All of them are good.
The portions are on the large.
The restaurant has a great vibe and the people who have worked here over the years are super sweet. 

Can't decide what to get, the Minnie's sampler with 3 meats and 2 sides is more than enough for 2 people. 
This last time we had a large portion of smokey pulled pork, 3 ribs and 4 pieces large of brisket (brisket = amazing.)

Also the fires are a huge portion, huge!
The main reason for the 4 star and not a five star rating is that the meat is consistently on the dry side.
author: Ben M.

description: Very pleased and happy to give 5 stars. Our group of 9 were treated to very warm, patient, caring, and generous customer service from Tom, Jared (spelling), and team. They offered us samples of both meats and beers to ensure we ordered the things we liked. They made great recommendations and we loved everything we ordered. They checked up on us throughout the night. Thumbs up for exceptional service! We ordered a lot of food...2 slabs of ribs, 1 lbs of brisket (mixed with burnt ends...not on the menu), 1 lbs of pulled pork, 1 whole smoked fried chicken, large Cole slaw, large potato salad, large greens, mac & cheese, French fries, and 2 pitchers of beer. We ate enough for all to get the meat sweats. So worth it! Looking forward to returning. Thanks again!
author: H E.

description:
I had the tri tip plate with a side of mac and cheese and baked beans. My husband had the beef ribs plate with mac and cheese and seasoned fries. 

The mac and cheese and fries  were stellar! However, my beans were bland, and my  tri tip was overcooked and tasted like cardboard....and so were my husband's ribs. It seemed like the meat was cooked earlier in the day and was just reheated. The meat did not taste fresh, it was so hard that it seems to be days old. I had to slather it with sauce to give it some flavor. 

Great, friendly staff. I just wished that the barbeque was better.
author: Suzanne K.

description: Good BBQ. The wings I had were alittle dry. The brisket and tri tip were on point. Mac n cheese was good too.
author: Jay H.

description:
{Review from experience 3 months ago}

Probably more like 3.5 stars.

I got the sweet pulled pork with mac & cheese and beans and corn bread. The pork was a bit dry for my taste. The mac & cheese was disappointing. The beans were, well, you can't go wrong with BBQ beans. And the cornbread was.. Uh.. I don't remember (so not too memorable I guess).

I think lots of people enjoy having the sauce options, and they are quite different and interesting. The best sauce, IMO, is a mix of the Texas Red sauce and the It's Stupid Hot sauce (for some sauce with a kick). 

May be back to try some other items on the menu, but this place can't compare to the Southern BBQ that I grew up with..
author: Julia N.

description:
An excellent solid barbecue place to savor meatsicles :)

With July 4th (FYI, it is National Barbecue Spareribs Day)
around the corner, I might as well get a head start.
Came at great time as it opened, received friendly
welcome from staff and cashier then without hesitation
(because I had a few minutes on the parking meter)
ordered three spare ribs/St. Louis smoked pork ribs
(formerly known as the rib sampler).

The ribs were good, meat fell off the bone good,
very flavorful with appropriate smokiness to the meat.
Nice that you get 2 sauces (North Carolina vinegar/red
and South Carolina mustard/yellow) therefore the
Writing 101 compare and contrast essay for the taste buds.

Brisket (very good), sides, sandwiches and daily specials
are the other offerings, which are very tempting thus
worth a try. If you eat in, enjoy the pig theme decor :)
Overall, a wonderful trip for good barbecue.
author: W L.

description: My boyfriend and I decided to try this place after numerous walk-bys. We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the meats and the price point. I got their Maxi Burger and my boyfriend got the Southern Star sandwich. Both absolutely delicious! The burger meat was ground in house, juicy, and cooked to perfection.  The Southern Star was a generous portion of 1/2 perfectly seasoned pulled pork and 1/2 brisket all on a baguette. Delicious! Our whole bill with beers came out to $30!  Do yourselves a favor and give Memphis Minnie's a try!
author: Anoush Y.

description: Ok so a rat ran across the floor over everyone's feet during dinner. Unfortunately, or fortunately, we had already eaten. Never ever going back.
author: Kadotah S.

description:
Last night I go to 4505 Meat BBQ on Divisadero Street try BBQ. Much better food. People very friendly. I see them make BBQ and smoke meat. Food taste very good. I not get sick. I go back again soon. 

Memphis Minny owner says to me: Your review is bullshit. Get a life, asshole. 
-not too nice to me.
author: Vasily M.

description:
This place is no big deal.. but hey, at least I tried it.

------------------------------------

Space was tight, but hey, it's San Francisco. The place looks like it's been here for twice as long as I've been alive. It's a little intimate and old-time-y but it's cute. The staff were nice and the food was quick.

It's an order first then seat yourself kind of environment. I had a Minnie's Burger with a side of fries and some southern wings. My bun was cold, the meat was average, and the fries were meh (I didn't want to finish it).

On the up side, the sauces are hella worth it! I think they had 5 flavors to try at where I was sitting. SO good. My friend likes the Texas one and I like the mustard.

Stuff I noticed:
- They sell their special sauces and SAKE(!?!?) at the counter by the bottle, baby.
- Communal seating?? or I guess my friend and I sat at a 6-person table and no one said anything.. oops.
author: Eileen ..

description:
Stopped by a few months ago and somehow forgot to leave a review.  

Walking through the area, starving, I was drawn in by the that sweet, smoky scent of bbq.  Not expecting much in taste department, I planned to simply refuel my calorie tank and keep it moving.  After browsing through the menu and observing others' plates, I started to think I could get more than just calories from this joint.  

So the gf and I ordered some ribs, brisket, fries and beans.  The ribs were pretty damn good and the brisket was better than anticipated.  The sauces were decent, but would've been better if prepared with the meat.
author: Mark M.

description: Always reliable bbq that has been my go to for years. Nothing will blow your mind, but everything is good. And their desserts are surprisingly tasty.
author: Amjad S.

description:
Seriously, there goes my diet and the 5 pounds I was working so hard to loose. Ok ok, maybe not working THAT hard, after all I came here two days in a row... Guilty confessions.

This little hole in the wall BBQ joint is an unassuming gem in the lower Haight next to UVA Unateca also a great eatery but for a nicer night out. 

Anyway back on track..... If you're wanting silver service BBQ this "ain't" your place. It's counter order walk up service and grab a table where you can find one. They serve a handful of local beers on tap and a standard menu featuring the essential BBQ and sides. From pork and beef ribs, tips, smoked meats and chicken wings I didn't feel like I had a lack of options. It was more of a challenge of what to order with limited stomach space. Unlike some other places you are only going to need 1 order bc you WILL be full and not break the bank. This is one place where you are going to have to seriously TRY to spend more than 40$ for 2 people bc I honestly think 2 people can share a main and side plus beers.
