I mean I'm not a total meat person though over the last year I've come out of my chicken and fish routine but seriously, I would DEVOUR pretty much everything here. The meat and sauces are right on par, everything is tender and melts in your mouth. I came back 2x in 1 week. Kind of embarrassing bc I think the cashier recognized me as in weren't you just here uhhhh YESTERDAY? Ok fine I was, but that was only bc it was so darn good and I was house sitting without many options to go to late night and was in my nasty sweats not wanting to hop in an UBER. Anyway, back to my point... I would be happy here stuffing my face in complete silence and be perfectly happy not talking to anyone else.
author: Audrey L.

description:
Oh my gawd. I just have birth to a Love Child. A little meat baby named Minnie. The smell from the street draws me in like an old cartoon as I float over the threshold following the scent of smoked meats. 

Sampler $22.95 with brisket (you need to ask?), pork ribs and Cajun, Andouille sausage. For sides, its old faithful of beans and slaw. This is a huge plate, easily shared. Not that I did. 
Tried a friends special porchetta and it was bone dry. Needs the smothered pork gravy to wet your whistle. 
Sausage has a great kick in the teeth. Arguably the best of the three.  
Brisket has a great color and ribbons of fat almost flaking apart but a tad dry. 
Ribs are smoky with a hit of pepper. Lip smack'n good almost falling off the bone. 
The slaw is vinegar based, no mayo, and sweet. This is home run. 
Beans are killer. Well done Minnie. 
Sauces were light and easy. Not much more to say which in this case was great. Enhance. Enhance. Enhance.  

I love the flavor but some meats I tried were dry. Maybe it's the time of day or week.
After it was all said and done, the banana pudding with Nilla wafers came out and on the house.
Pow! I was suddenly transported back in time to my grandmothers kitchen in Austin Tx and I'm in heaven. 

For BBQ, I'm impressed. For BBQ in California, I'm blown away. 
I'll be back for the fried chicken
author: Mark F.

description: This place is so hit or miss. Sometimes the brisket is tender and flavorful, sometimes it is so dry and under seasoned it's like eating shoe leather. The sides are usually good, but the cornbread is always very dry. This last time I ordered for delivery they left off the cornbread entirely. I don't care for it so I didn't say anything, but I do resent paying for meals that do not include all items advertised on the menu. I think I'm going to stop coming here and instead give my business to a more consistent BBQ restaurant.
author: Traci R.

description: My favorite BBQ in San Fran. Great customer service. Great food. Awesome portion sizes. Awesome sweet tea.  Just great place all around. Just wish the place had more seating.
author: Paul S.

description: Me and our office eat from here at least 3 times a month. They have no favorite meal- It is all good. Top of the line BBQ fantastic southern sides with a little southern hospitality. There food helped us create the best company BBQ we've ever had. A+
author: Reggie M.

description:
Memphis is a very good deal!
Huge amount of very tasty food for an affordable price. I loved it :)
author: Raissa K.

description: I had Memphis Minnie's catered for work today everything was delicious. I'll definitely have to check it out myself at some point. The mac and cheese here is delicious. Big noodles, slathered with rich, creamy sauce. The brisket is fall apart tender - you might even find it hard to pick up with some tongs because of this.
author: Austin W.

description: Best ribs ever. I love their sweet potatoes and the brisket. A lot of t shirts in the walls make this place like a thematic park focused on the ribs.
author: Alejandro G.

description:
SERIOUS BBQ!!!!
This funky dive on Haight St serves some of the best barbecue I have ever eaten, and I've eaten BBQ all over the country.  I'll be back!
author: James M.

description:
Not a fan. The food is actually 2 stars. But since they've taken the namesake of my hometown, there's a one-star deduction for misleading people into believing that this is somehow southern (let alone Memphis) BBQ. It's not. It's totally unrelated. Orders of magnitude different and not anywhere close to as good.

We also didn't enjoy paying those prices for food like that. And we were not impressed with the service. If you want good "southern-style" BBQ in the Bay area try KC BBQ in Berkeley. If you want good California style BBQ just go to Kinders.
author: Art C.

description: The food here is soooo good and the service is great! We ordered our food from here, took it to-go, and ate it at Molotov's next door.
author: Noemi C.

description:
Very disappointing, but I was craving BBQ and this place has so many reviews, I thought I'd try it.  Mistake.

The OK:
Chili Cheese Fries - Fries covered in chili and cheese?  How can you go wrong?  The chili was actually one of the better things in my meal.  The fries were seasoned and didn't really compliment the chili at all, but this was really one of the better dishes we had.
Pork Ribs - This were alright.  I've had so much better, but they fell off the bone.  They were a little fatty, but I didn't really mind that.  Cover the meat in sauce and it may satisfy some part of your BBQ craving.

The Bad:
Beef Ribs - Sooooo bad!  The ribs basically had pieces of burnt meat on them.  You couldn't even get anything edible off the bone.  Such a disappointment cuz I love beef ribs!
Slaw - I know this was supposed to be tangy, but it was overly sweet and sour.  An awful combination.

I know SF doesn't have many good BBQ places, but this place was just plain bad!  I'd rather go to Hard Knox or Roadside BBQ.  They don't have the best BBQ either, but at least I like some of their dishes!
author: Elena N.

description:
Okay so hear me out for a second: I am French and YES that means I know about good meat and good BBQ. Been practicing the art of eating good meat for years now. 

MEMPHIS MINNIE'S IS DA PLACE!

There's only one word you should add to your vocabulary if you plan on paying them a visit: St. Louis Smoked Pork Ribs. I guess that's more than one word but who cares. 

I shared a slab with my friends and MY GOODNESS I didn't even have to order siders. (beer doesn't count. No it does not.) That tenderness, these sauces (gotta try em all). I'm in heaven. 

Can't wait to go back!!!
author: Sev G.

description:
I hate eating crow but if I ever have to do it again, I'm going to get Lance over at Memphis Minnie's to smoke it for me.

I wrote a blistering review here a couple of months ago about some bad takeout I had from MM's. As a result, Lance, the pitmaster, and Tom, the general manager, invited me to come have another taste of their victuals. Today was the day and I made the trek over to see what this smoke joint could serve that was better than my last experience.

While I write this, I am sitting at my desk and my stomach is aching, not because the food was bad but because I couldn't stop eating. Lance served me a mixed plate with brisket, chicken and a rib along with a cornbread muffin, potato salad and a bowl of pintos. 

Let me tell you, I am particular when it comes to brisket. The pitmaster better do it right or I'm not interested. This brisket was perfection. The amount of fat and the smoke ring were the first indicators Lance knew his business. The first bite was heaven on a fork. While I'm not a huge fan of ribs or chicken, Lance made a believer out of me. They were all perfect!

As for the sides, I loved the pinto beans. They had just a hint of sugar and cinnamon that worked perfectly to bring out the best in the beans. The cornbread was what both my grandmothers used to make and I wanted more. The potato salad was okay but nothing special. I've had better and I've had a lot worse.

Lance and I visited about what could have gone wrong and I agreed that sometimes it's just a one off and, apparently, that's what happened with that takeout order.

I am now a firm believer in and a fan of Memphis Minnie's. Lance and Tom, my sincerest apologies for making a rush to judgement and I will be back. I promise.
author: John A.

description:
We had the food catered for a lunch event at work, and sadly I have to say I wasn't too horribly impressed with what I ate.

The beef brisket was a bit dry in my opinion, though the chicken and the smoked pork were much better (I should've snagged more pork, but it disappeared pretty quickly from the kitchen). The mac and cheese was okay though not crazy delicious. The grilled ratatouille was also pretty good, though it tasted pretty heavily of smoke.

The tart and tangy slaw was pretty good, and the potlikker greens were much more tart than I expected them to be, though still okay. The corn bread was ridiculously dry (could not even finish it).

Overall, not a bad impression of Memphis Minnie's, but not entirely favorable either. I wonder if the food might've dried out on the way over to my work? I'll hold off on a final verdict until I can get myself to the actual establishment and try a meal there.
author: Anna W.

description:
I promise not to just complain...BUT I will give you my honest opinon

Ok, I ordered my food through seamless delivery service. I was happy that my food arrived still hot. Whether it was swift delivery or just good timing...I am very happy in how it arrived.

I like that MM's gives you options on the sizes to choose from (small-large)..the smallest was about $1.95..which is not bad at all!

Now onto the food:

I ordered all sides..OK OK, you caught me I was in a carb craving mood. I ordered the yams, mac and cheese, beans and to try to make myself feel better I ordered the collard greens with a grand finale of Banana Pudding.

Yams- they were not the candied yams I am used to...at home or outside in a restaurant. I feel that it didn't have enough cinnamon, sugar or vanilla extract. the sauce they sat in was so thin and near see through I am not sure they had hardly any flavoring added to them.

Mac and cheese: ummm....I liked the shape of the noodles....No really, I was not impressed but I don't think it was the worst ever. I found the cheese to be thick and not melty.

Beans: This is one of my favorite items!! I mean they had the flavor as if they had  been slow cooking for decades to absorb every flavor possible. I liked that it had pieces of ham shank floating throughout. I ate this and had the flavor in my mouth wanting more..I wish I'd ordered a large. 

Collard greens: OH MY..I truly have no words...I have never in my life had pickles in my greens....It felt like vinegar going down my throat. I was only able to take three bites...I even tried to mask it with the beans...I just tossed the greens. and accepted that I wasted my money.

Banana pudding:  When I recieved it, it was warm...probably the heat from the other food. So I popped it in the freezer and about an hour later...I was in banana pudding heaven!! I wish there were a few more wafers inside but it was a great way to end my evening.

Overall, I think I will pass on this restaurant, the meal wasnt worth the cost. Also, the food could use some recipe tweaking. Granted I only had sides and not actually bbq- what good is it to only just have meat without its sides?
author: Amari C.

description:
Ignore the bad reviews. Those are bratty people whose perception you can never change, and who are unable to feel the vibe of a place upon walking in. Some people you can never satisfy.

I love the atmosphere, the employees are great, fun peeps. Food is good. U get you bbq fix, mac n cheese, beans, corn bread. I'm a happy ass girl right now.  Seems pricey.... BUT WERE IN SAN FRANCISCO. 

Yum :)
author: Lis W.

description:
I started working across the street at Edo Salon about 8 months ago and this place quickly became one of my favorite lunch spots. 
You pretty much can't go wrong with anything here, everything I have tried is seriously delicious. 
It's the ultimate comfort food spot and going here brightens my day every time. 
The business owner, Tom and the rest of the staff are so nice and friendly. They always ask how I'm doing and have even gone as far as giving me extra food &/or discounts when I was having a bad day. 
My favorites are the mac and cheese, sweet potatoes and especially their Thursday special, the Fried Chicken Sandwich. It's become my weekly treat. 
The service is always fast and I always feel like I'm getting something fresh and homemade. Oh yeah and they have really good sweet tea! 10/10 recommend esp if you're feeling a little down in the dumps and need a little pick me up. 
Good food, clean environment, friendly and caring staff. What more could you ask for!!?
author: Jade B.

description:
This review is solely for their homemade fried peach pie, which was delicious. Best part was that it wasn't too sweet. It could've used a little vanilla ice cream on top of it but that's just my inner fatty talking ;). 

Why didn't I eat more than just the pie while my friends devoured in various meat dishes? Well, I don't eat meat but my friends loved their meal!
author: Anastasia N.

description:
I think Yelp gets this place right at 3.5 stars. 

Came by tonight as I've been craving BBQ for a few weeks. My wife and I ordered:

1/4 lb brisket
6 ribs
Mac & cheese (medium)
1 cornbread 
Peach mini pies

It was the perfect portion for us. 

Meat was seasoned really well, good flavor, super tender. 
Mac & cheese - flavor and texture were great
Cornbread was good. 

The sauce options were very disappointing. I tried all 4 but felt they all fell flat. The flavors just weren't there. 

The pies weren't cooked properly. Too doughy. I let them know and they were very nice about replacing them. Something to do with one of the staff using the wrong dough. We were brought a new batch that was cooked better but you could still see a ring of soft dough. I'm sure they would have replaced it with a piece of pie but by that time we were good and didn't want anything else. 

Not a bad little spot but most likely wouldn't try it again.
author: Jesse P.

description:
Lot's of respect for Memphis Minnies. Best brisket in town, great Carolina mustard sauce, and better value than most other SF BBQ joints. Have tried damn near everything on the menu and have never been disappointed! 

I love Catheads and 4505 as well, but Memphis Minnie's is always my go to for SF BBQ.
author: Troy D.

description:
Memphis Minnie is an atypical Q place. atypical in the sense there's actual Q and/or value. didn't see combo or didn't look hard enough. many tables for sitdown

eats: slow smoked beef brisket sammie(10.95)
-lots of tender, slightly smoked beef brisket, almost melt in mouth
-chewy bread
-sauces mildly  interesting
-mac cheese side way above average
a fulfilling meal

crumbs:
-very friendly service, smiles all around.
-non metered parking nearby.
-takes out/deliveries makes waits longer.
author: Victor G.

description:
I was once a Very loyal patron. And Once upon a time the best in the city. Not sure if they lost the head cook but it's for sure lost its flavor and consistency. Meat with no flavor, very bland. Over cooked. Greens are soaked in SUGAR, mustard and vinegar(not good) over whelming after a couple of bites. 
Manager not very intelligent business wise, does not understand good customer service.  Will never eat there again not recommend this place to anyone. I would often Doctor up the meat after leaving there, I'm over it. 
How to measure good BBQ;   Does it Need Bbq sauce? Or do you want sauce?  If it needs sauce, it's not good meat.  They have good sauce. Bland meat.
author: Sean F.

description: I really love the smoked sandwiches here. I typically order the pork or the brisket, and I am always pleased with my purchase. The slaw is a crucial side dish, providing some great tang and freshness to the sandwich.  Minnie's also has some amazing sauces, the mustard sauce is absolutely delightful.  The environment isn't really the best.. but they are going for the classic barbecue joint vibe, so I can respect what they are doing here. I typically order to go, and eat at Danny Coyles, a great pub down the street (they allow outside food).  If you do choose to dine in, Memphis Minnie's does have some tasty local draft beer, which is always a big upside.
author: Alex E.

description:
I was at Memphis Minnie's recently and I had the pleasure of meeting Ashley and having her help me order. When I came into Memphis Minnie's she warmly greeted me. I won a free sandwich and she very graciously walked me through choices and possibilities. I was lucky she was there to help me. She is kind and thoughtful and Memphis Minnie's is fortunate that she is working at their barbecue. 

The food at Memphis Minnie's is fabulous. I recommend it to all my friends!

Thanks for your wonderful employees and your fabulous food! It's a pleasure and so delicious to come and eat!
author: Judy L.

description:
Fairly average BBQ in every way imaginable. The Memphis sweet-smoked pork wasn't all that memorable upon first bite, so what made the meal for me was being able to douse it with all the sauces available right at my table. The beans, mac and cheese, and cornbread were also good... as in merely good. My friend had the same view about his pork rib appetizer and BBQ pork rolls.

A bit pricey for what you get, although the portions are filling. Service was nice and courteous. Seems like the place is going for a really casual, down-home vibe with the picnic table-like setup and the large rolls of paper towels in lieu of real napkins.
author: Vincent L.

description: This place is like going back to family for a barbeque.   Everyone there is super friendly and the barbecue ribs, pulled port, brisket is wonderful.    Jacki, the manager is very informative and helpful.   She really knows about barbecue.   They have amazing side dishes like sweet potatoes and smoked chicken wings.  Prices are reasonable the place is clean.   Stop by and treat yourself to some wonderful barbecue.
author: Bill F.

description:
$18 for a the same sized portion I feed my cat. Never again, 3 little pieces of brisket. Think of Oscar Mayer ham, divide that in half x3.

Not to mention they don't serve corn on the cob...seriously? a BBQ that don't have corn? BBQ sauce is nothing less than mediocre.

Yams was disappointing, like steam carrots, no flavor what so ever. Beans were awful, this is not BBQ, Famous Dave's BBQ is is more satisfying than this.

I thought Everet and Jones in Oakland was pricey, this place makes it look a bargain. At Least Everet is good! Food for the tourist!

This is nothing but fucking GARBAGE. no 
one should eat SHIT.
author: Thanh H.

description: My favorite BBQ place in San Francisco. Their smoked fried chicken is amazing and now available all week. Thursday special should also be on the menu all week- best fried chicken sandwich in the neighborhood. Macaroni and cheese is my favorite, kinda wish they had other sides... Mashed potatoes would be yummy. Pulled pork egg rolls are worth the trip. Everyone who works here is so nice, plus sake and BBQ are a perfect pair.
author: Alexandria W.

description: We were in San Francisco on a mini vacay & came across this gem! Slow roasted Chicken, ribs (fall off the bone just how we like it),  mac & cheese, corn bread... yummmy ! TJ and team made us feel at home & we ate well! Don't forget to get a slice of the pecan & sweet potato pies!! We'll definitely be back when we come back in town.
author: Brittany T.

description: Ok, Memphis Minnie's is not trendy - far from it, but they do have great food and very nice employees.  Think 4505 meats but without Anthony Bourdain, nor the line - this spot is truly old school BBQ.  Both the baby back ribs and tri-tip are delicious - smoked and perfectly cooked.  Also, they put a special seasoning on the fries that make them downright addicting.  Finally, I preferred the mustard sauce to the tomato based BBQ sauce (the tomato based sauce seemed to have a bit too much cinnamon or nutmeg for my liking - I couldn't put my finger on it).  If you're craving authentic BBQ, this is your spot.
author: Tom G.

description: Very disappointed with the reply. Sarcasm not needed and my Q is bomb. Slabs should consist of the entire rib. My meal was dry, I called and complained and was told you were not on duty to deal with it. My family wasn't happy. Due to the attitude, I'll never visit this place again! Rude!!!!
author: Gwen H.

description: Thought it was amazing!!! I have been there twice and the food was delicious!! Super tender and tons of flavor!!
author: G W.

description:
Updating this review. The restaurant called me and was very apologetic about this. He said that he just got out of a meeting w/ the staff about food quality - what goes out the door, etc. He asked for an opportunity to get a second chance and show what they normally do, and he offered (almost insisted) that he send a do-over order out. I didn't need expect that at all but hey, free meat-sticks, so I said sure. They ended up sending over a ton of other stuff - ribs, fried chicken, beans, mac&cheese, corn muffins. Fried chicken doesn't usually travel well, but it held up ok. more important was that it was perfectly cooked/moist/etc.  The ribs we just right and the mac&cheese was hard to put down.

They didn't need to do all that and I'm not sure a lot of places would. Everybody/business makes mistakes, but a business that goes to that effort to make good gets high marks.  On top of that, the quality of the do-over-order was very good, so I'm rating accordingly.

Totally bummed out. Got a slab delivered via Caviar.  The order and delivery process was easy and all good. I order a slab and it was an adequate portion - commensurate w/ the price. The ribs had just the appropriate amount of "marbling" and the rub wasn't bad, however there was very little indication that they had been really smoked for very long. It was more like when you cook ribs on your grill with a side of wood-chips on the side. The main problem however was that they were flat out burned on about 15% of the surface area - black charcoal carcinogenic crispy-like. Smaller end where the slab tapers down was hard as jerky.  I just wouldn't expect that the person whole cut this slab up to even consider them fit to be sent to a customer.
author: T M.

description:
This place was great. Food was delicious, good vibe- all around positive experience. They have a wicked selection of BBQ sauces to try. As a group we had brisket, pulled pork sandwiches, awesome Mac and cheese and fried chicken. Good Prices and Friendly Staff. Definitely no frills, but didn't lack much..
We went in shortly before closing, our food was out quick and we loved it. The bathroom could use a little makeover and seating was a little crammed. Other than that, it was great
Who knew we weren't in the south!
author: Leanne E.

description: Just had a most delicious Reuben sandwich here earlier today! It was amazing honestly. The girl who took our order also was very sweet and helped me choose the Reuben, which I loved! First timer here, will come back again!
author: Brandon C.

description:
One of my new favorite places in SF. Great vibe, awesome - over-the-top friendly staff, and fantastic food. 

Our favorites from most to least:
1. SEASONED FRIES. If you don't get these, you're not doing it right. We are french fry people and let me tell you, THESE ARE OUR FAVORITES. Hands down, best fries in San Francisco. 
2. Brisket. Dayuuuuuum. Dip it in their bbq mustard sauce and oh boy you got a great meal on your hands.
3. The Greens. I am NOT, let me repeat, NOT a green person. The sweet gentleman at the counter recommended these as a side and woowee, I might live off of these greens for the rest of my life.
4. The Mac n Cheese: Absolutely DANK. And a nice pairing with the meat.
5. The spicy chicken sandwich: good flavors, but not our favorite. The bread's a little dry and gets in the way of how awesome the chicken is.

Furthermore, if you have not, please make a visit to Memphis Minnies immediately. It's casual, fun, and most importantly, the food will keep you thinking about it for days..maybe weeks following.
author: Rachel L.

description:
I learned about this place online and since we live pretty nearby, I was kind of embarrassed that we had never been to it before until today.  Nevertheless, I brought 3 well vintage BBQ eaters with me today and boy did we have a wonderful time there today.  The beef brisket was my favorite.  The variety of sauces they offer is also unreal.   Since I smoke a lot of meat and fish, I'm very picky as to where and what I eat.  This place did not let me down.  We are coming back very soon and I'm telling my eating friends to go check this place out.

Good job Tom.
author: Craig M.

description:
This place is delicious. Being from KY, I know what good southern BBQ is and also what good hospitality is. These folks do it right. Delicious pork, brisket, beans, fries, mac-n-cheese, sweet tea and the service is great. Super friendly and welcoming. I walk here for lunch about twice a month and its always a great experience. And the portions are huge! Always have food to take home with me and its just as good the next day. 

And my company used them to cater a picnic once too. They were great to work with on short notice, quick to respond to emails and flexible to meet our needs. Love Memphis Minnie's. Hope they stick around for a long time.
author: John H.

description:
The food is great! The brisket is usually juicy, but once in a while can be dry. 

The only problem is the inconsistency with the staff. They offer neighborhood and other discounts, and some of the cashiers are very nice and honor them. Others act like they don't know me even if I'm there for a second time in the same week.
author: Jessica W.

description:
I had leftover chicken. Even re-heated it was fall off the bone good. The sauces are amazing.

I had to update it to four stars.
author: Sweets N.

description:
Memphis Minnie's
SF: Lower Haight
Saturday March 3, 2012
Four Stars.

[SF#8]

Wandering Back Home, we needed a little snack to soak up the ethanol.  We ordered a BBQ Pork Rolls with Chipotle Dipping Sauce. They were AMAZING.  I wished I was hungrier so that I could order all of the delicious Pig products.  Plus they served Sake here (Shenanigans to later ensue)
author: Leonard L.

description:
When you're looking for beef ribs and they don't have it when you come for lunch that's a disappointment. Not a good look, especially during peak business. I choose the cajun sausage which was good, but still not satisfying. The gf chose the beef brisket which was better, but not as moist as it could have been. The southern fried chicken was decent, but the breading was not solid.

The mac and cheese was probably the best item.

I am a BBQ snob of sorts so I'm a tough evaluator. I can better BBQ in the east bay and won't be coming back on my accord. I'd be willing to give it another chance if I try the beef ribs.
author: Patrick Gabriel L.

description:
Yum! We stumbled upon this place on a random walk in the neighborhood while waiting to meet some friends. We don't know anything about the area, since we were just visiting, and thought we'd grab a quick bite. I enjoyed it, and I enjoyed that they had a GF option. 

I liked it.
author: Elyse S.

description:
The bay is not BBQ versed. But I won't lament. 

This is good. Like really good. 

The collard greens were amazing, as was the brisket.  Mac and cheese is made with spiral noodles, which not to sound like a purest but WHERE MA ELBOWS AT? 

Price points were spot on though the sides are a bit expensive.
author: Ryley P.

description:
I heard good things about this place and stopped in to get a taste.  The cashier was down right rude.  I'm used to Texas style BBQ joints: friendly, fast and fun.  Not a smile to be had.  She then told me that "she would not take my credit card".  When I asked her why she just pointed to a tiny sign stating $10 or over for a CC.  Totally fair, but she was just totally rude about it and then went on a monologue of her hatred toward banks.  The rest of the crew seemed just as sullen.

Brisket was overly smokey and rather fatty.  Priced at a premium.  Maybe I hit this place on a bad day or after a tough customer, but a real shame.  We need a good BBQ place in SF.
author: Henry B.

description:
1. Order at the counter
2. Find a seat 
3. Wait patiently for your food (ours took all of 10 minutes)
4. Listen for your name
5. Pick-up your order 
6. Be seated 
7. Stuff your face

I opted for the Minnie's Taster (any three meats with two sides and a cornbread muffin). I got:
+St. Louis-style smoked pork ribs: pretty dry and tough with bits of soft bone still in it
+Santa Maria tri-tip steak: delicious, but not juicy by any means
+Smoked Cajun Andouille sausage: juicy, flavorful, my favorite of the bunch
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/memphis-minnies-san-francisco?userid=cqf8dqO5_QUxjfo6WiM7yg#ih3p5OQfz6cR7UwYjbWqkQ

All in all, really, just OK. The ribs aren't saucy, which is why there are four types of watery sauces at each table: North Carolina vinegar sauce, North Carolina mustard sauce, Texas BBQ sauce, and Stupid-hot sauce. I just made my own mix of the Texas BBQ sauce, NC mustard sauce, and the stupid-hot sauce. 

As for the sides, I got:
+Tart 'n tangy slaw: tasty, a nice respite from the spicy sauce I'd made
+Mac & cheese: cheesy; reminiscent of homemade mac & cheese
+Potato salad: I tried my date's and it was awesome. Definitely my favorite.
+Smoked beans: smoky, sweet, pretty good. He slathered it in the stupid-hot sauce and it improved a bit. 

Drinks: they have a small selection of beer on tap (Anchor, Stella, and Shiner), as well as Hi-C fruit punch (ah, childhood), and sake (yep, sake).

We were quiet for about 20 minutes, just biting and chewing, sipping, and dipping. After putting away about a pound of meat, two sides, and cornbread, I tried some of the pecan pie. It was pretty good; really, really sweet (totally Southern), but pretty good.

My Midwestern man didn't rave about the meat, but then again, his plate was empty. So... yeah.
author: Adena B.

description:
The boyfriend and I celebrated our anniversary with stop #1, lunch at Memphis Minnie's and it was such a great lunch (thanks Mr. Boyfriend). What more can a girl as for besides good food and good company? 

..at the end of lunch, both our tummies were going to burst but it was going to burst from being filled with good BBQ. 

Walking in, you are hit with a quirky and color vibe and then your eyes scan around the room and notice shirts hanging on the wall and communal tables (there are small tables that seat a group of four). Oh, and you also notice the sweet smell of good ole' BBQ! When I walked in, I almost missed the menu because I was taking everything in and kept on walking. It is quite a cute place.

We ordered:
Three Meat Plate (forgot the name..sometimes Minnie) that comes with 2 sides
Brisket
Pork Ribs
Beef Ribs
Sweet Potato
& Greens

THINGS I LOVED:
The brisket, pork ribs, and beef ribs - all right, let's just say I loved all the meats, cause it's true. But what can I say, they were delicious, extremely delicious. The briskets were sliced thick and they were juicy with just the right amount of fat. I have had thickly sliced briskets that were extremely dry and there was none of that here. The pork ribs were fall of the bone delicious and when you took a bite, it felt like everything was right with the world. The beef ribs were perfectly charred and not dry, I feel like beef ribs are so hard to cook because they get dry easily but again, none of that dry stuff here.

THINGS THAT WERE OKAY:
The sweet potatoes - I didn't love them and I didn't hate them. They were pretty good and the juice reminds me of apple cider.

THINGS I DID NOT LOVE:
The greens, I just felt like it was soaked in vinegar and it was just not my cup of tea. Every time I took a bite and inhaled, I was hit with the taste of vinegar and I didn't really like the taste of it.

Sauces:
Out of all four sauces, I found that I leaned towards the Texas Red Sauce - I wouldn't say that it is my favorite BBQ sauce of all time, but out of the four choices that I had, I would say that it goes pretty well with the meats. The reason why I didn't love it is because it was a bit too sweet for me. But overall it's not bad drenched all over the meats.
author: Mona L.

description:
Apparently it takes 18 hours (literally) to slow cook their meets and it indeeds tastes that way. Staff were very helpful and knowledgeable. I'm not a brisket person but tried the brisket sandwich "The Southern S
Star" very tender and tasty. Barbecue sauce is also good. But wait.... sake pairings with bbq??? Icing on the cake & such perfection! To top it off in the lively eclectic Haight neighborhood. I will be back AGAIN for sure!
author: Christina W.

description:
Hell Yeah! I'm definitely one of their biggest fans! I'm almost giving 5*...

Best combo is 2 Meat Platter, with Brisket & Ribs, with side of potato salad and beans. It is BOMB. I often go there and even order when I'm at work. It's the best BBQ in the city for sure. I just LOVE it. 

I'm sure Texas has better BBQ, and I just can't wait to try Franklin's :D

Cheers
author: Antonin M.

description:
Feeling carnivorous? Then Memphis Minnie's is the perfect place to get your BBQ on!

With a good size menu, plenty of dipping sauces for us sauce fiends, and good service, I am down with this BBQ joint! The staff members were very friendly, gave us some suggestions since it was my first time there, and ended up getting a lot of food for a low price! 

My husband and I shared a half rack of beef ribs (they ran out of pork), a side of smoked beans, and a cornbread muffin. Yummies galore! They prepared the food and served it to us quickly, then we doused a bunch of their sauces (4 varieties) on our plates and got messy with our meat. The ribs were well made, not dry at all, the muffin was delicious, and the smoked beans were superb. I have never had smoked beans before and after eating these, it won't be my last time!

Covered in BBQ sauces of all varieties, we were grateful there was an extra large roll of paper towels on our table. We cleaned up, were thanked for coming in, and I can tell you that we will be back again!
author: Akvile D.

description:
It's tough for me to say how this compares to other BBQ in town, because this is where I keep coming back to. Why? Well, my uncle is pretty obsessed with the place and has become quite the regular. I live 700 miles away and I've eaten here no less than a half dozen times on as many trips to SF, so there's not much chance I'll be trying anywhere else very soon.

Some observations:

The brisket is almost always very good. Occasionally it's a little dry. Sometimes it's totally sublime. Mostly it's pretty good.

The sausage is underrated. Just try it once, and you'll see.

The ribs are solid. Not socks-off sexy, but solid.

The pie is pretty dang delish. I love pie, but even in a pie town it holds up. Best served after a big BBQ meal.

The sauces are fun to have on the table, but don't get carried away. The Texas red sauce is middle of the road, the Carolina vinegar is good in small doses, and the Carolina mustard is divine. I haven't tried the hot hot insane stuff. Why do that to a perfectly good plate of BBQ?

The sides are all pretty good. They're constantly evolving and changing. The slaw isn't the creamy kind, which is a nice change. The mac 'n cheese ain't what she used to be now that it's curly curl noodles. The collard greens are the business.

You pay for your meal. It ain't the cheapest game in town, so if you're not particular about your smoked meat stacks, you'd probably be best to try somewhere else.


Does it redefine the BBQ scene? Nah. But in a town not known for its 'que, they're slinging some good grub that transports a little bit of Memphis across the bridge.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: This review is strictly for the Reuben. I love the idea that this is a weekly special, sorta adds to the journey that it's not on a daily menu. If you're anywhere near lower height on a Wednesday, you have to try their Reuben if you're into pastrami. It's incredible here, so much that I refuse to order anything else. I've had their BBQ and like most places in SF the BBQ is mediocre so have some if you're in the mood. The pastrami is smoked well and just makes for a great sandwich. I get coleslaw as a side, and a secret is that it's nothing like coleslaw, it has all the veggies except they're pickled. Incredible. The moment anyone starts talking pastrami and always mention this place, and if its wed, were there immediately. If it's a Monday or Tuesday, we've just made plans for Wednesday.
author: Elton F.

description:
Amazing, authentic BBQ without pretention is one of life's great joys and Minne's has that in spades.  The brisket is so tender and juicy and the fried chicken crunchy and awesome.

The staff is always friendly and helpful, offering great recommendations and beer tastings.  Home made pie to finish the meal for you and don't miss the smoked pecan bacon brittle, yes I wrote that right!
author: Patrick P.

description: This is it!  The place for fried chicken on the weekends; seriously what is not to love about a deep smoked battered and then fried chicken?!?!?!   If you don't get the whole chicken, call me up and I will spring for the other half of the order.   This is deep south country fried love here folks.  The stuff your grandma used to make, if she was named Minnie and lived in Memphis.  Seriously, my grandmother made some good fried chicken, but this stuff is as good as it gets.  They smoke it first, then batter it and deep fry it.  The most tender chicken in the history of fried chicken.  If they made this every day i would weigh 500 pounds.  The brisket rocks, the pulled pork really good, I got caught up in the chicken, and the cornbread excellent!
author: John D.

description: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed every bite. We had brisket and pulled pork sandwiches which were amazing. There coleslaw was out of this world. It's so hard finding a good BBQ place around the bay area so happy we stopped in. We'll be back!
author: Kelly K.

description: Literally the best BBQ I have ever tasted. Brisket falls apart perfectly, the beans are amazing, and the slaw is fantastic.
author: Tim T.

description:
Pulled pork and beef brisket were both delicious! Yesterday was my first time here and I'm glad I tried it. Everything on my combo plate was delicious: corn bread, mac & cheese and potato salad. 

The cashier was extremely nice too! I really appreciate good service. If you plan on coming for dinner, come early because seats do fill up. 

I love their sauce choices and their decor - the drawings of the pigs under the plastic table cloth are so fun to look at!
author: Mimi V.

description:
Let me tell you a little story about an Ex-girlfriend I had a few years back.  She was pretty, had a good job, soft spoken.  Sounds all good right?  After about a year I discovered she was totally wack-a-doo.  I saw signs about three months in, but I allowed myself to be blinded, probably partly my own stupidity. Anyways, she was from Memphis...

A friend of mine suggested we try Minnie's since it's close to his house and he knows I like barbecue.  When I even hear the word barbecue I get a smile on my face like the Enzyte man in the commercials.  Barbecue reminds me that God loves me.  

Ooooh, as I walked in front of Minnie's eatery, it had the look.  Awww, how cute, a smiling piggy.  When I came in the employees were super friendly, nice guys.  It started off on the right foot just like my Ex did..

A little background about me, I'm a beast when it comes to eating animals.  I don't really have a problem with the process of foie gras (Yea, I said it!)  I even like veal and suckling pig.  For those that don't know, that's baby cow and baby pig.  But I do have a problem when it is cooked wrong and doesn't taste good.  It's such a sin.  

So while Minnie's had the look and the friendly people working.  Everything I ate from the beef brisket to the ribs, the mac & cheese and yams.  It was all just wack-a-doo.  Oh yea, Minnie's is from Memphis.  

So I'm starting to see a pattern.  My experiences with Memphis have just been all bad.  

So just as I told the Ex,  Memphis Minnie's this goes for you too.  in the words of Beyonce: 

To the left
To the left
You must not know bout me
You must not know bout me
I could have another you by tomorrow 
So don't you ever for a second get to thinkin

You're irreplacable
author: Michael L.

description:
I think Memphis Minnie's is pretty close to a 5 star for me, but I think I have to round down just because I'm feeling evil today, and because even though they were really good, I have trouble pinning anything with "as good as it gets".

Going in, I was skeptical.  Some people say it is the best in San Francisco, while some other reviewers have given it awful reviews.

The atmosphere is great for a barbecue place.  No metal trays, but still kind of a dive, and you can smell the smoke in the air (I've always wondered what the regulations are for these barbecue restaurants in an urban environment).

The menu has a really great selection, including beef ribs, tri-tip and some non-barbecue stuff like fried chicken, beef egg rolls and hot wings.

Before receiving my food, I thought the prices seemed rather expensive, but after the food arrived, it turned out to be a bit more food than other places, so that was fine.

Now to the food!  I ordered the taster(3 meats, 2 sides, 1 corn bread), and got a free order of onion strings for signing up with "thanx":

-Brisket: This impressed me the most.  Brisket is something that bay area places have difficult getting right.  This was tender and moist with a good brisket flavor.

-Beef Ribs: Very tender with a good bark, but kinda dry.  Leagues ahead of the beef ribs at Sam's BBQ in San Jose,

-St. Louis Pork Ribs: Same as beef ribs in that they were very tender with a good bark, but kinda dry.  I'm glad they were labeled as St. Louis style so I knew what I was getting ahead of time, but I thought it was interesting how they still had the skirt meat on the bottom(I like that meat, but I always thought it was removed for St. Louis Style ribs).

-Coleslaw: As far as I could tell, it was all vinegar and no mayo, so no creaminess.  I really liked that.

-Potlikker Greens: These were actually really good.  I just devoured these.  They had a good vinegary kick.  Not quite as good as the 'Smoking Pigs' version though.

-Corn Bread: Basic corn bread.  Not much to say about this, they didn't stand out to me.

-Onion Strings: Greasy Goodness.  'Tis hard to hate 'em when they are free.

-Meat Rubs:  I actually really liked the rub they used for the meats.  It gave a good bark and it complemented the meats really well.  It was pretty herb-y.  It worked pretty well by enhancing the meat but not vastly changing the flavor profile, although it wasn't as delicious for me as the stronger rubs at the 'Smoking Pig' in San Jose or 'Emergency BBQ' in San Carlos.

-Sauces: I was really happy with their variety and usage of sauces.  They serve all their meats dry and let us decide how much sauce to use.  They provide 4 different sauces to cover the basics, and yet surprisingly (which amused me), they don't provide the standard Kansas City style.  They had a East Carolina Vinegar Sauce, a South Carolina Mustard Sauce, a Texas Red Sauce & a spicy sauce. (Sorry Alabama, your white sauce ain't a basic sauce to me, you're just weird).  Each one was a pretty standard variant of its regional style.  It doesn't try and add their own flare to it like the sauces over at 'The Smoking Pig'.  Which doesn't garner it any points in my book, but it avoids a possible pitfall of a bad experiment.

___________________

Conclusion:
Perhaps you noticed that I did a lot of comparing to 'The Smoking Pig' in San Jose.  I thought that 'Memphis Minnies' makes very respectable barbecue for the bay area, but unfortunately 'The Smoking Pig' still beats it in my books.

After eating here, I think the people giving the awful reviews to Memphis Minnie's are just new transplants from the South who haven't had time to adjust to their new barbecue environment in the bay area yet.(Or perhaps I'm really just missing out on Oakland's Barbecue offerings)
author: Jason S.

description: I don't know man, their food was okay. They 86'ed on beef ribs so we got pork ribs and fried chicken with mac and cheese and beans as the side. Pork ribs were dry. Chicken was okay.  I think because it was July 4th and everybody was coming in for catering options that's why they ran out of food and we had sub par ribs that day.  Sauces were ok, I did like the spicy one though.  It's a little greasy in there but I did like all the little pig paraphenalia they had as decor and some of these drawings on the tables are hilarious!
author: Meena N.

description: The real deal BBQ on the west coast!  We are from the south but live in California and good southern BBQ is hard to find.  The food is delicious & the staff friendly. The pork was my favorite!  My husband is from South Carolina & loved their SC BBQ sauce. Thanks for the sauce, Tom!  A must when in San Francisco!
author: Laura L.

description:
Passable pulled pork. Brisket was excellent, tri-tip was above average but only just.

Fills the BBQ joint cliche a T, at least as close as the Bay Area gets on this.

Sauces are... okay. Have had much, much better, but the variety isn't bad.

Nothing wrong with the place per se, the Bay Area (hell the state of California) is just the wrong place to expect traditional American style BBQ as far as the Carolinas or Tennessee or even Texas is concerned, so the disappointment, while real, is entirely expected.
author: Brian W.

description:
I was up in the Haight with my gal and we had a hankerin for some food while out and about.  An open parking space right in front of Minnie's said we gotta go here. (street parking here can be bad sometimes)
I've been wanting to try this place for a minute and it didn't disappoint!  She got the pork sandwich, I got brisket.  The portions of meat for myself, and on Kat's sandwich were large so we were stoked.  Figuring out the right sauce on your first visit is a little tough but I settled on the 'basic' red sauce to compliment my brisket.  The sides were good, though if we got 2 for the price it wouldn't have been the worst thing.
I worked in Dallas for 3 years and I've toured with bands around the country this was hands down one of the best brisket's I've ever had!
The employees were all super friendly, the decor is fun, the only minor downside is the neighborhood parking can be brutal sometimes.  They don't control this, but it's worth being aware of when going.  
Will we be back, oh yeah!
author: Jim P.

description:
Meat is over cooked in general and overly sweetened. Granted, I'm from Texas.

If you're going, avoid ribs, brisket, as these are most likely be too well done. Chicken and sausage should be a better bet.
author: Lauren D.

description:
Came here for the first time yesterday. I typically get a Reuben at new places that have it on the menu. It happened to be the daily special so it's what I went with. 

Literally the best Reuben I've ever had. The cut of the meat was the perfect mix of lean and fatty and the sauces were incredible. 

I had to come back today to try their fried chicken sandwich; if it's anywhere near the Reuben's quality I'm sure I'll be happy. 

Lovely staff, clean restaurant, very normal prices for BBQ. Wish they had beef ribs, maybe someday!
author: Mo M.

description: Absolutely delicious. Best BBQ in SF. The meat was tender and not too smoky. The mild sauce wasn't too sweet or thick. The sides were spot on. I had it delivered so I can't vouch for the dining room experience, but the food spoke for itself.
author: Virginia V.

description: Very good BBQ, decent prices, excellent selection and chouces. Tough place to find parking in the Haight Street neighborhood.
author: Jerry M.

description:
I love Memphis Minnie's!!!!!  I should have taken a picture just now... I am here at KQED and Memphis Minnie's catered a Lunch Meeting.  When the President's assistant Stacy made an announcement over the intercom that there was some Memphis Minnie's left over in the board room you would have thought there was an Earthquake!!  There was a stampede getting to the boardroom!
Amazing Brisket, Cornbread that melts in your mouth, juicy chicken....
What a great surprise lunch... YUMMMMMMMMMMMY!!!!!!!!!
author: Ellen B.

description: Brisket today was exceptional.  Perfect moist texture. Caramelized edges. Great smokey taste. Minnie's has its beef down.
author: Richard D.

description:
Awful - don't bother with the dry meat and awful attitude.  

this place is just simply dirty and gross.

Eat here if you like food poisoning.
author: Jim B.

description:
Maybe it was a mistake for a Kansas City resident to get BBQ in San Francisco; maybe my experience at Memphis Minnie's was just a fluke. Whatever the reason, I can only give 2 stars for the beef brisket I had. It was cut into nice thick slabs with a small smoke ring, and I was pleased to see that the meat was not overly fatty (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/memphis-minnies-san-francisco?select=cwJUgg8LIZTk9j878uAHKQ#cwJUgg8LIZTk9j878uAHKQ). However, it lacked that rich smokey flavor, and even worse, the meat was on the dry side. I found myself needing to repeatedly use the sauce - and as we like to say in the midwest, that meat should be so good it don't need no sauce...The BBQ sauces were acceptable but nothing more than that; the sweet and spicy are a bit flat on their own but they combine nicely. I'm sure the vinegar sauce would go well on pulled pork and same with the honey mustard on chicken.

The meat on its own probably warrants 2.5-3 stars but I'm dropping down to 2 for price. 1/2 lb of beef brisket is $10.95, as is a beef brisket sandwich; 1/2 slab of pork ribs is $15.25. I know Q's not the most inexpensive fare, but I'm used to a price point at least $2 cheaper than that, for even moister and smokier meat. And while it may not be fair to compare San Francisco to the midwest, where most of the living population here consists of cows and pigs, I still contend that at a $10.95-$15.95 price point you can go elsewhere in the city and get an outstanding meal...it just won't be BBQ.
author: Clarice W.

description:
Sooo I don't write reviews often but I felt this place deserved an honest review from someone who has lived in the "Bible-Belt" my entire life and grew up on amazing Alabama & Georgia BBQ.

Meats: 5 stars
Meats are all absolutely great and on-par if not better than most BBQ joints. 5-stars

Sides: 0 stars 
The sides are mostly what brought this review down. Mac & Cheese wasn't good at all (to the point where it went to waste in my fridge for a week before I threw it out). Pot-Licking Greens also really disappointing (too much vinegar and something else not sure what it was) Glory greens would've been more appetizing and that's saying a lot.

Sauces: 3 stars
Decent selection of sauces. The mustard sauce and hot were by far the best but be prepared the hot is definitely hot. The red sauce is also pretty good. Only thing they are missing is a quality sweet sauce with some good ol' brown sugar and molasses. The sauces are all relatively similar and are almost like a rub with oil & vinegar added but that's pretty true to Memphis. 

Price. $$
Not bad for SF but definitely the most I've ever paid for BBQ. 

**My suggestion: Get a half of Pork Ribs and a half of Brisket. ~$22 before tax and you will be more than satisfied but Make your own sides. (Good can of Bush beans and Jiffy corn bread.)
author: Austin Q.

description:
I'd say the ratings on Yelp are about right. 

Smoked meat for 15 hours? supposed to be at least awesome if not mind-blowing right? 

um, no.

They give you ample servings of meat but the sides are small. I had the beef brisket, the meat itself was tender and moist but it really had me searching for flavor. I thought if I start slathering sauces on it, that would improve the taste. Four sauces were at the table: Texas Red sauce, vinegar, mustard and the "it's stupid hot" sauce.  The Texas Red was all sugar and I didn't care for the rest. The "it's stupid hot" sauce was too hot for me to handle! plus the consistency of the sauces weren't appealing, it's too thin.

On the other hand, the sides were good. Mac n cheese with big tubes of pasta covered with cheese and topped with breadcrumbs and sweet potatoes were chunky and just had the right amount of sugar and cinnamon.

The decor is really fun and very kitschy, lots of t-shirts with funnies hanging on the wall and other cute decor line the counter.  Beer, wine and sake are available for purchase.
author: Janice C.

description:
Smoky.

Walking in the BBQ smoke is almost overpowering. Atmospherically it's perfect.

As was my pulled chicken sandwich. Nothing but white meal on a roll and chipotle mayo. Or skip the latter and dip into homemade sauces.

Tangy red vinegar was one. Thick and slightly sweet mustard was another. Can't go wrong with either. Or the rich side of sweet potatoes.

Finished with a freshly baked chocolate chip cookie. As soft and chewy as they come.

Great service complements the great food.

Want to give more stars but can't look past the high prices. $15 for the pair seemed a few bucks too high.

Adds up to a hazy three.
author: Jason B.

description:
Best bbq I've ever had. Period. I'm the type of piggy that loves putting sloppy sauces on my meat but you will find there is no need to here. This meat can hold it's own, as is, because it is so stupidly flavorful and tender in itself. That is not to say the sauces aren't good (drink the mustard sauce, trust me). They're delightful in their own way and can be taken home for use on all your other dipping needs, whatever they may be. 
The sides are all phenomenol (usually where bbq places neglect their attention). They also serve sake, which i never would have thought to go good with bbq but it does. 
The staff is great and will not accept your feeble excuses as you try to explain why you had to steal seating before even ordering. Wait your turn like everyone else. 
The music is kickass and the ambiance here is where I would want to be if I was stuck in pergatory and couldn't find my way to the light. Did I mention the stimulation of your olifactory senses? The smells permeating out of this place are orgasmic. 
This place is my death row meal. This place is my favorite restaurant. Ever. Thank you for existing. My goal this year is to go through the entire menu. I haven't even gotten to the desserts yet. Can't wait.
author: Tom D.

description:
I saw MM's featured on "Check Please!" a couple of weeks ago.  While the three guests' were critiquing the restaurant, their tongues were hanging out and dripping the entire time they were discussing the food...enough said.  I like BBQ so I knew I had to give it a try.

Some friends were visiting, so I figured it would be the perfect time to check out the restaurant.

My wife and I ordered the St Louis ribs, beans and coleslaw.

These ribs were the best I have ever eaten.  They were cooked perfectly, had a good amount of meat and were deep with flavor and had a multitude of textures...Every bite seemed to bring out another layer.  I poured the Texas Red Sauce on them, an absolutely delicious condiment for dish.

The beans were simple, but perfectly cooked and had a depth of flavor I have never tasted from beans.  They were firm and juicy.

The slaw was delicious.  It was crunchy and vinegary with several different types of veggies added for more layers of flavor.  They were so good, I ate the entire side not thinking to save some for my wife.  Damn!  Had to go back and get more.  Wow, they were good.

My friends ordered the brisket.  I have never been a fan of brisket because it is usually dry and lacks flavor.  Brisket, to me, tends not to have much character.  This brisket was the best I have had.  It had a wonderful smokey flavor and seemed moister than brisket I have had in the past, but I wouldn't order it for myself.  I'm still not a fan of brisket.

My friends also ordered the sweet potatoes, which were outstanding.  They were firm, yet melted in my mouth.  They were buttery and sweet, but perfectly balanced.

I tried the sweet tea as well.  I asked if the tea was Southern sweet or California sweet.  The woman who took our order said it was Southern sweet, but wasn't.  It was sweet, but not sugary, like the kind you find in just about every restaurant in the South.  Most sweet tea I have had in the South is absolutely disgusting.  This tea wasn't at all.  It had a nice tea flavor and was "mildly" sweet.  (I would like to see them offer unsweetened so I could blend them on future visits.)

I really enjoyed the food at Memphis Minnie's and will try something new next time, as well as ordering more of the ribs.  They were out of this world.

I highly recommend Memphis Minnie's.
author: David M.

description: All three kinds of pork our group got were amazing.  Excellent fries.  I could bathe in all of the sauces.  Energetic, cheerful staff who clearly love what they do, and it shows in the food.  Fairly basic, but that's all meat needs to be sometimes when paired with a great sauce.  Good shit, perfectly cooked.
author: Aaron C.

description: I had the fried chicken today and let me tell u, they know how to cook up some chicken, southern style!! Just ask for Tom or Jackie and they will set you up nicely! Thanks Gail, Bob ,Tom and Jackie for a wonderful Saturday lunch!
author: Curtis L.

description: The best BBQ in SF keeps getting better.  Memphis Minnie's has been this 7th Generation Texan's source for BBQ for the past 7 years and they never fail to satisfy. This isn't some hipstered up over priced BBQ like you get elsewhere (I'm looking at you Smokestack and 4505), this is real deal no frills authentic BBQ.  Perfectly smoked brisket, some of the best andouille out there, and great sides across the board.  Pair that with a cold Shiner or some great sweet tea (a rare thing in this town) and you've got a meal that will make any homesick Texan happy.  Also, if you've not tried their Wednesday special ruben yet, you're missing out on one of the best sandwiches in San Francisco. Eat here and thank me later.
author: Joshua W.

description:
Driving thru Haight the light bulb hits me...memphis minnies. Mid day plenty of parking halle "friggin" lujah!

This is where it goes down hill. Dont get me wrong the people that work there are very nice. It is just that the place is filthy dirty: pigeons walking in and out...or was that my chicken...er ah burp. Tables are sorta sticky nasty. Food was aight but 3 ribs  a half a sausage with two sides for 20 bucks...dang that is a lot for lunch....and I had nothing to drink.

I think ole Minnies has seen better daze.
author: David G.

description:
Hit the Haight with the old man yesterday. Drove around looking for a place to eat, and we stumbled upon Minnie's. THe fella has been wanting to try it for a while, so we were off!
The place is adorable. The employees seem to really love working there lol.
I ordered the pork sandwich with a side of slaw. Pork was okay. Would have loved a little more smoke to it. Cole slaw was bomb. Seriously. Though I have to admit, for the price, I would have loved another side
There was tons of pork on the sandwich. Happy Kitten. Now to choose the sauce. They had a mustard sauce, vinegar sauce which tasted like straight up vinegar, a red sauce that seemed to be cinnamon based, and a hot bbq sauce. None of them the traditional bbq sauce, but in the end, I went back and forth between the vinegar and the red sauce.
My fella swore his brisket was the best ever. Next time I will try that. Though my pork sandwich wasn't the best I have ever had, I would definitely go back!
author: Kat R.

description:
I don't understand why Memphis Minnie's doesn't have better ratings because as far as BBQ goes, this is as good as it gets in SF.  (And I've had Sneaky's, Baby Blues, Catheads, Smokin' Warehouse, T-Dubs on Friday's.  Gorilla is also good but that is in Pacifica.)

I've eaten my way through KC BBQ and MM's pork ribs are second only to Oklahoma Joe's in KC.  I ordered a half slab and received a mixture of long and short end ribs.  They were delightfully smokey with a visually appealing smoke ring, and fell clean off the bone.  The mouthfeel was not as tender as OKJ's but good if you like your meat to have some texture without being tough or dry.  No need for sauce because the seasoning was good overall, maybe the short ends were a tad oversalted but not too offensive.  Now all they need to do is serve those ribs with some Wonderbread and a pickle.  :)  I also love the brisket and pulled pork at MM's and my friend from the deep South enjoyed their smoked fried chicken.

Only complaints: Prices are 2-3 bucks more than they ought to be ($15.25 for a half slab of ribs?!!).  Also, my one experience with the tri tip was that it was very dry, so I have avoided it ever since.  

And last but not least, the service is always great here.  Even when it is crowded, the employees do a good job getting you seated and then getting your food fired in a timely fashion.
author: Beatrice W.

description: Excellent BBQ!!  Enjoyed my last visit and reminded me of how good BBQ can be!  I ordered the brisket and was very happy with it.  The place is small - which is the one downside.
author: Brian C.

description: One of your competitors on folsom st. Delivered us very horrendous BBQ about a year ago. So we didnt have high expectations our 2nd go around with ordering BBQ. But as the comedian Katt williams says ' THIS **** RIGHT HERE!  is Banging! one of our family members ordered the pulled pork sandwich and said its to die for. It was also her first time tasting the carolina BBQ sauce, witch blew her away.Our second family member ordered the ribs and greens. She is extremely picky, she loved it, She prides her greens but she said she has to "bow down" to these greens. I myself ordered the brisket plate. Excellent tasting bark, smoke ring, juicy, and pulls apart effortlessly. You can tell that they took the time to do it right, i cant remember the last time that i took my time to enjoy good BBQ. MEMPHIS MINNIE'S IS IT!  Thank you for an excellent experience!
author: Ken M.

description: Not the biggest fan of bbq, but Memphis Minnie's was actually very good! I went with a few people and we all ordered different items from the menu. Everyone seemed happy with their orders. I got the  pulled pork sandwich with a side of macaroni and cheese and corn bread.  The sandwich was tasty, the meat was soft and the different sauces were all good too! I mixed the regular bbq sauce with the spicy one for a perfect combination.  My very favorite was the mac and cheese....sooooo yummy! The cornbread was ok. My daughter had the fried chicken and said it was good, would definitely go back again to try it for myself. I have to also add that the music selection was the best :)
author: Brigette B.

description:
Memphis Minnie's is one of those BBQ places that I think of immediately after I eat at a BBQ place that is not great. In fact, last time the office went out to BBQ for lunch, we went to a trendy new hipster BBQ place on Divisadero and it was not very good. After our meal, we swore that we would only eat at Memphis Minnie's because in my opinion, Memphis Minnie's consistently delivers an amazing BBQ meal. 
Memphis Minnie's has been around a long time and I think that is a testament to their quality and consistency. Julia Child even ate here! I'd bet she loved it because that lady knew good food. 

If you're questioning eating here, let me tell you about some of my favorites.

Memphis Sweet Smoked Pulled Pork: Juicy and piled high. SO GOOD. You don't necessarily need the sauce, but they give you FOUR sauce options to blow your mind. For the pulled pork, I prefer the Texas Red and Carolina Mustard sauces combined. Nom nom nom nom.

Smoked Pork Ribs: Really tender and not fall-off-the-bone messy. So good I sometimes even suck out the bone marrow. These could easily be eaten with a sprinkle of salt and pepper, but I do love all the sauces set up as a little dipping station for these bad boys.

Macaroni & Cheese: Big macaroni noodles, big cheesy flavor and breadcrumbs. Most BBQ places skip the breadcrumbs, but they add a great texture to contrast this soft and creamy side dish. Its some next-level stuff. I love it.

Potato Salad: Deliciously homemade red potato salad with a bit of red bell pepper that sends this picnic and BBQ staple to the moon. I am so glad they don't do boring sides here.

BBQ Seasoned Fries: Order the $4.75 basket and seriously get enough fries to feed six people or three super drunk patrons from Molotov's which is next door. These are really great fries and I don't love fries, so they impress me every time.

The service here is pretty good, but I can see how some people might get frustrated. The space isn't huge and when it is crowded, things can get kind of tense, especially when there isn't any more seating. To avoid this, I usually go for an early or late lunch to beat the crowds. You usually get better service and your choice of seating.

I have been enjoying Memphis Minnie's for years, even before I lived in SF and still beats out all the other BBQ I've had in the city's limits, so if you love BBQ (and I'm sure you do!) shift it into gear and get down to Memphis Minnie's for some bone-suckin, down home flavor!
author: Michael T.

description:
This is what they promise: "All our meats are cooked using the heat and smoke from burning white oak logs. We use NO GAS and NO ELECTRIC to cook our meats." 

This is what you want to hear. This is what we tried:

Texas Beef Brisket (Smoked 18 Hours): ugly - no smoke ring - but tender and tasty and prepared nicely. (Aside: the smoke ring is more about aesthetics than actual taste - it's a myth, you know - but we also eat with our eyes).

St. Louis Style Smoked Pork Ribs: looked great, tasted just fine, but a bit dry-rub dry for my palate.

Smoked Chicken: good smoked meat but also a little dry.

Potlikker Greens: sweeter than I prefer, but good enough to try again.

Pit Smoked Beans: I can't believe I'm saying it, but the shredded pork in here was too much of a good thing (as a side) - still, very nice.

Corn Bread Muffin: on the sweeter side, how I like it, but I'd rather have a couple slices of soft sliced bread (I'm old school like that).

In toto, I would've preferred more sauce options to go - all my minor dryness issues would have been mostly ignorable with more sauce. But there's also a redoubtable BBQ philosophy that argues that using/needing too much sauce is a sign of weakness. 

In closing, I'm suspicious of begging for a Yelp review and asking for 5 stars if you like the product. I'm also suspicious of such a large menu. But I also wish I lived close enough to try everything. I'm not saying I expect any one thing on this menu to give me visions (I think you can understand a place with 4-5 plates). But I am saying that I believe (most) everything is going to taste just fine.
author: Brski B.

description:
I have been on a quest for great BBQ in San Francisco, but especially the best beef brisket. As far as I'm concerned, this is the most tender brisket I've had in the Bay Area. I went the other night and wolfed down a half a pound of brisket along with some of their other great food. While the brisket was the standout of the meal the ribs were also really tasty. I had the corn bread and the slaw for sides, and they were both spot on. 
I really wanted dessert, but was conflicted which one to get. They had more choices for desserts than most BBQ places I've been to. So, my friend just decided to order one of each and we split them at the table. The sweet potato pie was as good as it gets. The fried peach pie was also really good, but was really hot when I first bit into it and burned my mouth a bit. The banana pudding was just as good as any other I've had and the pecan pie was also very tasty. They also serve these desserts with real whipped cream. 
The staff here was very friendly and the food comes out very quickly. I also like the atmosphere of the place. It's an extremely casual place in an ever expanding hipster neighborhood.
author: William O.

description: The BBQ Bandits Strike again at Memphis Minnie's. Delicious food, great service, you can find parking at the right time of day and lots of options. I am still hands down Everette and Jones Girl but this place is all organic and free range which matters to me.
author: Julie P.

description: This is the best damn bbq of all time! What makes it is, of course the food, but the staff and atmosphere is welcoming and warm. Try Wednesday's for pastrami night!
author: Albert R.

description: The food was horrible! The staff was friendly and service was good. The chicken was dry and overcooked. The cornbread was overcooked and partially burnt. The ribs were tasteless and the sauces at the table were watery! There is much better BBQ in SF.
author: Dougie H.

description: I was craving REAL BBQ and this place hit the spot. I was craving rib tips but they were out, so I got the Pulled Pork Sandwich with the Potato Salad and Mac-n-Cheese. The Mac-n-Cheese was "okay" but everything else was great and I left stuffed. Too stuffed to try any of the desserts. We should have gotten one sandwich and a few sides to split. Everyone was so helpful and so funny. Will definitely be back!
author: Allison T.

description: My husband and I were in the area and hungry so we decided to step in here. It wasn't busy and smelled great. The girl at the register was super nice and helpful. Kind of gave us the layout of all the food and what was favored. He got the pulled pork sandwich with Mac and cheese and I got the brisket sandwich with fries. Everything was amazing! Perfectly cooked and just the right sized sandwich. Will definitely come back here when visiting.
author: Morgan A.

description:
While there's really no good barbeque in the bay area, Memphis Minnies is adequate and far better than any other options in the city such as 4505 meats or smokestack. If I had to simply rate their ordinary BBQ fare such as their brisket or pork ribs, they'd get 3 stars. What really brings me back here are not the standard barebeque fare: Santa Maria tri-tip, smoked fried chicken, and their pecan pie. My god, their pecan pie. If you like pecan pie, you MUST try it. With REAL whip cream.  They also have an interesting Pastrami sandwich and reuben every Wednesday. Their BBQ french fries are fantastic. I see people eagerly ordering the burger with housemade bacon and fried onions like it is crack or something but I always have something else I am craving and have never tried it.

For hot sauce lovers, their Beelzebob hot bbq sauce is outstanding.

The staff are really nice. Jacki is a sweet lady who  walks around the place asking people if everything is ok. With that and the awesome decorations and signs on the walls, this place has a warm homey vibe that I really like.

But if you are from the south and dying for good Q, forget it. You won't get it in the bay area. You'll just have to wait until you go home or travel on business.
author: C S.

description:
I was craving for bbq meat for the longest time and I had to see what the fuse was all about. Nicely themed, pigs everywhere. 

We shared the combo with three different meats. Most of them were pretty good, some of the pieces were dry though. The mac & cheese was good. Their fries were flavorful. They were quick with my order.

However, when it came to my bf's it took about 20mins. He ordered after we were half way through the combo. The servers were very apologetic and even gave us his order for free. I noticed that they try to strive on customer services, that's a BIG PLUS, in my book.
author: Mandy D.

description:
~*300th Review!! *~ I'm a Memphis Minnie's fan from back in the day when they were located in the Mission, off 20th and York. Being their neighbor then, the smell of slow cooked meat would come wafting through and lure me in for their BBQ goodness. 

We ordered the 2-Way with Chicken and Pulled BBQ Pork, Macaroni and Cheese, Baked BBQ Beans and Sweet Corn Bread Muffin, and the Spicy Shredded Chicken Sandwich with BBQ Fries. Yes it all tastes as good as it sounds and looks. 

I'm a fan of BBQ sauces, drizzling and dipping my meats, accenting my sides and soaking my cornbread in them. My favorites being the Texas Red Sauce and the South Carolina Mustard Sauce. Gave me some inspiration on making my own sauces again this summer. 

Look out Summer, I'm ready for the FUN!
author: Rebekah T.

description:
We love this place so much, it has become our standard to judge all other BBQ to.  Good luck trying to live up to this place. 
Some of our favorites are Pastrami Wednesday the best Reubens!  And on Saturday, it's the Smoked - Fried chicken, THE best chicken on the planet! 
So, if you're on lower Haight  (576), or anywhere in the bay area stop by for the Best BBQ you'll ever have.
author: Steve W.

description:
Entrees:
Pork Ribs - DRY!
Rib Tips - DRY!
BBQ chicken - DRY!

The Sides:
Corn Bread Muffin - DRY!
Mac'n Cheese - Great
Potato Salad - Great
Green - Vinegary, but i like vinegar so i liked it a lot
Tangy Slaw - Great


Honestly i couldn't believe how dry everything was.  Especially since the 2 item plate is over $20.  It seriously felt like they gave me food that had been sitting out under a heat lamp all day; even their sauce couldn't save the dryness...


I liked the sides (except the corn bread's dryness), but you don't come to a BBQ place because of the sides.  


I hear the beef brisket is better here.
author: Steven F.

description: I've had better the sweet potato was bland and def not mashed like I am used to. It was cubed and with light flavor. The greens we not edible they had a ton of what seemed like vinegar all over them. Way too much seasoning. The chicken was ok and the brisket was ok a little fatty but ok.
author: Admin A.

description: The ribs fall off the bone, the cornbread is delicious. Service is great and the atmosphere is very southern.
author: Fernilla S.

description: Again, almost 5 stars. This place got me through studying for the bar -- no better comfort BBQ food in SF. Or if there is, please let me know! Ribs are fantastic (I prefer the larger beef ones), great sides (the slaw is particularly delicious) and their sauces are interesting. Plenty to choose from but not so much it's overwhelming. I always got it to go but now that the bar is far behind me, I'll have to check out their patio one of these days.
author: Alex H.

description: Food was great. Come in fresh from hippie hill on 420 and let me tell you...  This is real bbq. The meat fell off the bone and the sides were amazing. I'm a big mac and cheese connoisseur and theirs did not disappoint. I will definitely be back next time I'm in the sf area
author: Bobby B.

description:
A friend and I came here after she promised to take me out for a belated birthday and put the longing for BBQ in my brain. However, we came here more by chance as 4505 Meats had sold out of both brisket AND ribs by 7:30 pm, Cathead BBQ was closed on Tuesdays, and Sneaky's BBQ was catering at Vinyl but with no place to sit cuz it was Trivia Night. So after having read about this place here and there, I decided we'd make our way Memphis Minnie's.

When you walk in, you might notice how colorful this place is with all the T-shirts on the wall. The good thing is that the restaurant smells like Q. You order at the register at the far end of a high counter top separating you from the open kitchen. The service is actually quite friendly.

As is our customary habit, we opted to try as many things as possible.

Sauces: there are 4 sauces provided on the table. The reddish Texas sauce is the closest to store-bought BBQ sauce, but that's not saying much. It's a little sweet and tangy and worked best (in my mind) with the brisket. The mustard sauce is actually quite delicious and paired well with the ribs. The hot sauce is fairly spicy and offers a little bit of fruitiness (possibly from habaneros?) but lacked a deeper flavor (or the heat prevents you from tasting it). The vinegar sauce was our least favorite.

Brisket: smoky. tender, but not completely shredded tender. A decent but not overwhelming amount of fat. Seasoning was solid. My friend's favorite of our 4 meats, my only serious complaint was that it was served only warm instead of hot (see more below).

Ribs: my favorite protein of the 4. Again, smoky with a flavorful, savory (not brown sugar-based) rub. A ways away from fall-off-the-bone tender, you will definitely need to bite it off. Was able to eat some of it without sauce and still enjoy it, but the mustard sauce took it to another level. Again, temperature was a factor as some pieces were more dry and might have been made worse if they were heated to just-cooked temperatures.

Chicken: Pretty good, again a good amount of smoke. They gave us a weird combination of thigh+breast that left me confused as to how to pick it apart. Things are starting to get a little saltier here...

Pork: Some parts were overburnt offering pure carbon instead of cooked meat, and boy were some parts salty. It's hard to critique much else when your taste buds alternate between charred remains and salt.

Cole Slaw: Non-mayo-based, it was almost like a natural rendition of KFC's cole slaw with the vegetables being shreded instead of pulverized and with slices of sweet peppers mixed in. Predominantly sweet with a light touch of vinegar, it offered a refreshing contrast to the heaviness of all that protein.

Mac and cheese: good, spiral noodles cooked more al dente than most places serve, not much more to say...

Potato salad: It was alright, better than grocery store potato salad as it wasn't as sour...but overall somewhat bland.

Cornbread: solid, just a little sweet with an acceptably moist center. Good enough to want more than one.

Pecan Pie: alright, they do it right. The crust may be a little overdone, but large pecans and sweet ooey-gooey center makes everything else forgivable.

Peach Turnovers: more like peach empanadas, they were unfortunately filled with unripe peaches! Minimal sweetness without the confection sugar and somewhat tart, we couldn't finish them and it wasn't due to a lack of stomach space.

I don't know if this place doesn't have heating or they keep it shut off so that the cooks can stay cool in the open kitchen, but the 50 degree weather outside has a definite impact on dropping your food temperature really fast. If you come, sit further away from the door. I'd consider giving the pork another chance, but, pecan pie aside, this place will always be more of a fallback than a primary destination for me going forward.
author: Gene C.

description:
There's just so much dry BBQ I can handle..
