On the prowl with my girlfriend for some good ol' BBQ lead us to Memphis Minnie's in San Francisco's Haight district. As I was parking my car across the street, the aroma of charred meats instantaneously drew me in! ..oh damn, I forgot to feed the meter!

Minnie's Taster - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VlNE3m59v836-t3V4ZaOWQ?userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
3 Meats + 2 Sides + 1 Cornbread = $20.95
- St Louis Style Smoked Pork Ribs - Charred and DRY.
- Texas Beef Brisket - Bland and DRY. 
- Memphis Sweet Smoked Pork - Pretty good. Moist, tender, and just a hint of sweetness.
- Tart N' Tangy Slaw - The tart and tang was definitely there!
- Mac & Cheese - COLD.

Crispy Fried Onion Strings - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VlNE3m59v836-t3V4ZaOWQ?select=3ZCRSVVYVKyCsvchugHBLg
The fries were really good. Very light, crispy, and they gave you a mountain of the stuff! Gotta order some!

Memphis Minnie's Sauces - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=p6PmhgRkytd64LJB0KdLZw&userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
There's 4 house sauces at each table side but I really couldn't differentiate the differences. Like the "Beelzebub's" sauce claimed to be "Super Hot", but it hardly even tickled my tongue. The "Texas Red Sauce" was tangy but it personally didn't do it for me. The "South Carolina Mustard" wasn't bad, though I was hoping for a horseradish-type kick, it still delivered. 

I love all the pig-oriented decor, artistic pig drawings on the tables, and really great friendly hospitality, but the BBQ just didn't cut it. My girlfriend and I came in the mid-afternoon and maybe it's just me, but the BBQ gave the impression that it has just been lying about like a mediocre buffet, and upon your order, it's reheated (hopefully not microwaved) back up.
author: Albert L.

description:
My companion questioned the Hygiene of the tables and utensils, but it could easily be hard water residue.  Food is served quick without sauce pre-applied which is a fantastic quirk that I wish all BBQ places followed.  Deliciousness will vary based on your past experiences:

Brisket wasn't great, but the rib tips were amazing.  Really enjoyed the corn muffin.  Sweet smoked pork was quite good, beans were good, Mac & cheese left a little to be desired (improved dramatically with your choice of BBQ sauce).  4 MicroBrews on tap, nothing too fancy.  Fountain drinks.  

No question I'll be back the next time I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Johann N.

description:
AMAAAAAAAAZING! The boyfriend and I love bbq and stopped by at Minny's spontaneously. We agreed not to go to any other bbq place from now on. 

We shared half a pound of brisket and the special big bone rib. Don't remember exactly what the big rib was called but it was huge! And delicious! Both the rib and the brisket were so tender and flavorful. Wasn't a huge fan of the bbq sauces but that's irrelevant because the  meat was amazing by itself! 

The service was also outstanding. The woman that helped us was friendly and made some great recommendations. She also stopped at our table to have us try a bbq sauce that was off the menu. Great customer service!

We'll be back for sure!
author: Monica K.

description: Awful take out for party re: Caviar. Terrible appetizer plate, wings with chicken hair/feather still on it, tough brisket, overcooked ribs. Chicken was OK. Greens were too salty and Mac and cheese was good when heated. Potato salad was bland. Would prefer anything over this. Waste of money.
author: Laurel M.

description: You have to get the mac and cheese. That's the true star, but the mouth watering ribs and pulled pork were to die for. I recommend going in earlier if possible, as they tend to sell out of the more popular items in the late evening.
author: Kristin J.

description:
Wish I could give it 2.5 stars, but I can't, so it gets 2. Just not very good, and honestly, I wouldn't leave a Yelp review, but they beg you to leave one on the tables. Went with my gal and she ate half and subsequently got sick. My food was decent, but wasn't great. 

If it was a cheap meal, it'd be 3 stars, but it's just not that good. With plenty of good alternatives, I can't imagine I'll be back anytime soon.
author: Brian K.

description:
As a native Texan...this is the closest to real Texas BBQ that I have found in the Bay area.
And when I walked in I knew I was home.
The brisket I had was smokey, juicy and tender as my heart.
Side dishes...Greens and Mac n Cheese were simply amazing.
Wife had a pulled pork sandwich that was delicious !!!
Oh and don't forget about those fries...out of this world.
And for all you city slickers you have your choice of four different BBQ sauces.
author: MEAT M.

description:
I love Minnie's. I've been getting take-out semi-regularly with a friend for several years now. Early on we fell into a standard order: 1 lb. sweet pulled pork, 1 pint beans, and 1 pint mac'n'cheese and it's a great meal with leftovers lasting another couple days.

I finally got around to trying the brisket and loved it too. It's not as flavorful as the pork, but is less fatty and amazingly tender.

I've had some of the deserts and other sides, which were good too, but the main course of the meat and beans is practically better than desert.

When I want a treat I go to Minnie's.
author: Jack T.

description: Tried their beef brisket ... With honey mustard ... Hands down ! The best brisket that has entered yet in my fat body so far ...
author: Sandeep s.

description: Very competitive to baby blue ribs. I would give this place 8/10. Tangy coleslaw nice. Simple atmosphere. Get your own knife/forks.
author: Thomas C.

description: I swear they have gotten even better. The brisket used to be kind of hit or miss. The last 4 times we have ordered it, it has been amazing!  Tender and not too much fat.  Just so so good!!!  Keep it up!
author: Daniel A.

description: Friendly fun and helpful service! As soon as you walk in the smell consumes you. Great menu with lots of delicious choices. Tri tip sandwich is so good. The tri tip is so tender and they put a ton of it on the sandwich. Fries are super good. Oh and clean bathrooms! If you're in the area try it.
author: Sandy C.

description: I don't know how anyone can give this place less than 5 stars. Hands down the absolute best bbq in SF. The ribs brisket and tips were amazing. Definitely get the cole slaw....delicious.
author: Jason F.

description: The Pub is better! This place has fatty meats and always gives me worst indigestion. Always disappointed w the baked beans but that may just be the southerner in me ;) I don't really like this place and their take out is too confusing. I'm telling y'all the Pub take out is worth attempting! This place does have decent sweet tea is why they got 2 stars from me.
author: Brent T.

description: We stumbled on Memphis Minnie's by chance. A pleasant surprise. The Ribs were tasty. Seems like every rib joint has there own twist. Minnie's does as well. Prices were not over whelming like most of SFO. Staff can be a little terse, chalk it up to not being a regular. The family enjoys this area of Frisco and we will return.
author: Von E.

description: This is the best BBQ I've had in SF, and it's even better than some of the famous places in Lockheart TX that I've been to. The beans w/ pork is awesome.
author: Melville M.

description: Love their beef ribs with no sauce. Side dishes are pretty creative as well. Little on the pricy side but not ridiculous.
author: Armand C.

description: 1st time here today.  The service staff were rude and obnoxious.  The cook behind the counter spent most of the time yelling at the staff and the customers.  The woman on the register was equally as rude and LOUD.  I couldn't believe that people actually think this place is any good.  It's dark, cramped, and dirty.  The greens tasted like they were cooked in apple cider vinegar (really????) and were so bad we left a barely touched container on the table, the ribs were dry and cold, the coleslaw was also full of vinegar; we didn't eat that either.  The sweet potatoes had no cinnamon or nutmeg, the corn muffins were rubbery.  It was horrible and so were the people who work there.  The only one who was friendly and polite was the poor man busing the tables who the guy behind the counter kept yelling at.  Let's end this. . . . . . I'm never going back to this place. HORRIBLE.
author: RastaGirl J.

description:
First let me say.I ordered delivery from GRUBHUB $5.00 for
delivery & $4.21 for tip.Not bad.Their time for delivery between 
5:10 and 5:20.The delivery arrived at 4:55.And the delivery guy
was nice.Thumbs up for GRUBHUB(MY FIRST TIME USING THEM).Now
to the food. I ordered the smoked chicken plate with two sides
and cornbread $14.95(half a chicken) over priced.The chicken
was  dry.It came with two sauces (TEXAS RED SAUCE &
CAROLINA MUSTARD).The sauce made it more better.The red sauce
was BLAH.I never had mustard sauce with chicken before.But I have to
say, it was pretty good.I also ordered the St. Louis Style Smoked
Pork Ribs Plate $18.95 (half a slab/4 bones)over priced. I like 
the smoke on the ribs,but they were salty&fatty.The sauce helped a bit
on the ribs.Now the sides.Nothing to write home about.The mac & cheese
was BLAH.The cornbread was good.The potlikker greens were to
sweet.I mixed them with the cornbread and put some apple cider
vinegar on it,and it help cut out some of the sweetness.The potatoe
salad was  ok.I won't order from here again. but I
will use GRUBHUB AGAIN!

P.S I can get better bbq in my hometown, CLEVELAND OHIO.
       Sorry San Francisco.But you haven't got it right yet.But
       I'll keep looking.Peace out.
        

SIDE ORDERS SIZE.A LITTLE LESS THEN HALF A PINT.

PHOTOS JOHN S. PAGE 4 ON YELP
author: John S.

description:
I had the pork rib plate with a side of baked beans and Mac and cheese and the ribs were not good. They barely had flavor and I had to use sauce to make it a little better but I would not go back again. Mac and Cheese was just ok and baked beans no good. Corn bread muffin was tasteless. 

The staff seem to be having a good time and atmosphere is fun and great decorations. I come for the food and not for the decor.
author: Nicholas F.

description: Pretty solid bbq. I had the ribs and brisket with a side of Mac n Cheese and Greens. The greens were delicious, tangy and made actually eating green vegetavbles fun. The ribs were very flavorful.
author: Jeffrey G.

description: Food is very good but be careful you can over order very easily. We did and had 2 days of food. The kids loved the ribs and mom loved the fried chicken.
author: Rochelle J.

description: This is seriously good barbecue, but certainly overpriced by a few bucks. I do always enjoy eating here, the food leaves my tummy very satisfied and full, but my wallet feels abused.
author: Dave L.

description: Hands Down the Best BBQ EVER! I got the bbq beef brisket and pulled pork sandwich which was AMAZING! With a side of Mac n cheese which was so cheesy and full of flavor! The staff was very kind and friendly. We went at night so didn't have to wait long the location is very small. Only reason this place isn't getting 5 stars is because they sometimes run out of meat. My boyfriend wanted a burger and they were all out. Other than that best bbq place with a pretty good price range!
author: Deijah W.

description:
Crazy delicious. Ordered the ribs + brisket + corn bread + greens via grubhub. 

Here in 30 mins, food piping hot. Honestly some of the best ribs I've ever had. Molten deliciousness. Brisket was pretty good too. Who knew SF had good bbq.
author: Sarah T.

description: I have to say that I'm not a BBQ person. That being said, it's good here. It's saucy. and Messy.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Should have done this awhile back.  

Been a semi-regular for about 5 years now, because...well, because nothing else I've tried in SF comes close to the BBQ ribs and brisket I was used to before the death of the legendary Flint's in the East Bay.  Ribs ain't quite on the level of Flint's (sorry, Tom...nothing is!), but they're muy flavorful and juicy and head and shoulders above anything else you'll find in San Francisco.  As for the brisket...this might be blasphemy of a sort, but it might just be better than Flint's, especially when you get the juicy ends of the meat with its lip-smacking char.  Oh, yes, and the sauces...always on the side, but to die for:  Texas Red, South Carolina Mustard, and North Carolina Vinegar...and the restaurant's own tongue-searing, tear-inducing, flavorful heat-packing hot sauce--only a couple drops, now!

I pretty much always get a Minnie's Taster of ribs, brisket and Andouille sausage to go (I'm adverse to being an absolute pig in public, which I'm wont to do with this food; besides, everything in the joint goes VERY well the several ice-cold Anchor Steams and shot of Herradura Double Barrel Reposado that generally graces my humble abode...just sayin')...but I love waiting for my order in the restaurant and listening to the delicious blues and rhythm 'n' blues and roots music that pours nonstop from the speakers while I people-watch.  Hey, it's the Lower Haight.  Always a good time.

And that's not even mentioning the hip and happening servers, who always treat me like I've just come home for the holidays--even at my curmudgeonliest.  You'll hear people say the place is pricey...I just wonder, given the quality, compared to what?  Memphis Minnie's is more than just a BBQ joint to me...it's a celebration.

Keep on keepin' on, y'all.
author: Stuart H.

description:
Really disappointed with service last night. I don't know if it has to do with accommodation of online ordering but a walk in order for take out should not take more than 10 to 15 minutes to fulfill... not more than 30, as it did last night.  Even the person who ordered in front of me received their order more than 10 minutes before me.

Food was fine but it was very frustrating to have the online orders obviously prioritized.
author: Adrianne S.

description:
I really wish Yelp would allow me to give half stars because there are so many a times I think they're warranted. Case in point: Memphis Minnie's. I think it fits solidly at a 3.5 stars, so I had the age-long debate in my head on yelp: does that mean I bring it down to a 3 stars or bump it up to a 4 stars. 

I had to go with 3 stars because there wasn't an extra umph that helped bring it to that next level. 

The atmosphere is a standard BBQ place, it's nicely located though parking can be terrible if you don;t have the SF parking god smiling on you that day. You order then sit down and they call your name. 

I have to say, the brisket and fried chicken - SO good!!! The brisket would practically fall apart on my fork and melt in my mouth and I felt like I was in heaven. Then when I switched to the fried chicken, it was perfectly crispy and the meat was not dry at all. Definitely get the mac and cheese as a side as it was really good. The hot sausage was pretty good. If I stopped there, I would have left feeling really good about the food here. Alas, I also got the ribs and they were not that good. Very mediocre, weren't falling off the bone tender and were rather pretty dry. I was actually looking forward to eating some yummy ribs the most so the fact that they were not that yummy was a little disappointing. 

Pro-tip, free onion ring strings if you download the Thanx app on your smartphone. And man, that plate of onion ring strings were massive! We practically got full off of just that! Well worth the minute or two it takes to download the app and add Memphis Minnie's to it.
author: Lena Y.

description:
What is this place...the fucking DMV of BBQ joints?

First off, the food was totally fine. I especially liked their sauces.

But who gives a shit?

Their employees are rude and sarcastic and I will never go back here as a result. I'd go into detail about my experience, but it's pointless because judging by how they respond to feedback they aren't going to change anything.

I hope that at least one person reads this and decides to think twice about going here. 

Go to 4505 meats or Ricky bobby (where we had actually intended to go) instead.

P.s. Maybe don't leave your fucking to-go containers out in the open if you don't want people grabbing them innocently.
author: Ben W.

description:
Call me old fashioned but a slab of animal that has been slow cooked, with a beautiful pink smoke ring along its outside, now that is heaven.

Don't forget about the sides!  Oh the sides are so delightful.  The collard greens and mac and cheese.  Where would we be without these delightful sides?

This place is all about the barbecue sauces.  4 different sauces and lots of different meats.
author: Alex H.

description: I saw the place on TV, nice signage outside. Small place inside but pack on a Friday lunch. I ordered brisket and pork, it was tender and delicious with their 4 different kind of sauce. Their macaroni cheese is awesome! Good onion strings and corn bread. The pecan is the best of its kind. No problem with the food and service, they just have to do a little cleaning of the place and everything else. It could have been 5 star.
author: Noel O.

description:
When you're ready for a heart attack you need to check out Memphis Minnie's.  This place rocks!  The food is delicious and their BBQ flavor is perfection.  Not for the faint hearted dieters out there.

Go and grab some grub.  I recommend the Minnie's Taster which is 3 pieces of meat and 2 sides of your choice. A great deal for just under $20 and depending on how hungry you are it's great to split.
author: Kevin J.

description:
Bomb dot com ! I love southern BBQ and this place satisfied my southern cravings!
Four stars because my Mac and cheese was cold. It was delicious! But it was cold.
I had a pulled chicken sandwich and on the table there were like 4 different sauces. I personally loved the honey and extra hot sauce drizzled over my perfect sandwich. The bread was the perfect crunch and chewy.
I would def come back again
author: Simi J.

description:
In the nineties, I discovered barbecue the first time I ate at Big Nate's in San Francisco. After that, I had barbecue whenever I could, and Nate's was always the standard bearer. I was so bummed when they closed down several years ago. I visited Cat's Head but it wasn't the same. It sufficed though. 

This weekend, while on tour with The Jim Henson Company, I was staying in the lower Haight and, on a whim, decided to see if there were any closer alternatives to Cat's Head. Then I discovered Memphis Minnie's. This place is amazing and I believe I have a new favorite barbecue place in San Francisco. 

I ordered a two meat combo, brisket and pulled pork along with cole slaw and pit beans. The brisket and pulled pork were out of this world. So good.  And the crust on both was the best I've had, and I've eaten a lot of barbecue. The sides were good, the cole slaw was great, really great flavor.   The pitt beans were good too, similar to what I've had before, but still good. 

I love the sauce options that Memphis Minnie's provides too. Instead of being a place that is 'only Texas style' or 'only Carolina style,' Minnie's gives you different style sauces to try and they are all great. My favorites were the Carolina Mustard and the Texas Red. 

For dessert, I had a hard choice between the pecan and sweet potato pie. I went with sweet potato and it was amazing.  I'm eager to go back and try the pecan. 

The staff was nice and seemed to care that you really liked the food. While I was there, two older ladies ordered and then realized that they had ordered the wrong thing. The staff had already begun to prepare their original order, but when the error was found, the customer's error mind you, the staff prepared a new plate and boxed up the first plate for the ladies to take with them. Gratis. What place does that? None that I know of. That is service. 

Memphis Minnie's, you have a new fan and next time I'm in town, I'll be stopping in. Hold a piece of pecan pie for me!
author: Grant B.

description:
Freezing in the dining room all the time. = cold BBQ sauce and uncomfortable atmosphere. I hate being cold while eating more than anything. I get that the cooks are behind hot stoves.

Food is good though and they have sake. I've been here 6 times or so. It's always been uncomfortably cold in here.
author: Heber S.

description: Whatever you do stay away from the Pumpkin Pie!!! It's the worst! Like diarrhea in a crust. Now with that said, this place probably has the best BBQ and sweet in SF. So why the 3 star rating? First, the place is just plain Overpriced! The staff... awful! service leaves much to be desired. It's like they feel like they are doing you a favor and you should be honored to eat there.
author: William S.

description: The pork ribs here were the bomb! The pulled pork was ammmmazing! I would definitely return, too bad we live in southern Cali!
author: Lady E.

description: Fantastic fries & all the food is amazing! Clean bathrooms and friendly staff, love it!
author: Brenda B.

description:
Food is very good, with 4 different BBQ sauces to choose from. Beer is cold, and beer glasses are chilled in a small beer-glass-dedicated fridge. Beer selection is not massive, but they have what you'd want with BBQ.

The meats on the sandwiches are not pre-sauced -- you can add as much as you want of 4 sauce varieties. Service on a Saturday (it's always Saturday for us) has always been quick.

This is not the Ritz-Carlton. It's a BBQ joint and for what it is, it's great. I am a fan.

Note: A place like this should always have blues music playing over the muzak system. Always.

Edit: Last time we were there ... blues on the sound system.
author: F. T.

description:
Normally, I try to avoid restaurants on Haight because of the parking situation but we came here on a weeknight and found a spot right across the street, score! I had the Two Way combo which comes with your choice of two meats and two sides. I chose the brisket, pork ribs, mac & cheese and potato salad. I thought both meats were only okay, a bit on the dry side. I love brisket but theirs wasn't as soft and tender as I was hoping. They also had a bunch of different bbq/mustard/spicy sauces which added an interesting kick to it. Mac n cheese was probably the best part of the meal, can't go wrong with mac n cheese.

Seating was a bit hectic because it's self seat only. Once we put in our order at the register, we basically had to make a bee line for the next table that looked like they were wrapping up their meal and awkwardly stand close enough to make it apparent to other customers that the table was claimed and also make it awkward enough for the table eating to encourage them to finish up their meal faster.
author: Queena T.

description:
If you haven't been to Memphis Minnie's before just stand outside and the smells will automatically draw you in.  It's not a fancy, make a reservation type of place but that's also what makes it a great space.

I had read about the brisket so I got that plate and it was delicious.  The meat was perfectly prepared and with corn bread and two sides it was a great all around meal.  As my sides I got the mac and cheese which was awesome and the potato salad which was also very good.

The staff was super friendly and they were out the pecan pie when we were there so they gave us a free beer and some samples of their cookie.

Great relatively cheap food!
author: Blake B.

description: Okay barbecue, I guess as far as SF goes.  You don't really think about bbq in the City with so many outstanding restaurants.  The area is nice and there's lots of other stores and restaurants.
author: Jason G.

description:
Memphis Minnie's is consistently really flippin good.  Brisket is superb and I love the sweet sauce and the legitimately spicy sauce. 
I like the pulled pork and love the smoked sausage.  Excellent fresh cut fries.  This is several times in a row that I've been very satisfied at Minnie's
author: ari b.

description:
It is all about he food.  No frills, no parking, few tables.  Want these things, go somewhere else, more room for me.  

Just in case you are not from the south or your grandmother died when you were 2 and never got to eat this kind of food here are a few suggestions:   

Try a sandwich the first time to get a feel for the place.  The sides are great, just choose a couple.  Then work your way up to the pit smoked plates on your next visit starting with the rib tip plate.  After that you can split a full rib plate or brisket plate with a friend until you are man enough to eat one on your own.  

Don't let the crowd fool you, the tables turn over rather quickly however please observe Minnie's etiquette and only take a seat AFTER you have ordered.
author: D M.

description:
I was in town with my family watching the Charger game at Danny Coyles when we started getting hungry. Memphis Minnie's is a short walk away and the atmosphere is great. The smell of barbecue mixed with tiny pig figurines, checkerboard table cloths, and an all around southern comfort feel had us reminiscent of an old barbecue joint from Texas.  

We asked if they would let us sample anything but the cashier said the only way to sample would be to buy the smallest serving of what we wanted which was priced at 5.99. The brisket is what we love so we ordered some along with a whole lot of sauce and patiently waited for our food. I sat down to notice that there are what appear to be visitors drawings underneath the clear cover protecting the checkerboard table cloths. This made me feel welcome and tempted to contribute a little doodle myself. 

The food did not take very long and they packaged it in a nice little cardboard box for us. We stopped by a liquor store to grab some white bread and were loving life inside Danny Coyles with our barbecue from Memphis Minnies. The brisket was smoked just right and the sauce combined with white bread and tecate beer had me loving life.

Overall, this place is located in a very fun area and can provide a southern getaway for those homesick for some good barbecue.

Pros: 
Quick service
Free refills
Fun and comfortable dining area

Cons:
Parking is sparse
author: Frankie Z.

description:
BBQ in San Francisco...there is the real deal, and then there are the imposters. I've been fooled before, but you'd be a fool not to give Memphis Minnie's a try!

They've gone hog-wild with the décor; literally. It feels out of place in SF, but I love that.

But the meat...oh the yummpy meat! There are so many meat choices we ordered two three-way combos. Highlights were the Rib Tips, Tri-Tip, and St. Louis Style Pork Ribs.

The side dishes were very disappointing, with the corn bread muffin being the only edible thing in the bunch. But that's not a bad thing because it leaves more room for meat!!

So, in summary, this place has got it going on. It's busy as supper-time in the pig-pen, and that can make you wait for the food. But the meats are awesome and well worth your time.

That'll do, Memphis Minnie's. That'll do...
author: Greg S.

description: Real solid bbq - exactly what you'd expect. I ordered a spicy pulled chicken sandwich. The sauces that came with it were tasty. I also had beans and fries on the side. The beans were great - especially after dipping fries in them.
author: Rohan S.

description:
Spectacular bbq.  Although a bit on the pricey side, it is well worth the trip from Cow Hollow.  

I had the Brisket plate and my wife had the pork ribs plate.  Both generous portions of meat and sides. I preferred the brisket over the ribs: the brisket is their best seller.  The mac and cheese was great, the greens were good, and the slaw was ok.  I prefer white slaw, and this was just vinegar.

What sold this place to me was the fact that they have rib ends. You don't find that in too many spots.  Also they make their own sauces.  All pretty sweet.  Even the one that says "Hot" isn't really hot. If I was to make a suggestion I would say make a really hot bbq sauce, but other than that its a good place to get some meat!
author: Jeremy E.

description:
Rib Joint ? Me thinks not-Tuesday 12 noon for lunch  "sorry we are out out of ribs"  May we Recommend a substitute- ?...OK:  In  just under 2 minutes  I received  one expensive Finger size sandwich- served  on a tiny plate- with a Table spoon of   Luke  warm bland beans served in a a thimble size cup: cold white bread bun, and scant serving of Brisket beef  that had refrigerated cold spots in it . It Took them  all of 2 minutes to prepare it, and about the same amount of time to eat it. I won't go back  Cost me $12.
Andrew
author: Andrew C.

description: Famous Daves who?! I think this is the best bbq place in town for sure! The meat was amazing and you have to try their sauces
author: Jesus G.

description:
After several failed attempts of eating here, my girlfriend and I ordered take out. I thought it might jeopardize the quality but everything was still pretty tasty. 

I'd give this place three and half stars, mainly because it just didn't blow my mind after hearing this is people's favorite bbq joint in the city but it wasn't the worst bbq I've had either. 

I ordered the ribs. The rub was really flavorful and the ribs were really meaty. They were a little bit dry but nothing bbq sauce couldn't fix. Overall I was pleased. My girlfriend got the pastrami sandwich, that was the winner of the night. It was one of the best hot sandwiches I've had in a long time- the pastrami was packed full of flavor and there was just the right amount of sauerkraut. I'd go back strictly for that sandwich. We also got a side of mac n' cheese. It was decent, could have been cheesier. Their was a strange sort of sweet flavor that I couldn't put my finger on, but I give it props for being different. We weren't that excited about the dipping sauces. 

Next time I'll definitely stop in for lunch and get the burger.
author: Anthony P.

description:
My work relocated down the street here from the Mission. I'll admit that at first I was pretty bummed about not being able to chomp down on delicious burritos for lunch anymore. But not so bummed now that I've found this place.

I was craving some fries and walked past this place. A group of men stood outside eating some food. I glanced at the menu and couldn't help myself... it smelled so darn good!

The guy behind the counter talked me into trying their pastrami rueben sandwich. He promised it was the best sandwich in the city so I tried it with a side of fries.

That sandwich was tasty. The meat was nice and moist they were generous with the cheese.  The fries were outstanding. They were crisp and spicy. 

My main disappointment ended up with really thin watery bbq sauce, however, it was spicy (good).

I'm interested to try their mac and cheese and cornbread.  I also noticed that they had a fried peach pie. Yum?

We'll see!
author: Vanessa F.

description:
The man, Will was spot on for the recommendations.  Service was attentive.  Another gentleman was clearing and cleaning the table as soon as patrons were finished.  

Now the food - tri-tip melts in your mouth.  All the sides were delicious.  Favorites are slaw, mac & cheese, and corn bread.  I am not a sweet tooth person but after trying the pecan pie...  I could easily eat the entire slice.  Crust was flaky & light with the yummy filling; was a perfect balance.
author: Anna C.

description:
Great quick dinner by myself on a rainy Friday night after a long day of work.

Beef brisket sandwich and potato salad. Perfect size - told the lady behind the counter I was not super hungry so she got it right.

Really enjoyed the flavor - sauces add some variety but are not necessary.

Like the low like atmosphere of the place. Def worth coming back to when in town/the neighborhood.
author: Marc R.

description:
This is just for the Pastrami Special that is offered on Wednesdays: great stuff! The bread is a bit dry, but that just accentuates the sauce.

Nice people, too, but a small place and tough to find a seat.
author: George T.

description:
So far I've been blessed to have indulged in their St. Louis Style Smoked Pork Ribs, Texas Beef Brisket, Rib Tip Plate and my latest victim happened to be the Santa Maria Tri-Tip Steak Sandwich - So Good! 

Every experience that I've had here at Memphis Minnie's was different but all were positively good. The meats are smoked for hours low and slow and seasoned to perfection. The sauces - Texas Red Sauce, North Carolina Vinegar Sauce, South Carolina Mustard Sauce and my all time favorite the Beelzabob's Breath (stupid hot!). The side dishes - the bomb! I've tried them all... You can eat-in or take it to go and they also cater. And yes for some reason they have imported Sake.

Whenever I think of good barbecue this place always comes to mind you've gotta try it...
author: Gary E.

description:
ehhhhhh.... overrated. 

I ordered the 2-meat combo, which came with 2 sides and corn bread. My meat choices: brisket and pork ribs. the ribs were dry and didn't fall off the bone too easily. brisket... burnt and super dry. for sides, I chose seasoned fries and mac&cheese. seasoned fries were alright, partially because they were also burnt. mac&cheese, I do a way better job at making it. 

Babe chose the andouille sausage and smoked pork. now, these two items were decent. pork was quite tender and the smokey flavor made it even better. andouille sausage was a bit over cooked and lacked a kick.

all in all I was super disappointed. I'd prefer Everett & Jones or Gorilla BBQ any day.
author: Ann T.

description:
My bf and I love BBQ.  We happen to see this place while shopping at Haight Ashbury.  It looked promising so we gave it a try but what a disappointment.  It was literally the worse BBQ we've ever tasted....it was so bad we didn't feel like eating any for weeks and we still haven't eaten any since.  The experience has totally destroyed my appetite for BBQ.....hope it won't last any longer as I do love it like Baby Blues on Mission and Lombardi's in Petaluma.

The meats were served cold, tasteless like days old and not a hint that they were even exposed to some smoke.  The beans were bad, corn bread dry and their variety of sauces were all runny/watery.....great BBQ sauces are supposed to be thick enough to "attach" to the meat.  Oh yea the sauces didn't taste good at all.   

Anyone who says this is good BBQ has truly not been around to know how great a real BBQ can be.  We'll never go back.  It was definitely an unappetizing experience and a waste of money.  Warning:  Very bad!!!
author: MiniTess D.

description:
The chicken here is really good, but everything else is less than impressive, and it's pretty pricey considering the small serving sizes.
I haven't yet had exceptional bbq in the bay area, but I don't think it's worth going back.
author: Cami J.

description: I wanted to love this place so much more and maybe I need to pick something different next time, but the brisket was just ok. I did like the tangy sauces on the table. The mac and cheese was bland. The service is friendly and it's clean, so this is definitely a good spot for some quick grub. Oh! and I did enjoy the banana pudding.
author: Liz L.

description:
I was really disappointed after trying Memphis Minnie's. 

Because of my deep rooted love for BBQ, I was excited to meet another potential candidate worthy of going on my personal BBQ hit list.  I even put on my best pair of eating pants in preparation.

Even though a plus for Memphis is that there is actually a restaurant where you can sit down and eat (versus other places like Gorilla BBQ and Smokin' Warehouse that don't have seating), the food was just so subpar that I don't think I will go back.

The brisket was okay but a bit dry and made BBQ sauce a must.  The mac n' cheese was also just okay and it came out a bit cold.  Collard greens were yuck and mush and the cornbread did not meet expectations.

Sorry Memphis Minnie's, maybe some other not-so-crazy about BBQ foodies will come your way and appreciate you for your "cool" interior and fancy sauces but I am not one of them.  This is where I could slip in the line "it's me, not you"... but no, it's really you.
author: Gloria C.

description:
I've lived within a couple of blocks of Memphis Minnie's for 1.5 years since moving here from the South.  I've avoided this place intentionally because deep down, I knew I'd be disappointed.  Now, I'm not a BBQ connoisseur, but I've had some of the country's best BBQ, so I know what I like/what's good.  However, watching the Braves-Giants game last night made me nostalgic for something reminiscent of the South and I couldn't hold off any longer.

I placed an order for their "Southern Star" sandwich with a side of mac n' cheese.  First, they should be banned from using the word southern in connection with anything on their menu.  The meat was completely dry; it was so leathery (that's what he said).  They included two sauces with the meal: a "red sauce" and a "mustard sauce" is how they were described to me.  The "red sauce" tasted like a tamarind chutney.  It was terrible.  Tamarind flavors should only appear in Thai and Indian cooking.  The mustard sauce tasted like diluted Grey Poupon.  I thought "well at least I have mac n' cheese, right?" Wrong.  The mac n' cheese was dry and tasteless.  

At least the staff was nice and friendly.  I wanted to like Memphis Minnie's, but I knew it never stood a chance.  If this is the "best BBQ in the Bay Area" as cited in some reviews, then I'm done with BBQ in SF.
author: Ravi R.

description: Best BBQ in the City! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Pictures don't lie!
author: Alex W.

description: This place is amazing I try to come when it's open also try the sweet tea people here have a great hospitality
author: Mel D.

description: Good ribs, very nice toppings and sides. I'd suggest you to go early in the evening and ask for a well cooked meat dish. They close the kitchen at 9.30 circa. Some friends told me they raised the prices and effectively I spent a not-really-fair 30 dollars for ribs, two sides and a beer, which is more you could think for a bbq place. The place is very nice and colorful and the staff is ready and kind. Not an everyday place.
author: Florentin H.

description:
positive:
good food
nice people who work there
tasty choices and lots of it

cons:
table seems wobbly even though it's an easy fix
author: Mark D.

description:
Memphis Minis has great barbecue. I love that they play blues and have a down-home feel!

Would give them five stars for their barbecued meats, but this review is solely on their burger.  

The Minnie's Burger is wonderful with the exception of one thing... the bun is way, way too chewy and almost always when you try to chew into it, all the meat squishes out, and you haven't even bitten through the bun. Attempting to eat the bun for their burgers and chicken sandwiches actually makes your jaw sore and stiff after an attempt. There's got to be tons of different hamburger buns that they could use instead They also have no condiments other then cheese and grilled onions. The burger would be top notch if they offered a bun that you could actually eat as well as lettuce and tomato etc.

But I still go there and just eat the meat out of the bun because it is really flavorful and melts in your mouth!  They also have a kick ass barbecue sauce.
author: Paris S.

description:
Memphis Minne catered our wedding in Guerneville for about 100 people; it was an outside in a meadow under a tent arrangement.
Brisket, ribs, mac & cheese, greens, potato salad, cornbread: absolutely fabulous!
Everyone loved the food - a huge success.
Super nice people to work with
Thanks!!
author: Nigel J.

description:
First of all, the food is way overpriced for good BBQ. I might be biased since I've had some of the best BBQ in Texas. $16 for a plate doesn't seem reasonable. For the delicious food and sauces I devoured, I think $10 would be more fair.

I like how the place wasn't that crowded and the food comes out relatively quick if you're not getting a sandwich.

Get an order of the mac and cheese and some ribs.
I'm not the biggest fan of brisket but they're supposedly known for it.
The fries weren't that good.

I probably wouldn't come back again.
author: Marlon T.

description:
I love everything about this place!! 

The barbecue is spot on and delicious everytime!

The meats are top quality and exactly what you want when you are looking for good barbecue. But for me barbecue isnt complete without the sides, and oh do they not disappoint!  Every side they have is perfect truely perfect in my eyes!

All in all if you are looking for barbecue in the city you owe it to yourself to come here and treat yourself!
author: Trevor D.

description:
Awesome barbecue food!  
Best for 'DRY' BBQ fans; not for wet ribs.
Ribs are good, but other items make this place special.

Memphis Minnie's has steadily become my favorite restaurant in San Francisco, which is kind of interesting, considering a large number of other quality restaurants in the area.  While I love all the other restaurants, I end up going to Memphis Minnie's more than any other place, credit to their quality food and fairly reasonable prices.  I've had BBQ at much cheaper prices, but cheaper alternatives do not come close to the level of Memphis Minnie's.  They really take their food seriously, and you could see that people here are serious about their work.  While the restaurant's name suggests they serve Memphis style barbecue, their menu consists of Texas and St. Louis style items.  

Ever since Minnie's became one of my favorite restaurants, I decided to made an effort to try everything on their menu, a goal I still haven't reached, but coming very close.  Note that not all items are available all the time.  ALL their dishes are good, but here is the ranking of my favorite items:

1. Pastrami Sandwich (only available on Wednesdays) ($9)
2. Memphis Sweet-Smoked Pork ($12)
3. Texas Beef Brisket ($14)
4. The Minnie's Burger ($8)
5. Texas Big Beef Ribs ($14)
6. St. Louis Style Smoked Pork Ribs ($14)
7. Tri tip steak ($14)
8. Rib tips ($9)
9. Smoked Sausages ($12)
10. Smoked Turkey Breast (may need to go on Fri/Sat/Sun) ($14) 
11. Smoked Chicken Plate ($12)

Sides:
1. Tart 'n Tangy Slaw
2. Hand cut fries
3. Mac & Cheese
4. Beans
5. Sweet potatoes
6. Potato salad
7. Greens

I recommend ordering their two-way ($15) or three-way ($17) to try a variety of their dishes.

I first tried this place after it was featured in the show "Check Please --- Bay Area." (you can watch all their episodes online http://www.kqed.org/weblog/food/2006/09/check-please-bay-area-season-2-episode.jsp)  

SERVICE:  When I went around 7:00 PM on a Saturday night, the place was packed.  Seats are on first to order basis, which is fair.  I was impressed with their service in that the cashier kept track of when I got my seats and signaled to the cook to prepare the food; avoiding the food to cool down while the I still didn't have seats.

SYSTEM:  This is one of those 'order, pay, and pickup your own food when they call your name' kind of place.  As you enter, cooking area is to the left and tables against the wall on the right.  Form a line along the left side along the kitchen counter where you could see the menu on the wall.  The guy taking the order was nice and informative and wasn't disturbed when I was asking questions.  He informed me that pork ribs, which I thought would be the thing to eat there, was actually the third most popular item on the menu.  People come here to eat Texas Beef Briskets (smoked 18 hours), followed by Texas beef ribs.  Pay immediately after ordering, get your drinks, and find a table.  The cook will call your name when the food is ready.

FOOD:  I really loved their pastrami sandwich.  It's seasoned perfectly, so you don't need to slap on extra mustard.  It's a bit different than NYC style pastrami, but Minnie's makes it excellent in their own way.  I wish they offered it everyday, instead of just on Wednesdays.  Beef brisket, which was not tough at all, had a very tasty smoked taste even without any sauce.  All their food comes without sauce with three types of home made sauces available for use on the table.  The French fries were also very nice.  Cole slaw wasn't smothered in mayo and had this sweet vinegar taste.  

TIP:  I saw the cook preparing to smoke their signature dishes, sweet pork and beef brisket, around 7 pm.  She told me they smoke it until 11 am next day and its best after resting it for about 2 hours.  Which means you might be able to eat their brisket at their peak around 1pm.  

BURGER: You might wonder why someone would order a burger when their smoked items are so good, but frequent diners at Minnie's know that their burger could be the best burger in the city.  Don't look for lettuce, tomatoes, avocado, pickles, or mayo; they want you to enjoy the taste of their hand ground meat grilled to perfection.  Crispy charred outside, juicy inside, needs nothing more than grilled onions and cheese.  You could add ketchup or BBQ sauce, but you might want to first take a bite and notice existent flavors.  Toasted baguette keeps the juice inside and makes it a perfect bun for this kind of burger.  

SUMMARY:  You can keep it under $10/person if you go with sandwiches or go with their platters which are around $14 + tax and drinks.  This may seem a bit on high side for lunch at a non-full service restaurant, but it's actually a good deal when you consider the quality of food you are getting.  For dinner, it's certainly a bargain.
author: トモ T.

description: Don't waste your money on this place, you will be mad if you do.  Simply put this place just does not have good bbq; their meats are dry and not properly seasoned, their coleslaw is a cup of vinegar and a little cabbage in it and corn bread seemed reheated as it was super dry and not moist at all.  I really wanted to like this place based on what seemed like a good menu but was sadly disappointed.
author: Brooke K.

description:
OK, so just before you go to Memphis Minnie's the next time, I want you to play this video first...
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZaxLoRIs4nQ&feature=related
...yes, this is who you're eating. Piglet. The pan-sexual, pre-pubescent, porcine pipsqueak in the pink polyester pullover. With the Carpenters singing their greatest hits in the background. Of course, this is not the only cute piece of pork to be found, as they seem to have all sorts of Piglet-like paraphernalia here.

But that's not why you'd come here. You know it's the ribs, and like everyone else, I went for the $13.95 St. Louis Style Smoked Pork Ribs plate with the two sides. They were good, not great. I don't know what those three on "Check Please, Bay Area" were smoking, but I don't think it was the ribs. You get about five, and the meat pulls off the bone like buttah, for sure. I just thought the meat itself - though tasty with the South Carolina honey-mustard sauce - was a bit dried out.

Minnie's Macaroni and Cheese was good, stick-to-the-ribs (literally) stuff. It tastes like it's been mixed with some of the honey-mustard sauce, which was a nice, tangy surprise. The only problem was that I just had one of the best mac & cheeses ever at the Brown Sugar Kitchen two days earlier. The Potlikker Greens, however, were a complete miss...way too much vinegar made them virtually inedible.

The rib joint options are pretty paltry in this excessively vegan-head city, so one can't afford to be too choosy. There's Lilly's...and Nate's...and why the hell did McDonald's stop making the McRib Sandwich? I give Memphis Minnie's a passing grade, but I definitely need to do more shopping.

FOOD - 3 stars...good ribs, but dammit, not great...with mixed sides
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...funky with cartoon piggies everywhere to make you aware how cute the animal was before being slaughtered to serve your insatiable needs
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...rather jaded, ahhh...the Haight
TOTAL - 3 stars...passing grades for a post-mortem Piglet....R.I.P.
author: Ed U.

description:
Decided to show our son where we lived 20 years ago on Steiner St. We saw Memphis Minnie's and found parking in front so we went in. Smelled the wonderful BBQ and ordered a lot of food.
The food was delicious and we had so much food left that we were deciding who was getting what tomorrow in the car on the way home.
Prices were very reasonable for BBQ in the city, and I have to admit it was some of the best BBQ we've had in SF.
The staff was very nice and the busboys were extra helpful giving us some extra sauce for the leftovers.
Will go again when we want some good BBQ.
Also, loved the "no sitting until you order" rule.
author: Gilda W.

description: I don't know what I'd do without Memphis Minnie's. Always great meats and even better sauces, and the prices/portions are much more reasonable than that "hip" new BBQ on Divisadero.
author: Jack J.

description:
Worst. Ribs. Ever.

Every time I eat here I swear I'll never go back but there's no other BBQ nearby. This last order of ribs had not one juicy bite. It was all bony, gristly or just rock hard pork. Either the quality of meat was poor or they were way overcooked. So unsatisfying. 

Same story with everything else i've ever ordered - either overcooked or bad cuts of meat. Plus it's all way overpriced.

And the worst part is they are BBQ snobs. For a cuisine with such friendly, down to earth roots, these people are incredibly arrogant.
author: Mark K.

description:
Confession: I had a THREE-WAY this weekend...and I loved it.

A three-way platter from Memphis Minnie's that is :)

Let me preface this by saying that over the past decade, I've consumed so much of my father-in-law's delectable soul food cooking that I was frequently disappointed at most soul food joints I tried. Only Oakland's famous Everett & Jones could be considered a worthy competitor. But now, I consider Memphis Minnie's a strong 2nd-place contender.

As we waited for our food, we admired past customers' pig drawings, sketched onto napkins and placed under the glass table covers. Sketches varied from a Marilyn Monroe Miss Piggy to pigs smoking weed. But this IS the Haight, so I suppose I'd be concerned if there wasn't at least ONE pot-related drawing. Before I could attempt to sketch my own, our food was ready.

My husband and I split a three-way:

- Tri tip: I'm on the fence with this one. It was soft, but not juicy. Had they let the meat marinate in the juices and served it straight up, it would have been perfect.

- Ribs: Amazeballs. Soft and fell apart in my mouth. I tasted a hint of brown sugar.

- BBQ chicken: This was right on. The skin (which had rubbed-in spices) had a bit of crispiness to it, but the chicken inside remained juicy and tender. 

- Sides: Mac n cheese was creamy and full of flavor. The breadcrumbs added a nice texure. Potato salad was cool and had just the right amount of mayo. 

- I washed it all down with their refreshing sweet tea.

Total bill: $34

They also serve beer, wine and sake in the event you'd like to get wasted on three different types of alcohol.

But that's not it. We faced the ultimate Man vs. Food challenge by devouring not one, but TWO amazingly delectable desserts: their creamy banana pudding and sweet potato pie, both of which were worthy of a return trip on their own. 

And in case you're wondering, (wo)Man won this food challenge.
author: Mariela D.

description:
Came back on the 26th of September. Nothing better than consistency. I was going to order something different than my previous visit but just couldn't pass up what I had last time, YUM.
Will be back in November and promised myself to  try some of the other choices. And will also remember to order a few things to go. Good job, and here's the 5th star.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Holy BBQ sauce!  Try them all, they are awesome!  I dumped em all over my ribs...and my briskets and corn breads and my face.  'Naner puddin with Nilla wafer?  Yes pleeeeease.  Best BBQ place I know of, and I've been to a couple.

Don't take up a whole table if you're by yourself, you'll get yelled at...and rightfully so.
author: Chris R.

description: Yum! Have had this place twice at events and they never disappoint. Beef brisket was better than anyplace outside of Texas. Smokey falling apart deliciousness and it was not dry. Their tart n tangy slaw was so good. I'm a fan of slightly sweet and tangy so of course I loved it. Staff is friendly and the bbq is good!
author: Jennifer F.

description:
Let me preface this review with saying I have been on a hunt for decent BBQ in the Bay Area, not just my current residence of SF, but previously in the East Bay. After 9 years in the southern US on a diet steady of excellent BBQ I was about to give up hope. I stopped into Memphis Minnie's this afternoon, and I'm already planning my return. Initial impression, unassuming order at the counter type set up. No servers, no fancy vibe trying to distract from the food, this has classic hole in the wall presence; and I like it. I guess just this week they did away with combo plates/platters and the que and sides are  a-la cart. You order by 1/4, 1/2 or 1lb weights, with sides coming in small/med/large. I was very impressed to see rib tips as an option, cheap ends of pork that for BBQ fans offers great smokey chewy nuggets of meat. I went with 1/4lb of them, and 1/4lb of smoked pulled pork. They have a very extensive offering of meats, and a very comprehensive offering of sides, I went with slaw and beans (as staples of trying a new BBQ place I go with those) My name was called a few minutes later and plate of my food resting on the raised kitchen pass-through. I could tell almost immediately this was real BBQ, the rib tips with a bright pink smoke ring and the pork in beautiful clumps of meat. On the table are 4 sauces, South Carolina Mustard, Memphis, North Carolina vinegar and a super hot which is a more vinegar heavy version of the memphis. I tried a teaspoon of each, and not a single one wasn't good (which makes things tough, because which do I use??) I started with SC and started eating the rib tips by hand, it only took 2 bites to know I had found a place that can smoke meat. Tom told me they use mostly white oak and everything is pure smoke no outside heat source.... real BBQ! Pork was a little shy on smoke/bark, but I'm weird that I like the bark, most just want the moist strands of meat. The pork was the perfect dichotomy of moist/dry/flaky/clumpy..... a blend of the super hot and Memphis sauce was a nice addition. Beans..... perfectly cooked, not mushy, perfectly toothy with great smokey sweetness. Slaw was sweet vinegar based with bell pepper added. It was something different, something special and unique (which I applaud) Prices are very decent, I left feeling/looking 6 months pregnant (which is STUFFED) for $16.50+tip. They have sweet tea, that tastes like sweet tea (BTW) 

Wrapping up this lengthy review: I have found my spot. I will be a frequent returner. This is authentic smoked BBQ, unpretentiously served and all house made sauces are pretty awesome. I wonder if I can start a tab!?!? This spot, is a bad news for a diet.
author: Adam S.

description: Ribs/meat great but confusion about my order. And then they were not willing to help make things right. If you order take away.... triple check everything !!! Came away not happy at all...
author: James C.

description: AMAZING!!!  I ate every crumb off my plate.  Tasted like I had returned to the south.
author: Cassie G.

description:
I'm a chicken and fish kinda girl but I will break my habits for their pork! Last time I was there I got pulled pork and chicken with cornbread and Mac and cheese. My eyes were a little bigger than my stomach...ok a lot bigger. But it was so worth it to get a lot and try a little of everything. 
They also have like 6 different BBQ sauces on the tables. My favorite was this vinegary, sour, spicy one. I'm not much into the sweet sauces but they were pretty good too. 

Another huge plus to this place...you can bring your own booze in with you to have while you eat. We brought a six pack from home.

Great place!
author: Lizzie D.

description:
Meat is life. 

Therefore, Memphis Minnie good. 

[Seriously though - their pastrami sandwich which they only offer once a week changed my life. It was damn good. It was pricey at $10 but definitely worth it.]
author: Carlos A.

description: Very just ok. It has the right vibe and the people are nice, but the food is not great. I got a pork and chicken combo. The pork was cold and bland, and the chicken was cold and dry. Good beans and slaw though. Seems like would be awesome if you're drunk.
author: R H.

description:
I've had some pretty amazing BBQ in the south, and this place doesn't fully compare. Some dishes were pretty close. I liked the mac n cheese a lot. Their corn bread muffins were awesome! The "spicy" chicken sandwich was anything but spicy and a little bland. Rib appetizer was ok, maybe a bit on the dry side. I also really liked their banana pudding, although it wasn't as good as my grandma's. 

I'd rate this place a 3.5. And I will be back to try it again.
author: Jared T.

description: Good Lord do they give you a boatload of food!  We should have ordered one entree and shared it, that would have sufficed! Good schtuff with a variety of sauces to choose from
author: Ottis M.

description:
They do the real deal BBQ and make the best corn bread ever! Okay I admit I like cornbread and this place makes it good.  The atmosphere is country diner with your standard barbecue fare: ribs, chicken, sliced beef, and hot links. Basically, anything you order is going to be awesome yet the price comes with awesomeness. 

This place hits the spot when you crave BBQ and can't do it yourself. Beggars can't be choosers.
author: Patricia P.

description:
Good to see some BBQ in SF. I had the brisket sandwich with a side of mac n cheese and cornbread. Also we ordered a pitcher of Anchor Steam....not bad at all!  The brisket was very good and so was the pulled pork.  My favorite aspect was the sauces that are available at the table, so if you like sweet, tangy, mustard or all of them, you can add them to the sandwich!

The North Carolina and South Carolina sauces are awesome. The cornbread is also good. 

I will definitely come back!
author: Derek S.

description: I ate here last week with friends visiting SF and personally had the brisket, cornbread and potato salad. The brisket was excellent!
author: Semaj N.

description:
Trying to find BBQ near the peninsula is harder then I thought. Spent almost $40 bucks for two fountain drinks, an BBQ sandwich and a tri tip plate. Now, if it's finger licking good, I'm cool with spending that kind of money for it, but seriously for coming all the way down the lower Haight and meter parking, it wasn't worth the drive. Here's what would have made our visit here worth it.

-Bigger sides. For $17.95 got a few pieces of trip tip, a small corn muffin and two sides that were so so tiny... I was like, that's it? Mine that ALL THE FOOD WAS DELICIOUS. ESPECIALLY THE MAC & CHEESE. But for that price for portion size, it just wasn't worth it. We're talking like less then half a cup. For real. :/

-Juicier and more favor on the tri tip please. : ) Maybe I was a vampire in another life but I like my tri tip a little on the bloody side. The sandwich my husband had was much better then my plate.

Great vibe and really chill staff there, but it just wasn't worth the drive for the price.
author: Marissa J.

description: best pastrami sandwich ever. Every wednesday! be there or be square!
author: Eugene L.

description: Nothing really special about this place. Although, when you have a BBQ craving it does the work. I rather go to Hard Knox in outer Richmond. Oh and parking is terrible in this area
author: Jan R.

description:
Hubby craving fried chicken.  We were supposed to try Auntie April but never made it.  While driving around in Pacific Heights, somehow I thought of Memphis Minnie's corn bread muffin so we headed over.  I was supposed to just pick a couple to go but what do I see when I walked in?  The day's special: Southern Smoked Fried Chicken!  What?!?  I rushed back to the car and told hubby...we found a space and walked back to have a meal.

$12.75 - you get 4 delicious pieces of fried chicken - 2 pieces of thighs, 1 drumstick and 1 wing piece with a cornbread muffin, 2 sides of your choice - we picked mac & cheese and their delicious tangy slaw.  We added one additional muffin ($1) and hubby had an Anchor Steam ($4.50).

It's great sitting there to enjoy your food so you can soak up your tasty treats with the variuos sauces.
author: Gloria H.

description:
Found myself on Haight St. attending a gala reception (kinda a funny to say so given the nature of this 'hood, and the flora and fauna that occupy this area.... ), which I thought the event would have food, but no food. Hungry, scanning the street ... there is a BBQ Joint... bright red with colorful lettering "Memphis Minnies Bar- B - Que Joint". You just can't miss it. 

http://maps.google.com/maps?q=578+Haight+Street,+San+Francisco,+CA&layer=c&sll=37.771974,-122.431691&cbp=13,32.6,,0,0&cbll=37.771957,-122.431705&hl=en&sspn=0.006295,0.006295&ie=UTF8&hq=&hnear=578+Haight+St,+San+Francisco,+California+94117&ll=37.77197,-122.431576&spn=0.006632,0.016512&z=17&panoid=XAhC32h4KKKGOSXcMW_cUQ

Liked it. 

At our table:  ribs ( a little too much fat ) very tasty, the fried chicken w/ mac n cheese, sweet potatoes ... great !  Chicken had a fantastic flavor of spice and somehow maybe absorbed some of the bbq smoke flavor. The mac n cheese looked kinda runny, but turned out be be very tasty, I believe like you would find in Memphis. Sweet potatoes coulda used some help with a little spice think boiling a sweet potato, chop into squares, place in bowl, eat (the good news: they have 4 bottles of hot sauce on each table) ... . Found myself lusting after the french fries that landed on the table next to us. 

The owner roaming around making jokes with customers many he knew by sight and then sitting down at one table that were friends /customers....I appreciate the friendly monitoring of the joint.... especially based on the 'hood.  At first I thought he had just wondered in off the street from one of the 100 bars in that area. But after a little while, it was clear he was DA  MAN. I failed to ask him if he is Minnie and if he really likes pigs, but then again I value my teeth. With a "pig " theme, reflected in the signage, and in a the decor and front display of an extensive collection of pigs. Not sure what this is all about, but at least they are consistent with their theme. 

Itsa fun place. Felt a little outa place with my gala attire, but felt welcome. I do love some connection to the past and discovered the name of the joint is paying homage:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Memphis_Minnie
author: Matsuo U.

description: AMAZING food that smells as good as it tastes. I had the Maxi burger and it was just brutal! One of the best I've had in a while. Chili Cheese fries are very big and taste great. I love that this place provides you with enough tasty and greasy food to compensate for all the other places in this city that are super pretentious.
author: Juan B.

description: Food was good, but I had higher expectations.  I'm from Texas and it is difficult to find great BBQ that meets my standards.  Still, I would revisit Memphis Minnie's.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Yeah I hated it. Just plain BBQ, dont get the hype.
 Lived near Santa Maria CA home of the Tri-Tip cut they made good BBQ. 

This might be okay for city folks who have never had the real deal or who do not have a BBQ pit of their own. Personally I would rather go to Chili's.

I also found a bit of bone in my pork sandwich.

"they have good sides" my Vegetarian roomie said... its a BBQ place that means you judge based on the MEAT
author: Trisha V.

description: Beef Ribs in the middle of the day? Good choice! I was impressed how quickly the food came out, and how many options were available. I had the beef rib platter with 4 slightly overlooked beef ribs, some mustard greens, and sweet baked potato. I was a bit overwhelmed by the sweetness of the greens and potato AND cornbread, so it's my own damn fault. I enjoyed the different sauces, but for the ribs I slathered them in the main sauce, with a few squirts of the nc vinegar sauce...pretty good BBQ! The beef ribs were a bit more well done than I would have liked, but I give them an A- because they were really good! If you really need BBQ, then head over ASAP!
author: Ojas V.

description:
We were here 2 years ago, came back again today.  I had the special pork tip plate, with 2 sides (beans & potato salad), cornbread, and sweet tea.

All was very good except the cornbread was inedible - dry, stale, and flavorless. yuck.  As you read through other reviews, you will find MANY complaints about the cornbread.  Also they only have "sweet tea" not plain tea, and it is very sweet (too much so for my taste anyway).  But if you like super-sweet tea, then this is for you.

They are really nice, friendly, and helpful here but, just so you know their rules ( I saw this happen today) :  

#1 don't lean on the upper counter or you'll get scolded

#2 you can't seat yourself or your guests until AFTER you have ordered food.

I know I'm giving 5 stars, despite the cornbread, but that is because it comes with your order, I didn't order it special.  If I had, I'd really subtract some stars.
author: David S.

description:
We had the beef rib -- a little dry but very tasty and the beef brisket sandwich -- generous portion and also a little dry but very tasty.  The sides of tangy slaw and mac and cheese were delicious and satisfying.  The banana pudding was awesome.

The decor in this joint is delightful and quite a collection!
author: Djl D.

description: Just great.  I've been many times and yet to disappoint.  Get the taster and go wild.
author: Darrell N.

description:
I compare BBQ with small places in Georgia, Florida and Kentucky. All are unique, short on cute decor, big on tender flavorful meat. Minnie's is in San Francisco and has succeeded in bringing all that to the West Coast. The place is small, busy, self service, reasonably priced. You arrive, maybe grab a beer and stand, waiting for someone to leave their table so you can swoop in. Order immediately. A huge sign asks you not to sit before ordering. We did all that, and were rewarded with fork tender, moist, flavorful beef brisket and St. Louis ribs, sides of BBQ beans (also tender), delicious greens (hard to do), and cole slaw and potato salad. Delicious cornbread muffins and nice pecan pie. But the meat! Absolutely superb.

This is a great place to enjoy with friends. Not exactly where to take your mother. But do go. Minnie's has brought real BBQ to the city.
author: Doug S.

description:
A bbq place that has bbq sauce so STUPID HOT that you don't just pay for it the next day, but mere hours after you've eaten it?? That in itself deserves all the stars in the world!!!

The restaurant is super casual - you order from the counter, grab a table, wait for your order to be done and you go pick it up. There are several bottles of bbq sauce on each table and they also sell the sauce for you to take home.

We ordered the beef ribs/pork ribs/tri-tip combo with seasoned fries, cornbread and coleslaw. The ribs, though tasty, were a little too dry for me and not falling off the bones but the bbq sauce definitely helped make it more moist. Tri-tip was much better. Maybe it was an off day, so I'll have to go back again to try a second time. What I did love, love, love is their tangy coleslaw! I loved it so much I bought a pint of it to go and we also wanted to try a pint of potato salad.

Customer service was great! The guy who took our order the first time remembered our names when we went back up a second time to order the sides to go. And he was nice enough to charge us only for one of the pints instead of both. It's the little things like that which makes a big difference as to whether we'd come back or not.
author: Jamie C.

description: It's a fun alternative to standard fare in SF.  If you want a lot of tasty meat, this might be your option.
author: James H.

description: Might be my favorite spot in the city. I love the staff that works here, they are so friendly. Located off Haight. The atmosphere is awesome and I love their "saucy red" and "stupid hot" BBQ sauces (both pretty good mixed together as well). The Southern Star sandwich with the combo of chopped brisket and chopped pulled pork is soooo amazing! Well worth the visit if visiting or living in SF.
author: Frank P.

description:
The quest to explore all the different bbq SF restaurants have to offer continues...

We went to Memphis Minnie's because our original plans for Ricky Bobby was foiled because they had no power and had to close for the night. No worries, there were other options around the area and we settled on Memphis Minnie's figuring we can't go wrong with such an establishment right? Wrong! 

In our 3 person party, I split 3 meat combo while my friend had an andouille sausage sando. The St. Louis ribs were dry and tough like jerky (parts were beyond inedible), the sausage was dry, and I don't know what was up with the brisket! I hope it's because we went in an hour before closing because we were quite disappointed with the food that I had to stop eating altogether. After all the recommendations I've heard from others in the past, I was disappointed. Their saving grace was the nice cashier and the different bbq sauces to experiment and choose from.
author: Rachel C.

description:
Point 1) I am from Memphis, and I know good BBQ.  This is NOT good BBQ.  The sandwiches are small, and overpriced.  Prepare to pay $15 for a sandwich and a beer for substandard BBQ.  The mac and cheese is good, but that's about it.  I promise you.

Point 2) I came there with two friends.  We bought two full meals at this place, and my friend brought in a sausage from across the street.  The owner came up to us and instead of kindly asking us to leave (a reasonable move - we would have understood and just left), he proceeded to give us a condescending lecture on "how to run a business" and was very confrontational.  I couldn't tell if he was kidding or not because his unprompted diatribe was so ridiculous.  Not a good "business move," if you ask me.  He just drove away a few local customers.
author: David P.

description:
Beggers can't be choosers but I was thoroughly unimpressed with Memphis Minnie's. I got the pork sandwich with a modest side of mac n' cheese and a Shiner Bock. Ran me about $15-$16 (overpriced). 

The mac n' cheese was good despite the portions. The sandwich on the other hand was only mediocre. The roll was ciabatta bread or something similarly tough. That just doesn't cut it for anyone that's actually from the South.
author: Robbie K.

description: Really good hot sauce. Decent fried chicken. Average mac n' cheese and collared greens.
author: A L.

description:
Our boss went and picked up food for the office. Meeehhhhh... maybe from the time it left to the restaurant to the time it got to us in the financial district the food just got cold and hard? We had ribs and chicken, both were very dry.
the best part about the meal was the potato salad.. YUM!!!!!!! I'd like to try this place sitting at the restaurant one day so i can compare.
author: Penelope V.

description: Delicious mouth watering BBQ. the brisket sandwich was juicy, fresh and well portioned. Chili cheese fries were filled with chunks of beef. Highly recommend
author: Chris G.

description:
First of all, let me just say that THIS IS NOT MEMPHIS BBQ!!!

I am from 20 minutes south of Memphis in Mississippi and have eaten BBQ since, as "The Situation" would say, prehistoric kindergarten!

Corky's, Stateline, Rendevous are all places that should be mimiced for their BBQ. I'm not sure which Memphis the owners are trying to say their BBQ is from but in no way shape or form is it good ole Memphis TENNESSEE!

I didn't even look over the whole menu because I am a pulled pork sandwich girl. I just requested it...like I said, I didn't look over the menu so I'm not sure if it is on there. He let me pick a side, well, he SUGGESTED mac n cheese and I ok'd it.

I ordered a soda...and he pointed to the soda machines. 

"Sweet tea is on the right of the soda," the cashier said.

Wait, what? Did you just say....*the heavens open up, angels are singing* SWEET TEA?!?!?!

I wanted to seriously kiss him. Anyway, ask me why I gave this place 3 stars? Well, you should know. The sweet tea, of course.

Back to the BBQ. The sandwich came out...on some kind of "french" roll? What the HELL? Don't you know that pork sandwiches go on hamburger buns? If you want to name your business after a certain city, at least cook your food the way that they would cook it. Your name should be San Francisco BBQ or French BBQ or Cali BBQ...Idk but NOT Memphis BBQ. It is alwayysssssss served on a hamburger bun. Simple.

The mac n cheese were huge noodles with some cheese melted on it...and I'm hoping I just got a mistake bc I had like crumbs or some shit on mine??? I choked about 6 noodles down...but had to scrap off the crumbs. Seriously, do people really put bread crumbs on their mac n cheese? NOT IN MEMPHIS....

The only reason I will be back is because I'm on Haight and I want sweet tea. Or, at least the latter. Not for the food. It was a waste of $10.
author: Cally L.

description: The best fried chicken I've had at a restaurant EVER! The brisket was awesome. The fried peach pie was heaven! I'll be going back before I leave town as much as possible.
author: Cynthia H.

description: We had the ribs, both pork and beef and briskit,.. it was all yummy and I needed to go for a walk after :)
author: Claudia V.

description:
Walk in here and the smell of BBQ scent is everywhere. A interesting place with lots of piggy memorabilia and hogs perhaps? This was my second stop after coming across the street from a sausage eatery. I got a 2 way combo to go and decided to order the pork ribs and chicken. It came with my choice of season fries and coleslaw. 

Quickly got home and open the box and it smell great and tasted the seasoned fries and thought it was OK, a little soggy, but was a huge order. The pork ribs consist of 3 average size portion and was good on smokey BBQ flavor, but was too dry from over smoking ? Defiantly not moist at all. The smoked chicken was disappointed because it was 1/2 of a small breast and a small wing portion, not what I was expecting for $16.95. Corn muffin was good and coleslaw was ok.  I might go back to give them a try again if I'm in the area again.
author: Wolfy W.

description:
My experience at Memphis Minnie's wasn't so enjoyable, though the food was good. The line was about 15 people long and didn't move quickly. The cashier was answering calls, including to-go orders, and losing her train of thought during the in-person orders. Given the popularity of their table covers were sticky,  

A few people ahead of us in the line, the last sandwich roll had been purchased... at 845pm on Friday, 4/20. Hmmm, I didn't see that coming before heading to the Lower Haight to try their burger and BBQ. Darn. 

If you visit Memphis Minnie's when it isn't too busy, you'll have a decent experience for a fast-casual type of restaurant that cooks a variety of meat/BBQ dishes.
author: Mike H.

description: Hands down some of the most delicious brisket ever. When I come here I usually order the same thing just because it's great. Brisket sandwich with a side of mac and cheese and potato salad. The sauces are great too!
author: Amanda L.

description:
Holy meat galore!

A long-time lover of all things meat, I was really looking forward to a meat feast at Memphis Minnie's. While it certainly hit the spot in the meat category (not only was I still full when I woke up the next morning, I was craving salad... and I am NOT a salad person), it left something to be desired in the taste department. Perhaps I'm just not a big fan of dry rubs...

While I know that a huge part of American BBQ is the sauces, I also feel that great BBQ shouldn't rely on sauces alone. The meat itself should be so well seasoned and marinated that it renders the sauces somewhat unnecessary. This was not the case here. I found myself squirting puddle after puddle of sauces on my plate - not because I thought they were particularly amazing (though the South Caroline mustard and Texas red sauces were pretty good), but because my taste buds were yearning for more flavour.

I shared a Minnie's Taster (3 meats, 2 sides, and a corn muffin) with a friend. We chose the Texas big BEEF RIBS, Memphis sweet SMOKED PORK, their famous Texas beef BRISKET, bbq seasoned FRIES and SWEET POTATOES (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VlNE3m59v836-t3V4ZaOWQ?select=jCvDnrUbN4E6Evg518rsQQ). My favourite was the smoked pork, followed by the tender brisket. The beef ribs were ok and I wonder if I would've liked the pork ribs more. To be honest, all the meats tasted the same to me - that is, they tasted like whatever sauce I doused them with. The only difference was their textures.

I actually enjoyed the sides more than I did the meats. The bbq fries were delicious but extremely greasy; the majority of them were translucent (and soggy) with oil. The sweet potatoes were good, but how can you go wrong with cubed baked sweet potatoes? I also liked the sweet and sour potlikker greens. My favourite dish of the night, hands down, was the amazing MAC & CHEESE (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VlNE3m59v836-t3V4ZaOWQ?select=r977oww6RNTfhdFZrkJa1Q) that we ordered on the side. It was so much better (and cheaper!) than the mac n cheese I had at Wayfare Tavern and Bobo's recently. It was flavourful but not too saucy or rich. I just LOVED it!

The service was also great. They remembered our names and the owner even came by twice to ask us how we're doing!
author: Steph L.

description:
Walk into Memphis Minis BBQ joint and look on the walls before you order and you'll find certificates and degrees from completed BBQ courses. You have to be serious about BBQ to sit through entire courses on the subject, and you can bet your ass that these guys are. 

Unfortunately, I have never consumed the food sober, they are located across the street from my second home, The Toronado, so I get the food to go most of the time and make everyone inside the Toronado hungry when they smell the goodness. 

The best thing on the menu is the Brisket, which I always order by the pound. However, you need to ask what part of the brisket your going to get because sometimes you get a lot of the fat cap. The sauces are mouthwatering, the tangy flavor of the Texas sauce is excellent and brings out the smokey flavor of the meat. The best side is the cornbread because the grainy texture is perfect for scooping up sauce. The mac and cheese noodles are too large and the coleslaw is mayo free so I stay away from those sides. Great place, I need to try it sober one time.
author: bart b.

description: Just moved to SF and this was the first BBQ place I've been to. Now, I LOVE me some ribs. LOVE 'EM. Memphis Minnie's was...good. Seems everyone on here had dry, chewy meat.
