My ribs didn't exactly fall off the bone, but they had some good flavor. The sauces available were ok. The only one I liked was the Red sauce. The cornbread was good, as was the potato salad. Can't say I'll rush back to Minnie's; I think I'd rather search the city for some better places. But if you're on Haight on you have a craving for BBQ, I don't think you'll leave disappointed.
author: Nick F.

description: My husband is a huge bbq fan and had been here before over ten years ago. I really loved the experience, the food was yummy, so were the sauces and the beer was cold. I am looking forward to eating leftover mac n cheese for lunch.
author: Maribel M.

description: My second time here... I Absolutely love their Saturday special- Southern smoked fried chicken...
author: Sreelakshmi S.

description: Really bad service...  Stupid ass chefs keept looking at me and my girlfriend. And when I asked them what's so funny they acted stupid. Fuck that place!! As a San Francisco native knowing a lot of restaurants this is definitely not a restaurant to go to.. I give this place a negative five...
author: Miguel I.

description:
Memphis Minnie's,

You guys lost a loyal customer tonight. 

Not because of the food, but because your customer service fucking sucks. 

I always phone order and even tip when I come in to pick up my food. One thing I do require is extra sauce. I know they style of bbq can leave some of the meat dry and I'm good with that, but I consume a lot of bbq sauce. when I request extra bbq sauce it means I don't want the two you automatically give.

So when the dude with the backwards hat and the beard hands me my food, I ask him "Is there extra sauce in there?" and he says "Ya". I'm inclined to believe him.  Well, thanks for lying to my face, and not thanking me for my business. I will now be telling everyone how I hate Memphis Minnie's with a passion. I almost fainted I'm so pissed.
author: Aaron O.

description: Became a fan back when MM's was in Potrero. Always tasty, very consistent flavors. Just tried the Maxi Burger for the first time, and it's is amazing!
author: J.D. W.

description:
My dad is obsessed with this place.  He came here directly from the hospital once after he had surgery.  I had never been.  He called me the other night telling me he would take me and I needed to be ready in 5 minutes.  Apparently his BBQ was urgent, or something.  

I got BBQ chicken cesar salad, which I realize is TOTALLY not appropriate to order at a BBQ place and the kind of thing they might ask, "What would women or people on a diet like?"  I like BBQ, but I was in the mood for this.  The salad was huge, lightly dressed, with a huge amount of chicken.  I had a corn bread muffin which was salty and buttery and delish.  The sweet potatoes were pretty great too, soft and real sweet.

We went around 7pm on a Wed night.  It was mostly men, which might account for the smell of urine in the bathroom, unclear...

I thought the food and the staff were awesome, but the place was not so clean.  Our table was covered in meat crumbs and grease.  The roll of paper towels at our table was dotted with food.  I know that this is not a formal joint, but people should never notice a mess, even if it's there.  Just sayin..
author: Julia D.

description:
OK. Let me start off by saying I'm from Texas (THE REPUBLIC OF TEXAS) so I know good BBQ when I taste it. I'm always skeptical of places that throw around names like "Texas Roadhouse" or use descriptions like "true southern cooking" etc. 
   
   This joint is the real deal!! Everything is top shelf here. The links, tri-tip,ribs etc - all excellent. The sides like the cornbread muffins, beans and fries are good too. The Mac and Cheese is great. The Texas red sauce is yummy etc etc.  I could go on but you get the point: I always get the sampler platter which is quite frankly A  HITACHI MAGIC WAND FOR YOUR TASTE BUDS.
author: Brian K.

description:
Came for early dinner on Saturday (6pm), and the place was starting to get crowded.

For the 4 of us, we ordered:
1. Memphis Sweet Smoked Pork Sandwich, side of beans
2. Pulled Spicy Chicken Sandwich, side of fries
3. Minnie's Tasters: tri tip, beef brisket, pork ribs, sides Mac & Cheese,  beans; came with Cornbread

We found the food to be a little on the bland side; the pork ribs a bit dry.
Cornbread was good; mac and cheese was ok.
The bbq sauces were, hmm just OK.. 

It was worth a try bec of all the hype and recommendations from my friends.  I probably won't make a special trip just to come here.  I'd go to Everett & Jones instead.
author: Margaret W.

description:
After seeing "Memphis Minnie's" featured on PBS Check Please Bay Area, my hubby and I decided to pay this place a visit. We got there around 6:30pm and the line to order food was out the door. All the tables were packed so we thought it may be better if we order take outs instead. We stood in line nevertheless and went through the menu. That kept us busy while waiting in line. We ordered the following 2 dishes:
(a) Meat Two way combo: St. Louis Pork Ribs and Santa Maria Tri-Tip Steak Plate. It comes with 2 sides and I chose potato salad and potlikker greens
(b) Meat Two way combo: Texas Big beef Ribs and Beef Brisket. 2 sides included Fries and Mac N Cheese

They ran out of all desserts except for the Banana Pudding so we passed.  We wanted to order th Pecan Pie. 

By the time we ordered, the tables emptied so we decided to eat in and got seats right away. Then it was a wait for the food to come out. A couple right in front of us ordered To Go and they waited just as long... so there is really no shorter wait for take out. We got our food after 20 minutes or so. I must say that the food is overrated. The meats are dry and bland. We ended up pouring tons and tons of sauce (they have 3 for you to choose from) on the meats to get some flavors out of it. Quite disappointed. I've had better BBQ... but their business will probably continue to prosper because there is a niche of good ol' Southern soul food in the Bay Area. People tend to always associate old, funky places like these a gem. To me, it's one of those restaurants that I can say, "Been there, Done that." I can now move on.
author: Jannie Q.

description:
I love Memphis Minnie's.  I love the place itself--it's almost as fun to visit as when it was Spaghetti Western back in the day.  And I love that the staff is friendly and solidly down to earth.  They all seem like interesting people.  I never feel out of place there even though I'm not a Lower Haight hipster.

Their brisket is absolutely the best.  On my first visit I was surprised to find that their meats are served unsauced, but now I love being able to try several sauces, and I love being able to eat the brisket on its own as well.  So smoky and tender, with a nice crisp edge, and OMG, yum.  It is so flavorful, it doesn't really need sauce on every bite.

Recently I tried their fried chicken sandwich (Wednesday special) and it was very, very good.  It had three generous pieces of perfect fried chicken inside, topped with their slaw.  The slaw is actually pretty plain, and I loved the crunch and the tang but feel the sandwich would have been better with some mayo inside.  It was good with the vinegar sauce and the mustard sauce, so I kept switching sauces between bites to figure out which I liked better.  Verdict:  A draw.

Their sides are hit-or-miss, for me.  Some I love and some are just OK to me.  You might like different sides than me for different reasons.  One thing I wish they did is put honey and butter out for the cornbread.  That would make a big difference.  I love the bacon brittle for dessert.

I've got to come back and try the pastrami on a Wednesday.
author: Lorelei S.

description: Came here on a Saturday evening around 8. Parking was hard to find as expected. The restaurant was busy but we were able to order quickly and find a table easily. First time here. I really enjoyed the brisket and fried chicken. My fave sauces were (forgive me for not remembering the names) the mustard sauce and the Texas sauce. Tried the fried grits which was good and the pork egg rolls. The Mac and cheese was aright as was the beans and banana pudding. I'd come back again to try the other selections.
author: Angelyn C.

description:
I went here once about three years ago and didn't like it. I couldn't remember why, and this was pre-Yelp so I had no frame of reference. I decided to give it another go.

Then I remembered why I didn't like it. It's not good. Maybe because I go there after work but the ribs tasted like they were reheated from yesterday. I do this with my own ribs at home sometimes and you can definitely tell by the texture. The chicken was super dry. The pork was okay, but again, tasted old.

A lot of people like this place. I was contemplating this and recalled that most of the people there when I was picking up my order appeared to be drunk. Not to begrudge drunkards their drink, but clearly they are in no position to judge BBQ.

Maybe I'll try again in another three years but this is one of the not-so-great BBQ joints in the city.
author: Matt J.

description:
3 for 3 Memphis Minnie's!!! 

Three times I've been here in the past 6 years... this last time as an official resident of "The City" and I love you MM :)

Yes, your sauces are a little runny (I'm used to thicker, richer sauces) and yes, the brisket chili cheese fries were just a tad too salty for my taste (which the manager said they would gladly take my request for less or no seasoning salt next time) but it doesn't matter because overall the food is just delish!

Everytime I've come I've ordered something different and have always been completely satisfied with my meal... and the super-absorbent paper towels :)

The corn muffin is just the right amount of sweet, warm and corn-y. The brisket, when I had it, was NOT too dry or NOT too greasy. The cole slaw is tangy and sweet. The mac & cheese was creamy. The crispy fried onion rings flavorful.The pork meat on the pork sandwich was cooked just right and the roll itelf was soft and warm.

I'd give you 4-stars be it not for the following:

Your cashiers (2 out of the 3 times) were not the friendliest, the picture above the soda fountain with the pigs being carried thru the streets of Vietnam is rather disturbing (they were caged, ouch) and lastly... you don't have ranch dressing!!! How do you not have ranch dressing?? Is ranch just a SoCal thing? I hope not.

Overall, you guys do good work... 

Just please take down the picture of the poor piggies, train your cashiers to be a friendlier, start stocking ranch dressing and I will gladly stop coming here when...

Pigs Fly! ;)
author: Yahra V.

description: Awesome bbq !! I got the Texas BBQ brisket sandwich with beans with pecan pie. Food was up pretty quickly and proprietor or manager of duty was really friendly and eager to make sure eveyone was happy with their order.
author: Scott G.

description:
We ordered delivery tonight. The brisket was excellent, moist on the inside with a crunchy crust. The pork ribs were also very good.

We inadvertently gave the delivery man a $100 bill and a $20 instead of two $20s. He could easily have walked away with an extra $80 tip. Instead he knocked on our door again and asked if we had made a mistake.

Great barbecue, great honesty.
author: Blake G.

description:
Alright the more I eat Minnie's the more I grow to love it. My bf is obsessed with it and a good amount of the food is gluten free. I love that they now do delivery- so that lazy people don't have to hoof it up to lower haight.

My faves: brisket sandwich with greens, brisket meal with greens, pork ribs, and then more brisket. oh yeah the mac is good too :)
author: Skye W.

description:
I don't know who Tom C is but if he is the manager they should discuss customer care and attitude with you. I know what you think you know what happened, but you were not there. I was not rude on the phone and I didn't ask your line cook for my order before it was ready. I tried to joke with the girl that answered the phone and took my order and she obviously did not have a sense of humor, I did arrive early to pick up my order and waited patiently out side for them to finish. I did confront your cook when the sauce I asked for and was told would be there was not. As far as you are concerned I find it suspect that any negative review received at Memphis Minnies does not result in an improvement in service or food but does always get a response from you that the customer is the jerk. Maybe you should look at how your treat your customers and maybe acknowledge there may be issues at your business and then maybe you will be more successful and could possibly expand.

YOUR RESPONSE TO MY CONCERNS ARE INDICATIVE OF MEMPHIS MINNIE'S COMMITMENT TO CUSTOMER SERVICE AND SATISFACTION.

I do believe calling me an "ASS" and telling me to "stay away from your business" is counter productive and inappropriate. If you don't own this business then I think the owner should be aware of how you respond to criticism 

IN REPLAY TO YOUR LAST RESPONSE

I see your highest form of management is insulting customers who have opinions and comments about your business. Maybe you should go back to trade school and see if they have a better diploma than Incompetent Idiot with a Limited Vocabulary. Again I was only trying to make your business aware of a possible issue and you then turn into a blathering fool unable to communicate. Your parents must be proud. Try to improve your business and you wont have these issues.

Did it ever occur to you that maybe your employee's were wrong and didn't tell you the truth.

Not every customer with a complaint or issue an be wrong.
author: David M.

description:
Without a doubt some of the better BBQ I've had in the Bay Area. Service is super friendly for sf! Def your small hole in the wall type bbq joint but hey arent those always the best?  

The tri tip is unbelievably tender and and the smoked chicken only gets better. Yes I did order two meats ha. my cousin ordered the brisket it looks and smelled great. big plus that you can order meat togo by the lb.

Sweet potatoes are a must have for a side!
Also they have a variety of house made bbq sauces ranging from regular to "stupid hott" which are all great to throw on your meat!

Memphis Minnie's I will be back lol
author: Mousa K.

description: The fried chicken was good. Crunch on the chicken was clutch. The potato salad was good. The cornbread was a little dry. The mac n cheese was okay. The sauces were good. You have a variety sauces to mix and match and try. The worst thing at the restaurant was the cashier. She was not welcoming, really rude, and had a real sour attitude. If I could give one tip, it would be to train her on pretending to be nice. At least pretend! Her attitude almost made me say, "forget this place, let's take our business elsewhere." The manager who greeted people and asked how the meal was saved this review from being lower than three stars.
author: J P.

description:
I thought the ribs here were SPECTACULAR. It is pricey, but one plate was enough for my boyfriend and I (we don't have very big stomachs though...). They have a variety of sauces that I have never heard of or tried before. It was fun finding our favorites... The theme is great, the atmosphere was awesome (complete with big rolls of paper towels). They bush your tables for you. Order before you sit down. Corn bread was EXCELLENT, as were the fries! We wish we would've tried the onion rings.

Highly recommended! It is certainly at least worth TRYING and then deciding for yourself.
author: Joel A.

description:
As others have noted, the sides are overpriced.
The brisket sandwich I had was good and the gal at the counter was very friendly.
author: Bay G.

description:
Experienced Memphis Minnie's BBQ at our work place and decided to try their food anonymously before ordering their food for our birthday and 49er party. 

The brisket, sweet pulled pork and potlikker greens were good. After sampling most of their menu, we ordered brisket, sweet pulled pork, potlikker greens, mac 'n cheese, cole slaw and corn muffins for 24 people.

We were assured by Matt that the food will arrive 5 minutes early to set up their food for an extra $50 charge. 

They arrived 40 minutes late! No telephone call prior to late arrival by Memphis Minnie. 

Setting up the food while our guests were arriving was embarrassing and not impressive.

Sorry!
author: Ric L.

description:
OK, now that I've figured out the ordering process (not that it's rocket science or anything), Memphis Minnie's is really growing on me.

Every Sunday, I catch NFL action at Danny Coyles there on Haight street, and since DCs doesn't serve food, halftime is all about scavenging for grub in the immediate proximity. Rosemunde takes friggin' forever and the Mexican food place right next door is absolutely atrocious... so a slow-cooked BBQ sandwich is typically the cream that rises to the top.

If you like meaty sandwiches, I highly recommend the spicy pulled chicken. On the gringo spice scale, I'd give it a 6 out of 10, which is just about the right heat to get a kick in yer tonsils, but not enough to break out in a sweat. Throw some of that homemade mustard sauce on top, and we have ourselves a real barn burner of a meal!

Best of all, the service is lighting quick. Very good for grabbing food to go with only 15 minutes to spare.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
I took my Mom here on Mother's day and met the owner.  Such a nice guy!  He came out and gave my Mom's dog some brisket while we waited.
Food was quite tasty.  I'll gladly come back here!
author: Matt V.

description:
BBQ and beer

Q: So I take it you like BBQ and B?
A: If by "B" you mean "beer" then "yes" I "do" like them.

Q: Can you "stop" using " "? 
A: Only if you do.

Q: Fair. So what prompted a visit here? 
A: Some friends and a Sunday afternoon to kill.

Q: So you doused yourselves in sauce and got sauced?
A: Not exactly, but sure. We had ribs and beer. 

Q: Did you enjoy yourselves?
A: We didn't "not" enjoy ourselves.

Q: There you go with the " " again. Would you go back?
A: Hell yes! If not for some beer, definitely the ribs. 

Q: Cool.
A: That's not a question.
author: Tony E.

description: Beef Brisket and the corn bread is a must. Sauces are just ok. Sandwiches are your best deal ! I will be back! The meats are smoked to perfection with the perfect amount of juiciness.
author: Roman J.

description:
After a night of running around the wild streets of San Francisco, wandering from bar to bar, it was time to soak up some of the booze with some delicious southern style BBQ!
The place was covered with t-shirts from other BBQ restaurants from around the states, which makes for an interesting read while in an altered state of mind.
I devoured the BBQ Pork sandwich, which really hit the spot. I used their hot sauce which, when combined with the sweet BBQ, makes for some amazing bursts of flavor.
Next time I'm taking on the ribs!
Great for a late night 4th meal or a satisfying lunch.
author: Noel J.

description: Be sure to get the Chili Cheese fries, and smother it in the Texas sauce! Even without cheese it's fantastic.
author: Michael T.

description: The food was okay ive had better barbecue and They skimp a little on the portions. I ordered the tri tip sandwich and sweet potatoes. The sweet potatoes were diced into very small cubes into a little sauce container. For two sandwiches and drinks we spent $35... Not worth coming back.
author: Ariel R.

description:
I always order ribs, brisket and links as a measure of a good BBQ joint, and Minnie's seemed promising. I was in the area on an errand and drove by the restaurant, so decided to Yelp it. Good reviews, so I stopped in.

I ordered my usual, with Mac n Cheese based on reviews and Potlicker Greens cuz I love my greens, n got my order to go. It came with their slightly sweet BBQ sauce as well as their tangy mustard sauce.

Not sure if I caught them on a bad day, but the food was very average. Good BBQ is tasty when smothered in the sauce, but Great BBQ can stand on its own without the sauce. I have to say neither the sauce or the meat really appealed to me. The brisket was definitely smoky, but that was it. The ribs were dry and a bit bland.

The Mac n Cheese was kinda pasty, and the greens were pickled, not what I expected. I took one bite of the corn bread and was done, it was dry and brittle. The mustard based sauce was good and different, but I didn't care for their BBQ sauce at all.

It might warrant a second try if I'm ever down that way, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat there again.
author: John R.

description: A great and really convenient location & nice people, but the food is meh. Dry, overcooked rib tips. Dry, hard cornbread. Flavorless mac n cheese. Coleslaw was okay. I drenched everything in sauce and still was underwhelmed. Solid beer selection for what it is though! Meat plates are around $20. BUT I WOULD KEEP TRYING.
author: Sonya Z.

description:
came in here on a cold nigt and was dismayed to find it was cold inside too. But it smelled good. 
ordered brisket and collard grees and slaw...everything was pretty damn delicious but sadly after a long-ish wait to get our food, the meat was lukewarm. ??? 

I really wanted some piping hot food and everything was almost room temperature...delicious but off-putting in temperature.

I love the bottles of sauce on the tables...and used them generously as the brisket was just on the verge of being too dry. 

but it tasted good. 

oh and did I mention it was a bit too expensive for the type of place it is, the fact that you get your own food from the counter and it was not hot? for dinner set me back about $25.  For that amount, I could have sat down and had a steak.

I am not saying I would not come back, just that there are things I wish had been a bit better that's all.
author: Nilu r.

description: It's a bit divey, but the food was so good, I still dream about it 6 months later
author: David B.

description:
Memphis Minnie's is currently my favorite restaurant in the world. Michelin stars and French food don't compare to this delicious, juicy, tender barbecue. This is America's answer to those swanky restaurants in San Sebastian, Spain.

I've many times tried and can speak to the brisket, pork ribs, beef ribs, and smoked fried chicken. Let me say this - no place in San Francisco does it better.

First and most important: the meat is simply to die for. I would eat every meal here but I can't because they are closed on Mondays and also my girlfriend doesn't like barbecue. Second, it's honest and what you see is what you get. No gimmicks, no fanfare. Tables are simple, with red checkered table cloth. They've got beer on tap and sweet tea. No waiters here, it's order from the counter, and they call yer name when it's ready. I come here on Tuesday for lunch or Saturday for dinner. It has a soft spot in my heart.

Customer service is great, I ask for fatty brisket and they know just what I mean. 

When I come here I usually order just meat - so I can't say anything about the sides.
author: Andrew A.

description:
It could be that they don't offer what I want. I'm on the hunt for excellent baby-back ribs. They only had "Louisville Ribs" which is a different cut. Anyway, I placed my order and hoped for the best. Service was attentive and friendly. They did, however, misplace my order initially, but when I notified the food server, he immediately remedied the situation. So yay for that.

But once it showed up, the ribs were dry and hard to get off the bone. Flavor wasn't bad but didn't blow me away. I am also a fan of having some of the sauce cooked and carmelized on the meat itself but there didn't seem to be any. So adding the sauce after the fact was ok. But just ok. Sides were fine. Not bad, not amazing, but fine. So the hunt goes on as this was definitely not the taste I'm looking for, especially for the $20 they charge.

I think some of their other menu items may fare better. My experience was a 2star one, but I'm giving 3 in the hopes that their other stuff is better....
author: Sean M.

description:
SON OF A B!!!!

I read all the great reviews and tried this place.  Had the Southern Star Sandwich with mac and cheese and cornbread.

Disappointed. The sandwich was a whole glob of dry.  Mac and Cheese....cold....hated it.  Cornbread......cold....nothing special.  The sauces I'll admit were interesting though and caught my taste buds.

I had high hopes but either they started to slack off on quality or it was just a bad day.  If you have all these great reviews keep it up or make it better guys. Geez.....

It was a Wednesday and they were serving a Pastrami Reuben sandwich which my friend ordered.  I had a bite of her's and I'll say that thing was delicious.

I'll give it another shot but so far thumbs down. Sorry guys.
author: Chris L.

description: This is one of those places you just want to love.  It's kinda old school, untrendy...so old school that it should be trendy.  I had the beef brisket which was dry dry dry.  Isn't the whole point of brisket is that it's laden with fat so it's tender? The cornbread was yummy though....
author: Eric C.

description:
It's 9:22am, and I am craving their mac and cheese and cornbread. Memphis Minnies does something wonderful to my taste buds, and I just can't get enough! 

The prices seem to have gone up a little bit, but it's definitely worth it. If you check in with foursquare, you also get a sticker or button. It's nothing fancy, but it's a nice little perk. 

They do delivery as well, take advantage of that if you are not a fan of the Haight (some people aren't - I don't understand, but whatever.)
author: T M.

description:
Well, I finally got a chance to enjoy a "real" meal from this place, and it was pretty solid. It didn't blow me away like I thought it would (not enough to get that fifth star), but it was still very good. 

I decided to grab dinner here on a Friday after the gym. It wasn't that crowded (I've driven by this place when the line was literally out the door) and they were quick with my order. 

I decided to go the two-meat combo, which came with two sides. Now I love ribs & brisket as much as the next person, but I decided to go with the sweet pork (which I had before and knew was good) as well as the chicken. Both were excellent. I know that when it comes to BBQ, a lot of people disregard chicken (to some people it might as well be a "vegetarian" option), but I love BBQ chicken. The two sides I decided to go with were the seasoned fries and coleslaw (again, I know these aren't the most "BBQ-like" options when you also have sweet potatoes, mac & cheese, and greens to choose from, but they sounded good at the time). The fries were a little soggy, but did have good taste. I LOVED the coleslaw! It was tangy (vinegar, not mayonnaise based) and was crisp, with peppers and tomato. The meal also came with a corn muffin, which I thought was eh... 

The quality of the food was good, and when I eat BBQ I expect to pay more than I would with other kinds of food, but for about $17.50 (with tax) I didn't think the portions were great (certainly no leftovers for this hungry boy). I'll definitely be back, because the food is good, but it didn't "wow" me necessarily like I thought it would.
author: George A.

description:
Seriously this place has gone from one of my favorites to one of the WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EATERIES IN THE CITY!

I understand your busy, but I call in to place my order and they put me on hold for 5 minutes. Granted that is fine but then when I try calling back I just get sent to the answering machine! I finally get the same girl working there, Eva, I think her name was. And what happens? "Can we put you on hold again sir."

No. No you can't because I'll go right down the street to Metro Caffe instead if I want a burger. And If I want an overpriced sandwich I will now go to the Southern Sandwich Food Truck.

Thanks Memphis Minnies for showing me that Customer Service means nothing to you!
author: Raymond A.

description: Good BBQ, good tea /beer, good mac and cheese, good onion rings!!! Staff is friendly and the music is cool. That gets you a 5 star review. Not much else to say, you want BBQ check them out. Manager supports the Disc Golf community and darts as well, thanks buddy!
author: Keyser S.

description: Real Bbq hunny and it's dam good!  My fav is the brisket it is just so juicy, tender and full of flavor. Also not too much fat just the right amount.  I really enjoy their beans they are quite flavorful although I wish they were not as sweet (my personal preference).  They have real iced tea and because of this get two thumbs up.  Save room for the pecan pie and the banana pudding my fav it is creamy goodness!
author: Elizabeth J.

description: Came here after drinking across the street and it was just perfect. Came for friday fried chicken with mac& cheese and biscuit. The chicken was soo juicy and the biscuit was soo moist!
author: Angela L.

description:
I haven't had too much from this place but I am giving it 5 stars because  they have the best chicken wings I have ever had! Very original tasting and the meat falls straight off the bone.

The wings have my utmost recommendation!
author: Nick E.

description: If you love BBQ and Smoked n fried chicken.  This is your place.  Best in USA.  We eat here at least once or twice a week and always take home brisket n ribs for the rest of the week.  Great food, people, easy parking, good prices and awesome music.  Forget those bullshit gen x places this is the real deal.
author: David B.

description:
Wow. How did I not know this existed? Probably because I don't explore the entire city, but anyways this place is better than Blues BBQ except for the cornbread (Blues cornbread is so moist and just melts in your mouth...and you can totally taste the corn).

 My bf and I shared the 3 meat plate (which came with two sides and a cornbread) and it was definitely more than enough for the two of us for less than $20. They also serve beer, wine and saki.  The pulled pork was delicious, and so was the beef brisket, although it was  a little fatty.  The pork ribs were good but they didn't have much meat on them. Mac and cheese was good (not the best I've ever had) and the french fries were good (slightly spicy and sweet seasoning). The sweet potato side was okay (I asked how they were made, and the owner told me exactly how they make them, apple juice and all ha- i was just wondering if they were mashed - they're cubed btw). 

But the owner gets extra points because he said if we didn't like the sweet potatoes that much, we could change our side. While they were cooking it, we decided to switch bc we saw another person's fries, and he gave us an extra side for free. The owner seems pretty awesome and the place just has an awesome vibe. We'll definitely be back.

O- not 5 stars because although the meat was awesome for the most part, the sides were not awesome (they will still really good). And because they only had 4 sauces (I know that sounds like a lot), but there wasn't one that was spectacular...maybe I'm being too judgmental...it was great. yummm
author: Jessica S.

description: Been here a couple of times. Their ribs (dry rubbed) are pretty good, and that brisket... I keep a photo of that brisket in my wallet, and on sad times, I look at the photo and it brings the good memories of that 18-hour smoked meat.
author: Plinio C.

description:
Memphis Minnie's is by far the best BBQ in San Francisco. The unassuming joint in the Lower Haight serves up the tastiest brisket, tri-tip, ribs, and other fine BBQ treats in the city. Everything at Memphis Minnie's is slow smoked Southern style--no gas or electric here. All the meats are smoked at least 4 hours (some up to 18 hours) over white oak logs, lending it the authentic taste that Memphis Minnie's is known for. 

Memphis Minnie's is usually busy all day, which is a testament to how delicious it's smoked meats really are; however, the food comes out hot and fast. They are known for their Slow Cooked Texas Beef Brisket, but the menu also has an assortment of fine dishes if you aren't a fan of traditional brisket. Popular main dishes are the St. Louis Style Pork Ribs, Santa Maria Tri-Tip Steak Plate, Smoked Chicken Plate, and the Two Way Combo (any two meats) for those who can't make decisions. The Smokehouse Sandwiches are also an excellent choice for lunch or dinner for those with a smaller appetite. 

Memphis Minnie's is plain delicious. The meats are smoked to perfection, the sides are super tasty, and they even have creative desserts like the Smoked Pecan Bacon Brittle. Yum! Next time you are looking for BBQ in the city, hit up Memphis Minnie's and you won't be disappointed.
author: Alice S.

description: Hulk understand place is hit and miss. Hulk eat here many times, % 85 hit! Hulk like that but still searching for best BBQ. You help Hulk find?
author: Alexander L.

description:
The atmosphere here is pretty nice. It's not your typical restaurant and you order at the counter then sit and wait for them to call your name. I got the Beef Brisket meal is it didn't look like a lot of food, but I was quite stuffed! Mac & Cheese was good, but i like mine with more cheese. If I happen to be in the area again, I may drop by for another taste. 

Oh, and make sure to try to supid hot sauce!
author: Aaron Y.

description: Always walked by this restaurant on Haight and finally decided to check it out. Pretty pricey for what you get, but is good BBQ. I got the brisket platter with mac n' cheese and greens as sides. The brisket was pretty good (not like Texas bbq, but it'll do) and the mac n' cheese was amazing. The greens I couldn't really go for. Overall, a good bbq place. It's quick, easy, and the food is better than average BBQ.
author: Mike W.

description:
OK now having lived in texas for darn near a year, and eating Q several times including the legendary Snows, a place that Texas Monthly magazine said was the best BBQ in texas, I can say that Menphis Minnies is ABSOLUTELY so much better than product here. for some reason, deep smoke flavor and thick black bark is not so important. so san Francisco, relish in eating ant MM, a truly superior BBQ experience and the best of sides, all home made.

RIP Bob!
author: Michael B.

description:
Been here often......

Good food but somewhat pricey.  I expect that in the city.  Forget the ribs, go for the brisket.   That is pure meat magic.
author: liamrh y.

description: My favorite place in sf for bbq. The food is great and the staff is always friendly. the cornbread is amazing and the selection of sauces makes me happy, will be back again and again.
author: Manuel A.

description:
Great southern food, the restaurant itself is really basic though.

Their brisket is amazing!
author: Chad P.

description:
If you like BBQ, you need to get your butt to this place! Not in your diet?...well your next cheat day should be here!
I felt like everything we ordered was slow-cooked and trust me this place knows their stuff! The plates come with a cornbread muffin and two sides of your choice. My sister got the chicken with the greens and slaw while I received the pork ribs with pototah salad and slaw as well. The slaw was a perfect mix between sweet and tangy--not dripping from mayonnaise or sourness like other places I've been to. The Potato salad reminded me of my aunt's back in the day. Creamy yet hearty at the same time.
The ribs are something I would put on my last meal on this earth status. Not falling off the bones or burnt to a crisp; just the right amount of char with flavor by the mouthful. The plate comes with four ribs which will cover part of your daily protein intake. If this doesn't satisfy your satiety, you can also order some dessert that they have available as well!
author: Adam G.

description:
After too long in San Francisco without trying out Memphis Minnie's I tired out Memphis Minnie's. 

Okay, this place can hang. It's mostly makes it on the sides. 

The mac and cheese is pretty good. And since you order at a counter, and it's a southern classic, they don't get faulted for having mac & cheese on the menu. All you other posers still need up your game. 

But the potato salad and BBQ sauce are out of this world. I think that's what will drive me back. I hope they offer potato salad in party sizes. 

The meat is good, far from the "Best. BBQ. Ever!", but good it still good. I had the tri-tip. And if tri-tip surprises you, you'd probably be disappointed. 

How can they get to 4-stars? The problem is not that it's too expensive ($50 for dinner for two and you order at a counter!), it's that the interior is kind of shit for what you're paying. Some paint, some decent tables and chairs (you know an "enjoyable surrounding") would not be too much to ask for with a $50 dollar meal...

P.S....like you have paper towels on the table for napkins. That's fine. How about paper towel HOLDERS?! Just a thought.

P.P.S. They also don't have steak knives.
author: Luke M.

description: This is the best BBQ I have found in the city. I love the pulled pork but everything is amazing. The Tuesday special is also one of the best sandwiches, it's a porkbelly bahn mi, well their version of one anyway! So good!!! Recently I had a small party at work and ordered pulled pork and Mac n cheese. Everyone raved about it and already plan to go back with their families. Please check them out you won't be disappointed!
author: Kelly D.

description:
My wife and I were invited here by friends who were thinking this would be a great caterer for their wedding reception. The idea was for all four of us to pick as many different dishes as possible to see what they would want to serve. This was the best idea anyone has ever had. 

I recommend getting a combo plate that comes with meat and two sides. Since we all got different dishes and sides we were able to try a ton of food. The fried chicken was some of the best I've ever had. Burnt ends were so good. The cornbread was perfect. But the show-stealer was the mustard greens. I couldn't get over how good they were.

Seating is very limited so you have to be patient. Gotta try it. We talked about this place for two weeks after. Worth a trip to the City. And yes, they catered that wedding reception.
author: Toby B.

description:
Stopped by Memphis Minnie's today to satisfy my hankering for BBQ. Ordered the two way combo that comes with two meats (smoked chicken and brisket), 2 sides (beans and seasoned fries) and a corn muffin (they left it off my order! Boo! It happens.) for takeout. 

The food was prepared rather quickly, with the food and the restaurant smelling wonderfully of smoked meat. Once I opened the takeout box, the food was still pretty warm, but some of the fries were soggy from the steam built up in the container and the liquid from the beans. That's okay though, they were still tasty. The chicken is really good. Not only were the thigh and drumstick well cooked, the fat had all but melted off, leaving just a well seasoned, crispy skin. Yum! The brisket was a bit on the salty side, but otherwise very juicy and tender. The order came with a container of the mustard sauce and a container of the Texas BBQ sauce. Both were quite good and would be good on salads, veggies and even a plain broiled chicken breast. 

The utensils were thrown in the container...is that their thing? I've never really seen that before and am not sure I like having it covered in food before I even have a chance to eat it (the food, that is). 

Having spent a couple of years in the South and eaten my share of BBQ, I thought the food was okay, but on the pricey side. On my next visit I definitely want to dine in to sample the food hot and fresh out of the pit. Plus, I want my corn muffin! Staff was friendly and efficient. Love the decor with the pig theme.  Parking was a bit painful, but not impossible.
author: Melissa L.

description: I tend to go here every so often and I must say I always enjoy it.  This week I got the pork ribs, very nice..... and had my first Sweet Potato Pie, it was good.  I will continue to go back.   Please bring in Hushpuppies :)
author: Blake J.

description:
I LOVE this place. Excellent classic BBQ items, delicious new inventions (try the BBQ egg rolls - yum).

Great for kids, great for leftovers. The ribs and pulled pork and all of that are great, but so are the pies.

Street parking is a pain so be prepared.
author: Joy A.

description: I'm sure the BBQ is great, but once I had the Maxi Burger I never looked back. Hands-down my favorite burger. Pimento cheese, thick bacon, fried onions. Obviously a heart-stopper, but it's been a big sloppy present I've given myself once or twice a year since 2007.
author: Nathan S.

description: This is the first time I've ordered Memphis Minnie's Barbecue via GrubHub. I was not disappointed. And today's kinda yucky outside. With a dull overcast, dirty-white blanket of cloud, the streets & sidewalks appeared damp and the cold air weighed almost-heavy with moisture. And I was sure happy Memphis Minnie's delivers to where my 95 year old mother is. And it was the first time I used GrubHub as well and everything was delivered on time, as stated via online order. My mom likes Memphis Minnie's barbecued chicken, so I ordered that with their potato salad and Mac & cheese. She always likes those sides. And just for an extra snack, and because there's a delivery minimum, she got their appetizer assortment. That had a pork roll, three chicken wings, some deep-fried cheese sticks and their crunchy fried onion petals. Mom devoured half and finished the rest, for lunch, the next day. She was really happy with everything she enjoyed...!
author: Joe C.

description: We love this place for all the right reasons and all of the bad delicious reasons. They also catered our wedding and all 102 people loved it too. Thanks for making life worth eating through!
author: jess s.

description: I always get the pulled spicy chicken sandwich which is really tasty. I recommend the potato salad side.
author: Harshal J.

description:
Fantastic, just get a quarter pound of beef brisket and a side of corn bread. The sauce is the best, the quality of the meat is superb, the cornbread is fresh and the people behind the counter are very welcoming.
Can't go wrong.
author: Juan V.

description:
We went on a Sunday afternoon, completely starving. It was full of locals, and really did have a Southern feel to it. Pig knick-knacks, signs, trucker hats, you name it. We ordered the smoked pork ribs with greens and mac n cheese. It definitely hit the spot, very tasty, a little bit dry. Like any good hole in the wall bbq spot, it was a little worn and had sauce here and there on the tables. 

Getting in the door was a little difficult with my wheelchair. It's hard to wrestle the door and wheel over the bump. An easy fix though! The bathroom was spacious and delightful, complete with cow curtains. 

Overall, we give it an A-. We'll be going back for sure.
author: Shannon M.

description: One of the best BBQ spots in the bay, easily beats Everett's and other hyped locations in the east bay. Try the brisket or the beef ribs, you can't go wrong with either.
author: Pasquale A.

description: Disappointing.  Meat was quite expensive and was fatty, so we ended up cutting quite a bit off.  When you charge so much per pound you should trim the fat before weighing it.  I love greens, but the Potliker Greens were too sweet!  Beans and corn bread were very good.
author: Robert H.

description:
I had the 2 meat special - pork ribs and brisket, with mac & cheese and beans for the sides. 

The ribs were horrid - I wasn't expecting fall off the bone, but I found the meat really tough and really dry. It might have had some sauce, but the only evidence was the weird red colour the top of the ribs had. 

The brisket was far better, but really oily - couldn't finish it, I felt bad towards the end.

The mac & cheese and the beans were both passable, but far from memorable.

I might give it a shot for dinner, when I don't get stuff that feels a day old, or get the daily special - I'll admit it looked pretty good, and practically everyone else was getting it.
author: K L.

description: Not the same Memphis Minnie's I loved. Quality has gone down and price is too high for what you get. Maybe I went in during a slow time of day, but o still expected brisket to taste better.
author: Dfiz L.

description:
The amount of food is massive. When you order you get a giant plate of meat, 2 sides and corn bread. It's not fancy but the service is quick and pleasant. There seemed to be a constant line during our stay there. With very few seats we had to wait till a table opened up after we ordered, however the people that worked there kept  a watchful eye and when one opened up they cleared up and sat us down.  I had ordered the tri-tip.
 the plate was filled up with a mound of sliced try-tip, it was tender and juicy but a little salty for my taste. The cornbread that came with is was delicious, sweat and moist. I had the macaroni and cheese and the sweet potato, both were delectable and easy to finish off. 
The biggest down side, if you are just visiting San Francisco or driving to this place parking is a giant pain to find. we circled for upwards of an hour to find a parking spot with in a 5 block radius of the restaurant. 
Other than that it was satisfying and very filling, so filling, I was still full the next day.
author: Johanna C.

description: Oh yeah this place is on point! The meat is so tender - use the red Texas sauce on everything. No joke. I loved the greens and the sweet potatoes. BBQ in your face. Do it!
author: Jacob D.

description:
April 20th, 2011
7:30PM
Calling Memphis Minnie's
Owner:  Hello, what can I get you?
Me:  Stab of ribs, pound of tri tip, large potato salad, large beans
Owner:  How many people is this for?
Me:  2
Owner:  You guys stoned?
Me:  Nah maaaaaan...

7:50PM
Hipster delivers our order to the front door

Epic food.  Epic people.  

I like their style of BBQ.  No sauce!  Very flavorful.  Tender!  

During our first visit, the cook was very kind and made recommendations to us.  He gave us a rundown on how the meat was cooked.  He encouraged us not to use the sauce and give the meat by itself a taste.  He was RIGHT!  My saliva glands had an orgasm.  

This places get my NOMNOMNOMNOMNOMNOMNOM award!
author: Norm K.

description: I'm from Texas and still I try to hit this place when I'm in town.  Last week I ordered the pulled pork with mac n' cheese which were excellent as usual.  This time I tried the potato salad and that was also very good.  Normally I'd give this place 5 stars but they raised their prices (again) and while the food is quite good the value isn't what it used to be. Now, I may only hit this place every other time I'm in town.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Lots of hype for not so great food. They gave us a free pitcher for my boyfriends birthday though! I may be spoiled, however, getting Carolina BBQ every summer.

The rundown:
The meat was very fatty and not hot. The sides were probably the best part and they weren't great, in my humble opinion. Mac & cheese, meh. Greens - TOO bitter (and i love my greens).

 I must give props to any place trying to perfect southern cooking though. Keep trying, Minnies! Hopefully I'll be back with a better experience to share :)
author: Laura L.

description:
Great Food + Great Company =  Great Times!

Winning, DUH!

The MAC-n-Cheese and Andouille was the best to me.  I have a mission to try and re-create the MAC....it will be fun trying to perfect what they have done so, so well.
author: Virgo M.

description:
The brisket was aight, the pork was dry and tasteless.
The mustard sauce is pretty good.

I have no idea why this place wins awards. Maybe there's just not that many BBQ places in the hipsterville part of the City... but Brother-in-Laws and the opportunists that took over since they closed is orders of magnitude better... whatever, McDonalds is a decent BBQ joint if you think this place is the best in town.
author: Jeremy H.

description: After a Night of drinking I decided to come here for some BBQ. This is the second time coming here which I am glad I did. I ordered the brisket with mac cheese and greens. It was very tasty. The only thing I am taking a star away for is the price. I felt 20 bucks is a bit steep for BBQ.
author: Kyle W.

description: Hello de are two guys from france . Westrongly recommand this place .. it s The place to go if you want To discover good and authentic us food and meet us people .
author: Hugues L.

description:
Went here a few months ago...

Ambiance: tons and tons of barbecue-related posters, real diner ambiance

Food: Pretty tasty. I ordered a sandwich & fries combo. Portions were a little small though, and that combined with the fact that the food was good but not great is enough to make me think that this is definitely a good place to come once in a while, but not regularly.
author: Ben H.

description:
So, BBQ Anyone? YESSSSSS PLEEEEEASE!!!!
The BF and I come here when our pockets are overflowing with extra cash ( Which is almost never), but the times I have been here, FANFREAKINTASTIC! They lost a star due to dry brisket, but make up for it with their spicy mac n cheese, and their sanwiches-TO DIE FOR! If I could, I'd eat their everyday and never get tired of it!!! I recommend the MAC N CHEESE ( HUGE CROWD PLEASER), and the PORK RIBS after 4 pm, before 6pm, that way theyre still juicy and scrumptious!!! Parking around the neighborhood can be quite an issue, but well worth it. NEVER order delivery- they have a guy on a bike who hauls ass trying to bring you your delivery, just go pick it up!
author: Jen M.

description:
Hipster BBQ to the EXTREME. 

This place serves up pretty authentic barbecue food for those of us who generally enjoy consuming copious amounts of fat and collecting absurd amounts of cholesterol. The food is very good - I had an excellent brisket sandwich that was on the fatty side, but extremely tasty. The mac and cheese side was the star of the meal....ridiculously cheesy and baked to perfection. I'd come back here for the mac and cheese alone. They serve sake with their BBQ, which is extremely odd but something they've managed to get their clients to catch onto. They also have some very entertaining merchandise to buy.

The atmosphere is exclusively douchebag hipster, so if that's not your thing, stay away.....I mean it's not anyone's thing really, but if it means good food, I'll take a chance among them.
author: Matt P.

description:
Memphis Minnie's: delicious BBQ food and a fun laid back atmosphere. The food is ordered quasi-cafeteria style, which I always like at BBQ places. Good selection of meats, sides, and desserts. The staff is very nice and crowd is chill. 

The wait for food, however, is looooong. I'd advise not going there if you are extremely hungry and need to eat asap. But do go if you want to enjoy a few beers while you wait for a meal of delicious meaty food.
author: Mia M.

description: Came here with extremely high expectations and wasn't exactly impressed.  Ordered the sweet pork sandwich and fried cheese grit sticks.  Pork was super tender but the bread was dripping grease. Sauces weren't that impressive--my favorite was the mustard based one, but they were pretty liquidy.  Cheese grit sticks were delicioso, so that was redeeming.  Service was quick and friendly, but left feeling less than satisfied.  Fun atmosphere, but mediocre BBQ.
author: Ashlee C.

description:
Over the past few years this place has been sliding down hill. as you can see by my 08' review I was a fan. After a series of disappointing meals, my latest order has put me over the top.

1. order at 1PM on a sunday - one hour later I have yet to receive my order so I give them a call.  I get a seemingly stoned "Austin" oh ya bro, I meant to give you a call. we are out of beef ribs..Pork OK?  so i am like, well.. you are telling this to me now after an hour and I had to call you?  so how long will this delivery take I ask?  15 to 20 min max, we will rush this right over. ok, send the pork..

2. another hour goes bye, no food. I call back speak with Ben, totally confused as to what Austin is doing...  food is on the way; next time you order we will give you a discount... sorry for the delay.

3. 45 min later the food arrives; guess what, it is beef ribs, the item that they said they were out of and what delayed my order earlier.. 

4.  Beef ribs seems to be frozen / partially reheated and dry as can be.  well I guess they thought this was better than the pork.

All in all, 3 hrs of food delivery negotiation;  this was 40 bucks down the drain; I almost feel robbed. 

So Ben, dont worry about that discount - I won't be coming back.
author: Brian K.

description:
Pros:

- Good smoke.
- Good bark.
- Good Mac and Cheese (voted best sides by my co-diners)
- Excellent service.
- Price is reasonable for the volume of food.

Cons:

- Meat needs more rub.
- Beef ribs and rib tips were on the chewy side.
- Sauce was thin in texture and flavor.
- Corn muffins were dry.  (Hard Knox has better.)
author: Cherrie C.

description: Very good food and the cooks were pretty funny too so that goes along way to making the visit a fun one. I highly recommend the baby back ribs!! Next time i have a BBQ party i am buying all the food there and just will tell my guests i made it. You know i couldn't do as good as they did!
author: Stu H.

description: Just started working at Comcast in San Francisco. And I can honestly say this is my favorite BBQ hands down in the Bay Area. Brisket is crazy, Mac and cheese is bomb. Greens and chicken are very good
author: Benny T.

description: I ordered the Southern Star sandwich - holy crap is it sweet. Sickly sweet, I would say. At times, it felt like I was chewing on brown sugar cubes. Not a pleasant experience. +1 star for the seasoning on the fries.
author: Trevor H.

description: I had a great time here. The BBQ was excellent, particularly the Texas brisket. They also serve sake with the BBQ. Not sure that I am convinced but it was interesting. Very friendly service.
author: Mark R.

description: I drive from San Jose to Memphis Minnie's on Wednesday, just for their pastrami. 'Nuff said.
author: T. Weldon R.

description:
Word of advice: Don't have your friend grab a table while you line up to order food. They will bark at you to ONLY grab a table after you've ordered. I'm thinking, "Okay, okay, simma down now....I'll order THEN sit. Jeez."

The guy taking your order is not always the happiest camper in the world. You'd think he would be freakin cheery as hell with all that BBQ behind him. 

The food is pretty good...I usually get a trip tip sandwich. They hallow out the bread so you can fill it with one of their BBQ sauces if you so desire. The bf gets a combo plate of some smokey brisket and ribs. Their corn bread is okay, but aside from that I don't particularly love any of their other sides. Everytime I eat here, I have to get the fried cheese grit sticks; it comes with the best dipping sauce. Their banana pudding is the only dessert Ive tried. It's topped with whipped cream and 'nilla wafers so you know it's all good.

The decor at Memphis Minnie's is eclectic and they have some very cool things to look at while you wait for your order. Usually, your table will have drawings from past patrons under the glass. There are posters and t-shirts of various BBQ-centric events on the walls and you can't miss the flying pig above the register.

Prices are not bad for the portion you get. MM is the place we will continue to go to when we gotta have BBQ.

They are closed Mondays.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Not bad for my first BBQ experience in SF!

A couple friends and I followed our noses after some amazing smoky meat wafted into Molotov's next door. I went with the pulled pork sandwich and my meat was incredibly tender, smoky and flavorful. Plenty of sauce options (I lovelove mustard and vinegar based BBQ sauce and they had both) though beware of the bottle that says spicy. I like my food spicy, but this was like fire in my mouth!

Fried cheese grit sticks were interesting, but kinda tasty. Definitely not a must have.
author: Karena Q.

description:
I didn't come to San Francisco for BBQ but man am i glad i found Memphis Minnie's! A friend recommended it and it was phenomenal. I'm a huge BBQ fan, I've been going to the Big Apple BBQ blockparty for 5 years now and Memphis Minnie's had some of the best i've had.

A friend and I split the pulled pork and the brisket sandwich and both were great. The pulled pork was cooked perfectly. Tyr it with some of their coleslaw and topped with a mix of the north carolina vinegar and texas red sauce. The brisket was tender and incredibly smokey, definitely the better of the two. I liked that with the red and the hot sauce, which isn't as hot as advertised but still good

Definitely worth checking out if you're in the lower haight. swag.
author: Eric M.

description: This little piggy went to Memphis Minnie's for a smorgasbord of soulful sides and smokey meats but the prices were steep and the food was insipid so I went wee wee wee all the way home!
author: Dustin G.

description: I have travelled to almost all of the states, and have lived in Memphis.  This is one of the best roast pigs I have had this side of the Mississippi.  Stopped in again for lunch on Friday.  Always a treat to my 6 yr. old who grew up smiling at Bob.  Miss you Bob, but you live on in our hearts and in your ribs!!!  Great staff, great food, and a fun atmosphere!!!!!
author: Raymond C.

description: I'm kind of a BBQ snob as Chicago has many good BBQ spots. I walked in with low expectations and could not have been more wrong. Visible smoke rings, dry run crusts, everything we had was excellent.
author: Michael W.

description: Best bbq in sf hands down. Environment is amazing sight and sounds of Haight make it a lovely place to dine.
author: Thomas B.

description:
The hype is well-deserved.

Pulled chicken sandwich? Totally tender and juicy. Vinegar-based barbecue sauce - be still my beating heart. Combine that with some sweet potatoes (NOT sweet potato fries!) with a pitcher of Stella and I was in gluttonous heaven. 

Service is fun. A little confusing with the whole "order as a group and we'll call out your group name" deal, but we caught on... eventually.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
I am spoiled when it comes to BBQ and I know that this sways my views.  I honestly believe that my parents make the best pulled pork sandwich this side of the Mississippi.  My parents happen to be from Mississippi (mom) and Georgia (dad).  My dad cooks the pork and makes the BBQ sauce.  My mom makes the coleslaw.  When you put those three things together it is melt-in-your-mouth delicious BBQ goodness.  5 stars for my parents' pulled pork sandwiches.

Needless to say, every BBQ restaurant seems to fall a bit short in the pulled pork sandwich department.  Although I recognize Memphis Minnie's effort, my sandwich was just okay.  I ordered the "Southern Star" which consists of half Texas* brisket and half sweet pork. The meat had good flavor but was a bit dry.

I appreciate that they provide three different sauces on the table but none were the sweet BBQ sauce that my sandwich and I craved. 

The mac and cheese was delicious and my favorite thing.  The sides are definitely four or five stars worthy. 

If you decide to eat there like we did, do not mess with their seating system.  Take a deep breath, get in line, order, tell them how many people you have, and the next appropriately sized table will be yours. 

* I have had a few "discussions" with my friend Louis M., who lived in Texas for a bit, regarding whether or not Texas is actually part of "the south".  I asked my mother and she said "well, people in the south don't think so" so I win.
author: Emily J.

description:
I ordered a combo plate with 3 items:
-- St Louis Style Pork Ribs
-- Rib Tip Plate
-- Texas Beef Brisket (smoked 18 hours)
It was all delicious, but I have to say that I am quite surprised at how much I enjoyed that beef brisket.  It was much more tender than I expected.  I might have even enjoyed it more than the ribs (and I really love to pick at a bone).

Comes with four sauces: 
-- North Caroline vinegar
-- South Carolina mustard
-- Beelzebub's
-- Texas Red Sauce.
I'm not much a mustard fan, but I did love the other 3, especially mixing the vinegar with the spicy Beelzebub.

https://sphotos-a.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash4/426499_10100312813760839_137616023_n.jpg
author: Jeanne L.

description: The food at Memphos Minnie's is great! My husband and I got the ribs plate and the meat was falling off the bone and very tasty. The sauces are amazing, but the meat is so good you will likely not overuse them. We have been ordering from there a lot ever since! But I'd ask for the restaurant to consider the size of the mac n' cheese side - it is super tiny!!
author: Julia F.

description: From the last time I've visited the quality of the food has changed. The cornbread was dry and the meat was burned. It was edible but disappointing since the previous experience was better. Maybe it was an off day.
author: Caroline N.

description:
Delicious BBQ paired with Sake?
Affordable prices?
Home made hot sauce that is actually hot?
Sign me up!
author: Rebeca R.

description: Finger licking delicious.  When the craving hits and it will recur, it a rush to Minnie's!  No big favorites to recommend. Just wish they had buffet so I could do it all!  Save room for Pecan pie or take to go.  Flavors and marinates are savory and reminiscent of Saint Louis style smoke BBQ houses.
author: Donald H.

description:
Super nice staff!  It was a warm day and even with the fan on it was HOT in there.  The sandwich sampler was good (brisket and pulled pork) was good but honestly a little dry.  

I will try again because everything looked so good.  Plus, with a dab of sauce the dryness was gone.  And the sweet tea...yummmmmmmm.
author: B K.

description:
I came here awhile back with my girlfriends after a crazy night out. We wanted real food and one of the girls recommended this place. We were originally going to Squat and Gobble but ended up here instead.

Their menu is simple yet yummy. The aroma of BBQ reeks in here in a good way of course.

Took me a while to pick what I wanted but I think I ended up with one of the sandwiches that came w/ a side and I chose mac n cheese because it seems to be the side everyone else is getting. Must be good right? It was smaller than I expected, but it was homemade shit. Pretty goood. The sandwich was good. I really can' t remember which sandwich I got, see if it was a really really good sandwich I would of remembered haha. 
It could of been the pulled pork. But the sauces they have does give the finishing touches. 

Will want to come back one day to try the ribs perhaps.
author: Alice Z.

description:
The Lower Haight is known for its meat (present company included).

Its succulent, juicy, baked, grilled, fried, barbequed meat. Everywhere you turn, someone is offering you a burger, sausage or bacon-loaded pizza. 

Memphis Minnie's meets the Lower Haight's meat challenge and takes it up a notch by offering some of the most deliciously sauce-smothered carne you can find on this world-famous street. Whether you choose to order an individual item, a meat plate or a combo item, you will be rewarded with an extremely full stomach. 

I'm a sucker for sausage so I ordered the smoked sausage and got to pick two sides. After consulting with the woman who works at the front, I went with the baked beans (YUM) and the sweet potatas (spelled that way on the sign). There was A LOT of food on my plate and I ate every last drop. 

(Editor's note: I had an awful stomach virus that week and this was my first full meal so that might contribute to my insatiable appetite). 

If you like sweet tea, make sure you order it. It almost made me miss living in the south. ALMOST. 

It can be tough to get a seat here when it's busy. They are quite militant about you not taking a table until you've ordered and I seriously appreciate their diligence in keeping tables in a queue. 

Minnie: I look forward to meating with you again soon.
author: Jared S.

description:
Our company hired Memphis Minnie's to cater a homebrew event  so we wouldn't be drinking on empty stomachs. We got there early and were lucky enough to sample everything they had: ribs, brisket, pulled pork, chicken, coleslaw, beans, collard greens, and cornbread! On the side they had three different kinds of sauces. I forgot what they were called specifically, but one was a mustard, another was the Texas Red Sauce, and the last one was a hot version of the red sauce.

While in line, we could watch them cook up the chicken and ribs. They hacked into those chicken halves right in front of us! I'm sure these guys are pros, but it kind of scared me to see them be so forceful with a giant butcher knife!

The brisket was pretty good. I liked the outer crunch and just cut off the fatty layer. The ribs left something to be desired... I felt like it didn't have much flavor and I ended up dipping it into the Texas Red Sauce (which didn't do much for it, either). I also had a little helping of the pulled pork, which was also just okay. The chicken on the other hand was nice and moist! The juices had the right amount of flavor, no sauce needed! The coleslaw was pretty good, as were the beans, and collard greens... Nothing amazing, though. I did enjoy their cornbread. I got a piece with a dollop of their butter on top. It was crunch on the outside, but not too crumbly inside, which is exactly what I like. It was slightly buttery and sweet, but not overpowering. I'm a big fan of cornbread, and this was definitely up to par! My friend tried some of their sweet tea and seemed pretty satisfied with it, but I didn't try any.

As the crowd grew larger (who wouldn't show up for free food and free beer?), the line ended up backing up. I'm pretty sure these guys underestimated the number of employees that would show up. However, I peeked over there before I left and even though they were definitely moving quickly to get things cooking and on peoples' plates, they looked like they had things under control.

I've passed by their actual restaurant in SF, but never tried it until now. It's a solid BBQ place that I wouldn't mind returning to for their chicken and cornbread! It seems like they have a lot more to offer on their regular menu, so I'd be curious to give it a shot sometime!
author: Leana L.

description: Do you like brisket? Then come to the place and never go to another place again. Best brisket I have ever had!
author: Chris C.

description:
Memphis Minnie's is a BBQ "Joint" (they would approve use of the word, I'm sure).  I am a big fan of their beef ribs which are usually done to perfection.   Minnie's barbecues them (smoking them) slowly so if they haven't gotten them early, you can't get them that day -- and the supply of beef ribs is not as reliable as I would wish.  But if they don't have beef ribs, the various forms of pork ribs are wonderful, as is the Wednesday pastrami (available on Wednesday only). 

The ribs are smoked dry -- without sauce, and if you believe that BBQ means sauce, you just haven't tasted Minnie's ribs -- they are wonderful without sauce - and I sometimes eat them this way.  However, on the table are bottles of four made-at-Minnies BBQ sauces: South Carolina Mustard, North Carolina Vinegar, Texas Red Sauce, and Bee Izabob's Breath Spicy Hot Sauce. Texas Red and South Carolina Mustard are my favorites.  The rib plates come with your choice of 2 sides and a corn muffin (southern style definitely and delicious).   

Sides include fries (thin and flavorful), greens (so this can be health food), beans (not from a can), mac and cheese, sweet potatoes, and several others I think.  My friend and I usually order two plates and thus have four sides between us ... and they are plenty big to share.  And they have onion strings which you can order a la carte or as a substitute for the two sides (or at least they let us do that when we asked).  

The food is all delicious.  It is usually big enough that I eat some for lunch and have a nice lite supper on the remains afterwards.  That is, when the flavor doesn't make me forget to stop when I'm no longer hungry.  

They have traditional soda drinks (refillable from a machine) and sweet tea that should be illegal as it is so addictive.  I know they're other things on the menu but so far I've rarely had them.

How good is Minnie's -- The food is so good that a good friend (with whom I dine about once a week) and I come here nearly twice a month.  The service is friendly and good, especially for a BBQ joint.  The ambience -- well you're here for the BBQ.
author: Michael F.

description:
I went to Memphis Minnie's with a coworker of mine from Texas.  She approved so I figured it must be good.  She liked it so much that she bought a Memphis Minnie's t-shirt.

Need I say more?
author: Yi Z.

description:
Nice try San Francisco but I've bellied up at plenty Southern BBQ shacks that boast better cold left overs. Well wait before I bash you folks too hard let me first give a lil respect where respect is due and perhaps an extra star. 

The overnight smoked  brisket all by itself, no sauce no nada, is appetizing to a level that city slickers will be impressed. The potato salad was very mustard creamy and the beans had smoked meat mixed in!
Nice Job! Unfortunately for this East Texas native those are just the basics that you can find at any old service station in my hometown.

4 Major Malfunctions:

4) Smoke your meat not the customers. WhoTF thought it was OK to put a 6ft tall smoker in this little bitty teenie tiny shack right beside the customers? Every time they opened the door on that bad boy I was nailed with a wall of black smoke. If I wanted black lungs and to smell like a campfire I would have opted to do it myself.

3) Sourdough bread was so tough the roof of my mouth is still sore and missing a layer of skin. I had to dunk my bread in their sauce to soften it enough to rip off a bite. Might be a good choice for kids that need to lose a tooth.

2) BBQ Sauce?? Oh you mean those squirt bottles full of vinegar and runny salad dressing. LOL is this a joke am I getting punked? I managed to mix the runny Texas Red (please rename it) with the spicy one and made some edible sauce. 

1) My blessed Shiner Bock was skunky. OK OK maybe it was the distributors fault maybe not either way you're giving us a bad name you sons a....I'm out.
author: R J.

description:
Within the past year I've found my go-to place for fried chicken (The Front Porch), deep dish pizza (Little Star), desserts (Candybar) and mochi (Benkyodo), all thanks to Yelp. I can now gladly add BBQ to that list since I've found Memphis Minnies.

My dilemma with Minnies is that I've seen it 1389 times going to Rosamunde across the street, and it's just really hard to give up something you love so much to try something new.

Sorry vegetarians, I'm pretty sure the meat is the only thing worth ordering here. Their meat is done really well. The pork ribs are great! Not overloaded with dry rub and not overly fatty. The rib tip was probably my favorite with its smoky flavor and roughly chopped texture. The chunks were tender, soft and pretty lean, good just plain or with a small dash of their homemade red sauce. Lastly, there was the smoked pork which was a little chewier and clearly not as good as the other two meats.

The fries are super seasoned and salty and just too much. It left my mouth feeling raw after just a few so I stuck to the mac and cheese that was sort of bland but creamy and sprinkled with bread crumbs. I really liked the cornbread muffin which was sweet and just the right amount chewy. Overall, the sides were pretty lackluster, but I don't mind since I'm a carnivore anyway.
author: Chelsea P.

description:
Do you want...good ol' southern food....in SF??  = 4.7 pts average

This is THE place for delicious ribs and bbq roasted chicken.  ::drool::  I highly suggest the coleslaw because it is mixed with sweet vinegar and black pepper and not your typical messy mayo (5 pts).   All this for a decent price! (5 pts)

It's a little bit crampy, but this place can manage a group of 6 ppl easily, but I wouldn't recommend going any higher (4 pts).  But it's definitely a good place to mingle (not too loud) and eat bbq with your friends on a chill night.  It's a bit messy so I wouldn't recommend going clubbing afterwards.  

The beer selection is not great, but the bbq definitely makes up for it.  You want beer?  There are plenty of bars up and down Haight St.  

Sooooooooooo, the pros:

1) good bbq
2) good place to catch up wtih friends
3) good prices

Cons:  

1) small for groups
2) beer selection 

Overall happiness (1-10) = 9!  I enjoy the meal and that's why I come here.
author: Vannie N.

description: This place is really just okay in general. I'm sure there are some items on the menu that could yield more or less stars. The brisket in particular is very good and tender. I've ordered the ribs several times and always been disappointed that they were not tender. The mac and cheese was pretty delicious.
author: Jessica W.

description:
We've been looking for good BBQ in SF for over a year and kind disregarded this spot because of the mixed reviews here. Tonight we tried it after moving nearby and had to right the prior wrongs. This is some of the best BBQ we've had (definitely the best in the Bay Area!)

Amazing things:
1) ribs and rib tips -- juicy and terrific rub, not too fatty, crazy delicious
2) beans -- nice and meaty and soupy
3) pecan pie -- super flavor and not too heavy, nice big pecans
4) BBQ sauce -- red is the best in our view

Good things:
1) smoked chicken -- not too smokey, great rub, juicy

Ok things:
1) Mac and cheese -- a little too sweet for our taste
2) collards -- also a little too sweet and maybe a touch too much vinegar 

Excited to try the rest of the things on the menu and you should too!!
author: dr r.

description:
Last night I checked off another thing on the Big Eat SF list:

#14.  Beef brisket at Memphis Minnie's.

I have to say, it wasn't as great as I expected.  All my brisket experiences from now on are compared to some brisket a co-worker brought in from Texas, and Memphis Minnie's didn't measure up.  Yes, it was tender, but it wasn't juicy and flavorful like the Texas brisket.

I also had the Andouille sausage which was decent.  My hubby had the rib tips, and they were very disappointing.  They were dry and seemed to be overcooked.  None of the three sauces were able to save them.

The best meat by far out of all four that we tried was the pulled pork.  It was very tender and tasty.  Especially good with the vinegar sauce.

I had the mac 'n cheese and the beans on the side.  The mac 'n cheese was okay, drier than I prefer mine (I like mine super cheesy).  I also prefer baked beans to be a little bit sweet, but their version is a little bit spicy-ish.

All in all, our meal was pretty good.  I'd like to go back and try their desserts.  Oh, they don't have high chairs, so we had to juggle our little one on our laps and pass her back and forth to try and eat our food AND feed her.  Just an FYI.
author: Eileen H.

description: This place is bangin' just go and enjoy it. And they serve good beer? Please shut the front door!!!
author: Dan M.

description:
Seasoned fries
+
pork ribs
+
beef brisket
+
"potlikker" greens
+
mac and cheese
+
cornbread muffin
=
waaaay too much food for one person, but so totally worth it!  The only complaint I had was that my to-go order didn't come with enough BBQ sauce (just one souffle cup!)

Granted, I do not know all that much about BBQ, but I do know that the ribs were juicy, fall-off-the-bone tender, the sauce was amazing, and the brisket was super, super tender.  

Of course, I had to eat a salad for lunch the next day ...(I eat guilt salads more often than is probably normal).
author: Cathy Y.

description:
Tried the ribs and the brisket. They ran out of tri-tip. Brisket was fine, but could've been a bit less dry. Ribs weren't anything to write home about but I guess I just prefer juicy fall off the bone ribs to the more dry version I had here. 

Mac and cheese = average
Cornbread = average
Beans = average
Collard greens = sour
Sweet tea = pretty good, not too sweet
Decor = I had fun contributing to the customer paper towel art
Place = hipster

Oh yea... it'd be a nice idea to keep some silverware out next time. We were told that all the utensils were being washed and had to share one fork amongst 6 people (just a random comment that did not affect my rating of the food at all).
author: Colin H.

description:
I really liked this place! I did! It has an authentic BBQ feel to it that brought me back to the feeling of being in the Midwest. However,I was dreaming of a pulled chicken sandwich and sweet tea, which I didn't get because they were out of...

She said she couldn't serve me the pulled chicken sandwich because they were out of chipotle mayo. Huh? I just want pulled rotisserie chicken on a fancy bun, slathered in BBQ - you can forget the mayo! I settled for the friend chicken sandwich which was voted best chicken sandwich in SF. It was delicious but not what my little tastebuds were craving!
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Got the Memphis Sweet Pork sandwich with a side of Mac and Cheese. The sandwich was pretty good, the Mac and Cheese, meh. But that's okay, I liked my sandwich with the good selection of BBQ sauces. I wanted to try a ton of appetizers too and wish I had the appetite for it.

The only thing I wish the management would do differently is be aggressive. There is a very obviously HUGE sign that says seat yourself first. of course people in line (particularly this one group) sat themselves as the others waited in line (and others were waiting for tables). There's obviously a system and they knew it, but chose to ignore it. A guy tried to talk to them and they were pretty rude and were very matter of factly sitting there. I wish he would have kicked them up and made them wait like the rest of us had to and sat those who had ordered and had actually been waiting.
author: Analisa S.

description: I'm in the minority here, but I was not a big fan of the food here.  It was all pretty dry and bland.  That makes me sad.  I had wanted to try this place for YEARS and when I finally did, I was disappointed.  Service was also pretty slow and criticized one of us for wanting our burger well-done (I mean, really?  Is it that weird to not trust raw ground beef after a food poisoning episode?).
author: Jackee K.

description: So disappointed that there were no beef ribs available when the husband and I went there on our day off together recently. We go there mainly for that item and we were salivating the entire way to Memphis Minnie's. the last time there, the ribs sucked. Maybe it was an off day?? Anyway...we were let down this time around AGAIN with the lack of them available. Ordered their brisket and thank god it was juicy, fatty and delicious, just the way i love them to be.
