Husband got pork ribs. They were ok, a bit dry and TINY! Thinking we have to venture out to different BBQ places soon...One more strike and it's over between Memphis Minnie's and us.
author: B. M. C.

description: Super delicious BBQ!  Our family does not care about BBQ, but we had our family friend coming over and half of them are allergic to dairy and the other allergic to gluten. I used yelp to find a restaurant that serves gluten and dairy free food. This place came up.  The pork BBQ ribs are so yummy not fatty and has tons of meat.  Not dry either. The beef brisket is very lean and delicious as well.  The chicken was well it tasted like chicken nothing special but  not greasy at all.  None of the meat that we ordered were greasy or swimming in artificial flavoring.   Everything tasted fresh.  The cole slaw was everyone's favorite. No mayonnaise and very extra ordinary!  The potato salad was perfect too.  The BBQ sauce as well as their honey mustard was very unique and healthy.   It was a little expensive, but well worth the price. This place is incredible.
author: Marie Erika E.

description:
Awesome staff, food and decor. Like that they don't slather the meat in sauce, rather there's a 4 on the table to try. 
We'll be back!
author: Malia J.

description:
I found the food here to be underwhelming. I wanted to like it but it was mediocre bbq imo. I went for the ribs and they were overdone and somewhat dry (also not cheap for what looked like a half rack of ribs). The end pieces were like beef jerky. They still had soem flavor despite this fact but the bbq sauce on them didn't have a lot to it either.

The potatoe salad was delicious I have to say, the mac and cheese was ok. Perhaps they were having an off night with the meat? I'll come back and try again since I live so close by.
author: David R.

description:
F---! And! Yes!! Oh yeah, we're going: Memphis Minnie's is one of my favorite eateries in San Francisco.

And now they deliver by bike. Oh my god. Yes.

I love their succulent meat. I've had birthday dinners here. Yes, yes. This is a place of wonderful food.

Try the sweet tea. Thank me later.

Recommended? = Didn't you hear me? I said f--- yes!
author: Chris R.

description:
4.5 stars please

95% of the time to food is amazing.
3% of the time the food is downright divine.
2% of the time it is just below decent.
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
I must disagree with a lot of the reviews on Memphis Minnies. Coming from Atlanta, Tennessee, and Texas, which is barbeque at its finest, I struggled to compare this to anything like it. The sauce selection was incredibly weak, the wait was long, and they ran out of chicken. San Francisco is not a city known for its BBQ, and I will continue looking for something better.

Greenburger is just down the street and a great option if you are around and open.
author: Nathan O.

description:
I love tryin' places in the Haight, so I thought..,. why not a BBQ joint?!  :)  So, i took 2 others who I knew would appreciate some good bbq and we went to GRUB!

We wanted to try as many things as possible (we were thinking about them catering our next employee event), so we had:

BBQ Seasoned fries - basic but very good
Smoked cajun andouille sausage - this was a hit!
St Louis Style Pork Ribs - they were OK
Big Beef Ribs - wasn't crazy about them
Rib Tip - this was their best offering!!!
Smoky mountain wings - pretty good
Corn bread - yummy

This place was okay, maybe i'll give it another try someday.  I don't want to give it a bad review because there were some items on their menu that were quite good, i.e. the sausage and the rib tip.  I guess I just had higher expectations for what they are famous for... their RIBS!  I think i will try this again.

Parking isnt easy, it never is in the Haight!  :)
author: Marylouise R.

description:
I went back and forth about how many stars to give it. The number depends on what the measure is. Am I comparing it to all BBQ I've had in my life? To all available in the Bay Area? To my happiness that we have at least one good Q place here? What is that rating about?

I decided to give it the highest rating based on my relief that there is one good place here....and because the brisket is actually quite good. I have been to MM's a good 40+ times. I have never ever had anything except the brisket. When I think MM's, I think brisket. They are together in my mind. I don't go to ponder the options, I go because I want brisket.

Now. I will drive long distances to try Q. And I don't mean I'd be willing to drive to Burlingame. I mean DISTANCES. Have car, will travel kind of distances. Like most people who post here, I do not think there is any really good barbeque in the Bay Area. There just isn't. But we must roll with the hand dealt. And so we must allow ourselves to sit with both "it's not as good as" and "it's the best we have". It's better than nothing.

And so.....brisket is hella good. Fries can be good. The other sides aren't anything beyond basic. I wish beyond wishing that ONE place in the Bay Area would make real BBQ beans. Not chilli. No cumin. I'm talking baked beans with chunks of meat (big chunks), sweet BBQ sauce and a  baked to a thickness. I've given up on this. And yet, now and then I pray...
author: Opinions Are My Own, G.

description: If only it had E&J sauce... I was a little disappointed by all the hype, but to each is own!
author: baretta v.

description:
LIFE IS TOO SHORT FOR LOW FAT FOOD, EAT AT MINNIE'S.
( I totally agreed with the slogan. 100%!!! Life is too short.)

BBQ IS LIKE SEX, THE WORST I EVER HAD WAS GOOD.
( But I'll say, "Sushi is like sex also, the worst I ever had was 10 days old Mackerel.)

The cheese burger was really juicy, sweet-smoky with BBQ flavor.
This is not a regular cheese burger.
It is irregular kind.
It's toasted baguette and the rectangular shape burger patty.
BUT THE TASTE AWESOME!!! 
IRREGULARLY AWESOME.
Irregularly, something different, but good.

Great fries too.

I think I do like everything about the place. Food, People, interior, tables and chairs.

I want to come back for the Dry BBQ someday. Soon!
author: Nobu K.

description: My favorite bbq in SF. Very chill, laid back place. I come here whenever I'm in town. Do come here if you want some fast, tasty bbq. Don't come if you're looking for a high-end restaurant experience.
author: Matt C.

description: This place is ridiculously good, perhaps one of the best BBQ places in SF. The smoked wings, OMG, amazing. Highly recommended!
author: SFfamily S.

description:
There's alotta hype about this little joint in the Haight, and I wanted to know what all the commotion was about. My dad and I stopped in here on a Saturday night and it was packed! The atmosphere of the joint is pretty cool with wall to wall pig paraphernalia and customer drawings of none other than pigs on the tables. The staff are quick and efficient and got through the lines of people like it was nothing, so although the place may seem crowded when you go, it's usually not too long of a wait. Once you order your food, the staff are quick to see that you get a table.

On our trip, my Dad and I ordered the sausage, the rib tips, smoked pork and beef brisket. Far and away, the best meat dish there was the beef brisket. It was slow smoked and maintained a lovely, fatty richness that went well with the vinegary, chili accompaniments at the table. The other meats were simply average compared to the brisket. There was a wide range of sides to choose from including Mac and Cheese, Beans, Collared Greens, and Corn Muffins, but again, there was really nothing to write home about. Everything really seemed average and comparable to any other BBQ joint. 

There aren't too many BBQ houses around the neighborhood, so its safe to say Memphis Minnie's can feed the average BBQ fix, but I'm still on a quest to find something a little bit more satisfying.
author: Christina N.

description:
Wow - our new favorite BBQ place!  We both had the beef brisket - it was tender and slightly smokey.  It's served dry the way we like it so you can add your own BBQ sauce.  But while it's served dry it's anything but dry - it's really moist and tasty.  I ate half of mine without any sauce at all.  They had a red sauce (medium heat), Beelzebub sauce (label said "Stupid Hot" but I think it was only medium-high hot), and a Vinegar sauce (didn't do much for me).

Entrees come with a corn muffin and two sides.  We both choose Mac & Cheese which was some of the best Mac & Cheese we've ever had.  Our only complaint is that it was so good we would have loved more.   I had the smokey beans which we're very good and my partner had the seasoned fries.

The corn muffin wasn't good, but it wasn't bad.  It good have benefited from a slab of butter.  (Note to Memphis Minnie's - check out the corn bread at Home Restaurant - that's the kind you need!).

Prices were very reasonable.   Your order from the counter and they ask that you don't sit down until after you order.  The place was crowded but we shared a table with another couple which was fine.

All in all it was great and we'll be back!  Definitely one of the best BBQ places in SF.
author: Ed J.

description:
7/24/11 

I don't remember Memphis Minnie's being an incredibly good BBQ restaurant nor do I remember it for being that bad either.  If I was around the area and I was craving BBQ, I would stop by.  

I just ordered the pork belly and collared greens for $13.00.  It was probably the worst BBQ plate I've ever had in my life because #1, the maple syrup solidified into this chalky and grainy paste on the meat and it was in small kids portions.  #2, the meat was dry.  #3, The collared greens absolutely do not match up with the mustard sauce that they have.  No, it doesn't taste right.  

I watched as all this pork belly was sitting on the stove, drying away and they served me with that crap.  It was pretty terrible for a $12.00 plate of food.  

I think owners should take back the helm of Memphis Minnie's real soon.  My experience after this, I will never go back.
author: Roland L.

description:
"GwahnNah!," the guy behind the counter orders you.

"Gwanno?" you ask, confused. You look away from him and back at the menu, unable to make up your mind. There's too many delicious BBQ options to choose from.

"GwahnNah!," he snaps again.

"Gowah-noh?" you ask again. "Look man I don't know what you're saying," you tell him.

"GwahnNah!," he says, swinging his arm up to the menu and pointing. "GwahnNah!"

"Go on, now?" you venture.

"Yeh, GwahnNah! Ordah ahllredeh!"

"A southern drawl..." you mutter to yourself, in awe. You've never heard one in real life, and immediately realize it is the most badass way to talk on the planet. "GwahnNah...," you whisper to yourself. "Yes, GwahnNah," you continue, smiling.

Maybe it was the three pounds of beef brisket you ate, or the pint glass of that ridiculously good BBQ sauce you downed, but you're feeling like a real Southern badass right about now. Head home, grab a sixer of Budweiser, and turn that TV to Nascar, it's time to be a Southern badass!

"GwahnNah!," you say to your girlfriend as you slap her on the ass and point towards the beer cooler. As you've been being a Southern badass for two weeks straight now she will get sick of it and leave you. "GwahnNah!," you yell, as you slam the door behind her, never to hear from her again.

"GwahnNah!," you tell the bartender as you thrust your empty shot glass towards her, beckoning for another refill, another shot of whiskey to ease the pain of losing your girlfriend.

"I think you've had enough," she says, serving you another shot anyways.

"GwahnNah!," you order the police officer who pulls you over for who knows what bullshit reason, wanting him to hurry up whatever the hell he wants to tell you and let you be on your way.

"Sir, have you been drinking?" the officer asks. You're pretty sure Southern badasses are exempt from DUIs and this cop is up to no good so you reach for his gun because this is the goddamn South, well South of Market anyways, and you ain't taking no shit from the law, your whiskey soaked brain tells you.  

"GwahnNah!," you bark at the judge, as he's taking too damn long to read your verdict.

"Gwahn...Nah...?," you ask sheepishly, as your 260lb cellmate approaches you with a look of lust for fresh meat in his eyes.
author: Dave G.

description:
ALWAYS friendly,
The food is EPIC. 
I eat here 3 times a day sometimes, I can't help it !! 

Half pound of pulled pork is the key! 
Sometimes I wish there was a little more to the sandwiches, but other than that, 
Well worth the price
author: Austin M.

description: Solid bbq spot in SF. Had brisket, Mac & cheese & beans & my boyfriend got "The Southern Star". He was loving it all- 5 star vote, I thought it was a solid 4.
author: Jaclyn B.

description:
Great staff- everyone was friendly and really helpful. 

Came here for a late lunch on a Saturday; there was plenty of room to sit and eat. We ordered both the spicy pulled chicken sandwich and the beef brisket sandwich. The latter was a little dry, but the mustard dipping sauce and bbq sauce that came with it made the sandwich great. The spicy chicken sandwich was solid- didn't need any sauce -  perfect on it's own. Also, the portions were just right; one sandwich was enough to get me full and then some. There'll definitely be a next time for me and I'm already thinking about what I want to order (...either the ribs or the pulled pork sandwich) - yum!
author: Kimya P.

description:
OK - I walked from the Inner Richmond to Memphis Minnie's so I could work on getting my 10,000 steps in so I could not wait for some mac and cheese and fried pies...WELLLLL-

I haven't been here for awhile and was disappointed in their mac and cheese. The reason I liked it before was that it was cheesy without it now drowning in cheese sauce...so it is now a "was". And they had no fried peach pies. That was even more disheartening cuz I had walked enough to earn dessert.

BUT I still love their brisket...it's very tender down to the fat, if you're into fat...which I have to admit if it's done right, it's doggone good. And it is. And their corn muffins are really good. Love sweet potatoes...they make them really healthy - sweet, a little dry but not drowning in syrup...which means I probably won't get them again.

I'm glad to see that they are doing so well as they have a lot of staff behind the counter.  Hope the next time I'm there that there will be pies.
author: Dee Z.

description:
Had the pork ribs for lunch today & it was just ok.  Great french fries & good mac & cheese.

Polite & friendly staff.
author: Jacob C.

description: Love this place!  The food is mouthwateringly good and the staff is so friendly. My favorites are their St. Louis style pork ribs and Texas beef brisket.  They're nice and smoky and oh so tender.  The slaw is light and refreshing and their mac and cheese is comforting. Also love their yellow mustard based sauce.  Their other sauce is a little too runny for me, but still very tasty.  C'mon head on over already!
author: Vicente G.

description:
Dry meat, lame bread, small sides, thin sauces, overpriced. 

Was looking at the menu when I came in for a while to get a feel of what they had. The guy at the counter was saying that I must have came in from some place nearby that after asking a friend, found out is a place where you can go and smoke yourself out. While that's all fine and dandy, it was an insult considering I wasn't at the place and don't smoke. No offense to the pot smokers among us.

I'll pass.
author: Tushara S.

description:
I come here often because it is a no brainer... it is quick, easy, and I know I am always in the mood for some good meat. 

My review is specifically for the beef brisket plate... it is as good as it can get. The reason I am giving it four stars is because the first time I came here, I got tri-tip and it was just average. 

But oh this beef brisket- flavorful, fatty, juicy, and with the right combination of sauces, so so good. And best part is that two days later, it is still just as delicious. 

For my two sides I usually get the greens (to balance out the unhealthyness of eating BBQ) and Mac and Cheese. I've tried some of the other sides, but I feel that these two make a very complete BBQ meal and complement everything nicely. 

FYI-The fries are very thin... not a good potato to fryness ratio if you ask me.
author: Rona Y.

description:
So. Much. Meat.

The brisket and pork had a lot of great smokey flavor.

The sweet and sour greens were a little weird... i wasn't prepared for that tang.
author: Jeffrey H.

description:
Apparently Thursday is the (unadvertised) special for the "chicken fried chicken" sandwich.  (basically pieces of boneless fried chicken on a roll with some vinegar-based coleslaw).

I LOVE a chicken sammy (in any and all forms). This one was pretty good, my only complaint would be that there could be a bit more coleslaw (and no green or red peppers in the slaw).  I tried the sammy with each of their sauces on alternate bites and found that I liked it without the sauce the best. The chicken was nicely spiced (a teeny bit spicy) crisp, moist and a nice ratio of meat to bun.  I want to come back on a Tuesday which is apparently the unadvertised special for fried chicken.

It comes with a choice of side, I went with mac & cheese, which was fine, but not the style I most prefer. This one was a little gummy rather than creamy (sadly without a crunchy topping). 

Bottom line, to quote our Govenator---"I'll be back"
author: Amy W.

description:
Super Bowl Sunday BBQ ruined!  After reading all the reviews of various BBQ joints I decided to buy BBQ at  Memphis Minnies for this special day. We are from the south and the reason for choosing this place was -they advertise they do slow smoking and have a southern style mustard based sauce.   What a dissappointment. The mustard BBQ sauce tastes just like the cheap store bought stuff.  This is nowhere close to Southern Style BBQ. The meat (brisket) is super fatty. We bought the Texas Style and the Sweet Smoked Style, both were nearly 40% fat- I mean grossly fatty!! .
And the prices are astronomical. The sides are equally as bad. The Mac and cheese is made with a roux so it has tons of flour in it to thicken it up--just gross. The collard green come swimming in the sickeningly sweet, cheap mustard based sauce. Terrible all the way around--really bad BBQ!
author: Ann P.

description:
OK. So back in November my sister rode the BART over from SF & pays me a visit... with wonderful gifts... A bottle of "South Carolina Mustard Sauce" and a bottle of delectable, sweet, smokey, burn-your-mouth-Habanero-laced BBQ sauce called "BeezleBob's Breath", described on the label as "Stupid Hot". She tells me she got these sauces from a "bomb-ass BBQ spot in the Lower Haight called Memphis Minnies". She visited again in December and brought the "North Carolina Vinegar Sauce" from this fine establishment...

Although all 3 of these sauces are outstanding, being a "Food Pyro" (I love spicy sh*t) I used the "BBB" sauce on everything. Pork ribs, beef ribs, chicken, bacon & eggs, sandwiches... I think the kicker was during Christmas, when I marinated a top sirloin roast in it. Even though that roast was one of the last entrees out of the oven, it was the first one gone... with several victims perspiring and asking for more at the same time. 

So this past weekend I finally paid a visit to the source of this infamous sauce. Needless to say, the food was DELICIOUS. I had the "taster", where you can order your choice of 3 meats. I opted for the Brisket, Memphis sweet smoked Pork (pulled pork) and Rib tips. I initially ordered the Tri-Tip, but at the last minute changed it up to the rib tips. For my side dishes, I got the Mac & cheese and the potato salad. It also comes with a corn bread muffin. 

Both the Brisket and smoked pork were ridiculously tender... the rib tips - not so much. They weren't horrible, but lets just say I should've stuck with the Tri-Tip. My wife found a new friend in their "Texas Red sauce", which she doused her Pulled Pork Sandwich with. (we bought a bottle to take home) The potato salad was a perfect texture, with a little tangyness to it = delicious. The mac & cheese was creamy, cheesy and mmm, mmm good! The corn bread muffin was a little on the dry side but at that point I really didn't care! 

Oh , I forgot to tell you that we ordered their "Chili-cheese & Brisket Fries". WOW. That's all I can say. Just WOW... 

One thing I WISH I WOULD HAVE ORDERED: The St. Louis style Pork Ribs. My son ordered them & couldn't finish his, so... what the hell, right? After about half a swallow, I was convinced that I'm getting a whole slab the next time I go back to Memphis Minnie's. I haven't had that kind of regret since I forgot my camera that time I saw Jessica Alba in a 2 piece bikini at the Kahala Mandarin Hotel... (did I just say that out loud?) Oh well... 

So, with all the praise I've just given this place, you're probably asking yourself: "Well then why did you only give them 4 stars?" It's simple. Portion size. Since my dish was $16.95 & included 3 items, I was thinking it would be a HUGE pile smokey BBQ... eh, it was ok. 4 slices of Brisket, about 3/4 cup of pulled pork & 4 rib tips. I hate to sound like a pig but dammit, I was hungry! Then I see some guy with a plate FULL of pork ribs... so again, it's no mystery what I'm getting next time. 

Bottom line: Eat Here. If you like spicy, please try some "BeezleBob's Breath". (hint: it's not on the table)
author: Shannon F.

description: The brisket melts in your mouth! Memphis catered two xmas parties that I attended including my office.  They offer a variety of bottled bbq sauces that include vinegar and mustard.  The chicken and pulled pork has a distinct sweet smoky flavor which probably comes from the name Memphis.  Unlike anything I've tasted before but its super delish!  I was able to take some of the carnitas home.  It lasted pretty long in the fridge.  I pan fried the pork and it was twice as good.  It also had that burnt crunch to it.  I was still thinking of that brisket though.  They cook it to perfection.
author: Chris S.

description:
Love the name of the restaurant because Minnie rhymes with Matt's wife name!

"Oh Matt, nobody gives a crap!"

Ok, Matt cares about this Haight St. Barbeque and Southern food venue. So how come he's only been here a few times?

Matt has been here three times to be exact, and all three times it has been on a Wednesday. For the restaurant, every Wednesday is Pastrami Wednesdays. For $8.95, you get a Pastrami sandwich with a choice of sides, and another $1.50 for a fountain soda.  The Pastrami was tender, but dry. So Matt added their original Texas Red Sauce to moisten the meat and excite the taste buds. Matt chose fries as his sides. The skinny fries were spiced really well and complimented well with the same Texas Sauce. 

Matt enjoyed the Texas Red Sauce so much that he paid an additional $6.50 for a bottle of his own to take home. Another favorite sauce in his condiment section like the Sriracha Hot-sauce, Tapatio Sauce and Dave's Insanity hot-sauce to name a few. As the coined-phrase goes according to Emeril Lagasse, the Texas Red Sauce would taste great on a sole of a shoe.
author: Matt G.

description:
I'm a sucker for ribs.  I love them when they're so tender they just gracefully fall off the bone - no effort required.  I also love, warm flaky cornbread muffins and cheesy soft mac and cheese.  

I was looking forward to all of the above when I ordered my St. Louis style smoked pork ribs with a side of slaw and mac and cheese but I got none of the above.  The ribs were dry and tasteless, the slaw tasted like it could have been from KFC, and the mac and cheese was hard and cold in spots.  Really disappointing considering I spent $16 for this whole shebang.  I appreciate the fact that you can get in and out of this place quickly on a busy Friday night, but that's about it for pros for me.
author: Jean A.

description:
Oh man, this place does BBQ right. Everything we ordered was just delicious. 

We ordered:
-Texas Beef Briskey (smoked 18 hours!) - $15
-Two Way Combo with pork and beef ribs - $16

They both came with 2 sides so we got the mac and cheese and corn bread. The mac and cheese was SO good!! Too bad they come in tiny little sauce cups - it's okay...portion control! The corn bread is forgettable; was kinda dry and you have to ask for butter if you want it.

Note: I made the mistake of asking for a knife for the brisket. The main chef (maybe owner) left the kitchen to come to our table and give me a lengthy lecture on how disappointed he was that I asked for a knife when his brisket is super tender. Damn. Well, at least he knows I won't ever make that mistake again! Haha...all good though..we were joking about it a few minutes later.

The desserts looked incredible too: Scratch Pecan Pie, Banana Pudding, Fried Peach Pie. OMG. All slices are $4.95

Seating is a bit tight so plan ahead if you're coming with a large party.
author: Yee-Shing W.

description:
Memphis Minnie's is a great place to visit for the full experience, and CRIKEY they now deliver!!!  We ordered in for a delicious Friday night treat.

It's a $25 minimum for delivery, but that's pretty easy to reach - what with delicious sides that you'll definitely want a pint of, and tasty mains.  Their sides impressively don't taste oily, but are more tart with vinegar, and definitely remind me of my visits to Memphis and Mississippi.  I had a delicious Southern Star sandwich, and appreciated that it came with two kinds of sauce on the side.  The combination of Southern home-style-ness along with CA ingredients makes Memphis Minnie's one of my two favorite BBQ places I've been to (the other is Tupelo's in Cambridge, MA).  I absolutely love barbecue sauce as a condiment, but Memphis Minnie's makes ingredients shine such that one wouldn't want to douse them in sauce.

The only down sides to the delivery experience:  they can't deliver sweet tea, and I should have mentioned over the phone that I needed a copy of the receipt since the delivery guy couldn't give me one.
author: Sohini R.

description: I love myself BBQ, but found this place to be just okay.  Too expensive for what it is (it was ~$20 for a plate of chicken, 2 sides, and a beer).  The sides were decent (except for the sweet potatoes), but I didn't like the chicken or the sauces.
author: Ryan S.

description: Upgraded to 5 stars! Manager Tom messaged me to apologize for the error and to make up for the missing slaw, we have a credit for a new one. We will be back for sure. Thanks so much!
author: B W.

description:
You know what I got no beef with this place? Wait a minute, I did get the beef here. Like all beer swilling, manly men, I love me some BBQ. Thank goodness for Memphis Minnie's for offering up some good ol' BBQ in the Haight area.

Okay I will admit it, I've never tried "authentic" Midwest or Southern style BBQ. I only know of the Northern California interpretations. 

As far as I know, Memphis Minnie's only serves up the slow cooked and smokey good stuff. Whether you choose to go here or just order in (you can easily order online from Grubhub), you are in for some good and tasty meaty eats. 

They serve up fall off the bone ribs (Texas style, whatever that means) as well as a smokey, moist, and fatty (thus flavorful) beef brisket. I am partial to the beef brisket which is just sliced slabs of meat. It comes with two good dipping sauces (a BBQ style sauce and a spicy mustard sauce), but I prefer my meat just plain. I'd rather not let the flavor of the sauce overpower the taste of the meat.  

The sides here good as well. Not a huge fan of their corn bread muffin, which is too dry for my taste. But I really like the sweet potatoes here. This is the perfect sweet (and relatively healthy) complement to any BBQ dish. 

It's hard to hate BBQ unless you have no soul (but you probably have bigger things to worry about like eternal damnation, but let's not go there). You can't go wrong with the offerings here at Memphis Minnie's. This is a great place to eat if you are in the mood for some real deal authentic (Northern California style) BBQ.
author: Allan Y.

description: Certainly not Kansas City BBQ, but definitely one of the best in SF. Excellent service here as well. Would recommend the Southern Star!
author: Michele K.

description:
BBQ.  Best I've found in the city, and I've looked.

Oh ... you want more info than that ... ok

Get the beans.  Firm beans in flavorful sauce with chunks of bacon, not a mushy mess.  Exceptionally good.
I think their standout meat items are the sliced varieties, the tri-tip and brisket.  I'm betting it has to do with that nifty black oven-smoker-giant iron thing in the front of the joint.  Great flavor with out without sauce, though they do serve a selection of sauces - 2 types of red sauce, a mustard sauce, and a spicy sauce.  All are good.

Downside - call ahead.  They do run out of things, and occasionally don't open random days.  Parking is always fun.
author: J P.

description: Best bbq in the city. The chicken sandwich and the briquets are terrific. The staff is amazing and friendly.
author: Celine T.

description: Love this place. The fried chicken is awesome when they have it, as is the brisket and occasionally some crazy good Pastrami. Good corn bread and greens too!
author: Chris H.

description:
Came here and expected greatness! but got disappointment  =( .. We ordered a 3 way , bbq chicken, ribs and tri tip? sweet potato fries, corn and everything else that sounded yummy. 
  In my opinion you have to dress the BBQ up with the sauce,.. I don't like BBQ that's drenched in sauce. I like BBQ that's seasoned well with little to no BBQ sauce needed.  

The place isn't the cleanest either. and if you need to use the restroom, I suggest you wait till you get home.
author: sharlyn g.

description:
Real Barbecue! 

It's hard to find a place that is willing to go out of their way to cook great barbecue in the Bay Area. Memphis Minnie's is that place. 

We've been here several times and have tried different items. The brisket is divine - the crust, the flavor. Mmm! I think I'm hungry again. The Texas Big Beef Ribs - I had been looking for those forever, soooo good and cooked just right. The Andouille sausage, the best I've ever had. 

Word to the wise - NEVER ask for baby back ribs. I had the pleasure of witnessing the bearded man behind the counter give an aptly dressed yuppie a quick lesson in Barbecue 101. This isn't a place of bottomless, flavorless ribs. This is the REAL DEAL. 

I wasn't too keen on the sides with the exception of the corn muffin. I skip them and go straight for the main course. 

Know what to expect - this is a no fuss barbecue joint serving authentic smoked barbecue. 

Parking is hard to come by so expect to walk a few blocks.
author: Cassie M.

description: This place turns animals into cannibals and vegetarians into animals.  I was personally pulled in by the pulled pork, but the sweet jesus sweet potatoes, the tangy & tart cole slaw, the southern-style fried chicken and pecan pie have my Kansas City ass coming back toward this surf just to get a tasty reminder of home turf.
author: Russell C.

description:
This Saturday, I hit up Memphis Minnie's for their Saturday special: Southern Smoked Fried Chicken. Sweet, smokey with just the right crunch, this has to be some of the best fried chicken I've ever laid my lips upon. 
Their potato salad is mediocre; their macaroni a bit bland. But this chicken, oh this chicken, is a masterpiece worth every penny; every calorie; every pimple that may surface the next morning. 
And this was just their fried chicken. This is a BBQ house. I can't wait to make out with their pork ribs.
author: Rhys A.

description: I got the Southern smoked AND fried chicken with the mustard BBQ sauce, and it was amazing! Leave room for the banana pudding and sweet tea!
author: Amanda H.

description:
The colorful signage, cute pig stuff and location in a cool neighborhood drew me into Memphis Minnie's tonight... I was with a friend who often orders the chicken sandwich and really liked it so, we decided to give their other menu items a try too.  

We ordered the brisket sandwich which was dry (good bread though) and the Saint Louis style ribs, which were tasty and tender but, also a lil dry on the ends.  They are served without sauce, which I prefer, and your chosen sides come in lil bowls on the side.  We had the beans, which were not cooked enough and a bit hard/chewy, the potato salad, which I actually really liked, and the sweet potatoes, which were tasty though so sweet, they should have been on the dessert menu.  

Now for the sauces... of the 4 offered, a vinegar, mustard, bbq and hot sauce, I only liked the mustard sauce enough to eat with my food.  Sad, I know.  Apparently the sauce that's on the chicken sandwich is different and better... I wish they'd have had it out on the table.  

All-in-all, I wouldn't seek-out Memphis Mini's but I'd go back to try other things if friends wanted to meet there.  My friend still supports his chicken sandwich and the ribs, potato salad and sweet potatoes were good enough to reorder probably.   On my own however, I'd rather check out a new unknown joint... it's part of my quest for the best BBQ on the west coast.  :)

Might see ya there.
author: Susan D.

description:
I will admit I'm no expert on BBQ, but I don't think this place is as fabulous as everyone says it is.  The meat does fall off the bone - yes, but wasn't very moist.  The sauces on the table were great, but shouldn't this place be about the meat?

I shared the 2 meat choice combo, which we had brisket and pork ribs.  Our sides were fries and mac-n-cheese.  The sides were all right, but nothing fantastic.  I thought the mac-n-cheese was quiet boring.  The cornbread muffin was nice and the cornmeal gave it great texture. 

Perhaps going on a Sunday night isn't the best time?  I don't know - the food didn't leave me skipping and smiling with joy.
author: Lisa R.

description:
Went here on Sat 1/6/07 but I had a cold so couldn't taste my food all that well.

We decided to eat here from Fremont cuz of lots of good reviews I've read before and Check Please which re-aired again.

Parking is pretty hard in SF, we didn't find the restaurant first so we ended up parking like 8 blocks further then planned, oh well.

Was meeting up with a friend, but since I was getting hungry decided we should get the table first.  That's not how it's done.  You have to order the food first, then when a table opens up they let you have it.  You gotta wait for your order when they shout out your name.  Communal sharing of a table is in order since it's a small place.

Food we tried:
corn muffin-gritty .75. wish it came w/ butter
Southern Star 1/2 Texas brisket & half Memphis sweet pork sandwich w/ a side of mac & cheese $8.25-pretty good, though I used lots of Texas Red Sauce to drown my sandwich.  Mac & cheese-runny, just ok.
scatch pecan pie $3.95-pretty good
sweet ice tea $1.75-just like drinking sugar water, no tea taste at all.

Food was ok, but it could be due to my cold.  Might give it another chance one day, not in a hurry.

Time visited: 1
author: Ann L.

description:
Oh, pigs.

I actually don't care because when you see pictures of pigs in and around a Haight street restaurant, you know it's going to be good.

Hence Memphis Minnie's you have pretty awesome BBQ.
BBQ style Fries are a must-have. Not joking, there were four of us who ordered plates with 2 sides each and we still managed to obliterate a large order of the Fries appetizer. Shut up, Diet, you can wait until I'm done.

I've had better BBQ at another place so I can't give the last star. But customer service is kick ass and helpful, atmosphere is very laid back and the sweet BBQ pork (not ribs) is ironic because it tastes like damn awesome BBQ but feels like a pillow in your mouth. That means it's super soft.

Share a plate and do a bit of pre-gaming before barhopping on Haight. It'll be the most productive thing you'll ever do!
author: Joanne S.

description: We use to live California and this was my favorite place to eat. After moving away my number 1 craving is Memphis Minnie's "Pulled" Spicy Chicken Sandwich. Whenever my husband goes into town for business he brings me home one but it has been too long since I had one. Please open a shop in Colorado. I will drive great distances to eat your yummy food again!!! It is NEVER a let down even after craving for a year or more. Always taste just like I remember and craved!
author: Meghan P.

description:
The meat has a good smokey flavor to it. If you get the sandwiches, it's pretty much a simple meat and bread formula. The various kinds of sauces on the tables can give it more of a kick 

I had the pork sandwich and I was expecting a slightly bigger portion for what I paid for. A big disappointed here! When I took my first bite I noticed the smokiness, but after a while I realized that's about the only kind of flavor I'm tasting besides the special BBQ sauce they had. I tried some of my friends' food and I can say the same about their orders as well. Although, they seemed to have enjoyed this place much more than I did. They said they would come back. I would too, but maybe not as eager as they did. 

I will give them props on their customer service. They were friendly and kind of joked around a little, which I liked.

If I do some back I'm going to order some of the fries. I looked at the table next to ours and that's all I could focus on.
author: Justin C.

description:
Came here Wednesday afternoon and no one was in in line, ordered the brisket and two sides (mac and cheese and sweet potatoes).  

The sweet potatoes was the best I ever had, soft, juicy, and wet.  My whole fucking plate was awesome.  I would return.
author: Doug F.

description:
Okay, fine I get it. I grew up in California. I'm not accustomed to "real" BBQ. Screw that. This is some of the best BBQ I have ever had in the city. It always fills me up, I'm always excited to scarf it down, and most of all, the service is top notch. 

I feel SF food scene has forgone the need for quality service. Counter service restaurants are no exception.

Memphis Minnie's is the kind of casual place you walk into tand they ask your name not only for your order, but so they can remember it for the next time you come in. They truly want to take care of you. They don't have any kind of elitism or surly manner. They believe in good food and good people. Look around the restaurant at all the swag they have been given, and the drawings people have left. It has such a fun vibe. 

The Chipotle mayo in kind of insane too.
author: Devon C.

description:
Delicious but inconsistent.

First order was amazing, more food than I could eat, everything was flavorful, hot, and delicious. The tri-tip was heavenly and the brisket was on point (love the bark). Mac+cheese is okay and the greens are better than I've had elsewhere. Delivery in less than 40 min. Success!

So I decided to order the very next day. It was barely a 2 star effort.  Brisket was 80% fat and the amount of tri-tip was paltry, food was lukewarm. It was like they were scraping the bottom of the pan for my order, and I was disappointed and left hungry. 

Ordered a third time just to make sure because deep inside I'm a fat kid with a BBQ fetish, and the food was killer and I am happy. 

On a separate note, I appreciate how technology has made ordering food easy like Yelp, GrubHub and eat24, but nothing beats picking up the phone and speaking to a friendly, patient individual, someone who actually wants your business. Refreshing.
author: Tae L.

description:
I hope the owners of Memphis Minnies finally listen to someone. The sauce. Is. Too. Thin.

I love Memphis Minnies more than almost anything on that block of the Haight (aside from Molotovs next door), but I'll be damned if they dont use the worst barbeque sauce I've ever tasted.

Try the Minnie's Maxie Burger. Heart attack.
author: Brendan M.

description:
I appreciate Memphis Minnies for being true to themselves. Not the best I've had but they are doing their own thing and doing it from scratch.
 I like the southern star sandwich (half sweet pork, half brisket; with side). Daily specials and bike delivery if you're in the hood.
author: Edmund C.

description:
I ate here often, the last time I went,  I was served a meal that was not even eatable. What pisses me off even more, I left a tip after I paid. Since you pay first then get your food later.
I will never go back. I am sure they could care less since they have tons of business from the local hipsters who are scared to go to black owned BBQ places.
author: Bob b.

description: After reading some of the reviews I was hesitant to try Memphis but wanted BBQ in the hood and had been more disappointed with 4505 lately. Got take out quick and easy. Only had the brisket and sausage. It was very good considering the price. Only had greens which were hella different than I have ever had but were great. The sauces were good but the meat didn't need them. Will clearly go back.
author: mike w.

description: Pork ribs and beef brisket dry and tasteless--is there a decent BBQ restaurant in SF??
author: C L.

description:
I thought I ate at Memphis Minnie's (MM) when they had a location on Polk by Russian Hill. Now I'm thinking it was just a dream because I can't find it now and for some reason I remember really liking it!! :-O

Fast forward to the present . . .

I have eaten at the current Haight St location 3 times and have been severely disappointed each time. The meat has always been dry, tough and not particularly flavorful. 

The brisket. Dry 
The beef ribs. Dry
The pork ribs. Dry

Dry BBQ != Dry Meat!!

I don't know why I've gone back . . . OK I do know why. It's people raving about the place and telling me to give it another chance. I even went with a MM raver and he admitted that "it must be an off day." Apparently I always pick the off days . . .

Well, 3 strikes and you're out Minnie.  Make that 4 strikes. They catered a function at work and the food was blah there too.

I'm giving it 2 stars. 1 for their present day suckage and +1 for my fond memory of the old location . . . a dining experience which may or may not have actually happened.

------------------

Update: it wasn't a dream!! There was a Polk St location!! ;-) http://www.ibiblio.org/lineback/bbq/jnt5f.htm
author: Andrew C.

description:
On a lazy Sunday, my boyfriend and I were trying to figure out what to eat for dinner. "BBQ sounds SO good right now", he said. One place immediately came to mind, and thankfully for us, it's close by - Memphis Minnie's.

I had the Memphis sweet smoked pork, it was good but definitely needed 'something'. I wish it was a pulled pork sandwich, but overall it was good. I liked the BBQ sauce that it came with, the mustard sauce not so much. I got a side of potato salad and I really enjoyed that. My boyfriend got the smoked pork ribs and he absolutely devoured it - meaning it was pretty delicious! He had the coleslaw for his side, and he said it was okay. 

After all this food, of course we had to end it with dessert. After a lot of back and forth between getting the pecan pie or the fried peach pie, we went with the pecan. It was amazingly delicious. It was sweet and literally melted in your mouth, the crust was crispy and crumbly. Add the whip cream, you won't be disappointed!

Overall, I enjoyed my meal and would go back to Memphis Minnie's, but I've had better.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Came here for the first time last week for dinner.  The St Louis ribs were fantastic.  It's not very often that you can find a place where the ribs are good enough to eat plain.  I love the multiple varieties of sauce that you can mix and match to get your own flavor.  The mac n cheese is REALLY good.  The downside...they will charge you extra if you request both of your side dishes to be mac n cheese (this extra charge is not shown on the menu).  

Although good, the food is pricey for the amount that you get.
author: Emmy G.

description:
[3.5]

This is a nice small place on Haight Street, where everything is cool and different. As soon as you walk in, to the left (to the left) is the cooks station. To the right, is the seating area, which is very limited on seating capacity. My family and I planned on dining inside, but because they were crowded we opted to take out. Fine. Seating is on a first come, first serve basis so if you really want to sit down, swoop on it! 

The walls and counters of this place were adorned with pigs galore of all sorts: t-shirts, figurines, banks, pictures, etc. It looked like a piggy collection on display. Cute. Different. Nice. Fitting. 

The menu offers a nice selection; pulled pork, chicken (pulled or smoked), ribs, and more. You can also order by the pound if you're feelin' one specific meat more than another. I ordered a "pulled" spicy chicken sandwich with a side of potato salad. I couldn't wait to eat it because I was curious as to what "pulled" chicken tasted like, since I love pulled pork. Well....I opened up my box and found my sandwich nicely compiled, not sloppy, nice mound of potato salad and a small container of bbq sauce and mustard sauce.

First bite: mmmm, omg that's good. Kinda dry, but good. I like that flavor, what is it?
Second bite: yummm, flavorful, and tasty!! why isn't this spicy? (mustard sauce is starting to drip)
Third bite: I like this.... I really like this sandwich. Wish it had more kick. I like pulled chicken, love that bbq flavor! 

Oh, and can't forget the potato salad between all my bites, tasted nice and light, but too vinegar-ish for my taste. I also had dry corn bread. Yes, DRY corn bread. I enjoyed my pulled spicy chicken sandwich, although it wasn't spicy at all. Whatsoever.  But I will definitely be back here again.
author: Kimberly H.

description: it was sunday morning at 12:30 pm when we tried to eat hear with my wife. the bbq pork with ribs was good which i ordered. And for my wife is the bbq braised beef. it was ok, sorry to say but i was not wow!. and after we ate my wife and I our stomach aches that is a wow! i dnt know from where but for sure its not from the bbq coz i saw its not only us who is eating that bbq inside that restaurant. Until now im still figuring it out which from those food I ate that make our stomach ached.anyway, overall experienced was not to comeback anymore. maybe ill try to find another bbq house that will mill make me wow!
author: Dexter B.

description:
Great food, great service, great times. 

Looking for great BBQ in the city don't miss out
author: Brian L.

description: Pretty good, when they first opened I was so greatful for a nice bbq joint in the hood.  But then I realized that their style of bbq was somehow not my cup of tea.  Seems too healthy or lean or something.  Still, I always enjoyed my meals, just wish it was a bit more rich and addictive.
author: Patrick S.

description: I went here with a friend when the place was empty, so I don't know what it is like when crowded, but I really enjoyed my meal. The St. Louis ribs were delicious as was the mac-n-cheese side and the cornbread muffin. Choice of hot sauces was solid. Cashier was really nice and fun to engage with. Place is pricey, but it was well worth it. I'll be back for sure.
author: Larry K.

description:
Meh. The barbeque was just okay. The experience started off with a hipster cashier's smart ass remark when I asked him.."What are the specialities?" and he said, "Barbeque." 
The meat on the ribs was fall-off-the-bone only because it was super dried out. The tri-tip was just okay, the pulled pork was just right. However, the sauces just plain sucked. Too Thin. Not one that you can say you like over the other...the Texas sauce had cumin in it so it tasted like it had an Indian food taste to it.  Really..just okay.
author: Darren J W.

description:
Decent solid BBQ in a city not known for it's BBQ other than that of the Korean or Brazilian kind (and even then, not so much).  I've been there a couple of times now and while certainly not the worst BBQ I've had (that honor currently goes to some BBQ joint at DFW airport...seriously, DFW?  I'm in freakin' TEXAS and you can't get a good BBQ place in your airport?), it does make me wish I had easier access to my old place in Atlanta.

I've had the pulled pork, in sandwich form, and the brisket, in plate form.  The pulled pork is pretty good, tender and juicy enough, though it still requires a bit of splash of sauce to help moisten it up.  Unfortunately, tonight's brisket was quite literally half hit, half miss.  The slices that had a good bit of fat fell apart at a touch and melted in my mouth.  The other slices looked like they had previously had the fat there, but either it was all cooked out or this was an old brisket that had been left to dry, as the meat was dry and flaky...and very much not in a good way.

Other downside, is that the wait can seem to be rather long, which is a little annoying considering that most of this stuff is already cooked and done.  Sure, you might have to slice up some brisket, but does slicing up brisket and scooping out some sides and picking up a cornbread muffin really take 20 minutes?

So for the wait, and time, down a star from 4 to 3, but props to making me occasionally wish I was living back in the south...if only just for the food.
author: Mark C.

description:
"What did the pig say when it was hot out?"....."I'm bacon!" 

Hahah...love it. This was the joke on the table where I sat while I enjoyed my two plate combo (beef brisket and tri tip with a side of sweet potato, corn muffin, and mac and cheese). The two plate combo was perfect for two, I think I would have definitely been in a food coma if I ate the entire thing myself.
author: Debbie C.

description: I don't know if it's Memphis style or just this place, but it just doesn't do it for me. Been by a number of times and always feel like I paid to much or I should have tried something else. Sandwiches are ok, sides ok. I feel like it's great for out of towners to stumble in, but when i got time to think about options I never choose them.
author: John O.

description:
I've wanted to try out Memphis Minnie's ever since I got hellbent on having ribs one day in January (after a 10 year bbq hiatus, which was broken at Asqew, more on that later...). I had high hopes. I was excited. I was ready gorge on meat. I really wanted to try the Texas beef ribs, but they ran out. The cashier was friendly and made suggestions for other beef related dishes, but I ended up ordering the St.Louis pork ribs instead. 

The sides are surprisingly small, they put them in those little cups that are sometimes used to hold sauce or dressing. The corn bread was pretty good, I wish it was warm though. As for the ribs, I got a pretty large portion. Unfortunately several of the ribs were really dried out and tough making them inedible. The ribs that weren't dried out were pretty good, but not amazing. I had really high hopes for Memphis Minnie's, but I must say I was let down : [ 

If you're seeking out good barbecue, Asqew Grill on upper Haight has way better fall-off-the-bone ribs and larger sides.
author: Paige C.

description:
The BBQ is just so/so.  I had the Brisket and it wasn't bad  but it sure wasn't very good either.  It was a bit dry, overly smoked and poorly;y trimmed.  It had a stiff overly cooked texture and was a meager portion for $15. Pass on the brisket if you are eating here, the pulled pork looks like a better bet.  The baked beans were really a mess.  The flavor was very nice and the pieces of meat mixed in were good, a little watery but that was ok. What wasn't OK was that the actual beans, they were totally under cooked.  Hard little balls of under cooked beans are not tasty nor delicious. The coleslaw was good, no mayo just a nice vinegar slaw that was fresh and crispy.  
I may give it another try but I am not in hurry.
author: Grant H.

description: If u want dry tasteless meat then go ahead and order from here. My boyfriend said they had good bbq so we ordered from here. Man were we disappointed. We got a taster combo with chicken brisket and ribs. Everything tasted like it was burnt, 3 days old and thrown in the microwave including the cornbread. So gross. We called to complain and the manager was super cool, took care of us and that's the only reason they get two stars. Good customer service! Dry burnt bbq...
author: Elise H.

description: Good food, not great, but if you want great BBQ it is not to be found in SF, avoid the beef ribs.  Mustard sauce is a+++,  potato salad and greens are flavorfull
author: Patrick S.

description:
I used to live right down the street from this place, and I am insanely sad that I'm not 5 mins away anymore.

Minnies is a little piece of bbq heaven. The staff is awesome, the food is incredible. I highly recommend the brisket chili cheese fries. The ribs are to die for, the pull pork sandwich is delicious... honestly I've tried a good portion of their menu and the more I try, the more I fall in love with this place. 

The restaurant is small, and seat yourself, some see this as a draw back, which I totally understand if you're coming from a ways away... but the food is well worth the trip, and if you have to take it down to a neighboring bar like danny coyles, so be it. 

Minnie's you have won my heart with your pork fat goodness.
author: Shawna M.

description:
As far as bar-b-que places in this city go, Memphis Minnie's is a pretty good choice. They have a wide selection of food and a fun staff behind the counter.

however, its always packed, so if you dont want to wait for a table you'd be better off calling ahead and getting take out, and its a bit pricey for the portions that you get. 

In the end though, its tasty, hardy, and a great local business
author: Ryan M.

description: We have been looking for a good barbecue place because the one we go to which is out of this world is close for renovation in DailyCity! We found this on yelp and it looks good by all the pictures. We got there which you have to order which was fine with us.  The place was not pack at all! I ordered the chicken and it was dry and not real barbecue flavor! It was not even real rub smokin barbecue flavor. The brisket my husband had was dry and fatty! I could of made it at home! Not worth the price! The employees seems like depress and couldn't wait to get home!
author: Pineapple P.

description:
A visiting cousin and I stopped in at Memphis Minnie's last night and we both ordered the special, pork tips with two sides and cornbread. The sides were good (I had the greens, which were flavorful and pleasantly vinegary, and the mac & cheese, which were also flavorful) and the cornbread - corn muffins, actually - was quite good. Sweeter than I typically like, myself, but quite tasty with a pleasant bite to the texture. 

The main event - the pork tips - wasn't as good. They were actually pretty disappointing. Tough and dry, it was clear they were the left-overs from ribs that hadn't been cooked long enough, at too high a temperature (I'm not complaining about the tips being cuts from other, larger cuts, but being as dried out and tough as they were, they shouldn't have been served). Being from Arkansas, I grew up with some pretty darned good barbecue and, sides aside, this just wasn't in the same league.

The service was great: friendly, fast, and efficient. Nice beer selection, and the sauces, available at the table, were full of flavor and very enjoyable. 

But that meat. Man. Really?
author: Eric B.

description: Having lived in the south and mid west for 30+ years, I can honestly say the best BBQ in SF so far.  I have been multiple times and they have not disappointed.  The smoked meats are tender and cooked just right.  The customer service is always friendly and a pleasure to deal with.  Only wish they were bigger with more seating.
author: ben c.

description: Great barbeque for SF.  Have been eating here for years and am rarely disappointed.  Fries have a great seasoning and the mac and cheese is very tasty.  I always order the pulled pork.   It is nice having different sauce options at the table.
author: Dennis C.

description:
No, no, no.  I'm sorry, but my idea of a pulled pork sandwich is not a bunch of dry meat on bread.  And the whole cole slaw thing was some kind of weird pickled nightmare - with chunks of carrots and red peppers, no less.  As my friend Al might say, "That _wasn't_ cole slaw."

This place made me mad.  Especially having to pay top dollar for a side that came in a container the size of a Nyquil cup.

This is someone else's idea of bbq.  Not mine.  Boo.
author: Sondra H.

description:
I enjoy good smoked brisket and pork baby back ribs, so when yesterday I got cravings for the BBQ, I already had idea to check this place out, not that I have never been there - no, please! I ate there, but it was during my first days in SF, and I barely remember my past experience.

So I was rushing to get my portion of protein, when we got there - I totally loved the atmosphere, looks like "hole in the wall joint", has it's unique character.

My fiancee ordered brisket and chili French fries and 2 sweet teas (I miss South!), and we decided to split it, since it's always too much food for us. (by the way we paid $30 including tip - I'll say too much for that taste and quality).

So brisket was good, but fries...hm, I wouldn't say so, first they were over fried, actually burned, and had the taste of refried oil, you know, that harsh flavor? 

I liked their sauces, but everything had taste of vinegar to it.

If you go there to get just meat -- it's your place!

P.S. I am still fan of "Tommy's Joint" :)
author: Anelya S.

description:
My house in San Francisco is 100 feet up the hill from Memphis Minnie's and the woodsmoke drives me crazy every Wednesday morning. This is seriously good Texas-style BBQ which will be marred if you eat there by Minnie's habit of serving it on a crusty sourdough french roll. Fortunately, the solution is simple: buy a pound of brisket to go (check your order before you leave; they've been known to slip in a hunk o' fat) and serve it on a soft bun from Safeway as it was meant to be eaten.

If you like pork, try the rib tip plate which is almost always on special and a great value. The sides are way expensive relative to the meat and not distinguished except for the wonderful sour slaw; fortunately the recipe has been published (go to sfgate.com and do a search for "slaw, glorious slaw" in the full archive) so you can make your own.
author: Otis M.

description: Let me tell you somethin': We just got home from back country Texas, on a serious BBQ tear, and it's like we never left. Stellar BBQ!
author: Dana G.

description:
I came here for the first time a couple of years ago and I remember the food being pretty good, the bbq sauce being really spicy (that always scores extra points with me) the bbq seasoned fries being spectacular and the service being great. 

The latter still holds true and maybe my palate has changed since then but on my recent visit, the brisket and pulled pork seemed to be dry, fries seemed a bit soggy and the spicy bbq sauce just didn't hit the spot. 

We always order a plate to share in order to get  variety. The portion is generous enough for me and my boyfriend to share and we'll have some left over. 

I don't think there are many casual bbq joints like this in the city so I'll continue to  come back but I'll try other things on the menu. I hear the chicken sandwich is a hit and the corn bread is wonderful!

The place is really cute and I've never seen so many variations of pigs on display. It's fun looking around at all the items they have collected around the restaurant and the staff is warm, friendly and very attentive.
author: Cyndi G.

description:
MMmm... smoked bacon pecan brittle.... never have I ever had something so succulent and surprising. I have an extreme sweet tooth and I think this brittle should be categorized under a new tastebud : baconlicious. 

The surgeon general should warn that after eating the brittle, possible side effects include addiction, cavities, sugar highs, and extreme cravings.

A bit on the pricey side but the friendly staff and kitschy feel go well with the bottomless BBQ sauce that is supplied on the Gingham covered tables. The ribs were great, and I'm a big fan of the mac n cheese.
author: Stephanie M.

description: This Place has the better BBQ of San Francisco ! The brisket, chicken and ribs are delicious! This is as good as it gets for BBQ in sf
author: Lisa N.

description:
I just realized I haven't reviewed Minnie's yet.  I've had takeout and eat-in, and I love everything about both.  Love the meats, the sides, the sauces, and the vibe.  -Plus, they have one of the cutest websites I've ever seen. 

If they'd let me move in, I'd live here.
author: Earline A.

description:
"I want my baby back, baby back, baby back riiibbs and barbecue sauce!"  

OK eventhough that's the song for Chili's, Memphis Minnies is what I'm talking about!

City Church had a special lunch after service today and they were serving bbq from Memphis Minnies. We had tart and tangy cole slaw, Texas beef brisket (smoked for 18 hours), Memphis sweet smoked pork,  beans, and corn bread muffins.

Everything was so tasty! The beef brisket and cole slaw were my favorites!
author: Helen Y.

description:
Best brisket I've found to date in the Bay Area.  Well, apart from my mom's, but that's not bbq, it's Passover Jewish style... but I digress...

The brisket has that salty, seasoned crusty texture that I crave.  The meat is moist and tender.

I'm not a pork ribs gal, but the beef ribs are darn good.

And the banana pudding - with nilla wafers - is a guilty pleasure.
author: Melanie K.

description: I love BBQ and Memphis Minnie's didn't disappoint. We went with the 3 meat platter, with two sides. Two of us feasted on brisket, ribs and chorizo with mac n' cheese and collards as our sides. The meat was tender inside with a delicate char on the outside. Infused with distinct --but not overpowering-- smokiness, this was what I needed to satisfy my BBQ jones. The collards are unique, perhaps not for everyone since they bend more to the sweet side of things vs. the meaty/porky flavour I'm more familiar with. The Sweet Potato Pie was a great finish.
author: Paul K.

description:
I was really pumped to come to Memphis Minnie's because of its rep. It looked pretty legit, with the fun, funky decor as well as the freshly baked corn muffins still in their sheets...mmm.

In my party, we had the crispy fried onion strings ($5), a two-meat combo of brisket and ribs ($17), a tri-tip sandwich ($10), and a fried chicken meal, around $12. For sides, we got an assortment of mac 'n' cheese, greens, and beans.

I was expecting something special, and unfortunately it was a letdown. The meats were good, solid, but nothing special. The onion strings were delicious and well seasoned, perfectly cooked. That's the only reason I'm giving 3 stars instead of 2. 

The side were a huge letdown. The corn muffins that looked so fresh were hella mushy and spongey. The collard greens were bland but had way too much vinegar, they were sour as hell. The mac and cheese was cold and had a weird, sharp taste to it. The baked beans were ok, but how do you mess those up.

IMO, the sides are just as important as the barbecue itself--so I won't be coming back.
author: Kris Q.

description:
4th of July means BBQ right? Appropriately, this is where my friends and I decided to stop by on the 4th. It's a rather small place, with 8 or so tables lined with heavy plastic (in anticipation of messy BBQ eatage), with fun little drawings underneath that customers leave behind.

So you get in line, all the while taking in the delicious scent of BBQ, and by the time its your turn to order, you want to eat EVERYTHING. Which is exactly what I did. I ordered the "Minnie's Taster", which is THREE meats and 2 sides. I was super sad they were out of beef ribs, so I got pork ribs, brisket, and the Andouille sausage, along with fries and baked beans.

I had really high expectations, and some of what I ate delivered. The brisket was deliciously fatty, and fell right apart on the plate. The sausage was also really delicious, flavorful, and spicy. The fries were OK, kinda like the cajun fries at Five Guys, but not as good. The ribs though, were quite bland, and didn't taste like much of anything except meat (and tough meat at that).

Gotta give an extra star though for the service. The guy at the register, Steven, had his staff in order, even reprimanding one of the guys while we were ordering for being lazy. When I finished my meal and went up to tip him, he actually remembered my name! And the bus boys who also prepped the tables for us were very accommodating and helpful.

Even if the food wasn't the best, it was good enough, and I'd totally go back for the great dining experience.
author: Kevin T.

description:
Order the brisket!  Its my favorite brisket in the city.  Lily's is ok but too fatty and tough for me.  Memphis Minnie's brisket is tasty and melts in your mouth.  Ribs however I prefer Lily's which always causes a problem.  I end up getting ribs from Lily's with two sides and cake and then go over to Memphis and get brisket with two sides and then pass out on the couch with my cat chomping on the ribs.  Its delicious but definitely a night ender.  Although I did manage to get up after 5 hours and go see Rebirth Brass Band at the Independent.  Its a miracle that even happened.  

I do need to say something though.  All the pig decor freaks me out.  I like pigs, they are cute!  They used to be my favorite animal and I refused to eat them but then my mouth got a taste of Carnitas and it was over.  Pig for life!  But, do you want to stare at a cute little pig while you're eating it, not so sure.
author: Kristin Marie S.

description:
I went with high expectations, but left feeling a little disappointed.  I tried the beef brisket.  It was perfectly tender, but lacked flavor.  The sauces on the side just didn't give the umph.

The best side there, hands down, was the smoked beans.  It was sweet and sassy, just the way I like it.

Overall, the both the portions and the flavors could have been bigger.  With so many options in the city, MM just didn't cut it for me.
author: Stella K.

description:
My Husband & I ordered from here tonight for the first time. We had them deliver.. and HOLY CRAP these guys are fast! It took like 25 minutes for them to deliver to us... I was chatting a bit with the delivery dude, and apparently they *bicycle* all the deliveries. Massive respect to those guys!

The portions were HUGE and the price was totally reasonable. Two rib plates (with 2 sides each), plus the delivery charge & taxes- came to a total of $36.  

Order the BBQ Fries. They're delicious.

One star taken off because generally I like 'saucy' ribs.. and Minnies seems to mostly do the more dry-rubbed variety. They do send along two little sides of house BBQ sauces. Neither of them really did it for my husband and I. Whatever though- still yummy!

I still can't get over how fast the delivery came... Jesus. Tip your delivery guy well!
author: Tamara B.

description: I have learned to somewhat dislike BBQ ribs in America over the last 30 years of living here. The meat is often very poor quality, often overly spicy, and side dishes somewhat questionable. However, Memphis Minnie's has been a revelation to me. I just had the St. Louis ribs and I cannot sing the praises of this establishment highly enough. I now understand what it is that Americans who love BBQ are talking about. The ribs had a pleasantly, not overpowering, smokiness and the meatiness of the rib was impressive. The accompanying red sauce and mustard sauce were truly delightful. One can only admire the mastery of this team that puts other BBQ places in SF to shame. 5 stars.
author: John F.

description: For San Francisco BBQ, this is as good as it gets,  Sweet, tangy ribs, and succulent brisket.  May have been a bit dry, but the awesome mac and cheese make up for it.
author: Gregory N.

description:
i decided to swing in here on my way home from work. i liked the feel of the inside of the joint. it's got a homey feel, fun bbq shirts filling up the walls, and tons of pig statues around.

my order: smoke pork ribs with slaw, mac & cheese, and a side order of grit stix. 
upon opening my package, i first noticed i had potato salad instead of slaw (i did over hear them mention they were out, but no one ever told me). the potato salad was ok, but i would have loved to try the slaw. i really enjoyed the mac & cheese, maybe a lil less pepper, tad more salt, but creamy delicious. cornbread was good, not as good as Cajun Pacific's, but good. 

the ribs were falling off the bone. sauce on the side (not liking either sauce very much, one had a overly taste of cinnamon), but i didn't really enjoy the thick rub on the meat. i didn't enjoy the flavor, but i loved how tender it was. 

grit stix were fun and different, didn't love them, but enjoyed them.

i definitely will come back to try some other stuff out.
author: Abigail W.

description:
Very tasty BBQ. Ribs are good, but don't miss out on the sausage.

My only complaint, like Mike B, is the sauce. I also prefer my sauce a bit thicker in texture.
author: Miriam W.

description: I live three blocks away and this by far is my favorite restaurant to eat at on a regular basis.  I am no expert on BBQ but I have loved everything I have ordered at this fine establishment.  Plus enough good compliments cannot he said about the staff.
author: MA R.

description: I was very eager to try one of the only BBQ joints in the hood, but was sorely disappointed in the complete lack of cleanliness here.  I'm trying to be nice as it was down right disgusting!  Where do I begin....from the cleaning supplies (gallons of bleach etc) hanging in the kitchen area amongst the food, to the dirty walls with years of scum & dirt, the old t-shirts hanging on the walls incrusted with years of dust bunnies, to the sticky/dirty table cloth with the last 10 dinner's crumbs still on it.  Not to mention the reviews hanging on the walls from 2001 & 2003...seriously...in 2012?  Not to mention my food was barely room temperature and the meat my boyfriend ordered was pink & so raw that he wouldn't touch it.  This owners of Memphis Minnie's should be ashamed!
author: Alison A.

description:
I've now eaten here twice and I'd say both experiences were a plus. However, I will say that the food on my first visit was a bit better than the second.  Their beef brisket is quite nice but it has a little too much fat on the edges for my taste. Some will argue that the fat is what gives it taste, however I disagree. I'm just a picky eater that way. The staff is great ... playful, friendly, and when it is not packed, they have a wicked sense of humor.  The pulled pork was great both times I've visited.

I would definitely go back.
author: Shae I.

description: The food was pretty good. The ribs were ok, needed more spice or sauce or something...the brisket was ok....everything was just basically ok. Nothing too amazing. It was also over priced.
author: Aimee E.

description:
I've only eaten here once but I was impressed.  I got an order of ribs which were really tender.  No I mean REALLY TENDER like they had been cooked a loooong sloooow time.   They had been cooked so well I accidentally started eating a bone.  I poop you not.

I was chewing on one of my ribs thinking "I should have hit bone by now."  I actually had but it was so soft I couldn't tell.  That's a sign of some gooood down home cooking.  It didn't splinter into pieces, just sort of fell apart in my mouth (mmmm...boooones).  If I were a dog I'd be lov'n this place.  I'd probably write some like "Woof!  Bark,bark,bark woof!"  Then knock over a lamp with my frisky tail wagging.
author: Brian K.

description:
Who would have thought? Good barbecue in San Francisco. The first place that I have found here that is better than something of the same style back home (Philly). Half of the staff are really nice, the other half are really rude...but the good kind of rude that is endearing and just comical enough to not make me angry. I've gotten the brisket almost every time I have been here because it is really, really good. Also, they have the top 10 best mac & cheese I've ever had. The banana pudding is pretty nice too. I also enjoy the drawings and stuff on the table because it gives you something to look at while you wait. 

It's kinda expensive ($20+ a person) but it's a ton of food and I've never finished the full meal, it's just too much. I would advise getting the sandwich for half the price, it's more than enough food and makes it way cheaper. I usually get that every Sunday and watch some football and feel manly.
author: Alex R.

description:
Every time I come here, which is about four or five times in my life, they're out of tri-tip.

Any restaurant that is too cheap to buy enough food to have on hand does not deserve my business..
author: Dave M.

description: Ok, first let me say I love their food.  So why two stars?  They're always out of something.  ALWAYS.  The last 4 times we've tried to get food from here they've been out of things as simple as buns for burgers or french fries.  So basically I give up on this place.  Too bad since the food is good - if they happen to have some of it laying around to actually sell.
author: Shane C.

description:
Eh... Ribs were all right. I'm a big BBQ fan, but I wasn't feeling this place. The sides were not impressive at all. Way too vinegary for my taste. Sauce was a tad bit watery... The rib meat was tough and scarce. I felt like a dog gnawing on his bone for a tiny morsel of tasteless meat.

Honestly, I would come back to try the tri tip sandwiches and give it another chance. There has to be a reason why there was a 20 minute wait and a snake-like line that was out the door.
author: Judy K.

description:
So i kinda go here a lot, Its kind of expensive, the tables are kinda dirty, the wait times can be awful, the sauces are awesome, the sides are great, and the actaully barbaque is jsut average.    San Francisco is seriously lacking on bbq places, so thats why this place soars.

For take out i really prefer da-pitt.
author: Michael E.

description:
Big improvement in service from the last time. The girl working behind the counter was VERY sweet and friendly. And even one of the kitchen hombres said thank you to us as we left.

My remaining suggestion is to put at least one healthy side dish on the menu. A green salad? Grilled asparagus with garlic? Your diet-conscious patrons will thank you!
author: Brian T.

description:
This place was listed on yelp as a "kid-friendly place" so my man and I took the little toddler nephew for lunch on Wednesday. 

The place is super casual and there are all sorts of pig-gurines/ ceramic and plastic pigs everywhere that was soo delightful for the little guy. 

The big guy and I ordered the Wednesday only special of reuben sandwiches. The deliciousness of it made me almost shed a teardrop of joy! When I went to give thanks and appreciation to the chef guy, he explained that they age and smoke the meat on the premises and so it is an extra-special treat that does not ever get frozen before reaching the table! 

It was awesome food! Oh yeah, and no sauce needed and the big guy is huge into sauce on everything and even he went sauce-free!
author: Charlene C.

description: Quite simply...the best BBQ in SF. There are more expensive places, places with nicer seating arrangements, places with better beer selection but if your intent is to get awesome food in a friendly atmosphere this is your spot. Literally everything here great and at the very least good.
author: C F.

description: Before I cared about becoming obese, I came here frequently. It is a solid BBQ place. I am from Texas, so I have high standards. This place is not what I use to eat in Texas, but it is a good compromise. I like that they have a variety of sauces (I feel like I have power). If I did not care about my heart - I would still come here. Unfortunately the heart burn that results from their food is enough to keep me away. Thanks for the fond memories, Memphis Minnie's.
author: Melanie S.

description:
Customer service was good.
Parking- I got lucky found parking in front.
Cool decor.
Food was pretty good i had the  pulled pork and brisket nothing to write home about.
author: Ron B.

description: Superb soul food and BBQ. If you have never been here, get the pulled pork sandwich. If you have been here before, get the pulled pork sandwich. The selection of delightful in-house sauces makes for a robust and custom flavor. (Smoky!) Eventually I'll order something else...
author: Anthony S.

description:
I had had real southern BBQ at it's best.  The type that is slow smoked over mesquite for hours that the mean is so juicy that it falls off the bone, and this is not it.  The sauce is awful.  It ruined that smoked taste of the meat.  Actually I really could not even taste the meat because there was way to much icky sauce poured all over it.  

I wished they would change their sauce to a more smoky sauce with less sweet icky taste.  After that first time, I won't go back.  I'll stick to the traditional whole in the wall style Southern Soul Food places over the pretentious Yuppie place on Haight.
author: Vanilla C.

description: Definitely good! A little expensive for a hole in the wall. I've had better BBQ but I can't complain. Nevertheless, it's worth the trek especially if you're looking for a protein rich, carb light meal! It's a neighborhood staple for me!
author: Brandon G.

description:
This place brought me back to my childhood in Georgia.  Yum.  I got the pork sandwich and mac n cheese, which were both amazing.  My boy got the coleslaw and the brisket, which was better.  They have four sauces, the best of which (someone back home is gonna hate me for this) is the Texas.  But because the meat is SO good, you don't need to overwhelm the sandwich with sauce like you sometimes do back home.  They also have AMAZING sweet tea, so make sure to check that out.

The restaurant itself is cute, though not that big, so I imagine it fills up pretty quickly.  The guys behind the counter are super friendly and I will be back, soon, if I can help it.
author: Adam T.

description:
A BBQ joint thats smug and condescending about their food? I dropped 30 bucks (no exaggeration) for a half rack of ribs, a coke, and a couple bucks in the tip jar. I went to take off and noticed that they only gave me a single little 1.5oz cup of sauce, so I asked for another one ... or nine, preferably. I was then informed by the manager that Minnies is only about the meat - in this case the dry, rubbery, day old pork ribs. Is it so preposterous that one should want barbecue sauce with their barbecue?

Also, the smoke is the restaurant is overwhelming. You'll come in for a couple minutes and leave smelling like a campfire. If you want legitimate Northern California BBQ, I'd strongly suggest trying Cedar Hill - or one of the other million or so awesome places to eat in the city.
author: Chuck H.

description:
