Been here twice and had both great experiences. 

IMO, it is some of the best BBQ i can get in SF. Best part is that its across the street from Toronado, one of my favorite pub/tap houses. 

I seem to always get there brisket sandwich, which is to die for. The smoker and/or sauce they use brings out more of a sweet zesty and slight spice BBQ flavor that I totally dig.

I should defiantly try out there specials, seems they got alot to offer on a daily basis. Cheers!
author: David P.

description:
This place makes me angry. Eating what is considered award winning BBQ in San Francisco just makes me so angry when I know that in Memphis or frankly anywhere in the south, southwest, midwest and probably even in the northwest this wouldn't even be considered decent BBQ.

If you are going to have "dry" BBQ that is unsauce then you sure as hell better makes sure that the meat is super flavourful and tender.

I've gone 3 times now and I will not go back from the 4th. I've gotten to try all their meat and found them to just not be that good.
then you add the small portions and higher prices.

I can only assume that people like the place because it's super clean and run by a white boy. Frankly I'll take some neighborhood joint like the BBQ places on Van Ness or in Soma that aren't all shiny and polished but has tender flavourful meats. A BBQ place should smell like smoked meat, when you leave you should smell like smoked meats. When I picked up my order, my to go container didn't even smell like smoked meats.

If anyone tried to serve this food in Tennessee they would be laughed out of town.
author: DeathandFood H.

description:
I took my roommate and friend Shane to Memphis Minnie's for his birthday dinner. At first we wanted chicken and waffles, but that place was closed - so BBQ was naturally a close second. 

The decor there is fun, with signs like "HIPPIES, OVER THERE!" As we were coming in, this 8 year old girl shared her drawing with us. It was a picture of a sad pig with the caption, "You're so cute, but you're so tasty too!" Aw, how sweet.

We split a half pound of pork ribs, a half pound of briskets, and a basket of fries - and while we finished it all, it definitely could have comfortably fed three (or four small children). For the amount we paid, we got a great amount of food, and tasty too.

The sauces there were kind of funky. One of the BBQ sauces reminded me of Indian food - not a bad thing, just something peculiar.

The portly fellows working there were fun people and really friendly. 

I don't know often I will eat BBQ, but Memphis Minnie's is definitely cool in my book.


Oh yeah, the employees there wanted me to tell you guys that they do delivery now - Sick!
author: Ralph N.

description:
1 star for friendly service.
1 star for cool location in the Haight, complete with cute piggies.
1 star for tasty side dishes.
-1 star for watery bbq sauce
-1 star for price.

I'm sorry, but this place does not cut it for me. My boyfriend and I are on the hunt for the best BBQ in the city, and Memphis Minnie's has been on our list for quite sometime, but after we saw them on Check Please Bay Area, we knew we had to go ASAP.

I'm not a fan of their BBQ sauce at ALL. It's super watery!!!  And, after all, this is a BBQ joint so that is kind of important.

Not to mention, it was $42 for 2 entrees and 2 sodas (ok, one dish was a meat sampler, but come on man!). I could spend that much at a semi-upscale eatery in SF, with table service to boot.

I have so many BBQ places on my yelp bookmark list that I will not be back. On to the next.
author: Stacy S.

description:
You never really feel good after you eat here do you?

Food Poisoning Monday night from this food, DO NOT EAT HERE! And why does the girl that works at the register keep bashing on SF State, saying she hopes it burns down??
Thumbs down for service and food.
author: Sarah R.

description:
I recently got over a BBQ phase where I craved BBQ goods for about 3 weeks. Memphis Minnie's is one of my BBQ fixes. I love their Big Beef Bones. I don't know the fatty content, but I know its full of good feelings after and guilt free pleasure during. AND their fried chicken, that is good. The way they fry it the way they do... kills me softly and slowly as I bite into its crunchy exterior that meets the tender juicy center... fried chicken. LOVE IT.

The sides, you gotta have sides. I get sweet potatoes. For some reason, they are so damn tasty here. No really. Sweet and Yammy is the best way I would describe it.

Oh God, this review has revived my BBQ itch.
author: Andrea K.

description:
I went with 3 other girls...and we shared three plates..

The Ribs, Rib tips, and Tri Tip
Sides-potato salad, coleslaw, fries, mac and cheese, corn bread.

Ribs and Tri Tip was ok....didn't really impress me

Rib Tips-They were the best and it was more filling and cheaper.

Potato Salad was really good...big chunks of potato

Coleslaw was not very good.

Fries had good seasoning

I did not try the Mac and Cheese because im Lactose Intolerant

Corn Bread was dry and really grainy (i prefer hard knox corn bread)

at the end bill was ~$50 for 3 plates...not bad...next time im just gonna stick with the Rib Tips....
author: Brendan L.

description:
I'm sorry. This place is buschleague. 

If there's any food I know, it's BBQ.  I've had great ribs 'n fixins all over the country and this place just doesn't cut it.  I've been a few times and had a variety of dishes, but it's just too "San Francisco" for a BBQ joint.  I'm not saying the place is too "classy" for a BBQ joint. But BBQ should be no-nonsense comfort food. Oh - and affordable. Sorry, but I'm not paying 13 dollars for a glammed up pulled pork sandwich and a small shitty side dish.
author: Troy C.

description:
This little dog is from the south, the Florida Panhandle to be exact, so I know good barbecue when I see, smell and taste it. Minnie's has the best  barbecue that I have had in San Francisco--but I have definitely had better.

I guess that the all them Clean Air laws you'all have here in the Bay Area keeps them from really smokin' the barbecue as good as we do back home. The main complaint that we have (after eating here twice) is that the french fries have entirely too much seasoning on them. And a nice, sweet type barbecue sauce would be an good addtion to the present sauces that are available. And those buns used for the hamburgers are awful tough; though the hamburgers are really good.

You can also get your barbecue "by the pound" on your way home or for a picnic. We prefer the pulled pork.
author: Finnegan M.

description: This was the worst bbq place I've ever been to. Had the pork ribs and brisket. Both were overcooked and bone dry. There is some decent bbq sauce on the table but that didn't help much. The sides were no better. I had beans (below average), corn bread (super dry and bland) and slaw (just tasted like pickled cabbage). If this is the best bbq joint in SF this town is in trouble. I would never go here again. Super disappointing.
author: Matt S.

description:
I cant say that their bbq is the best around town, but its good enough to make you want to come back.  To be honest though, i dont eat much bbq.  Ive had a few stuff off the menu: pulled bbq chicken, fried chicken, brisket, and ribs.  All good but way too much for my tiny frame.  

I'll tell ya whats delicious though - their version of chili cheese fries.  Hesitation set in - brisket used to make chili cheese fries?  What are you up to minnie? *raises eyebrow*.  Oh thats what you're up to.  You win, this stuff is seriously good AND addicting.  Its also filling but the kind of filling where its so good you'll keep stuffing yourself even when the buttons on your pants are about to burst and you're slightly hunched over from the "im full now, stop!" pain inside.  Even when your eyelids are starting to lower, you'll keep eating it.  Its sweet torture.  Wash it all down with a sweet tea and you're good to go.

I always leave here feeling guilty and 10 lbs. heavier.  And yup, I dont care.
author: Juv C.

description: Been looking for brisket like we had in the Midwest ever since we moved to the Bay Area 2 years ago. Found it! Plus very friendly service besides. Will be back again!
author: Jeff R.

description:
I've only been here once so far, but felt like it deserved a review just for the chicken. I don't know if it's offered every day, but I tried the smoked fried chicken special and it was pretty tasty! I've never had fried chicken smoked before - different but delicious and the portions were pretty big in my opinion.. The greens were ok until I reached the bottom half of the little bowl - there the greens were completely drowned in vinegar and inedible to be honest. The sweet potatoes were disappointing but edible. Cornbread - fine. "Sweet tea" was all right but nothing to write home about. I think Arizona makes a better one (you know - the tea in a really tall white can for only 99 cents at the corner store). Service was OK - I think as friendly as you're going to get from big burly white dudes all sweating in a kitchen for 8 hours or whatever.

I will probably go back to try the brisket. Kind of wish they had mashed potatoes, but didn't see it on the menu.
author: Dorothy W.

description:
18 bucks for a beef brisket & tri-tip with two sides. And they forgot my brisket, argh!

BBQ in San Francisco makes about as much sense as a vegetarian restaurant in Dallas. But after Bay to Breakers we ended up here, and I was truly curious what the Bay Area's take on BBQ was.

I'm pleased to say this was much better than the BBQ I'm used to from Florida. That's to say, no sickly sweet sauces poured over everything in over-abundance.

The tri-tip was great, not overly dry as tri-tip tends to be when prepared by amateurs. My sides of sweet potatoes and greens were also good. 5 stars for the sweet potatoes and 3 stars for the greens.  Honestly, I'm not a huge fan of green vegetables, and just got them so I didn't feel too guilty about the whole meal.

You're probably not going to find a place to sit, so bring your food to one of the nearby bars and grab a beer.

If you're in the Haight, it's worth dropping by.  But make sure you have the money to spare, because Memphis Minnie's isn't cheap.
author: Rishi G.

description:
THE BEST BBQ IN SF!!

Sorry to yell there, but I just sorted the reviews here after seeing that MM didn't have a 4.5 or higher rating. I'm from Chicago and grew up visiting friends and family in Texas and Kentucky. Memphis Minnie's wouldn't be able to hold up in a BBQ contest in those areas, but neither would any Restaurant. BBQ is supposed to be something that you baby for a full day and put your love into. When you come to a BBQ joint you're getting BBQ joint food. Memphis Minnie's knows exactly what that should taste like. I come here at least once per month and I'll continue to do so. 60% of the time I come here I get the smoked andouille sausage. I use the BBQ sauce sparingly like it's supposed to be eaten. 

BTW - yelp should filter out reviews that rate a restaurant based on the fact that you live near it and hate the smell of BBQ. That's totally your fault dude. I would hate to live above or near any restaurant and that's why I don't...Don't hate the player; hate the game.
author: Mike M.

description:
Every time I'm hungover I come here.. 'nuff said. 

-1 star for inconsistency sometimes.
author: Alex E.

description:
Hail to the Pig! 

Don't worry, it's not meant as an insult to our President. Memphis Minnie's truly idolizes the pig. There are pig-themed wall signs, pig-inspired napkin drawings and pig-adorned t-shirts on the walls. In other words, it's a perfect place to pig out. 

My first couple of minutes at this place were pretty awkward. Here's the conversation I had with the cashier right off the bat: 

Memphis Minnie's Cashier: "Welcome! Are you still deciding? You should definitely get some of our country fried chicken. It's so good, it comes with its own prescription for Lipitor." 
Me: "Well, I already take Lipitor, so I won't be needing that." 
Cashier: [awkward silence] 

Since I didn't come to this place to lower my cholesterol level, I decided to go all out. I went for the two-way platter with brisket and pulled pork. Reasonably priced at $15.95, the platter comes with two sides (mac 'n' cheese and sweet potatoes, please) and a cornbread muffin. I complemented the meal with a glass of Diet Coke from the fountain, paid $19.60 all told, grabbed some silverware and sat down. 

The place is really small. We were here at 4 pm, and the place was empty. I bet the lines get pretty long here during the dinner rush. There are about 12 tables in the whole establishment, so they ask that you not "save" a table until you order your food. The tables are covered with checkered tablecloths, which, in turn, are covered with plastic protectors (similar to the ones you might find protecting your grandma's couch). I thoroughly enjoyed looking at the customer pig drawings on the napkins displayed under the plastic protector. If I could draw, I would, too, try to get my napkin on display. 

It didn't take long for them to call my name to come to the counter and get my food. I got four thick slices of brisket and a decent sized serving of pulled pork. Next to the meat there were two tiny cups with the sides I ordered. The sides were embarrassingly small. Even my cornbread muffin (DEEEEEElicious, by the way) was laughing at those tiny cups. The brisket and the pulled pork were a little dry, but it was nothing a little BBQ sauce couldn't fix. There were 4 kinds of sauce on the table: vinegar sauce, mustard sauce, regular BBQ sauce and extra hot sauce. The last two were very good. My mac 'n' cheese had a weird flavor, and my sweet potatoes could have used some spice. Bland sweet potatoes are not the best thing in the world. Maybe the small sides were a blessing in disguise. My friend ordered a brisket sandwich, and he seemed to enjoy it. 

Memphis Minnie's might just be the best BBQ in San Francisco, but I am still looking for the real Southern BBQ place with real Southern portions and real Southern flavor. Business opportunity, anyone?
author: Yan G.

description: RIP OFF!!! Very disappointed with Memphis Minnie's BBQ. Got the two-meat combo (ribs and brisket) with fries and sweet potato. The portions are ridiculously small! The quality of food was maybe 2.5 stars. Should have read the reviews before coming. No need to try this place.
author: Stephen Y.

description:
DEAR GOD THERE IS REAL BARBEQUE IN THIS HIPPIE CITY.

No, seriously, the Virginian/North Carolinian in me sorta kinda lost its shit when it realized this place existed. The pork ribs were a bit dry and fatty, but try the spicy pulled chicken sandwich. Also, corn bread.
author: Christopher B.

description:
My parents and I are staying in San Francisco for vacation and my Mom had seen Memphis Minnie's while driving so we decided to come here. We shared the 3-way dish. We had the:
Chicken which I would give about 2.5-3 stars. It was okay. The chicken was dry and there was not much sauce on it but it wasn't bad. 
St. Louis Ribs which I would give 4 stars to. They were very tasty and the rub that was on it was great. The only complaint I had was that they were a little too hard at some points. To the point that I was not able to chew it.  
Brisket which I enjoyed but they were a little too fatty for my liking but my mom said she loved it and would give the brisket 5 stars.
I probably would have given it 3.5 stars overall if I could. The few complaints I had were that the bbq sauce was not like the traditional bbq sauce but it was still good. Also the bathroom was not clean when I went in.  But overall I enjoyed my food, it was a good meal.
author: Emily I.

description:
Great BBQ, cool staff and awesome decor (little piggies everywhere).

Gotta try the St. Louis ribs w/ a side of Mac and Cheese.
They also make some great greens as well.

And to finish it off, get the banana custurd, the stuff is incredible.
Caution, may need to be wheelbarrowed to car after the meal :-)
author: Matt C.

description:
After being disappointed a couple times, I've decided to bring out the ban hammer on this joint.

Yet another local restaurant that wants to be loved, but the quality control for the food is wanting.

My #1 complaint is leather dry BBQ. Sometimes it's the pork ribs. Sometimes it's the brisket. Sometimes it's the beef ribs. Even the Wednesday special pastrami isn't immune from this problem. Then there was the time where the meats left an unpleasant smoky taste in my mouth that didn't want to leave.

It's like playing Russian roulette every time you go there.

If y'all like bone dry BBQ, then y'all be in hog heaven at Memphis Minnie's, ya hear? Well sorry, but I don't.

It's pretty obvious the guys in the kitchen don't sample each batch of Q before hacking the meat up and serving it on the plate. I would really like them to taste what they're serving up to the public.

I do like their complement of sauces, except their habanero sauce. The red, mustard, and vinegar sauces have a nice tangy taste and complement the meats nicely - when they aren't dry as leather.

Side dishes like potato salad, coleslaw, cornbread, chili, and BBQ fries are decent.

Stay away from the mac & cheese tho'. The cheese is usually clumpy, like it's been sitting around for a while on the steam table vat.

The crew working the restaurant is nice. They make you feel welcome. Can't fault their service at all.

In closing, if I'm paying close to $20 on lunch or dinner, I'd rather spend it at a place that maintains a consistent quality of food. Every meal shouldn't come with a dish that makes you think, "Oh, I could have had a better version of this dish at restaurant X."

Memphis Minnie's, you've made me think that thought too many times, and I don't want to be disappointed anymore.
author: Bono B.

description: The fried chicken sandwich is a life changer.  I talked about it for days.  My boyfriend probably wishes I would shut up about it.  But I CAN'T STOP! I WANT MORE! I am kind of happy this little gem is across town from me...my thighs couldn't handle being so close to all that goodness!  And bacon brittle?  Come on!!  And the staff...seriously adorable.  I might like Manny as much as I like my chicken sandwich.  MIGHT!
author: Nikki G.

description:
5 stars for the beef brisket and beef ribs ONLY!!!

-2 stars for the disgusting sides and unimpressive sauces
-2 for rude customer service

Customer service is so bad here that it's appalling!  My friend sat down at an open table while I was at the cash register ordering our food and he was actually KICKED OUT of his seat because we hadn't received our food yet!!  Yes I understand that the seating is somewhat limited and they want to make sure that people with food in their hands have somewhere to sit... HOWEVER.... the owner of this place actually walked up to my friend in front of several other patrons and scolded him for saving a seat!  This wasn't just rude and poor tact, it was very embarrassing to be singled out and kicked out of our seats in front of a restaurant full of other people.  NOT COOL

The side dishes are simply not good.  In fact, the mac n' cheese is one of the worst I have ever tried.  Generic boxed Safeway mac n' cheese is 10x better.  Off texture, off flavors..just not good!  The coleslaw is awful.  Chopped up cabbage and carrots mixed with a weird vinegary, sugary mixture.
author: Suzie M.

description:
dry, dry, dry. The beef ribs were chewy and dry and the pork ribs were the same. The sweet pork was the only item that was savory. Not a place to dine in unless you want to fight for a seat. A lot of the patrons ignore the rule of ordering then wait to get a table. If I do go back, I'm going to march right up to an empty seat and save it, then get back in line to order.
I'm not a pro at bbq'n but I surely can do it better. There are alot of better bbq places, but unfortunately most are located in the East Bay, if you want to cross the bridge.
author: Que T.

description:
I think I've tried most of the contents on this menu and my faves are the beef brisket, the BBQ Pork Rolls, Mac n Cheese and the Scratch Pecan Pie.   All are bursting with flavor with or without their specialty sauces.  I love the smoky flavors this place has to offer.  

The ribs are just ok, a little dry, cornbread a little dry, collard greens are vinegary, which I didn't like at first but now they've grown on me, so yes me likey.  Wings are spicy if you like spicy, and the fries are just ok.    

It's nice to order take out, but if you eat in, I like how you can show up in sweats and get finger lickin with the fat rolls of paper towels, only for the fat rolls to then transfer onto your belly.  Don't expect to wear tight jeans after eating here.
author: CHRISTINE L.

description: This is one of my favorite places to go for lunch, I'm here almost once a week.  Get this combo: brisket sandwich, potlikker greens, muffin, and a sweet tea.  Put their sauces on the sandwich and eat your heart out.  There's nothing in the City I get more than this.  Their pork sandwich is great too, along with the yams.  They do a fried chicken sandwich one day a week, I think it's Thursday, and it's much better than Betty's.  Their ribs aren't the best around, which is too bad cuz I love me some ribs, but everything else they have there is tasty.  And they're really nice, with good southern music playing.
author: Jason D.

description:
Recommended Dish: None. Despite the fact that the restaurant was packed and extremely busy, I didn't see what everyone was raving about. We ordered at least 4 different meats along with at least 3 different sides. None of their dishes seemed tasty or good in general. If anything, the meat was tough and hard to chew, the sauce was overpowering and at time even overwhelming, and the sides were at best mediocre. 

For the price (considering the quality of food) combined with the lack of seating (able to seat 30 people best case, if everyone squeezed cheek to cheek), I would give this BBQ joint 1 star. But the sweet and friendly staff behind the counter, at least that's how I remember them in my mind, made me roll the rating up to 2 stars.
author: Ellen C.

description:
Average BBQ in SF with the best part being the Texas beef brisket (smoked 18 hours).  That brisket (the only thing I would recommend getting) just melted in my mouth and was the best I can remember tasting on the west coast.  I've been to some better BBQ's in Oklahoma and Texas but I'm not in Texas so I got to remember the environment I'm in.  The St. Louis style smoked pork ribs and Memphis sweet smoked pork were just average and nothing special.  

It was kind of a cool ambiance with flying pigs all over the place but that doesn't make the BBQ taste any better.  I also had the fried peach pie (not worth getting) because it sounded interesting but the problem was that it was fried but it didn't really taste like peach and looked more like a hot pocket.  They should call it a "fried peach imitation hot pocket."  I've tasted some really good fried pies in Oklahoma so I got to remember, "I'm in California, not Oklahoma."
author: Albie F.

description:
As other reviewers have pointed out, BBQ is quite a subjective thing. Sauce? Smoked? Rub? Pork? Beef? Hot? Sweet? Tangy?  Therefore, I base my review on the things all BBQ must do.  But you can have it any way you want here b/c they St. Louis and Memphis AND THEIR SAUCES ARE AMAZING, if you are into that.
Best: The sauces - we got 4 and my boyfriend loved 2 while I LOVED the other 2. Happy family w/ no fighting.: ranch base, mustard based, spicy cajun creamy, BBQ sauce.
Best: BBQ pork rolls- minced bbq pork rolled like an eggroll and fried.

The Sides: good tangy relish-based slaw (not drenched in mayo), solid cornbread muffins (could use a little more flavor), beans are solid too.

The meat: all the meat were perfectly cooked and the you could pull the meat off the ribs WITH YOUR FORK!  Tender tender tender!  You don't even need a knife for the steak either.

For me, I thought everything was good but MAYBE the meat was too "smokey" (I know I know) but my boyfriend who is from the south and has had MANY BBQs loved it all. We both agree - BBQ pork rolls are the BOMB!
author: Barndi K.

description:
Yesterday, on a hot & beautiful day in San Francisco my gf and I were in the mood for some great BBQ. We checked out yelp and a lot of my fellow yelpers recommended Memphis Minnie's. THANK YOU!! We went down there and had some wonderful BBQ that whisked us off to the south. We ordered the beef ribs, which were ab fab. Very smokey flavor, not covered in sauce like some other places do and very authentic. I also ordered the southern star sandwich, which is half beef brisket and half smoked pork. Incredible flavors and cooked to perfection. The prices are pretty good and you get a lot of food for your buck at this spot in the lower height. I'm a huge fan and my gf and I are having dinner there this Wednesday and I am very excited!! Great BBQ in sf is hard to find, so trust me when I say this spot is a must go.

Update to 1st review: I went this past Saturday, ordered over the phone to avoid long line & when I arrived I was told to wait at the end of the line, which defeats the purpose of ordering over the phone. I digress. It looks like Memphis Minnie's has a problem with consistency b/c in my 1st review I mentioned how wonderful they are. The 2nd experience was absolutely garbage! I ordered Texas Beef ribs and they were terrible!!!!! One large chuck of fat all the way through & very small amount of edible meat, which was a truly disgusting experience! Three ribs came with the order & I ended up tossing the last one b/c there was way too much fat & gristle for my taste. So, as much as I want to love this place I don't!!!!
author: Hector G.

description:
My first meal at a legitimate BBQ spot in SF.

I look forward to the mac and cheese more than anything at this spot.

For some reason I feel like your sandwich should be piping hot coming out of this place, but it never is. -1 star. Still tastes great. +1 star.

The dude at the cash register one day was not very personable. Kinda just going through the motions, 'goddammit-just-figure-out-what-you-want-to-eat-already' style. -1.
author: Harold C.

description:
"woohoo! as good as it gets!" in san francisco

the quote is that text next to the five stars and as a barbecue place in this city, it's deserved.  i can't boast being from the south, but i can say that somehow business travel and the big bbq cities and locations have consistently met up over nearly 12 years and 200k miles.   and when i travel to these cities, bbq is what i look for.  i'll make any trek from the hotel, sometimes stopping at 2 places a night.

so, this is one of the very few places that gets it right.  you have to like the dry rub memphis style, of course (you can't add the sauce at the table to make it truly "wet").

i've been here dozens of times and never been disappointed with anything on the menu, even the rib tips.  well, maybe the bbq tri-tip could be better.  i just don't think that cut of meat takes well to the smoke.  it's far better slow-roasted on the grill than smoked.  but you don't see that in bbq in the south anyway.  traditionally that's an expensive cut of meat and not where bbq came from in the first place.

all the sides are exceptional.  the beans with their pulled pork in it.  the greens.  the mac and cheese.  the french fries are almost dessert.

Bob Kantor knows what he's doing and he doesn't mess with it.  Sure there are daily special that are kinda fun, but that menu doesn't change and his cooking doesn't change.
author: kevin w.

description: I have been wanting to try this place for quite a while and we finally did the other day. Good location, found parking pretty easily at 3:00 in the afternoon on a Wednesday. I was very glad that Wednesday happened to be their reuben sandwich special day. Delicious! Big sandwich, lots of very flavorful, melt in your mouth meat. My dining companion had their pork ribs and liked them. Neither one of us was impressed with their crispy fried onion strings - greasy and came out cold. Had their fried peach pie (two pieces) which was very good. Sweet, friendly, hip young people at the counter where you order. Definitely going back for more reubens, maybe with fries this time. Oh, I also liked all the great music they were playing.
author: Soher Y.

description:
Memphis Minnie's was my very first dining experience in San Francisco and I had huge expectations.  A smattering of tables and big kitschy signs everywhere.  It was too crowded to dine in, so my friends and I took out (the crowded usually would indicate greatness).

I got the special burger on recommendation from the girl at the counter.  The burger took forever, but was definitely worth it.  Bacon, cheese, onion strings and some quality beef.  The fries were lackluster though.  Seasoned, but soft and limp.  The BBQ sauces were also just so so.  The red one I got was thin and missing either sweetness or a kick.  The spicy honey mustard was a bit better, but still tasted too thin.  Mixing the two did nothing.

If I came back I would go for a different side and try to dine in and taste a few more of their sauces.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
What is up with BBQ joints being closed on mondays... LOL... anyway, my husband and i had this place a while back, just forgot to post this review...

We ordered the pulled spicy chicken sandwich and the smoked cajun andouille sausage w/ greens and mac & cheese...

I dont have much to complain about. The greens were ummm gross. The portion size was average. The mac and cheese was nothing to write home about... 

The stars actually go to the chicken sandwich. This is hands down the best chicken sandwich I've had in a long time...
author: Shirlene M.

description:
I have pretty high standards when it comes to BBQ, so maybe I am being a little tough on this joint with 3 stars, but it was exactly that "A-Ok". 

It is definitely a hole in the wall type place (def not a romantic first date type spot, but good for a quick bite) with a good selection on their menu. But you do not sit and they take your order, you stand in line, give your order and they call you up to grab your food.... 

I tried the pulled pork sandwich with the Mac and Cheese side. The meat is very tender and tasty, however it was not cooked with BBQ sauce. One of the selling points for this place is the ability to select your own sauce that is on the table. The sauces were mediocre at best  and are not standard.. There is a vinegar sauce, a spicy sauce, a red sauce (tasted like red enchilada sauce), and a spicy mustard sauce... All i wanted was some good old fashioned original BBQ taste and there was nothing even comparable. The Mac was delicious tho! Very yumm! 

I also tried the deep fried peach pie and sweet iced tea. The tea was a little watered down and the pie was very tart. And it's not so much a pie as it is a turnover. I wouldn't get it again. 

Also, I felt the server was a little rude taking my order. I wanted to ask questions about the menu and he seemed a little irritated with me because of it.... 

All in All, just OK
author: Ashley s.

description: It's not as good as real southern cooking but I love them none the less. The links and greens tickle the german in me I can't help but grab a pound
author: Josh A.

description: I really wanted to love this place since I live two blocks away and I've been searching for a good BBQ place in SF, but I found it extremely disappointing (twice)... The first time I went I was craving a big juicy burger, instead I got an overcooked tasteless burger with nothing else but the meat.  So the second time I decided to give this place another chance by trying their infamous BBQ ribs: again they were overcooked and the sauce wasn't very tasty.  They have a catchy logo and a hipster setting but the food is overpriced and not that good.
author: Monkey B.

description:
Here's how to enjoy Memphis Minnie's.

1) Eat lunch at MM order what appeals to you.

2) Go drink beer at Toronado.

3) Eat sausage at Rosamunde.

4) Go back to Toronado and have another beer.

5) Stop at Suppenkuche for a boot and potato pancake.

6) Cap it off at Magnolia Brew.
author: Peter F.

description:
I'm part of that 1% of black people who could care less one way or the other about barbeque.  I don't crave it, I don't get all excited when people say their cousin's throwing down in their backyard, and it's not a regular  part of my diet to knaw the meat off of bones.  Fried chicken, on the other hand...

Given this little fact, it is no wonder why I do not frequent BBQ joints with any great regularity.  Enter today: Momster's out for pig blood and has made a request for BBQ.  Me and Dadster head out to run errands, picking up the 'que on the way back.  San Francisco is not known for its 'que places, let's just get that out of the way.  So, there are locations few and far between that would be worth any visit.  I can name a handful.  But I suggest Memphis Minnie's because since it's on the parental dime, I could get down with some brisket.  

We order the brisket, a plate of pork ribs for Mom, and sides of Mac 'n' Cheese, Fried Cheese Grit Sticks, and the Smoky Beans.

In a nutshell:
The Swine: Can't comment because I didn't have any
The Meat between the cow's front legs: Deliciously beefy
MnC: Tasty, but in a bland way - had to put some real cheese on it
Grits: Not a fan of the shell, but really liked the inside
Beans: Listen up, if you can BITE INTO your bean, it ain't done
Sauce: Never been a fan of either of the sauces, but this day I decided to check it out and they were okay

I'm sure in Memphis, the creed goes something like, The Lord, then swine, then family, but this CA girl isn't convinced.
author: Tamar D.

description: I love this place! the best bbq in SF by far! The meat  is smoked to perfection.. so good you dont even need the sauce.   I lived in the neighborhood when this place first opened up, and they have added so much to the menu.  I love it all.. the brisket is my favorite.  The burgers are great.. even the chilli is addictive.    I would give it 5 stars, except i dont care to much for the greens.  a little too vinegary for m personal taste.. but its all about the meat, and you can tell they take pride in smoking it to perfection.  I have got 7 friends addicted to this place already, and i am sure there will be more.  oh how i wish i lived in lower haight.
author: Sharon C.

description:
I'm from TX. I know BBQ.  This ain't it.  Sorry, guys. 
I came here last week under the promise that this was the best barbeque in the city.  That may be true, but I guess that means the city falls way short in terms of BBQ standards.
I got the brisket, mac n cheese, and sweet potatoes.  I also had a small taste of my friend's beans which were good. My brisket was okay, but was on the dry side.  They had a couple of side sauces which were flavorful and used to drench the meat.  The mac n cheese was so-so, but could have been a bit tastier.  The best part of my meal were the sweet potatoes. 
Oh, and don't even bother with the cornbread.  It's not worth it.
author: Uchenna A.

description:
MEMPHIS MINNIES is a cool stand in for real BBQ for those of you not willing to travel to East or North Bay. 

Although a tad expensive for BBQ, Memphis Minnies offers a fine selection of dishes that will appease the most stubborn bbq eater. 

The only downsides to this place (beside the price) is that the portions are a tad small, and parking is non-existent since its located in the lower Haight. The meat, although yummy, could be seasoned a bit better. But when you smother it with your favorite sauce, you will hardly notice. 

BTW... The Sweet Tea is daaaaaaangerous is you DONT want a sugar high! lol
author: Black K.

description:
3 stikes you're out!!  This was the third and LAST time I'm going to this place.  The food has been terrible every time.  

St. Louis Ribs: WAY too expensive.. $16 for 4 dried burnt ribs.  There was hardly any meat on the bones because because it was burnt to a crisp.  I thought I was eating tree bark.  

Rib tips are also really tough like big chunks of ROCK MEAT or something.  

SIDES: greens were way too vinegary for my taste, mac n cheese was plain and bland, beans had a weird flavor to em, corn bread was dry and crumbly.

I don't understand the high reviews for this place, maybe it depends on when you go.  Last 2 times I went was on a Friday night (last night being one of them).  It was the exact SAME STAFF both times.  One of the times I went I tried to call in my order ahead of time, first they put me on hold for 10 minutes, then they said it's going to take 35-40 minutes for my order to be ready, when I get there they make me wait in line which took another 15 minutes and then when I said I was there to pick up my order they started making it and i had to wait another 10 minutes to get the food. 

Crap food for a high price... not worth it no matter how much of a Q-craving you have.  Go elsewhere.
author: Mel D.

description:
Smoked meat proper style. The brisket is solid, but ladies and gentlemen they've done BBQ pork loin some real justice. Sweet pork sandwich, or the platter, or whatever, just grab some. 

So damn good, reminds me of the pork loin at Rudy's BBQ chain in Texas but twice the price. But u ain't going to fly to Texas to save $4 on BBQ so whatever. 

I don't know about Memphis Style, so no comment on that. It may just be that they have the mustard sauce. Don't matter; if you walk by on Haight your nose will lead you in the door and you'll try it yourself.
author: Ethan P.

description: I've had Minnie's several times via their catering back in the days of the San Francisco Blues Festival, but I went there with a buddy this past weekend after many years of not having had any or been there. The employees were friendly and the menu is fairly expansive. I thought I may have been making a mistake when I dared to venture away from their ribs and brisket and pork and other goodness when I chose their daily special of Minnie's Smoked Fried Chicken. I was very happy that I did - it was awesome, and the slaw, greens and cornbread were all great. The Chili Cheese Fries appetizer was huge and off-the-charts good! All washed down with a nice brew from Fort Point Beer Co.  One quick note of caution: their sauces -- and even the sides (slaw, greens) -- are very much vinegar-based, which gives it more of a Carolina flavor than that of Memphis. I can see some people not liking the vinegar-y flavors, but I enjoyed it!
author: Brian S.

description: We have eaten here numerous times and the food is usually great. We have even ordered delivery once before. Tonight we called to order delivery again and the woman who answered the phone said she needed to check the delivery area (which is online and we are inside of it.) She neglected to put us on hold and we could hear her mocking us on the phone to her co-worker and did not even thoroughly check the delivery area. When asked if we would like to pick up the food, we said no thanks. We will gladly take our business to people who are friendly exhibit proper customer service.
author: Nichole S.

description:
Most excellent BBQ~!

I told the guy at the counter it was my first time...he was gentle.  I told him I only wanted meat....no sides.  He asked how many people.   Told 'im 3.
He suggested the Pork, Pork Ribs, and Brisket...all 1/2 lb each.   This was way enough for 4-5 people I found out once I got home.  The package it came it was quite deceiving!
Smoke lines on ALL the meat.....awesomeness.  SO VERY VERY tasty.
I loved the vinegar-y bbq sauce they gave me on the side.  The mustard-y sauce...not bad, but not a fan.

I thought it was excellent for the price for sure.  Not too fatty.  Tender, smokey goodness.

The reason no 5 stars:  
Two dudes cookin, one guy orders.  Took about 20 min for me to wait for the meat to go (at around 4:30pm), and two orders were in front of me and looks like that took a while.  Now....I had no sandwich assembly, no sides to pack up.  Just meat in a box.  And as we know with BBQ.....you're not cooking it for me, you're just cutting it off what's already done....so why the long wait Minnie's??

PS.....not a ton of seating space, I would hate to see what it's like busy
author: Q L.

description: This place is AMAZING! I just moved here from the south, and have been missing good BBQ.  It is some of the best I've ever had.  On top of that, I signed up for their loyalty program on my iphone while in the store, and it is super cool.  You just download Thanx in the app store and the restaurant is right in there.  I immediately got free onion strings (which are amazing) and you can see on the app how close you are to getting the next thing...I am very close to a free order of the "Smokey Mountain Wings." My mouth is watering thinking about it. I could not recommend this place enough! Definitely get the Taster!
author: Jade N.

description:
bff said that they were just having a bad night...but sadly, i must review the place for what it was...and well, it wasn't horrible but it wasn't good either.

there were 4 of us and we decided to get 2 of the two way combos...which comes with 2 meats and 2 sides each.  we chose brisket, tri tip, chicken, and sausage.  each meat was pretty dry...the chicken was still raw...the best out of the 4 was the sausage..which shouldn't be the meat that shines at an all bbq place.  the sides we had were also less than mediocre.  the greens were SUPER sour.  we got the butt end of the mac n cheese...while a new fresh pan came out for all of the guests after us.  the cornbread was also pretty dry...it was just a sad meal.

the bbq sauces were ok..the best out of the 4 was the carolina mustard sauce.  but, i have to say that the chili cheese fries were pretty good.  it was really salty...but the idea was awesome.  they put their 18 hour brisket into this chili...not bad at all.  

i'm still searching for the best bbq in the city...memphis minnie's was a disappointment.  but bff said we've gotta give them another try...so an update will be coming soon!
author: Jen W.

description: Great smoked meat.  Sauces are very good. Service was with a smile.  Nice neighborhood feel.
author: April M.

description:
Consistently good BBQ

As you would expect from a decent BBQ place. The portions are large and the food has a smokey taste. Everything is great quality and the staff has always been nice and helpful. The dining experience is very fast food-ish which in great for lunch or if you are on your way to a show and just want to be in and out.
author: Eric G.

description:
I have to confess, I have been going to Memphis Minnie's about once a week for almost a year now.  Why?  Thursday is FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH day!  I would put this against anybody else's (Even Bakesale Betty's).    The chicken, the slaw, the bread... its the perfect bad-for-you sandwich.  I'm also a big fan of the brisket.

Staff is cool, atmosphere is fine, prices might be a little high but its worth it.
author: Mo P.

description:
We went there yesterday night and I guess we went at the wrong time because we were doing laps around the neighborhood for half an hour!  My sister raved about this place and said this was #1 on their BBQ list.  (I should've yelped it first...oh well.)

Take the bus there if you can.  The parking sucked!!!  But I guess you can say it was a good way to get the appetite going cuz by the time we got to the place, we were hungry as heck!

I like the environment a lot -- all those piggies looking at you.  =)  We ordered the taster ($16.95), which included your choice of three meats and 2 side dishes.  We chose to get 2 pork ribs and the beef brisket for meats, fries and beans as our side dishes.  

Beef brisket was good -- nice and soft, not chewy at all -- kind of like melt in your mouth type.  The beans were good as well -- not too soggy or blah.  Now, the ribs were good but too dry.  We got jipped man!  We got like burnt pieces or something.  And the fries were not that great.  They were too dry and krispy.  And I didn't really like the spice powder on them -- it was funny tasting to me.  Oh, we also got the sweet potato pie with whipped cream ($3.95) and it was pretty good!  And their cornbread was pretty good as well.  And I didn't really like their sweet potatoes either.  Soda pop was $1.95.  

Oh, and when you're trying their sauces, don't put too much of the hot sauce.  On the bottle, it said "it's stupid hot" and man..it was hot!  I usually like spicy stuff and this did it for me.  Try their mustard and red sauce.  They were pretty good!  

Now, would I go back?  Probably not due to their parking issues!  I don't think it was worth our 30 minutes of circling around the neighborhood.  If I was in the neighborhood for something, then MAYBE we'll drop by..but that's about it.  I wouldn't go to the neighborhood just for this place.
author: Joyce L.

description:
I ordered the brisket plate along with their baked beans and mac & cheese. A bit pricey at almost $21 after tax but the food is definitely delicious. Brisket was fall apart tender with great flavor, the sides were tasty and I love that bottles of sauce they have out on the tables.

The staff is really friendly as well. It took a little while for our food to be ready and one of the guys working behind the counter took the trouble to give me and my buddy a free sample of their pork ribs as a way of thanking us for being patient. I really appreciate that sort of service.

The only knock is that the tables are a little dirty but this is the perfect place for a little mid-afternoon lunch when you have absolutely nothing to do for the rest of the day other than fall asleep on the couch. I'll definitely be going back for to try the rest of their menu soon.
author: Tae K.

description:
Just goes to show you what happens when the owner no longer works at the joint... (come back Bob! and save your place)

Used to be the best BBQ in San Francisco.  I've been going there for years. As of the last two years, it has been getting progressively worse. But today was the last straw. 

Dirty floors, dirty bathroom, apathetic staff, the sides were tasteless and the once succulent great meats were dried out (again). And don't talk to the manager, he could care less. Maybe that's the problem.
author: T Bear C.

description: I'm writing this update because I've been back to this place on more than one occasion since my last review and let me just say... Wow. If you get here on a Wednesday you are OBLIGED to get the Ruben Sandwich. Or at least something with the GODLY pastrami that they only make and serve once a week. It was one of those "holy" experiences that sticks in your brain for weeks... nay, months.... (possibly years?)  Yes, I will never forget that ridiculous pastrami goodness. And, I must admit, after trying a few other things again (especially the brisket and sides... like the deliciously saucy mac n cheese) I've bumped them up a star and am seriously considering two, based on that pastrami alone. Screw it, they earned it. Yes, go here. Damn, I wish it was Wednesday.
author: Fareed R.

description: The best brisket i've ever had in my life. the St. Louis style ribs are'nt too bad either. Whenever i have the craving. i have to go. the traffic on the bay bridge is worth the wait.
author: Zamora M.

description:
loved it.  loved it.  loved it.

we had Memphis Minnie's cater our most recent lunch at work.  we had bbq chicken, pork ribs, rib tips, andouille sausage, and beef brisket.  damn the ribs were on hit!! the brisket was ok, the sausage, the rib tips and the bbq chicken were better than i expected.  we got good portions too.

definitely coming back!
author: Ray R.

description: Place was pretty good.. Had the 2 meat combo with brisket/pork ribs.. Didn't really care for the mac and cheese but the beans were good as well as the corn bread. The sauces were ok..
author: Kevin H.

description:
Local spot that always hits the spot for me. Stella and Anchor Steam on tap. Brisket that makes your mouth water. Their fried chicken, while the crust is a little greasy, is always moist inside. Their collard greens and macaroni and cheese are staples for me. And the pecan pie? OMG. Yum. 

Solid BBQ joint.
author: Kristie W.

description:
I was so pumped to go here when I moved to Lower Haight. We made the mistake of believing some of these Yelp reviews (no offense, fellow Yelpers) and word of mouth. Supposedly, Memphis Minnie's is supposed to be good. And to be honest, it smells great when you walk by. But stop in, and the food doesn't come anywhere near the build up. We had dry brisket, greasy collard greens, watery mac n cheese, and the burger (which we read was great) was burned, over seasoned, and terrible. I'd like to give them the benefit of the doubt, and hope that we went on an off night... but I can bring myself to go back inside. So disappointing.

All I can say is, if I'm craving BBQ, I'll make it myself.
author: T T.

description: What an establishment, my Uncle lives in Lower Haight and brought me here the first time I ever came to SF. I have been back every time I have visited. The Tri-Tip sandwich is amazing and their sides are excellent. Their sauces and spicy mustard are fantastic as well.
author: Dylan B.

description: Its okay if you are in the area but Looneys in Oakland is way more devine and clean. Place felt a little dirty and cramped.
author: E. Y. G.

description: Love this place. Everytime I go there, it's always good. The spicy chicken sandwich is amazing and the Mac and cheese, unreal. Huge fan of this place and the dudes that work there are cool. Highly recommend if you are in the mood for BBQ. At little pricey but tasty.
author: Brad B.

description:
me and my dad have been regulars here ever since i could remember.
i don't usually like mac and cheese, but they have my favorite mac and cheese.
good cornbread and sweet tea.
casual but delicious desserts. fried peach pies  are not very sweet but spot on. they're my favorite dessert here, because they are unique and not served at any other place I've been. banana pudding is a very standard bowl or homemade banana pudding topped with nilla wafers and whipped cream. pecan pie is great too. 
meats are all good. the ribs, brisket, pulled pork, i like em all. the tri-tip can be pretty dry though, especially on a sandwich.
AMAZING staff. i was always the little girl chowing down her brisket, so they were always so nice, and often gave me a free dessert. a few years ago, they thought it was hilarious i was such a fan of this place, being the young skinny ballet dancing girl i am, and they gave me a free shirt.
author: Jess C.

description:
We came here on Saturday and got a Minnie's sampler.  We had the brisket, beef ribs, pork ribs, greens, and mac and cheese. The brisket was so fatty and delicious. Super tender and moist (but declines as it cools, so eat it when it's hot!). The beef ribs were also really good. It's hard to find beef ribs that are seasoned and cooked properly. The St. Louis style pork ribs were mediocre and bland (especially when compared to the first two meats); I think it needed some seasoning and a good dose of salt. I would pass on these next time. The greens were super vinegary, and tasted like they were cooked with the Southern Carolina mustard sauce (sidenote: this sauce would make a great salad dressing), and I ate every last bit. The mac and cheese was creamy and serious comfort food, just like God intended.

The space itself was awkward (it's definitely tight quarters!) and the kitchen, understandably, takes up the majority of the space. 

I'll definitely be back here. It doesn't hurt that Toro is right across the street.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Oh my, Miss Minnie... Best. BBQ. Ever.  I had the smoked pork, chili cheese brisket fries, cornbread, and macaroni and cheese.  Everything was delicious.  Portions were gargantuan.  Delivery was extremely fast.  LOVE!!
author: Emily P.

description:
get:
beef brisket
tangy cole slaw
pork ribs
house classic bbq sauce

meh:
baked beans

TIP:
spicy sauce is on fire spicy!!  not for the faint hearted.

service brisk and friendly.   clean restaurant with plenty of paper towels.
author: Josie M.

description:
For the love of all that is holy, whatever that may be for you, order the 18 hour smoked Brisket

Everything else on the menu is irrelevant
author: Seth S.

description:
Possibly the worst BBQ I've ever had.  The pork ribs were tiny and extremely dry.  My fiancee compared them to jerky.  The fries were under cooked and the mac and cheese had zero flavor.

If this is really one of the better BBQ joints in SF, I'm in trouble.
author: Kenso K.

description:
Just meh. I hope I didn't go there on a bad day. 

I ordered the burger but after paying for it they told me they ran out of patties. They recommended the brisket and I was expecting a brisket sandwich but they gave me the full meal with two sides at no additional cost. Yay.

GOOD
Mac and cheese is terrific. 
The peach pies were delicious with a sprinkle of powdered sugar. 

MEDIOCRE
Shredded porn and beans was bland and could've used some salt. 
The brisket was a bit dry but maybe that is why they have those squeeze bottles full of sauce. One of the caps was leaking and dribbled vinegar sauce all over the place.

The sauce was the only thing that redeemed the dish and that is not saying much.

There was nothing special about the cornbread.

SERVICE
Everybody is super friendly and a guy was walking around and asking us if all was fine.

COST
I paid $15 for a $19+ dish.
author: Evan W.

description: The guy at the front desk looked like he was high but he was surprisingly helpful. He recommended us to his all-time favorite and house special Mac and cheese, which did not disappoint. He also recommended the beef brisket, which was really good. He said that they smoke it for 18 hours therefore it is embedded with flavor. Our meal including drinks plus tips cost us about $48. I thought it was going to be cheaper but I guess meat is not cheap. But all things aside, we felt great afterwards. The food was very hearty and wholesome. I had their smoked chicken and coleslaw, the pairing could not have been any better. It hit the spot. Also tried the greens, and it was delicious. I'm not exposed to a lot of southern style bbq but I thought that this place was pretty good.
author: J C.

description:
K.I.S. = keeping it simple

My Meal 
Memphis Star = 3 stars 
Sweet Tea = 4 stars - a bit sweeter than I'd like but still pretty good (it would be perfect with a shot of vodka ;p ) 
French fries = 4 stars - I really enjoyed the seasoning 

Friends Meal 
3 meat platter = ribs 5 stars, sausage 4 stars, beef slices 3 stars (she really liked the ribs and said she'd come back for more) 
Mac n Cheese - 2 stars (good but not cheesy enough) 
Cornbread - 2 (not much to say, it was OK) 
Coleslaw - 2 (she said it was too sweet) 

We found metered parking on the street and arrived 15 minutes before the crowd so we were able to get a table. If you're not lucky and come on a busy day you may have to make it a to-go order because there isn't much seating. I may go back and try the fried chicken sandwich and a dessert but I don't have any plans to go back soon.

It sucks that I have to spend extra time at the gym for an okay meal.
author: Mel P.

description:
Place is real cute. Fun atmosphere, feels like you stepped out of San Francisco and into the Boondocks.

4 sauces mustard, vinegar, Texas red & spicy Beelzebub. 

Brisket so tender it falls apart on your fork.  Just a little dry. 

Grit cheese stocks are yummy.

Pork ribs are tasty. But dry.

Brisket fries too salty

Coleslaw crunchy, fresh and sweet.
author: Travis L.

description: The food of my people! I grew in Kansas City, and it's not exactly easy to find BBQ comfort food in San Francisco, so I'm pretty thrilled. Here's what I liked about Memphis Minnie's: Quirky cashier made me laugh; barbecued pork/egg roll fusion appetizer [quite possibly my favorite thing of all]; and potato salad that reminded me of home. It was such a cold night, I really came for the chili, which was just okay. Intrinsically, it was tasty -- only not all that warm nor spicy. My friend had a brisket sandwich and macaroni & cheese ... both of which I tasted and fully approve! They truly do an amazing job with the smoked meats. I wasn't too crazy about picking up my own food (not because I'm lazy, but because you literally have to reach into the chef's window like a food server would, and it was a bit precarious) and parking is a biiiiiiiitch, but the B-Q sauces are quite good (regular, spicy, vinegar-based and mustard options). Minnie definitely has notes that call to mind life in the Middle, so I shall return. And next time, I want that burger made from a mix of brisket and chuck.
author: Gregor G.

description:
We only stopped briefly for some wings but they were quite well done.

The fat was fully rendered, leaving a very crisp smoky wing with just enough seasoning to stand up to the sauce of your choice.

Perhaps a tad bit overpriced, but I would have rather come here than get food poisoned next door.
author: Charlie H.

description:
I usually pop into Memphis Minnie's to grab food before heading to Thursday night trivia at Mad Dog. 

What to order?

I usually get the Two Way Combo (any 2 meats, 2 sides + cornbread!). You will need a partner in crime to finish it. 
Rib tips-- GOOD!
Brisket--GOOOD!!
Ribs--GOOOOD!!!
BBQ Fries-- MUST!
Cornbread-- Butter me up!
Mac 'n cheese-- Mhmm!

Finally tried their spicy pulled chicken sandwich. DELICIOUS!!! Next time I have to try their special Thursday sandwich, Fried Chicken Sandwich, per Chai Chai's order.
author: Tina Y.

description:
HANDS DOWN THE BEST BBQ IN SF, MAYBE CALI!

I live in LA and whenever we make a trip to SF, no matter what, we always stop by for a sandwhich here. So good and unique tasting, and the mustard sauce is where it's at. The guys that work there are pretty cool too. 

One time I went to a wedding at a vegitarian hippy buddist farm outside san fran, and we were there for a week with NO meat- only greens grown on the farm. We actually ducked out of the weddding as soon as we could and our first stop was Minnies! We were craving meat sooooo bad. Ah, this place was like a rush of blood to the head! Yummers! 


I am considering having my WEDDING catered by this place! lol.
author: pat s.

description: Awesome BBQ, loved the country-style atmosphere, great sides. Would recommend to anyone looking for some good BBQ in San Fran.
author: Stephen L.

description:
I'm giving two stars for how nice the people are and how good the food tasted. 
The other stars I'm removing because I was sicker that night than I've been in ages. 
I've eaten here twice and am not likely to do so again. Too bad, because I love bbq.
author: Amani Ellen L.

description:
Meat heaven.

Brisket heaven.

Pulled Pork Egg rolls heaven.

Bring an empty stomach!

One of the best bay area BBQs for sure!!!
author: Joe Bob J.

description:
Is is the hype?  Is it the fact that tourists don't know any better?

THIS PLACE SUCKS.
author: Lauren L.

description: Absolutely a faBulous BBQ place. The REAL thing. Friendly and efficient staff and very reasonable prices. Their (new addition) Cheese Steak is awesome, and as is anything Brisket-specific. The pulled pork sandwich is again a must-have on my menu.  I can't speak to the Ribs as I honestly don't like ribs. Oh, and their deep-friend Pork Roll is incredible along with the sauce that is served with it.!
author: Tim P.

description:
SWILL! You folks in SF need to venture out somewhere and see what
BBQ is supposed to be like. This was the worst excuse for BBQ that I have ever had. Just to stay safe, based on many reviews, I ordered the brisket sandwich with a side order of their much touted Mac n cheese. The brisket was DRY, DRY, DRY, TOUGH and tasteless! And, how, someone tell me...just HOW do you f-up macaroni and cheese? That crap out of the box on the supermarket shelf would be way better. DRY &
STICKY, as in all stuck together and tasteless!!!! What a tremendous disappointment. This crap doesn't even resemble what I know to be BBQ.
Also, the ordering procedure is awkward and unclear, the environment needs a thorough CLEANING, and, adding insult to injury, they got our simple order WRONG! The waaaay toooo many goofy/dusty tsochkes in there does not make up for the horrible food. I would suggest that they close their doors and stop trying to be something they are not. I am sooo
very disappointed and would NEVER go back there! UGH!
author: Xenry W.

description:
I've been told by several Native Texans that Memphis Minnie's is the best brisket/BBQ experience in the city, hands-down. Coming from a Texan, that's high praise. It's like being called "holy" by the Pope or "beautiful" by a drag queen or  something like that. If you don't like the brisket, then there's something wrong with you.

In addition to brisket, the sides are all wonderful and I'd recommend the peach pie for dessert. Make sure to double-down on the yellow sauce, if you like tangy treats.

That having been said, I wouldn't veer into sandwich territory. Why so much bread? Are you afraid of the meat?
author: Steve L.

description:
Officially my new favorite place to eat in the city. Memphis Minnie's has the fastest service I have ever seen in my life - and the food's tasty too. My BBQ pork sandwich was great slathered with red sauce, and the mac 'n cheese was a great side. The corn muffins were so delicious that I wish I'd ordered another one. Plus, they have Stella Artois on tap - they clearly know the way to my heart.

Memphis Minnie's displays numerous awards on its walls from over the years, and it's easy to see why. Quick service, cool atmosphere, and some of the best food you'll find in the city. I'll be back for sure.
author: Jon C.

description:
Can't believe I have never reviewed this place as it is (shamefully) probably my favorite restaurant in town.
Having grown up on back yard BBQ, spending most of my teen years and early 20's BBQing river-side with a case of beer, and settling down with a southern boy, I have serious love for this genre of food.  
Problem?  I now live in a glorified closet with no access to a grill or smoker of my own.
Solution? Memphis Minnies.  Everything is good here.  EVERYTHING!
I've tried their brisket, tri tip, ribs, chicken fried chicken sandwich, pork, and every possible side.... ITS ALL SOOOOOO GOOOOD!
Favorites here have to be the brisket, which is always the perfect balance of meat and fat, and the mac n cheese, which is topped with crumbles of corn bread.  All of their sauces are tasty, and the variety helps tailor the barbecue to your exact craving.
Remember to wash it all down with a gallon of nummy sweet tea!
author: Jannea T.

description:
California just doesn't know BBQ. I'm sorry, but MM's bbq sauce is sooo weird.  They have 3 flavors to choose from:

a.) red sauce - super thin and sweet?!
b.) mustard sauce - yet again too thin and doesn't resemble bbq sauce in the least
c.) vinegar sauce - my least fav. Like a salad dressing that goes on the meat? What? Why?

I also got to try #14 on the SF Big Eat List - the beef brisket.  It was ok, but I preferred the chicken. 

So I basically stuck to the non-bbq-esque mustard sauce. I was so disappointed in this place. I wanted like normal, real bbq yesterday and I obviously didn't get it.

The only reason I'm giving it two stars is because the staff is friendly, and the meat is actually pretty good. I just wish I would've brought my head country (from Oklahoma) that I had in my fridge at home.  

I can't wait to go home and get my bbq fix. Or at least for someone to grill me up some delicious meet and douse it with my good ol' head country.
author: Jenny W.

description:
Went here for the first time last night:

1. Line was helllllaaaaaaa long but people were happy to wait and once I ordered I got my foods in ma bellys soon, so thats a plus. Guy at register was extremely enthused about the BBQ so that was promising.

2.Thought the briskey would be pulled or shredded so I was sort of dissappointed.

3. THE MUSTARD BBQ SAUCE AND THE BAKED BEANS WERE UNRIVALED. That good,  my friends, THAT GOOD.

4. I'd return. :)
author: Kate K.

description: The mac 'n cheese is really, really good.  High grade mac.  The sweet pork sandwich is also worth a holler.  The people that work there all seem to be really friendly, almost cheeky so they're usually good for a giggle.
author: Emily T.

description: Excellent ribs cooked over a wood fire. Best ribs in town! The potato salad rocked! And the onion strings are to die for!
author: Sbh H.

description:
This place is excellent.  One of my few regrets from when I lived in SF (2002) is that I didn't try to work here to learn how to make BBQ.  They get bonus points for the existence of Toronado across the street (reviewers complaining about the beer selection are missing the point), for offering sake (which is inspired) and for being a BBQ place in California that *isn't* texas-style.  I've been back since and it seemed basically the same.

My favorites were/are the beef ribs, pork ribs and the chopped pork sandwich.  I don't remember a pulled pork sandwich.  Great cole slaw and sides.
author: Gray C.

description:
Seeing a BBQ place that serves sake, I thought I had seen it all.

Until I walked out and saw the homeless guy pushing a piece of wood down the street with his stomach.  Then, the board slipped down, hit a crack in the street, and nailed the poor bastard in his twig and berries.

Pretty much a perfect night if you ask me.

The BBQ was great, we had the pork ribs and a pulled pork sandwich.

The guys that work here are beyond friendly.

For a good meal, just go.  

For a great meal, wait until the homeless guy with the "wood" is out front.

Groin.
author: Archie R.

description:
Reallllllllly, Big Eats SF? Is the beef brisket at Memphis Minnie's SO AWESOME that it deserves to be on the list of 100 things to try in SF?

Because reallllllllllly...I'm not feeling it.

The meat looked dry as a bone so I was surprised that it it was as tender as it was, but it still left me with a kinda ehhhhhhhhhhh overall impression. 

I didn't care for the sauces it came with and my corn muffin could not have been less exciting.

Ehhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: I really like this restaurant when I come to San Francisco but the damn place is always closed even when their website says they're open.   Very poor for customer longevity much less dealing with the horrible parking.  Never again!
author: Darrell C.

description:
Seems like the brisket is always too dried out or too fatty.  Beats the shit out of me.  Good smoke flavor although that seems uneven from day to day.  Part of me is sometimes disappointed here but I keep coming back.

Bo's bbq brisket in Lafayette is the best in the bay area.  You can cut it with a feather.  It's nice and moist too.  It's a religious experience.

I'm from Texas.
author: gary l.

description:
I like Memphis Minnie's okay, but I wish I liked them more.  I also wish it wasn't all the way in the haight where there's no parking and no close BART stop.

Anyway, as far as BBQ goes, this is the best I've found so far in SF.  That's not saying that much (I haven't really found an amazing BBQ place in SF yet) but I have been here a few times and enjoyed the food each time.  The pulled pork is quite tasty, but the ribs are kind of dry and could be a little bit more tender.  As far as sides, I thought the mac and cheese was average, and the sweet potatoes and fries were both good.  Next time, I plan to try their burger.

The prices are slightly higher than I'd like and it can be tough to get seating inside if its crowded, so keep that in mind.

Overall, I give this place a mild recommendation.
author: Chad H.

description:
You think their Pulled Chicken Sandwich is good???

I KNOW it's great!! 

And you know what's almost even better?....

The Chicken Fried Chicken Sandwich! Crispy chicken, soft roll, with a sweet, tangy slaw that compliments the sandwich SO well. 

ATTENTION!: this delectable sandwich is only available Thursdays! as it is the THURSDAY SPECIAL! 

You've really got to try it - it's making my mouth water just writing about it! 

Grab some BBQ fries, sweet tea, head over to Mad Dog for Thursday night trivia and YOU'RE GOOD TO GO.
author: Christine C.

description:
One of my most favorite BBQ restaurants in the sf area.  Love the tri-tip, ribs and brisket. Melts in ur mouth like butter.  For real; it melts. U only need the carolina mustard sauce.  Not that into the other sauces although i wish they had slightly thicker sauces.  But they are really just good for their smoked meats.  As my native born and raised Texan friend tells me, the sauce just gets in the way of the smoked flavor.  

For sides I like the beans and mac and cheese.  Not too into the corn bread.

Location is a little small but decent and it is sf.  

Decor is not kid-friendly. 

A Plus - u can double up ur meats for the 2-way or 3-way without extra cost. Portions are decent. And price is standard for BBQ. 

Single bathroom - decently clean.
author: john k.

description: Surprisingly good BBQ for a place outside of Texas. Stella was the only thing on tap, which was less than exciting, but they had Shiner bottles and the food made up for it. The mac 'n cheese was superb, as was the slow cooked brisket, and we got a free plate of chili cheese fries (probably because we had a few Texans in our group).  Definitely will be hitting this place up again.  And they take credit card - cha ching.
author: Carter G.

description:
The place is a good choice when you feel the need for that BBQ flavor.  The food is delicious, portions are quite large, and the price is not very high.
Don't expect anything fancy, but if all you want is a good BBQ experience, this is a good choice.
author: Sophia B.

description: Best slow roast and dry rubbed BBQ in the city, hands down. Some people don't get Minnie's because it's not about BBQ sauce here, even though the sauces at the tables are unique and delicious. Minnie's is about the slow roasted, 18 hour smoked, dry rubbed meats. Brisket and Tri Tip. Tri Tip sandwich with premium sake taster and the sweat and sour slaw they have with pickled ginger!
author: Jordan P.

description: You guys were right the beef brisket was to die for and the ribs are yummy!!
author: Melissa C.

description: Went in again and can't get enough! The food, the service. They are a no nonsense sort of place, with a joy and seriousness about BBQ... great BBQ. They do it and they do it well. We have such a great time there. Today Ben taught my kids how to draw a pig! It's the sort of place where you come in and feel like family. It's just a lovely experience every time. We did get some sad news that Allison is leaving... she will be missed! Best of luck on a new adventure, Allison! We ate an extra side just for you sweets!
author: Jessie J.

description:
The Brisket is by far my favourite thing here. But that sauce on the wings is also to die for!

My boyfriend and I just ordered a few different things, not plates or burgers/sandwiches. All the meat was moist and juicy. The onion strings are addicting. 

We weren't impressed with the sauces at the table. Just not as flavorful as we had hoped. 

I had to get a corn bread muffin to wash down the meat... was starting to get the meat sweats.

All in all it was good. We'll likely be back.
author: Stephanie V.

description: Where do I start? The beef brisket was amazing, the smoked and fried chicken was delicious, and the rib meat came right off the bone. Also, their Cole slaw was probably the best I've ever had. All around fantastic meal.
author: Kyle J.

description:
I really don't know what all the hype about this place is. 
I'm a HUGE fan of BBQ, American to Polynesian. This place sure disappoints and the quality of meat used would probably help its cause. From two different occasions, I've tried the ribs, chicken wings and the pulled pork, coleslaw and mac n' cheese. The meat was stringy and chewy, the wings were hairy and low grade. Pulled pork? Generic. 
I love coleslaw, but the coleslaw is not my style. I would think that should call it vinaigrette salad instead. 
Don't even get me started to the mac n' cheese - cakey and generic as well.
author: Peng M.

description:
As a child whose parents killed their own dinner, ordering meat scares me a little.  I wonder if it had a name, a favorite time of the year, or a little friend named Janney who played with it everyday after school and then came home one afternoon to find it missing and steaks on the table.  

After that, I requested pasta for dinner.  A lot of pasta.  

That being said... I don't actively seek out meaty meals.  

But, Memphis Minnie's is 'dern good barbeecue' as the white trash folk back home say when quoting jokes used on the teevee by overrated redneck comedians.

Sure, the animals that went into my "half pig/ half cow" sandwich might not have grown up on a sunny farm together and befriended a rat named Templeton and a spider named Charlotte, but eating the meat made my tummy and tastebuds happy - and life IS all about me, SO...

My friends swear by the Spicy Chicken sandwich, whereas others like ordering the combination plates, because then you get two sides.  The Mac & Cheese was delicious, the Cornbread wasn't bad, the BBQ French Fries were so tasty I forgot to share, and I didn't try the 'Slaw because that junk scares me.  Does it raise a red flag if I'm terrified of mayo, but don't mind eating something that used to have a face?

$33 for two very big meals, cooked quickly and devoured at little tables covered with glass and giant pourable bottles of BBQ Sauce and Mustard. 

Oh, and before you judge my family for killing, please remember they didn't shoot animals (or people) for sport.  Just for food and trespassing.
author: Janney B.

description:
I'll keep this review short. The staff was incredibly friendly, the food--delicious, and the ambiance--just perfect for the home-style cooking they offered.

I'd highly recommend getting the BBQ fries if you go! :D
author: Ty L.

description:
hmmm sorry Memphis Minnie's..

Although the service was very friendly, got to say the food was bland and a home BBQ would've been better.

Had the pork combo and the catfish.  I mean I just thought it would have more flavor especially for the price.  

Not sure if we'll come back...if we do, maybe to check out the ribs.
author: Melris C.

description: I told them I'd create a yelp account just to review them and this is it! My friends and I were lured in by the siren song of delicious smoked meat. We had JUST come from another restaurant and done some light sight seeing in the car when we spotted a place for an after dinner beverage. We didn't get that far. My cousin wanted Mac and Cheese and my buddy said he could go for some ribs. I was concerned where we'd be putting this food but my stomach ordered a platter of brisket, ribs, beans, and greens (and sweet tea to wash it all down)!! I was elated in how wonderful the food was. I thought for sure we'd need a box or three, but everything was so flavorful, juicy, we shoveled it down! The sauces we're amazing!!! I loved the Texas Red, and the hot was wonderfully wicked hot!! We never made it to the bar, and I'm glad. One more thing and I'd've gone belly up with a great smile on my face.  My buddy and I have been craving REAL bbq for ages, our Texas go-to guy passed away and, we've been mourning him as well as his cooking for years. I'm glad to say, he would've been proud at  Memphis Minnie's!! Thank you! Thank you!
author: Team C.

description: Really good tri-tip sandwich and great bbq beans.  Pit Master gave me a healthy sample of the pulled pork and it took me back to Carolina.  They have legit BBQ sauces including South Carolina style mustard based sauce and of course the vinegar based North Carolina sauce.  Would have five stars if they had hush puppies.
author: Christopher M.

description:
First off let me say this.  I love the food here.  So you may be asking why I am giving it only two stars, well it's because of their rising prices and small side dishes.

I've been coming to this place for almost five years and now my favorite dish (Southern Star) is $10.50.  $10.50!!!!  That's ridiculous.  It seems like everything has been going up in price here.  Well, that's enough of a deterrent for me.  The sandwiches have crossed the economic threshold for what me and my friends are willing to pay.

My second complaint is the small portions of their sides.  The mac and cheese side is like $5 and it's not even a cups worth.  Beans, potato salad, etc. are all served out of a cup you might expect to find ranch dressing in at a diner.  Not too mention that their pie slices are too small and the rest of the sides (which all look amazing by the way) are way too few in quantity to justify ordering any of them.  Again, I've been coming here for five years and have never once ordered any of the sides (that didn't come included with my meal) individually.  It's just a total rip off for what you get.

Aside from that, the BBQ itself is amazing.  The prices and portions are just getting really bad.
author: KC F.

description:
Although I of course cannot tout Ms Minnie as the best BBQ I've ever had or anything, I do appreciate her opening my eyes to the difference between Memphis BBQ and Texas BBQ - or as the cashier kindly noted as I asked for any sauces on the side: "All of our sauces are on the side. We don't RUIN the meat by slathering it in sauce."

Oh, um, thanks. Awesome. 

My chicken was good - albeit slightly dry - but as I'm not a big 'sauce' gal, I was appreciative of the fact that it had tons of flavor simply from being smoked. Or whatever they do to it for 8 hours... The firecracker fries were also pretty killer. I love me some sodium, and those things had enough to keep me retaining water for a week. Woo woo!

Only disappointment was the collard greens. Um, they were sweet. Sweet? Seriously? Someone needs to give these guys a trip to Roscoe's in LA. I'm not a fan of the essence of Miracle Whip in my roughage, unfortunately. 

All in all, I'd go back. I might not lasso up the horse and cross the plains to get there or anything, but thankfully, the wild wild west of San Francisco isn't too hard to navigate.
author: Veronica R.

description:
Their sauce reminds me of my ex-boyfriend: I just kept wishing it was thicker.

Memphis Minnie's is fine, and that's it. My husband and I shared a pulled pork sandwich and a plate of brisket and sausage links. The brisket was really tasty and fell apart nicely, but was a little dry. The pulled pork was not that flavorful. The links were scrumptious, especially dipped in the mustard sauce, but it's pretty hard to F up links.

There are three different sauces to choose from on the table: A red sauce, a vinegar-y sauce, and a mustard sauce. I was partial to the mustard sauce. The vinegar sauce was way too thin to stick to or flavor anything.
