We ended getting a combination of beef ribs, sweet-smoked pulled pork, beef brisket, andouille sausage, and smoked chicken. I tasted everything except the beef ribs.

Sweet smoked pulled pork: kinda bland and not as moist as I'd thought it would be. It tasted only a bit sweet, and not really smokey.

Beef beef brisket: moist and great beef flavor, but not really a smoke/bbq flavor. Nice thin layer of fat on top for juice. I needed to add sauce to it to make it to my liking.

Andouille sausage: good sausage! It had a bit of spice to it so it had good flavor and texture.

Smoked chicken: smokiness is there, but I found the meat quite dry.

+ Sides

Fries: Wow these were tasty! They gave us a mountain of them and they were really well-seasoned. Crispy and not swimming in oil either.

Macaroni & Cheese: swimming in cheese sauce, and super rich, not exactly appetizing, but more of a guilty pleasure.

Baked Beans: pretty standard, tasted how they are supposed to

Potato Salad: Good mix of eggs and mayo and other veges to go with the red potatoes. Consistency was there, but it tasted like regular potato salad.

Collared Greens: I'm not sure if they were supposed to be this way, but the greens tasted pickled, and were too tangy with vinegar to consume. We didn't eat much of it.

Coleslaw: too tangy and too sweet. This isn't coleslaw made with mayo. It's made with vinegar so it was wet, sweet, and sour. Didn't finish this either.

+ Conclusion

They didn't really screw up on anything, but it wasn't really awesome either. The sauces there are too sweet or too tangy for my liking. I'd come back if I was really hungry and in the area, but in terms of BBQ the search continues.

*looks into the horizon*
author: Charles L.

description:
I've really only had the one thing: sweet smoked pork sandwich. It's so good I've never wanted to have anything else. 

AND!!! AND!! they have Shiner Bach. A big deal for a Texan like me.
author: Emily W.

description:
So, the mac and cheese is better at the Hard Knox, as is the cornbread... but when you're having soul food, it's all about the side dishes. At a good BBQ  joint, it's all about the meat.

Meat is what they do well here. I personally go for a Southern Star: half a brisket sandwich and half a pulled pork sandwich. With potato salad or slaw, it's a fantastic lunch made better only by a post meal beer across the street at the Toronado.

Here's the tip... Wednesday is pastrami day (which they reckon might be the best east of 2nd Ave in New York). While it certainly isn't New York deli pastrami, it's amazingly good and addictive.

Beer, BBQ and sake (I know, I still can't figure it out) and pretty decent sides give Minnie's a clear 4 stars.
author: Avery G.

description:
still searching for *really* good BBQ here in the city.

MM's is the best I've found to date (and a damn bit better than big nate's).

I had the tri-tip platter, with baked beans and potato salad for sides and a cornbread muffin.  the meat was done perfectly -- a nice medium rare with a good crust on the outside, thinly sliced and well-portioned.  good stuff.

the baked beans were *really* good.  home run there.  as was the potato salad.

the cornbread muffin was, um, like a chunk of partially moistened corn meal.  it looked good, but ate like a sawdust brick.  crunch.  crunch.  I hate cornbread muffins that taste like a fluffy, sickly-sweet cornbread cake... but would have preferred even that over being served a gritty door-stop.

also didn't get the "BBQ" sauces they make available at the tables.  they have a "south carolina" mustard sauce (which tastes like it would be good on a salad, but eeep -- keep it away from the meat!)... a "north carolina" vinegar sauce (good for fries, perhaps?) and a candy-assed, "texas red sauce."

perhaps it's my own regional tastes in BBQ prejudicing me here... but none of these sauces taste good on meat.  isn't that a BBQ sauce pre-requisite?  if your idea of a BBQ sauce is limited to one dimension: sweet... you'll do fine.  I'd like a little smoke and the option of a little heat to mine, thanks.

not saying you shouldn't give 'em a try though.  I'm sure I'll go back to try out some of their other offerings... while continuing my search for a 4 or 5 star BBQ joint here.
author: Mark B.

description:
I must have come on a good day, because after reading all of the mediocre reviews, I came with zero expectations.  We were the first people in the restaurant, so our food was fresh outta the smoker.  I only get brisket at BBQ places and this brisket did not disappoint.  This is legit BBQ, unlike Bo's where they put the "east bay twist" on it.  The brisket had a delicious pink smoke ring and a pretty thick layer of fat that kept the meat moist.  You have a choice of the three sauces on the side (S. Carolina mustard, N. Carolina vinegar and Texas red) and they're at the table, so you can put as little or as much on as you'd like.  

I also got the two sides of beans and mac n' cheese.  The beans were to DIE for.  Baked with pieces of brisket (and I'm sure cooked in fat or drippings), these beans were super tasty.  The mac n' cheese wasn't mindblowing, but the thick Velveeta-style sauces was pretty good.  Add a cornbread muffin, and the whole plate was delicious!  The bf had a side of coleslaw and couldn't eat more than a couple bites since it tasted like cucumber vinegar salad.  Gross.  Skip that one for sure.  

The one downfall that took this down to 4 stars was the guy behind the counter.  He had a chip on his shoulder and acted like we had just stepped into BBQ heaven.  Everything seemed like a chore to him and he had an attitude that you don't expect to find at any restaurant, let alone a laid-back BBQ joint.  

The place itself was pretty kitschy with pigs and t-shirts and awards all over.  The only thing this place needs is a cool outdoor area, but I guess you can't have it all.  

Bottom line: If you can catch this place on a good day, you're golden.
author: Kathleen B.

description:
When it comes to BBQ, everybody has a different idea about what's good. I've been to Big Nate's and I thought I didn't like BBQ no more.

My order: beef brisket+mac&cheese+fries+corn bread and 1/2 pound of Cajun Andouille sausage.
Neil's order: combo of brisket, pulled pork, pork ribs+collard greens+mac&cheese+corn bread.

"I'd love to see you finish all that" the dude behind the counter said.
"You'd be surprised" I said, thinking "you have no idea"
"You don't have to worry about this one" Neil said pointing at me.

Brisket plate's portion was a little small for me but the 1/2 lb sausage and sides helped fill me up. I even help Neil finish his . . . 

Brisket was super tender and nicely charred and smoked on the outside. So juicy I almost didn't chew'em. Flavor could use a little bit more marinating . . . This is probably my Chinese side talking since we always marinate meat before BBQ-ing.

Sorry to say that I like Chili's baby-back better than the pork ribs here . . . SOWWIE!!!!

Mac&cheese was forgettable. Still love the mac&cheese at Home (the restaurant on church and market).

I decided that first lining the meat with some of that vinegar and then mixing the South Carolina mustard and North Carolina red sauce was the best way to go =) Or did I get'em all mixed up?
author: DANIEL T.

description:
This place was good not great. I really wanted to love it.

First off - it is TINY inside so you're lucky to get a seat on a busy night.

The service I found to be very unfriendly. The spicy pulled chicken sandwich was good - I'd get it again. The thing I do like about this place is the variety of sauces on each table from spicy mustard to vinegar.

I was disappointed with the mac and cheese - it was a weird consistency, had a funky taste to it and was luke warm - I'd skip that next time. Oh and they have sake to wash it all down with.
author: Chili B.

description:
So I've only had take out from here brought to me by a friend, which means I may have missed a killer restaurant ambiance and experience.  I got a pulled pork sandwich and my reviews are a little mixed.  Not a whole lot of flavor in the meat and a pretty sparse sandwich, but the sides of coleslaw and beans were pretty bomb.  I liked their variety of sauces, but good meat shouldn't need too much sauce, and their BBQ sauce was actually the worst one!

I tried my friends ribs and they were decent but nothing to jump for.  I think the only reason I wasn't disappointed by this meal was the fact that I had just watched Wall-e a couple times and was glad I wasn't being a fat ass drinking my meals out of a cup...just a fat ass eating a sandwich.
author: Brian H.

description:
Boy howdy!

I happened upon this place while visiting my pa' in SF. He mentioned this place and whipped out a menu, proceeding to order the prepared playes. BAH! I yelled...you don't order prepared plates at a place like this...you order BY THE FRIGGIN' POUND! So...$112 later, we had a feast! And I agree with many of the postings here...the brisket was some of the finest I have EVER had. Ribs weren't worthy and the sausage wasn't my kind...but they were good.

2-day post feast report: I am proud to report that we have achieved "Fire in the hole!" after this one! I just may up my rating to a 5 based on this alone! WOOOHOOO!
author: Scot B.

description:
Memphis Minnie's is a fun place to go. I like the decor a lot. The quality of the food is very good, but I'm just NOT in love with the BBQ sauces here. And that really puts a damper on my BBQ experience if I'm not IN LOVE with the sauce, man. 

I keep meaning to eat brunch here, 'cause I hear it's yummy delicious. 

The shop owner is a really nice fellow, but generally the other staff is humorless and kinda unpleasant. 

I will probably keep coming back because it's still a good place. They have great sides and very high quality meats, but sheesh, the sauce doesn't thrill my buds.

I keep meaning to get some Memphis Minnie's to go and use Big Nate's BBQ sauce on it instead. That might just put me over the BBQ edge.
author: Yvette K.

description:
This place is overhyped. 

Ordered a Minnie's Taster place w/ pork ribs, brisket, spicy sausage w/ sides of seasoned fries and sweet potatoes. Also ordered a cup of chili. Meat overload! The meat flavoring was mediocre, the 3 sauces on the table were pretty gross. The chili was sooo heavy, one or two spoonfuls and I was done. 

Far better meat and sides at Uncle Franks in Mountain View. The bbq at my work is sooooo much more flavorful and delicious. oh well!
author: Jen P.

description:
I found out about this place from the stellar reviews on Check Please Bay Area and apparently, so has everyone else. The place was packed. I could sense the regulars fuming that their little cozy Lower Haight BBQ joint had been invaded by foodies. The system of ordering was a bit confusing and this tension was in the air. My questions of "So, how does this work, exactly?" were met with hostility and anxiety from other customers. People, relax -- it's BBQ! 

My girlfriend and I split the three-meat platter, we got Texas Beef Ribs, Brisket and Smoked Chicken. All three were incredible, but I can't believe I didn't order any pork! What the hell is wrong with me?? 

The meat was flavorful and the BBQ sauce at our table was great, but I honestly didn't even need to coat everything with it. The chicken was incredibly tender. My only complaint was the brisket was a tad dry for my taste. 

The demand on a Friday night was so intense that they literally SOLD OUT OF FOOD by 8pm, which seems to happen a lot lately according to these reviews. 

Good food, reasonable prices, friendly staff, fun n' kitschy ambiance. I would definitely go back to try more of the eclectic menu.
author: Roman H.

description:
I don't understand how anyone can think this is 4 star barbeque.

i guess not everyone has been to the South or experienced authentic bbq. Memphis Minnies would not last a week in Memphis.

Dirty tables and decor, dry food, mediocre sides, all in all relatively tasteless unless you drown it in their subpar sauce. And it's not cheap to boot. 

Oh well, you take what you can get.
author: martin l.

description:
I was there -- got the st louis pork rib platter.  It was OK.  I mean the portions were big enough, the meat was tender, but man I have had WAY better BBQ than this in my life.  The corn bread muffin was dry and fairly bland.  The beans weren't tangy at all.  I mean BAKED BEANS are supposed to be tangy.  

I'd probably rate it higher, but forking over $17 for casual dining fare and a drink is really a bleeding screw.  But you know, they have a veritable monopoly on this kind of thing in SF.  Now I want to go back to Milwaukee and go to Pitch's for some real rib action.
author: Eric X.

description:
Review of St Louis Ribs 'n sauce; handcut fries:  Went this afternoon based on yelper comments thought it would be nice to do up some Sunday bbq in the lower haight.  If you go, also read Rick H's review about the drop in quality of rib meat because I hope the pork ribs were once better than this-- they are big-boned, but the meat is too dry and lacks full smoke.  Howevah, the superior taste of the sweet Texas Red Sauce (Rick refers to) remains apparent.  Their sweet texas red sauce has punch, depth, smoothiness and a very subtle heat-- the components of great bbq sauce.  Not to be mistaken for the orangey (Kansas?) sauce (they supply orange & sweet red sauces for your ribs) that needs to cut back about 1/3 of vinegar-- way too astringent.  

Another miss: though my heart palpitates at the site of the phrase "handcut fries,"  MM's bbq fries were a downer.  First, I wish I knew they were SHOESTRING fries 'cause unless it's sweet potato shoestrings, McDonald's or "pomme frites"-- I don't believe in shoestring fries.  Since they were none of the above, it got even sadder when I opened the container to discover a MOUND O' FRIES over-coated in an addictive bbq spice which IS addictive but cannot mask the soggy, starchy, shoestring potato compromise.

(I did not have it, but the people beside me looked like they were really enjoying the beef brisket and possibly the tri-tip; those cuts looked ok-- from about 5 feet away!).  

I will go back for brunch because the space is really cute, clean and the staff appears super-friendly, and how can one resist the concept of BARBECUE BRUNCH??

HOWEVER, for authenticity's sake-- IF you want falling off the bone meat succulent specialty sauce ribs, homemade sides and full-on street-cred you go to Brother-n-laws in the Western Additon NOT Memphis-minnie-mouse in the faux lo-haight!  The IDIOT reviewer who said the MM is better than Brother-n-Laws is obviously typing with one hand and holding a crack pipe with the other!
author: E L.

description:
I don't get it...everyone says this is "The Best" bbq in town. I've tried it on numerous occasions since it took over Spaghetti Western. (a place dear in my heart still) I just find the meat way too dry, is that what 'good smoked meat' is supposed to be? Then you drown it in a mediocre sauce? No, sorry, I like meat that hasn't been dried to the near point of jerky. The veggies are way overcooked, fries are spiced but also sugared, too weird for my taste. Everything is too sweet, the sauces, the fries, the sweet tea. I keep meaning to try the wings and grits, but have not yet been pleased by anything else on the menu. 
I like the guys behind the counter though, they are always sweet but snarky, my favorite combo.
author: Colleen B.

description:
Beef brisket sandwich, you are my new go-to stoner food.

What's up with the super-sweet collard greens though? I think I detected pineapple in there.
author: Kelly M.

description:
I want to give this place 3 stars for having some so-so menu items and inconsistencies in quality, but I can't because I love their burgers too much. Ask for yours medium, with grilled onions and pimento cheese. I promise you'll like it. Promise.

The second reason, I can't give it three stars is the shrimp and grits that they serve for brunch. Creamy grits, served with a nice portion of grilled shrimp, tomatoes, cheese, and green onions. So terribly rich and awesome that most of the time I pretend it doesn't exist, just so I can fit in my jeans.
author: stephanie c.

description:
This place is soooo good. Its got my vote for the best BBQ in the bay area. All their meat is good. My favorite is the pulled pork (oh sweet & tender pulled pork... how I loveth thow) but the tri tip & brisket is top knotch.

I'm sure the other meats are good too but the pork, tri tip, and brisket are all so good I've never even tried anything else. Get a plate, get a sandwich, get a Memphis Minnie's sampler & share it! Whatever you do, you'll walk away happy. Everyone who works there acts like a douche, but its part of the atmosphere and gives the place some motzie. Once you get used to the ordering setup & service and actually get to know the workers a bit, you see its really just a show.

You're still reading this? GO GO GO GO GO GO!!!!
author: Jeff S.

description:
YUM!!! Super causal restaurant with a great atmosphere. There are piggies decorations everywhere and the walls are covered with t-shirts and more decorations. 

You order with the cashier and pick your own table. The table comes with 3 big bottles of sauces: Texas red sauce, north Carolina vinegar sauce and south Carolina mustard sauce, all very tasty. When your name is called, you can pick up your food from the friendly chefs. 

Our friendly cashier gave us great recommendations and informed us that they have some super big plates if we were hungry. I ordered the southern star - half Texas brisket and half memphis sweet pork sandwich, potlikker greens, corn bread muffin and a sweet tea. It was soooooooo tasty. The brisket just melted in your mouth and the different sauces made the meat super juicy. 

I also saw bbq seasoned fries and fried cheese grit sticks on the menu and can't wait to come back and try it. They also sell meats by the pound and have a variety of sake - apparently, it's delicious with bbq and I won't disagree. There's also fried peach pie, banana puddn and sweet potato pie on the dessert menu.

Plenty of reasons to come back again. :-)
author: Gladys C.

description:
It shocks me that 200+ people give this place an average of 4 stars. I would give this 3, but I'm trying to skew the average so its a little more realistic. 

This is not a 4-star BBQ restaurant. Although the meat is tender and falls off the bone, you have to add a lot of their sauce in order to get taste out of it. And I'd avoid the chicken altogether since it doesn't have much flavor. 

As for sides, don't get the cole slaw. Yuck. The mac n' cheese is good, as are the beans. Nothing special though. And I vote for the Sweet Potato pie for dessert. There's always a happy ending with that. 

Overall, it's a decent place and you get a lot for your money. But it could be better. In fact, I pick Nate's BBQ over this any day.
author: eileen b.

description:
I went there once, and I was unimpressed.

I read all the reviews again, and realized that I had to give it another shot.

Today, I gave it another shot. Not only did they run out of ribs at 11:30am (I know, WTF?), but the sides were overly sweet, the BBQ sauces were strange, and the meat was only so-so.

The rib tips - dry but edible. Not too much smokey flavor, but at least the cartilage was tender.

Beef Brisket - I tell ya, i never seen meat that looked so funny, but it was juicy and nice. A little smokey flavor, and just the right amount of fat - I'd say this was the best thing we got.

Chicken - dry and uninspired. 'nuff said

Pork - pretty tasty, slightly on the dry side, but above average

Tri-tip - no thoughts whatsoever

coleslaw - omg wtf was this shit. it's like sugar water + vinegar + cabbage and red peppers. no good.

Mac n Cheese - bland at best

Greens - DO NOT GET THESE. Sweet mother of God. It's like someone drowned some green napkins in a jar of high fructose corn syrup. I never tasted something so offensive.

Fries - they're pretty good for fries, and the dry rub is tasty.

Cornbread muffin - slightly above average.

Mustard sauce - the most interesting of the 3 sauces, a little too buttery for my taste

Texas sauce - omg who turned on the cinnamon-sugar faucet? somebody's gotta control that. that's almost all you can taste!

Vinegar sauce - like...it's black vinegar. with some pepper in it. is that bbq sauce?

I'll go back again for the ribs and adjust my review accordingly, but for now, only 3 stars.
author: Kevin L.

description:
I'm very happy that Memphis Minnie's is not in my Rincon Hill neighborhood. If it were, I'd be growing in all the wrong places I'm afraid as I absolutely love barbecue and the southern variety side dishes they prepare.

I had the pork ribs, and no knife was needed as the meat came right off. It has a good taste ... but I tossed on the mustard barbecue sauce here and there to sharpen it a bit. The beans were wonderful .. not sure what flavoring is in there, but I knew I wanted more of 'em.  Spiced up french fries were also a delight.  The one disappointment on the plate was a cornbread muffin ... I'm still waiting to find cornbread on the west coast that's worth a dang.

I didn't have any when I visited, but there seems to be quite the selection of sake to help wash down the pork at Memphis Minnie's.

There's an overload of pig memorabilia in display cases and barbecue restaurant t-shirts on the walls.  The folks behind the counter are very kind ... neighborhood-y types, talking to some of the regulars and knowing their first names.  I like supporting these types of places .. good food and good attitudes.
author: Jamie W.

description:
I admit, I went here because I saw the stellar reviews on "check please bay area". I have gone here at least three times. I feel like I went to a slot machine and on the first pull won a jackpot - so even though I don't always win, I still come back and play this slot machine. 

The first time I went here I fell in love. I came with a large group and we got to try almost all the entree on the menu - and it was all good. The meat fell off the bones of the ribs, the sausage was smoky and salty delicious, the brisket was soft and had a great sauce, the chicken was also fall of the bone tender and so tasty, everything - good. The sides were a mixed blessing but who cared after those great main dishes. 

I went back with a different group and it was good, but not as great as the first time. Also, no ribs, they all ran out. 

Next time, we did have the ribs but it was dry! The brisket was also dry and the sausage...dry (how is this possible?!?)! Now, when the entrees aren't as good, you start to notice the sides. I love mac and cheese and gain much pleasure in trying new mac and cheeses. Minnie's is wet. I'm not sure if this is a southern thing or what, but I don't like it. This was runny almost soupy mac and cheese. Yuck, I want cheesy gooey yummy cheese with cheese flavor on every piece of pasta. Not liquid cheese soup with pasta in it. Potato salad was average. 

So here are am with dry food and average sides. What was the saving grace for this meal. 1. alcohol. 2. the sauces on the table. With the sauces, even though th meat was dry it was a salvageable with the sauces on the table. 

Don't expect to sit down. We went on at 3PM on a Sunday and still had to wait. And by the time we left there was a line out the door. The workers are super cool though and won't let anyone sit down with out ordering first. They have crazy eagle eyes that WILL know if you're trying to grab a seat ahead of your turn. If you're against communal seating, I suggest you do take out. I like this since I like to talk to my stranger neighbors (stranger as in someone I have never met, not stranger as is more strange).

Break down (break down do-wap do-wap):
Food: 3-5 depending on what day you catch it 
Atmosphere: 2 hard to get a seat but once you do, enjoy it, talk to your neighbor and see what they like. My last neighbor loved her collard greens - I might try it next time
Price: 3 It's more than I'd like to pay for BBQ but when it's good it's a bargain. When it's bad, it's not worth it. Regardless always worth the gamble. 

Final: 2.75 (I weigh food higher than the others) -3.75 So a solid 3.25 stars. But could be as good as a 3.75 stars! 

OK enough math.

Oh! I totally forgot! The cheese grits fries are AWESOME!
author: Tray I.

description:
My brother 'makes' me go here whenever I'm in town.  It is the one place where I always make an exception for my vegetarianism for.  I can't really single anything out, as everything I've ever had here is fanflabbytastic.

(Yeah, that's right, I'm a vegetarian who occasionally likes to eat some barbecued flesh.  What are you gonna do, call Moby on me?)
author: Alex G.

description:
If I were able to rate each menu entry separately, it'd be 5, nay 6 stars for the brisket alone. Memphis Minnie's walks away from all the local barbecue competitors just on the basis of the quality of the meat. The best sauce in the world can't compensate for gristly meat chunks.

The sides are all tasty--greens, yams, cole slaw. I wish the portions were a little bigger, because it's good and I want more of it. 

My biggest gripe is the sauces. Memphis Minnie's offers a choice of 3 sauces on the tables. A mustardy sauce, a vinegary sauce, and a more typical bbq sauce. I'm generally skeptical of self-lubricating barbecue situations, but I wish Memphis Minnie's tried harder in the sauce department. The sauces are not only self-serve (which means the meat is not sauced on arrival) but also they're merely adequate. I'd be happier buying a bucket o' brisket and bringing it home to use my own home-made barbecue sauce.
author: Nato G.

description:
Was highly recommended by friends and was pretty alright.
Cute gal working behind the counter...
author: Peter O.

description: Yay! Another spot with real deal bbq. Such a rare find now a days. Had the brisket and ribs, wow melt in your mouth brisket. The ribs however, were really dried out, a bad day maybe? Hence the 4 stars. The catfish and fries were amazing and the sauces all made from scratch goodness! Buttery flakey fish, yummy get in my belly goodness. The potato salad and beans uber goodness. If you are in SF and craving bbq get here NOW!
author: Charlotte G.

description:
Some of the best brisket I've had.  Absolutely love their brisket sandwich with a side of sweet potatoes and a couple corn muffins to snack on.  Sometimes I wish they had a more extensive beer selection but Toronado is just across the street.

Nothing to complain about except that this place can be pretty hectic when it's packed.  I've never had meat that was too dry or sides that weren't tasty so as far as I'm concerned the consistency in quality is good enough for me.  I've only been here a dozen times though.

Love the mostly bluegrass music playing every time I eat here.
author: Jeff C.

description:
I ABSOLUTELY LOVE MEMPHIS MINNIE'S!!!

*Brisket Sandwich* (FAN-F'ING-TASIC!) .. MY FAVORITE - Get it every time I go with a side of  sweet potatoe's!
The Ribs are reallly good and the pulled pork is melt-in-your-mouth delicious!

I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu. EVERYTHING is REALLY good... Except I'm not too sure about those brownie bacon bars, those are a little WEIRD for my taste buds.

Oh, and mix the Texas Red sauce with the Stupid Hot sauce, just trust me on that one.
author: Katie J.

description: Enjoyed the brisket; looking forward to eating my way through the rest of the menu.
author: Dave B.

description: I went there for the first time yesterday. I always Yelp food places because, well hell, we eat 3 times a day. Thinking of that place right now makes me hungry. The briscuit was lean(you never see that) the sauces were thin and spicey, mustardy. They have their own style, which is good. Not a copycat, kc masterpiece using place. The guy messed up on my side though, I asked for beans and I got greens. But, still trying to figure what they were about, like a pickled spinich thing, pretty damn good too. The guy behind the counter gave me the full 411 before i ordered, and I would surely return.
author: dave d.

description:
Memphis Minnie's is a meat lovers paradise. I didn't know it was even possible to bbq meat for 18 hours, until I discovered Memphis Minnies' brisquit. Make sure to get that, along with the andouille sausage and a side of mac and cheese.

They also serve sake here. Who would have thought???
author: John M.

description:
This may be sacrilege, but I prefer the pork to the brisket.  The brisket seemed a little bland last night for some reason.

I went in with a purpose this time, pecan pie or death.  Well I made it to the pie round and it was well worth it.  Some of the best I have ever had in fact.

An added bonus was the impromptu sketch style performance of Hamlet by the staff.  Perhaps it is a new genre, Shakespeare and Memphis style BBQ.
author: Matt T.

description:
The BBQ is too bland for my taste. It seems like they don't spice it up and marinate it long enough before putting it on the pit. The pork ribs I had last night weren't falling-off-the-bone tender like I like 'em, and I've been disappointed in the brisket in the past.

I really, really like the fried catfish, but they're out of it 50% of the time that I try to order it. Sheesh, last night they were out of half the items on the menu. Admittedly, we did waltz in 15 minutes before closing.

And the greens. Why oh why do I keep ordering the greens? There's 2 camps when it comes to flavoring greens. One is the vinegar camp, and the other is the pork product camp (bacon, salt pork, ham hock, etc.). I fall solidly into the latter. I keep a big hunk of salt pork in my freezer just for making giant pots of excellent greens. Sadly, Memphis Minnie's is way in the vinegar camp. It's pretty much like eating a cup of vinegar.

The beans I had last night were awful. Seems like they hadn't been soaked or cooked long enough, and they were crunchy. At least they threw some pork into the pot for those, though.

They have a new sauce, called "It's Stupid Hot Sauce" or something which was really good and REALLY spicy. It salvaged my pork ribs.

The service is friendly. And I'll probably keep going back, because when I stumble out of Toronado after several beers, BBQ always seems like such a good idea, and I'm too drunk to remember that disappointment awaits.
author: Jessica J.

description:
Super friendly staff and yummy food, including sweet potatoes as a side option. 
As my other half likes to say: Swine is Fine!
The mustard sauce is quite good, too.
author: Sara B.

description:
Update: After a recent visit I've decided to upgrade the rating to 3 stars. Probably spurred on as much by my lack of good BBQ as anything else. The meat was good, it was smoked properly and had a very generous smoke ring, but it still failed to deliver the succulent tenderness that I'm used to. Still, my ratings criteria is a bit stricter than most. If this place was in Kansas City I'd never have given a second thought to coming back. Their sauces are still their weakest link and part of this seems almost intentional given how the owner is diametrically opposed to my own fierce loyalties as a strong proponent of dry BBQ. Even if you take it to go and put your own sauce on it at home it's just not quite up to the standards or really good BBQ.

Mediocre, but perhaps given the environment it might top out at average. So add a star if you're West coast born and raised, but if you're from a place that knows how to do BBQ right and have strong opinions about the proper way to do it then, well, this probably isn't for you.

Personally the biggest problem for me is that I'm from Kansas City and they just didn't offer an appropriate sauce. All three sauces available are strong vinegar sauces and reflect more of a focus on Carolina style (both mustard and a light tomato sauce are available) bbq than Memphis style. The "Texas style" sauce seemed a bit off , but then I've never been as familiar with Texas sauces. What was totally lacking, though, was a thick, rich molasses-laden sauce of the type that really speaks to me as barbecue and without this, well... it just wasn't right.

The meat itself didn't really live up to much of anything with the ribs failing to be fall-apart tender and without a lot of flavor on their own.

If you're in the Lower Haight and really need some bbq then maybe stop in and give them a try, but if not... well, it's not worth crossing the city for and it's probably not worth a second trip.
author: Mark S.

description:
Not a bad place to eat BBQ, although the meats were all more dry and crispy than I had hoped.  The side dishes of mac and cheese (which tasted like fake cheese and not in a good way) and the french fries.  THe corn bread was a bit dry, so have your water ready before attempting to eat it.

The only highlight worth mentioning was the chili cheese fries, which were drenched in tasty chili and good fries.  Unfortunately one dish isn't enough for me to raise the rating above 3.  I may go back to try other items but I'll be in no hurry to do so.
author: Stephen H.

description:
When I first moved to SF, I came here literally every day.  Those were the days when they had hand pies(imagine a bbq empanada).  And who can forget their weekend brunches with stuff like beef brisket omelets.  also gone.

My main beef (no pun intended) with Minnie's is:

1. they get rid of their best menu items for no reason (hand pies, armadillo eggs, etc)

2. they stopped brunch

3.  there is high staff turnover and therefore the food is not consistent because there are always new people working the line.

When they introduced their Wednesday Pastrami sandwich, it compared to the 2nd Ave Deli Pastrami in it's own unique way and that is almost impossible to do.  (FYI, 2nd Ave Deli is what all these fake kosher-style Delis in the Bay area aspire to be)

The last 2 times, I have ordered the Pastrami, it has been either dry and/or bland. Don't know if this is attributed to new staff on line

Ditto for the Chicken Dinner. Was great 3 years ago, now eh.

All bashing aside, It is still one of the best places to eat in the Bay area and the owner is Jewish, so I have to support my peoples.  Just don't tell the Rabbi about the pork going on over there,
author: Jason B.

description:
let me start off with letting you know that i'm not a big meat eater.  i don't eat beef or pork, but i do eat chicken and some other variations.  BUT i love side dishes.  i love mac & cheese, greens, french fries and corn bread.  

that said... the chicken was ok and the sides were just ok.  i wasn't a big fan of the mac & cheese, greens or corn bread.  

i guess it comes down to expectations.  my expectations for this place were very high, since i had heard it was the best bbq.  however, i was let down.  

now if i went there with no expectations or if i read some of the yelp reviews first, then i might not have expected as much and would thought "hey, this isn't so bad.  i didn't taste any old man spit."
author: jen b.

description:
Awesome food. Plus when the four of us sat in the corner, the guy taking the orders said that he'd move us to a bigger table so we'd be more comfy. What?! And nice people too? Aww yeah!

Plus the bbq sauces and nummmmmy. And don't even get me started on the greens...
author: joann p.

description:
I use to go here for lunch when I worked in the city over 3 years.  I was notorious for food runs and got a lot of people in the office to try this place.  We would order meat by the pound which is the best way to go for a group.  We usually get a full pound of the brisket, some ribs, and chicken.  I've been back on my own to order enough to make some sandwiches with the left over brisket.

I perfer this place over Big Nates which covers everything with sauce.  I like having my sauce on the side and I like dry rub BBQ's over heavily sauce cooked BBQ.

I didn't give them 5 stars because it can be a wait to get your food.  Rule of thumb is that if you're getting take out, order about an hour earlier than when you plan to pick up.  

BTW I found it interesting when I was watching the travel channel a few weeks back on best BBQ across the states.  Memphis Minnies was named on the show, who'd of thunk I've been going to this place for over 4 years.
author: Twist' D.

description:
Not your traditional BBQ spot - but don't get me wrong, this place is still good.  I have to agree with other yelpers, the sides are odd (collared greens)- but if you like weird flavors like I do - give it a try!

I'd still rather go into a hole in the wall smokehouse for some messy ribs and homestyle sides though.
author: Melissa P.

description:
I've been coming here as much as I can for the last five years for lunch.  Last night for dinner, my husband and I ordered:

- The pulled pork was moist and tender. Hint of smoke, but not overwhelming. You can actually taste the meat. Love the pig and the pig will love you. Delicious!

- The rib-tips were a little dry, but after trying the ribs at Everett & Jones, these were definitely not  bad.

- Tri-tip had slivers of fats meshed in with chunks of good ol' flesh. It was cooked just right. 

- The lickin' greens played a tug-of-war of  sweet and sour vinegar taste in my mouth that was different to greens I've had at other bbq places. I would have loved it more if I had not doused my meats with the wonderful vinegar sauces on the table.  

- Mac and Cheese. I'm a sucker for anything that mixes cheese and pasta. This one was ok, but not the best I've had because it wasn't creamy and could have been warmed up a little so it wasn't congealed. 

- Cornbread I didn't try because I was so stuffed. In the past I have enjoyed it.

Staff has always been friendly. The cashier did a great job controlling the tables during peak dinner time (don't occupy table until you place your order).  The place was small and it packed last night. 

The menu has grown since my last visit over a year ago. Not too sure I like the egg rolls and sake on the menu, but oh well.  As long as the  the meats are the main attraction and cooked well, then I'll still come back.
author: YAMMY C.

description:
I was very disappointed with this place, in looking at some other reviews it just seems like I went on an "off" day. I went to school in the South and am particular about my BBQ, but really don't consider myself a food snob. I had the pulled pork (dry, with the seasoning overpowering the taste of the pork), sweet potatoes (ok), mac & cheese (not very cheesy, with an odd mustardy aftertaste) and the cornbread (very dry). I tried the pork ribs, which were also dry and overwhelmingly spiced (with cumin?) and the greens, which were actually pretty tasty - tangy, sort of like shredded pickles. The mustard sauce was nice, but the bbq sauces were forgettable.

At any rate, if you like a modern twist on traditional barbecue then you may want to check out this place. If you're like me though and are more into the artery-clogging Southern style (flavorful yet non greasy meat falling off the bone, moist barely sweet cornbread, mac & cheese swimming in grease, etc) then feel free to skip this joint.
author: Kamini T.

description:
I have a poor sense of direction and when I mentioned BBQ to my friend after attending the Chihulay exhibit at the DeYoung in GG park it had kicked into full gear. I thought we could walk to Haight and there it would be in all its porky goodness. Little did I know it would end up being a 2 mile hike. Boy, were we hungry when we arrived.

I had the 2 way combo plate, meat # 1 was the St Louis ribs (nice smoke pinkness, very tasty with a combo of their regular Texas BBQ sauce which has a heavy spice content and a healthy dash of their HOT sauce), meat # 2 was the Beef Brisket, this was OMG good and I had plenty but I didn't share this moist and smoky meat.  There was so much meat I let my ribs get cold and they transformed into dry nubs :(.

I have to warn everyone about the greens they have a sweet mustardy flavor oddly interesting but very sweet. The mac and cheese had good flavor but soggy. The corn meal muffins look great but the use of stoneground grits is too hard for this recipe, I suggest a 1 hr soak in milk before baking. 

My friend had the smoked chicken plate and it was 1/2 a chicken, moist and meaty. She is from North Carolina and found the NC BBQ sauce lacking in heat, no matter how much we shook the sauce. But, the mustardy BBQ sauce was just right for the chicken. 

Nice folks and fast service.
author: Lhm M.

description:
Sunday morning, a little hungover, watching the noon run of Check Please when we see Memphis Minnie's being featured. Barbecue? 18-hour Brisket? F*ck yeah!

Initial impression is that the place is not even close to authentic. It seems like it's trying too hard, down to the pig figurines and "vintage" signs that looks like they were made yesterday. The whole place feels branded, and I was disappointed that I wasn't overwhelmed with thick barbecue smells or even a hint of smoke. I got the brisket plate, and my buddy Jake R. ordered everything.

Damn, the brisket is good. But the sides were a major disappointment: the slaw is vinegar based w/o mayonnaise. The macaroni and cheese was utterly forgettable and the cornbread was inexcusable in its crumbly dryness and lack of corn flavor. They were also very small portions. I ate a rib from my friend's plate, and that was pretty good.

In the end I was stoked about the brisket and a few redeeming qualities about the place, but not ultimately satisfied on my search for the best barbecue in San Francisco.
author: Ben W.

description:
Ugh.  I had such high hopes for this place and was very eager to try it after seeing them profile it on "Check Please!" on KQED.  Not only will I refuse to ever visit this place again, but that show has definitely lost all credibility with me.  

The food was terrible.  The BBQ tasted like fuel or lighter fluid.  I'm a big fan of meat and an even bigger fan of good BBQ, so I'd like to think I know my stuff when it comes to good BBQ.  The meat was somewhat tender, but nothing takes away from the fact that your food tastes like fuel.
author: Mike L.

description:
I have to say that although I'm not the hugest of dry rub YET. A lot of my friends tell me the sauce makes you wonder more, and yes for BBQ sauce i did want more. The rub itself did taste good but I wouldn't call it the best in the city. The sides were OK. 

I would def go back to try more, but I'm still searching for the end all to end all BBQ in the city.
author: Eric A.

description: I ordered the brisket chili cheese fries and a side of beans. Big chunks of meat in the beans, pimento style (not my favorite), but good nonetheless. The chili cheese fries were enormous. Amazingly seasoned fries that on their own were enough to come back for. The brisket was a little dry, still tasty though. On the table were four sauces, I didn't bother trying the Beelzebub as it had a skull and crossbones, but the rest were exceptional. The staff were very sweet, the cook calling me across the counter by name, he remembered from my order, to see how my food was. The owner, he sure seemed like the owner, taking orders, then checking in with tables as he moved around tending to details. I'll be back.
author: Jan S.

description: The food is ridiculous here. This is how you flirt with danger, and don't dine alone because you need someone to call 911 just in case. The cheese grits sticks are irresistible, and the mac 'n' cheese and greens are excellent. And those are just the sides. The ribs, pulled pork, and chicken are pretty nice too. Oh, and that sauce...
author: Maximillian M.

description:
GRUB! And the service is pretty good too. The folks behind the counter are friendly and the beef ribs are great! I also love the fact that they've got some greens and they don't slather the ribs in BBQ sauce... they leave that up to you.

And their sauces are all good. Overall a great place for BBQ, I just wish it was closer... wait no I don't, if it were I'd be there all the time!
author: Douglas L.

description: Their cornbread is like sawdust. SAWDUST. Oh, and their BBQ is okay, nothing special....but I will never forgive them for that fucking dry cornbread.
author: Miss Tina Sparkle S.

description: I'd seen a review of Memphis Minnie on a certain, local restaurant review show and decided to give it a try.  I went in mid-week for lunch and it was busy.  I'm not a big pork eater, so I had the beef brisket and it was very good.  I noticed the food portions of the  patrons, so I decided to only have the corn bread and the potato salad as a side.  Both were delicious!  The corn bread was moist and the potato salad was heavenly!  I did not try the desserts because I was too full.  I felt the price was reasonable considering the portions of food served.
author: Carlos C.

description: All the food was served luke warm which meant dry/coagulated Mac N Cheese (if theyre gonna serve it at that temp they shld add some milk/cream to it!) Brisket was smoky but so so so so dry. I mean DRY. Corn bread was alright. Overall I can't believe this was a plate I paid $20 for.
author: J S.

description: Being from the South. Ive eaten BBQ on Beale street more than once or twice in my day. I'm not expert but I know good BBQ when I eat it. This place shouldn't have Memphis in the name. They are from the Midwest and have no true southern swag. The sauces sucked... nothing but mustard crap, vinegar crap, and two more really nasty sauces. I finally went with the red one cause it was the least gross. No sweet sauces with smokey flavor. Nothing. My BBQ ribs tasted like they were reheated in the microwave. They were raving about the smoked Fried Chicken. It was ok. Better than my ribs. But lets be honest if you walk into a BBQ place for BBQ and they recommend fried chicken, they probably dont have the best BBQ. So hard to find decent BBQ in this state. Cornbread was good tho and potato salad.
author: Harrison J.

description:
I've only eaten here once, when it was almost closing time. They were out of their supposedly 'famous' brisket, out of fries. I got the smoked pork sandwich (I was in a pulled pork mood, but no pulled pork on the menu) w/ mac n' cheese. I don't know why people rave about the mac n' cheese here so much, i thought it was nasTAY, give me kraft's "the cheesiest" over minnie's slop (and it did resemble actual slop) anytime. Or maybe it was the fact that I sat at the table facing the bathroom which didn't help make eating any more appetizing... So, lesson here: Don't sit at the tables near the bathroom (the 2 in the back). But when I was there (about 9:40p? on a Tuesday) the place was packed and there was no other choice.

The smoked pork sandwich itself was ok, but i had to spit out some gristly parts. I was urged by friends not to make up my mind about this place until I try the brisket. But I know of much better bbq's in the bay area & probably will not go back unless i'm in the neighborhood again & everywhere else is closed. On the plus side, I do like how you get a choice of 3 sauces, in bottles at your table - allowed me to try all 3, alternating between different bites.
author: Andrew C.

description:
I've tried a few of the different menu items and the St Louis style ribs are by far my favorite. They are quite tasty and have a slight apple wood smoke flavor to them and the meat was succulent and tender, practically falling off the bone. I doused them in the Bezzelbub sauce which is not for the faint of heart as it's a habanero based hot sauce made on the premises (as all their sauces are I belive). That sauces kicks and has a great flavor that cuts through the heat. 

It has a great laid back atmosphere and the staff is always been super friendly!

Now it's not as great as the BBQ I've had in Memphis, Texas or even KC but c'mon folks this is San Fran not exactly a BBQ mecca. It's also the first BBQ joint I've ever seen that has a sake tasting menu??? 

Like I said it's not the best I've ever had but if I'm anywhere near Memphis Minnies you can sure bet I'm stopping in and getting some ribs!
author: Nick D.

description:
been to a few bbq spot around the bay and each place seems to have something that they do good, and the rest just average. uncle frank's in mountain view has the best pork ribs, doug's in san pablo has the best links, sam's in san jose has the best beef ribs, etc...
memphis minnies however seem to do good in a little bit of everything, though nothing really stands out.

wait for the food was a lil long, even though the restaurant wasn't packed.
they had some unsual things on the menu also for a bbq spot.

this is the type of place to go to if you go with a group and everybody likes somethin different. also great for kids and families.
author: Phuc B.

description:
Best damn brisket I have ever had. Same goes for the beef ribs. 
Oh man that brisket....Crusty on the outside, brittle moist flake on the inside. Total melt in your mouth goodness.At the end of the day it'll dry out a bit and that is when the Vinegar BBQ sauce comes in handy, though you'll want to use it sparingly  cause the meat is FULL of flavor.

My kids love the Turkey. I love the turkey because when my kids eat it, they fall asleep exactly 30 minutes later.

And sake really, really goes well with BBQ. They havew some great ones here.
Easily best BBQ in town if not in all of California.
author: Derek O.

description:
I'm from Kansas City, so realize I've been spoiled with some of the country's best sauces and smoked meat for most of my life.  

My meal & what I though:

Beef Brisket Sandwich 
- the brisket was dry and overcooked, this probably could have been ovecome if they would have slathered the meat with some warm sauce
- good rub and decent smokiness, but it was dry
- it was on a crusty hoagie roll- this is just a bad combination, tough rolls don't go with barbeque- buttery, toasty, soft rolls and wonderbread are better
- how 'bout some pickles?

French Fries
- EXCELLENT, enough said

Beans
- Not saucy enough, forgettable

Sauce
- Pretty damn good, I had to use plenty
- The mustard sauce is nice

This is a pretty good place, don't get me wrong.  I'm used to a place that smokes meat for days in a hickory pit and makes hickory pit beans.  (Hickory Pit Beans are beans that are made literally in the same smoke pit as the meat.  The brisket drips tasty goodness into the bean pit as the meat smokes.)  I want to leave a BBQ place with sticky fingers, a BBQ sauce stain on my t-shirt, tender meat stuck in my teeth, and the aroma of hickory in my clothes.  This ain't gonna happen at Memphis Minnies.

The real deal for barbeque lovers: www.jackstackbbq.com - the best BBQ you've ever had straight from KC.  Get some hickory pit beans shipped right to your front door.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Adam B.

description:
Me likey!

Brisket was excellent! Ribs are pretty damn good, but a little bit dry. Drench them bukkake style with the signature Memphis Minnie's sauce to fix that right up. Pork pulled sandwich was average in my opinion because that was so dry that no amount of sauce could save it.

I tried 4 sides (mac & cheese, sweet potatoes, potato salad, cornbread) and they were all very plain and average like yo mama. The potato salad wasn't very fresh. Corn bread somewhat stale/old. And the mac + cheese needs more cheesiness & kick. Basically, I think I could make better sides than these guys. 

Staff is super friendly. Decor is pretty cool with all these pig toys, statues, figurines, pictures, etc. 

Make no mistake about it, the strength of this place lies in it's meat. Forget about everything else.
author: Jay W.

description:
Who needs dessert when every dish at this place begins with two heaping cups of sugar?  I've never tasted sweet greens, and am still trying to forget them.  Corn bread muffins are gritty ... like bird food gritty.  

Chicken was dry, and the sausage was steamed if it was cooked at all.  The ribs were decent, but the BBQ sauce was blah.

I have to agree with Jim S' review, "alas, the place is coasting on its reputation".
author: T T.

description:
I'd heard a bit about Memphis Minnie's and was chomping at the  bit to give it a try. I met up with 3 other friends to check it out. I loved the casual "pig" decor and the brightly colored outside. The Haight is a really cool area in general. The outside of Minnie's fits right in with the neighborhood. 

Minnie's is small inside but that's cool for BBQ.  The first thing I noticed was how uninviting the guy behind the counter was. I mean the guy was like Joe Friday...no smile, no personality...just the facts. I'm used to walking into restaurants and being greeted with at least a little warmth. 

But anyway onto the BBQ. My friend's hooked a up a couple of appetizer's:BBQ Seasoned Fries and the Beef Brisket Chili. I've got to give it to them for creativity. And the food was pretty good.  Not a complaint from anyone.

By the time our 4th arrived and we got ready to order the main dishes, a much friendlier guy was working the counter and he recommended the beef brisket. Of course we obliged! We also through in some Smoked Pork RIbs, and Combo plates to get a good tasting of as much as possible.

I have to say the meat was seasoned well and cooked practically to perfection(i.e. moist, tender and not dry). They offer 3 different sauces: one was a tangy mustard type sauce, I think a second one was either KC or St. Louis style and I honestly don't remember the third. They weren't bad just nothing memorable. 

All in all I'd definitely return for another try but I wouldn't go out of my way for a second visit.
author: Kevin J.

description: Horrible. I got pork rib tips and sides to go. The undercooked, inedible meat was pure gristle and everything tasted like it was drenched in honey mustard salad dressing. All of this nauseating mess ended up in the  garbage.
author: Pam J.

description: As a former resident of the deep South, I can attest to the fact this place is too expensive for what they serve. A brisket plate with two tiny side dishes shouldn't be costing $17, but that must be the protocol for having an eatery in the lower Haight. Wasn't bad but it definitely didn't meet my standards. The raunchy cashier chick was funny, but that didn't make up for the average food. I'll go back if someone else is buying, so basically I probably won't be back.
author: Sherry G.

description: Dude. I live in Texas and I haven't had a brisket sandwich that was this good. Enough said.
author: Christine I.

description: Great ribs, I mean GREAT ribs.  The chicken was a little over cooked, and the brisket was cooked WAY too long, even though it was very tender and moist. The smoke flavor was way too overpowering; they advertise it had been cooked 18 hours...  UGH!  Way too long to cook brisket.  Pecan pie was to die for, as was the potato salad.  5 stars for atmosphere, and the great ribs.  But they have NO hushpuppies, and although they have NC vinegar sauce, no NC barbecue!!!  Plus, when you get the order to go, I got no plastic fork and knife.  Had to eat my slaw with my fingers!
author: Mary V.

description:
I give their beef brisket a 5.  

We ordered the trio, which came with three meats and 2 sides.  We asked what they recommended, and they suggested the brisket, pulled pork and ribs. 

The brisket was fantastic.  Tender, lean, and good rich smoke flavor (I would find it dry for a sandwich, but on the platter it's perfect).  The ribs are simple, and I suspect the slight dryness comes from 1. not being boiled and 2. not being heavily fatted.  As someone who generally doesn't do ribs because I don't like the soggy, fatty texture, I appreciated these.  The pulled pork was a bit too on the dry side for me, but still enjoyable with some sauce (which we mixed together to create one we liked).  

For sides we had sweet potatoes and mac n' cheese.  The sweet potatoes were cooked to just the right firmness.  I preferred the ones on the top of the dish because they had less contact with the sweet base.  The mac n' cheese was solid, cheesy, with a slight cornmeal texture that I started to really dig after the first bite.  

The platter was enough to feed the two of us.  We'll definitely be back when we have a craving for good ol' meat.
author: G.L. B.

description: I love barbeque and usually end up spending a small fortune but I was highly impressed with the prices at Memphis Minnie's. It's by no means a fancy place - you are going for BBQ after all! The staff is super friendly, fast and attentive and even stopped by to ask how I was enjoying my food. That's more than I generally expect from a place where you place your order and pay before sitting down. I tried the Beef Brisket based on the recommendations of other yelpers and was very happy with it. I didn't think I could eat a full dinner size plate, and the cashier recommended that I order the lunch sized portion which was perfect! The Mac & Cheese is wonderful, very light and fluffy but not too rich. The cornbread muffin was a little on the dry size.  I'm also a big fan of their BBQ sauce (sweet with a little kick) and their southern mustard.
author: Marissa P.

description: I like the flavors of the sauces, but that's pretty much what kept this place afloat for me. The brisket came out completely delicious - until I realized it was half fat, half overcooked. The turkey, unfortunately, was all overcooked, and dry. The pork was delicious and was hands down the winner of the three, and the sweet potatoes and mac n cheese weren't bad at all, either. For legit BBQ, I'm going to keep looking.
author: Johnny S.

description: After all the reviews from my friends, I was expecting some AMAZING bbq. I've recently returned from several business trips to the South (South Carolina, North Carolina, and Georgia). Their sauces stay true to the vinegar based bbq of the Carolina's. As for the actual bbq, I may have come on an off day, but all the different meats were charred. The brisket and chicken were especially blackened. I know this is BBQ and there should be some smokiness, but this was inedible. I may give them another chance.
author: Sara A.

description: ok... so my co-worker and I had a taste for some BBQ... after researching several places including reading review on Yelp we decided to try Memphis Minnies....OMG... whoever heard of a BBQ joint not selling links???.. and then the greens OMG... what did they cook them in... Sugar and Vinegar.... the rib tips were ok......The Beef Brisket was super dry... and the Sauce.... Please Help me to understand who sells BBQ without BBQ sauce... the sauces they serve are some kind of sweet tangy mess..... never again!!!!!!!!!... Now I see why I didn't see any person of color in the establishment, when they are right smack dab in the middle of lower haight!!!!!!
author: Danielle G.

description: Absolutely fantastic! I was really missing proper BBQ that seems so rare in the South Bay area... I had Texas beef brisket, pulled pork, potato salad, coleslaw, and hand cut BBQ seasoned fries. A bit too much to eat it all but I could not stop myself from doing so because it was nothing short of delicious! After 10 years in Texas I've come to recognise great BBQ and this is it!
author: Alex R.

description: Got talked into Minnie's, again. Seems like it could be the best BBQ in SF. Please tell me if you know better. Two way, St. Louis and Tips, with double mac. Didn't have to eat for a week.
author: Jeff B.

description: One of my favorite BBQ spots in one of my favorite neighborhoods.  Good for both a birthday celebration with friends or a late night drunken meal.  Great food!!
author: Jay S.

description:
The food isn't bad here but the service is a complete joke.  I've gone here on three occasions for takeout and every time, it's the same story.  There's a single guy on cash who refuses to let you pick up your takeout until it's your turn in line -- and the line usually takes 25-30 minutes to clear up because it's all first-time diners who need to be walked through the whole menu.  Note that it is ALL first time diners.  I think I may be the only person who went here more than once. 

The food isn't bad, but as far as BBQ goes, I'd check out some other places on Yelp.  This place is pricey for what they offer, the ambiance is Chuck-E-Cheese mixed with Denny's and the service can induce a heart attack more than the cholesterol-laden food they serve.

That said - if they had a sign saying "takeout orders - please come to front of line" and adhered to that policy, I'd give this place an extra one or two stars.  Still pretty overpriced, though.
author: Mark D.

description: Dissapointed they don't offer the fried catfish anymore it is so sad.  Still the best barbecue place I have found in SF or Marin County.   Very casual and always people moving through. I have always gone for dinner so I don't know if lunch is less hectic.
author: Miguel R.

description: Five stars is too little.  You will find the best BBQ in the USA.  I have traveled deep in the south and I can only say that my heart belongs to Memphis Minnies in San Francisco, Haight area.  The tender meat combinations with a variety of BBQ sauces not found in local supermarkets are heavenly - Tri Tip, pork and beef ribs, chicken and brisket , the brisket ....are do die for.  The sides are perfect essentials for they add the flavor of what real BBQ is all about.  Let's talk about the corn bread, baked twice in a buttery, sweet flavor like mama used to bake.  Delicious!!   Price is exceptionally perfect for  the servings allow you can take left overs home and nibble on them the next day.  Service - well, it is worth the wait on a busy day and you get instant gratification on a not so busy one.  Six stars. WORTH THE FIVE MINUTE WAIT!!!!!
author: Becky A.

description: Memphis Minnie's has alot of character walking in this place, order and pay at the counter, wait for your order to be called to get your food.  Ordered their smoked pork sandwich with one side under USD 10.  The meat was alright, but it didn't really wow me.  Don't know if sweet tea is supposed to be that sweet, but that was really too sweet for my taste.  They were out of the fried peach pie and sweet potato pie.
author: George L.

description:
When I'm gettin' my carnivore on, I head to Memphis Minnie's, order a plate of rib tips with beans and greens, douse them in all three sauces, and dig in. Mmmm. Meat. 

Everyone seems to love the banana pudding, but I am not a pudding fan. If I have room for dessert -- and that's a BIG "if" given the size of the bbq plates -- I get a slice of sweet potato pie. Mmmm. Pie.
author: Fawn F.

description:
Stumbled on this place en route to the Under One Roof sale several weeks ago. We ordered two sandwiches; beef brisket and pulled pork. Both are served dry with their variety of sauces available for self-dressing on the table. The offering included a vinegar sauce, a "Stupid Hot" habanero sauce, a mustard sauce, and a classic sweet BBQ sauce.

On the whole, while the meat was decent enough (although slightly dry), I was not Wowed by any of the sauces, finding the classic BBQ almost Oriental for some reason. The sides, on the other hand, were pretty fabulous; collard greens that were hefty and vinegary, chunked yams, and an interesting cole slaw with large slices of bell pepper and more.

The restaurant itself is part of the attraction with a long banquet of tables and chairs with red checkered cloths, ample paper towels, fun t-shirts on the walls from competitors, and tons of pig paraphernalia. They also played great music. Doubtful I'll go back based on the sauce alone, but they do seem to have other things going for them including a fried catfish dish and several weekly specials so who knows...
author: Carolyn T.

description:
Voted 2007 "Best Hangover Food" by the people in my household.

It's grub.
author: m t.

description:
This is the only place in town I can get my sake and rib fix at the same time.    Pork ribs, mustard sauce, and cole slaw on the side.    There is rarely a long wait here and it seems to cater mainly to locals.   

Surprisingly the sake menu is pretty good for a rib joint.   Come to think of it, it is pretty good sake menu even if it was a sushi joint and considering that the nearest sushi place in the lower haight blows you may want to just go here anyway.
author: Jim Z.

description:
MMMM memphis minnies!
beef brisket and pork ribs deliciousness!
the beef brisket doesn't need a knife and melts in your mouth.  the pork ribs fall off the bone.
the slaw is just ok, maybe too much green/red pepper, not enough cabbage.  you know that feeling you get when it feels like they were to the bottom of that jar of slaw?  that's how i felt.
the mac and cheese is just ok, maybe needed to be heated up a little.  
the star of the show was the bbq - i can't wait to try more items!
oh, if you're concerned about cholesterol, you may want to avoid this place.  i'm limiting myself to once a quarter.
author: cristina t.

description:
On a recent excursion into the Lower Haight for a friends party I meet up with some other friends going to the same party as they dropped into Memphis Minnie's to pick up some food to take to the party. After looking over the menu they chose the cornbread, potatoe salad, and chicken wings. As we left we saw that they had chili and decided we would pick some up after we left the party.

The wing, corn bread, and  potatoes salad were all very good and seemed to disappear very quickly. After leaving the party we returned to MM for the long desired cup of chili. While the chili was okay it was not what I expected. The lack of bean and high concentration of meat turned me off. While it was not how I would make chili myself it was rather cheap.

I give MM 4 out of 5 stars. Taking away one star for my disappointment with the chili. The decor and atmosphere of MM is fun and those who work their are very pleasant
author: Jeffrey F.

description:
I can't believe some people consider this "good barbecue"... the ribs were so chewy I had a jaw ache after eating here. This is not the end-all to beat-all of California BBQ that some Helper's are making it out to be.The brisket sandwich was okay, but other then that i found the food to be less then desirable.

If given a choice between Minnie's ribs or a burnt car tire smothered with with BBQ Sauce, i think i might chose the tire instead! at least I'll know it;s something i can chew through and digest!!!!
author: Steve B.

description:
This place is pretty average, even by California standards.

I'm not sure what type of wood they use, but if I had to guess, I'd say apple, although I now see from all the press that he uses white oak. Almost everything I ate had a taste of apple, even the meat that didn't have the Texas Red Sauce. That sauce was terrible by the way. It tasted  like a bad version of Kentucky-style apple cider-based sauce.

Brisket was the best of the sandwich meats and moist but lacked any real punch. Maybe I just prefer a more aggressive rub. It looked like it had a nice smoke ring but lacked that deep, smoky flavor. Throw some more hickory logs on the fire, Bob!

The pork was dry and flavorless. A real disappointment considering the place has Memphis in its name.

The fries were excellent. Probably the only thing I truly enjoyed about the meal.

The beans, despite being loaded with meat, lacked much flavor. They need more heat, more  salt.....something.

The mustard sauce was mustard sauce, the vinegar was vinegar sauce. No complaints there. But if you're going to be all over the map, why not get some KC-style sauce. Maybe even put burnt ends on the menu.
author: Rachel J.

description: Horrible service! I called a few minutes ago to order some food for a group buddies and me. Steve, the dude who answered the phone, was a total asshole! His attitude was bad from the get go. He had an attitude just to have an attitude. The first time we called, he rudely answered, telling us to hold for a few minutes, not even giving us an option to speak. We called back a few minutes later hoping someone else would answer...no luck. When I attempted to order for us, he interrupted me and told me he had a line out the door. This would have been my first time ordering from this place....so much for that. I don't care how busy he thinks he is, there is no reason to act the way he did. I will never order from this place.
author: Ryan M.

description: Great BBQ!  The brisket rocks and I think there sides are all pretty tasty.  Like the unassuming environment with plenty of paper towels and suces on the table.  Had no idea sake tasted so good with BBQ.  Even when busy the staff has always been friendly and helpful.  Just recently introduced 3 friends to this place and all 3 LOVED it.
author: Sean M.

description: Very laid back BBQ place with excellent brisket.  Get the mac n' cheese and a beer, then the banana pudding. YUM.  LIked being able to order at the counter and grab a table.  I dind't think the sweet potatoes were that great, but the corn muffin was delicious. definitely want to go back for some pork and a few more desserts...
author: leah w.

description: The food was really good. The service was excellent. That don't have traditional thick barbecue sauce which is why I gave them 3 stars.
author: Theresa C.

description: Two words. Bacon brownie. Try them, it's heaven in a bite.
author: Lee H.

description: really sub par, unless all BBQ meat is supposed to be served with two sauces tasting mostly like vinegar, pork was overcooked, sandwich consisted of meat and bread only and two vinegar sauces and the chicken rub made me sick
author: Dov B.

description:
If you love your barbeque smothered in a thick traditional barbeque sauce...GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!

This place sells barbeque the way it is supposed to be, smoked a long time with no sauce on it. There is no hiding of flavor behind a plateful of sauce, if your looking for that try Big Nates or the other place on Grove and Divisadero.

THE BEEF IS BY FAR THE BEST IN SF., smoked to perfection, very tender and usually cut correctly which is against the grain. However I have had it there once cut incorrectly and probably because the meat cutters are from south of the border (that's how they cut meat down there).

The pork ribs seem to be hit and miss, but the last time I had them they were off-the-hook (great). Sometimes they don't have that burnt flesh on them and are also a little tough. The pulled pork is done to perfection and the chicken is just so so. The links are andouille which are really not traditional barbeque and tough. I don't eat beef ribs, but my friends say they are great here. 

With both good and bad here the only reason I cannot give them more than 3 stars is the sides and the sauce. The mac n cheese is okay, but the rest are just BLAH and needs to be overhauled. The last time I tried the greens (about 8 yrs ago) they actually put barbeque sauce in them...YUK!...and the sauce sucks...YUK x 2.

As most barbeque joints go the service is slow, even if you have phoned in, but overall its good eats if you appreciate smoked meats and are not looking for a sauce drenched dinner.

If you are a sugarholic, try the sweet tea, it's sweeeeeeeet! And they have an eclectic selection of throwback sodas made with PURE CANE SUGAR! But I guess you can only appreciate cane sugar drinks if you're over 40yrs old. So just so you newborns understand the deal, don't get excited because it's NOT cocaine, it's white granulated sugar that soda was made with when it was called soda pop. You have probably heard about it in those old movies granny watches and have seen bags of it in the grocery store, oh Im sorry, what's that?...Wall Mart in bags that say C & H.
author: Jim L.

description: Best BBQ in SF!  If you are in the mood for BBQ, this is your spot.  If you're not sure what you're in the mood for, step in and take a whiff.  This place smells like BBQ heaven.  Smoky, tangy, sweet, sour, you name it.  Memphis Minnie's is the BOMB!!!!
author: Daniel B.

description:
This place has spoiled me for BBQ anywhere else. Everything is very good. The staff is a little on the surly side- think "no BBQ for you!"- but of course that itself adds a certain charm. As does the miniscule portion of delicious mac and cheese- something like 3 bucks for 2 mouthfulls- but oh, what a mouthfull! The coleslaw redefines coleslaw. Bitchin' brisket.

BUT: I'm going to join the chorus here, and ding them a star for how paltry the sides are. 3 bites of Mac and cheese for $2.25? Culinary blue balls. No me gusta. And the snotty staff is less of a charm each time I have to face it, actually, and so I darken their door less than I otherwise might. Joke's on you, jack!
author: Jonny A.

description:
OK.  So I was listening to T Bone Walker yesterday afternoon, and had a desire to eat some BBQ, who would have figured that?  I looked on Yelp for the best BBQ in town, and this is what they gave me.  It was PACKED.  They had a sake obsession, so I got some beer.  The food took a while, but that's only because there were so many people there before us.  I got the St. Louis style ribs with slaw and sweet potatos.  The slaw was not very good, I can't even describe why.  I think this is entirely subjective (obviously), but there was one shread of cabbage in it.  Weird.  The sweet potatoes tasted like apple sauce (bonus!), and the rib tips were chewy (sign of too-fast cooking), but the rib parts were delicious.  

I'm not giving it 5 because I had to wait, the cole slaw, and the tips of my ribs.  I will be returning here whenever I want BBQ, however.  I was told to try the Pork rolls (like egg rolls) and sake.
author: Ben H.

description:
I ordered the pulled chicken sandwich with macaroni & cheese, corn muffin, and banana pudding for dessert. My boyfriend had the brisket with potato salad and macaroni & cheese. We wanted to order the garlic fries but they were all out. All this food plus 2 sodas came up to about $30+ kind of expensive for cafeteria style eating. Very comfortable place though. I liked the fact that you have rolls of paper towels on each table and that you can get your own tap soda. When I looked around, everyone was eating ribs. I wonder if they're any good. Too bad I don't eat pork or beef. I would go there again to get the pulled chicken sandwich and banana pudding. Hopefully they'll have garlic fries the next time I go there. So you get an idea of what I thought of each item, I rated each item individually down below.

Pulled chicken sandwich: 5
macaroni & cheese: 3
corn muffin: taste: 5 ; texture:2 (the corn meal was like raspberry seeds)
brisket: 3 (not much taste)
potato salad: 4.5
banana pudding: 5
author: Amy M.

description:
OH YESSSSS.  My favorite is the Beef Brisket Sandwhich with Texas red Sauce.  The side dishes are all fantastic. You have choices like Potato salad, Beans, & Mac N Cheese, Greens,  andSeasoned Fries. The corn bread is excellent and always warm.  

I come here at least 3 times a month and have no guilt.  I know it doesn't compare to TEXAS BBQ, but it works for me.

UPDATE:  2-21-08
Just went here last night for dinner and picked up the usual brisket sandwhich, but this time I ordered the BEEF BRISKET CHILI CHEESE FRIES..... LADIES AND GENTLEMEN WE HAVE A WINNER
author: Robert M.

description:
This place is chock full of charm, i must admit that i am not really a bbq snob as some of my friends are...

I had the pulled park sandwich with the potlikker greens, the greens were a bit sweet, but excellent. I brought them next door to molotov's and washed it down with a tall margarita, i am sorry but sake with bbq is just too plain weird... margaritas though? Hughbetcha!!!
author: wayne s.

description:
I've been doing Memphis Minnie's for years.

There are more "authenticate" smoke shacks in the towns and communities that consider bbq core cuisine. White folk, black folk, yellow folk, brown, there's not a cuisine on this planet that doesn't smoke meat as a cooking option.

Memphis Minnie's gets it -- bbq is about the rub and the smoke. They are in the food business like many, have great days, have off days. They have proven, over the course of years, that their ribs, brisket and big bones are rubbed and smoked to perfection.

Memphis Minnie's has survived in a neighborhood that once had over six smoke shacks - there's two today. Something's got to be right to survive as a restaurant in this city.

If you've not been, check it out. If you've not been in awhile. go again. Try something different. They aren't trying to be anything more than a good place to get a good plate of food.
author: Joseph F.

description:
Oh cruel mistress. why do you torment me so. I didn't even break my cardinal rule of no night time Q. But it didn't matter, for the hope of my weekend BBQ fantasy was dashed upon the rocky crags of mediocre meat. There IS something wrong with me if I can't even capitalize m.... me..... Sigh....

Meat.

Though normally a great feast... (The Lady and I have devoted almost equal time between here and Nates) this feast was dry and, well... overcooked. The Pork Ribs looked like they had been sliced and left on top of a hot shelf for at least an hour before finding their way into our trough. Though we could tell they had been tender once, they had dried out too far to be the succulent morsels I've grown accustom to. The Big Beef Bones were about the same... maybe not quite as dry, but they cooked too hard I think. (Though the Rub sill tasted great!) Brisket... and Sweet Pork... same story.

I've said it before, BBQ can be a fickle lover, and I picked the wrong day to come a'calling without flowers.

Please know that I do... really like these guys. Hell, even the music today was great... a bluegrass rendition of Pink Floyd's Lucifer Sam, followed by a bluegrass Under The Bridge.... 

Regardless, onward and upward. Good sides. Potlicker Greens are great, Mac is average in texture, better in flavor, and even the Cole Slaw doesn't turn me away. Corn Muffins are some of the better I've had in the local Q joints.

We like the Pecan Pie (out today). But in its place decided that the Banana Pudding and Sweet Potato Pie would be the answer, and lo... we came out ahead on that call. (Whew!)

So the rating... they were on the High side of a 3.5 before today... which brought it crashing down to the low side. Hence 3*** (for the time being).

I will go back. Rest assured. I will go back
author: Ryan F.

description: What a great place for BBQ. Such a down to earth place, having a great atmosphere. My goodness were the ribs good. The beans were made fro the same sauce or seasoning as the BBQ, and it tasted phenomenal. The fries had the same seasoning as the ribs, too. And they too, tasted wonderful. There wasn't much service, but the guy at the counter was friendly and snappy. Great portions, too. A very simple restaurant, one I would definitely recommend.
author: Alex L.

description: This is the best BBQ in the bay area. We have been there a couple times and the food has been more than worth the wait. Seating is limitied and parking is difficult, the service isn't five star, but really it is a BBQ joint... if you want great service so some place else. If you want great food, this is the place!
